title: Elevators are a nightmare. Beware if water construction. Request a low floor to avoid elevators!
text:
Elevators are a nightmare. Had to wait 15-20 to get an elevator to/from 24th floor.

Water was turned off on 2nd day from 1pm-4pm with limited notice (small sign in elevator) that you had to look for to notice. There were no options given on alternative restrooms during this work, even when asking reception (I was working from my room that afternoon and on Zoom calls, and had to wait 15 mins for an elevator to take a break, go downstairs and look for a nearby restaurant where I could use a bathroom.
Front desk staff was pleasant, but housekeeping and other staff during the water outage were using the elevators and cutting in front of paying guests to use elevators and were not very friendly.. As a Hilton Diamond member with @150 night a year, I have never seen such a lack of organization in any Hilton branded hotel. Rooms were typical small size for  a NYC mid brand hotel but not well laid out with closet blocking suitcase rack (only place to put it).

title: Great find, excellent stay
text:
Great place to stay which is away from the main hustle and bustle but with easy access to everywhere.
Staff were friendly and nothing was too much trouble for them, little shout out to housekeeping and maintenance who were lovely and went out of their way to ensure we had everything we needed.
Rooms were spotless and lovely white fluffy towels provided. 
Bonus of having fridge in the room and really quiet rooms which was perfect for us.
Check in was effortless and a nice touch of a freshly baked cookie and a bottle of water each.
Would not hesitate to return here if ever in New York again.
Ps it’s a 15 minute walk to Liberty Bagels and this place is well worth a visit!

title: Great location for exploring Manhattan
text: Hotel is in a fantastic location near penn station and Madison square garden. I was able to walk into Times Square and all the way down to 911 Memorial. Great spot for also exploring Chelsea market, Tribeca and high line. Room was comfortable and clean. Front desk staff always willing to help. Would definitely stay again.

title: Should be rebranded Hampton Inn
text:
Cons outweigh the pros:
Cons:
- only 10 rooms per floor but you can hear everything in the hallway and adjacent rooms. You will hear every door slam on the floor. Street noise was actually quieter.
- hallways so narrow two people can’t stand shoulder to shoulder. 
- greeted by vacuum cords I almost tripped over on way to room. 
- only 2 elevators and staff use them too. So expect long wait times if on upper floors. 
- bfest was pretty subpar. Don’t expect pastry selection or even oatmeal at bfest bar. Maybe you can order Al la cart. 
- lobby? Nope. Sitting area might accommodate 3 people. 
- tiny tiny rooms. That might be a Manhattan thing but this felt like my first college dorm room. 
- don’t expect the front desk to break a big bill. They don’t have cash. 

Pros:
- location location location. Was here for Big East tournament at Madison Square Garden which is about 3-4 blocks away. 
- friendly front desk staff
- comfortable bed

Overall, I’m surprised Hilton branded this is a DoubleTree. Felt more like a Hampton Inn.

title: 1st time in New York
text: Kareem made our stay sooo much more memorable ! From check in to check out, he gave platinum service and went above and beyond to ensure that our first time in New York was one to remember. He was very knowledgeable, made us feel like family and never hesitated to answer our questions on dining / things to do suggestions . He is most DEFINITELY an asset to the Hilton brand !

title: Wow, what a great find!
text:
What a find!

This was my first visit to New York and I wasn’t sure I picked a hotel in the right location or if it was a good hotel or anything of the sort. I was extremely nervous booking this property because of some of the reviews but I ended up pleasantly surprised!

The hotel is a quick walk from Penn Station and I found the location fantastic for everything I wanted to do during my time in New York. I came in for a concert and was able to walk to and from Madison Square Garden with zero issues. It was also a relatively easy walk to Times Square and to multiple subway stops.

The room was clean, well-kept, and modern. The bed was extremely comfortable and the shades kept the room nice and dark. Loved that my room had a bathtub!  There are only a few rooms on each floor, and so you’re never truly far from the elevator. My room was immediately next to the elevator shaft and there was noise from the elevators as a result. However, I never found it to be disturbing, and it never woke me up or prevented me from sleeping. It was just sort of background noise — same with the city noise. I was on the 23rd floor and still heard city noise, but it didn’t bother me!

I ordered desserts via room service and breakfast via room service as well. Everything was fantastic! They even honored my Diamond F&B daily credit without issues — I’ve had to “remind” hotels of it in the past, so that was a nice surprise!

My flight got pushed back to a late afternoon flight and the front desk happily honored my request for a late checkout (1PM) even though I called the morning of checkout asking for it.

For my needs, this hotel was PRRFECT. Thanks again!

title: Great Location- Good Hotel!
text:
I picked this hotel on the location & it’s a good one!
You are close to everything you need & a subway stop is just minutes away.
Rooms like most of New York aren’t massive but they were good enough!
The bathrooms were lovely though!
Reception staff were great only thing I don’t understand about these chains is the large deposits but that’s all too common now it seems…

title: I would stay again but it (like everything in this area) was expensive
text:
Trying to keep in mind that it IS NYC so of course things are expensive.  I paid over $240 for one night.  My room was very small but clean, comfortable and quiet.  I paid extra for an Empire State Bldg view but didn't get it.  It was snowing anyway so I told myself it didn't matter.  

As a Diamond member, I received a credit of $18 for breakfast but even the basic Hilton buffet (which is free is most locations) was $25.  Ala carte is available but it, too, is expensive.  $18 for 3 pancakes with a couple of strawberries on top.  

Parking is available a short walk from the hotel (at Icon).  It is a valet only service and, with tax, cost another $60.  

The front desk was busy but pleasant.  My complaint, like so many others have already mentioned, is with the elevators.  They are slow - and the lines are long.  I would have been okay going up and down 26 flights of stairs but my friend wasn't so inclined.

title: Great location and reasonably priced
text:
We stayed for 6 nights over the Christmas period. The rooms aren't huge but exactly what I'd expect for NYC - we had room for unpacking large suitcases and then storing those. The rooms are clean and well looked after by the maids service. The location is excellent, very close to Macys and well connected to all parts of the city, an easy walk to Bryant Park, Times Square etc.

Only negatives I'd cite are the shower temperature was a little difficult to deal with and the lifts are a bit slow but not impossible to deal with.

title: Not a good option for NYC
text: Low key hotel with bad customer service . Not complying to what has been promised the day before. Had two consecutive stays and asked twice to keep the same room before checking in upon call’g front desk and at check in . On the day, I asked politely to to as told and my claim was denied because the hotel is sold out …. Still room available in the same category …. And we do have to switch rooms . Nice for a confortable stay . Never again !

title: Good place to stay
text: Lets start with the negative.. The shower does need to be updated our showerhead was old and the water was just going everywhere. The rooms are small BUT you know when you visit NYC you are on the go all the time trying to see everything! So the room being small did not really bother me because the PLUS is that you are close  to many main attractions in the city . The rooms were clean and unlike the negative reviews I read (before booking this hotel) Every staff member I spoke with were all nice and professional!!

title: Regular Guest - Multiple Room Review
text:
I stay at this hotel 5 to 10 times a year when in the city on business.  Reading some of the other reviews, I'm somewhat baffled as I've not experienced many of the issues mentioned.  I've also stayed in quite a few other hotels both in this area and around the city in my years of regular travel to the city.

*Waiting for an elevator is a normal occurrence in a hotel this size - I've never waited for more than 3 to 5 minutes at this hotel, and that's just during peak times. Also, I've never had to go down to the basement go back up (as one review said). If the elevator is heading down and you board it, then yes, it will go down first and then back up, just as any elevator would.
*Wear and Tear - Yes this facility has seen some use and everything isn't pristine new. However, any functional issues I've experienced have been quickly met by the staff with a good attitude and never have I seen any mold issues in the bathrooms, air units, etc... and I always look as I'm very sensitive to mold!
*Beds and pillows are comfortable.  I like my bed at home better, but never had an issue sleeping.
*Closets - Closet space is small as NYC rooms are small and there isn't a lot of extra space, but I've never had a problem hanging up a week's worth of business clothes.
*Noise - If you're not a really heavy sleeper, I recommend getting a white-noise machine for ANY HOTEL in NYC as there will always be noise from the streets, etc... .  I usually do have a room that adjoins the elevator shaft, so I do hear a little noise from it (not loud) and the white noise machine will drown that out no problem (along with sirens, etc..).
*Restaurant - I often eat in the restaurant simply out of convenience and it's included in my stay. It's a good, basic hotel restaurant.  Staff is friendly and courteous. Food is decent.  
*Cleanliness - Never seen major issues with cleanliness. Yes, sometime the lobby gets trash on the floor when large groups come in or during periods of heavy foot traffic, but the staff cleans it multiple times a day (I've witnessed this).
*Location - It's a relatively quiet, safe location with plenty of restaurants and subway stops all within a few blocks.  I don't mind bringing my family with me to this hotel as I feel they will be safe.

Overall, I will continue to be a regular guest at this hotel and find it to be a great option at a stellar price point compared to others in the area.

title: Terrible
text:
I stay here frequently because it is on the same street as my office.  This is my last time.  It is no longer worth the convenience. 

The bathroom had long brown hairs all over it (I’m blonde). They “cleaned” the bathroom and took all the hand towels and left two bath mats.  The toilet paper holder was broken, the bathroom shelf is falling off the wall.  My mini fridge was not working and when I called the front desk, the person who answered asked me “is it a mini fridge or a cooler?”  I was like, excuse me?   She sent someone up and miraculously my mini fridge or cooler was working when I got back.  

They offer me a dining credit as a Diamond Status holder, but the info provided by the hotel says room service is open until 11:00pm, but they are not. 

And, as others have stated, the elevators are truly terrible.  They have no dedicated staff elevator.  So guests and staff have to use the same elevators.  You better leave 15 minutes early.  I generally choose a room on the second floor so I can just take the stairs, but beware, you can’t go up from the lobby, you have to go down to the basement and then go up.

title: This was a terrible experience. Motel 6 has better rooms.
text: My mother in law and I stayed there from September 26th to September 30th. We had actually booked the room till October 4th. For $500 a night, the room was a disgrace! The maid never came in the 4 nights we were there. The wallpaper was peeling on the walls. The place to hang your clothes was a joke. The restaurant had terrible service, there were 2 other parties in there that had already been served and we still waited 15 minutes and finally left because the server was standing talking to the bartender. The only positive thing was one of the bellman named Jayden. He was helpful,kind and very good at his job despite everyone else that worked there. I would never stay there again!

title: An amazing stay which was faultless until it was ruined by the hotel charging my bank double. Would be 5 stars and I wou
text:
An amazing stay which was faultless until it was ruined by the hotel charging my bank double. Would be 5 stars and I would return if the charge was dealt with appropriately. 

When I checked in at the hotel, I had two pending charges. This was for the room and then the security deposit. Two days later, the security deposit disappeared but the room charge stayed pending. This was on top of the full room charge which left my bank. This meant I was down over £1000 which resulted in a lot of stress and panic. 

The response I got when I complained of this did not reflect the issue. They tried to say that “the pending transaction is the security deposit, which does take anywhere between five to ten business days from check out for the pending charge to reflect back on the card.”  One of the pending transactions has been cancelled and this was definitely not a security deposit. 

We stayed in a room on floor 27 which had a  balcony. 

Negatives:
The door to the balcony did not lock. We were busy on the trip and honestly didn’t think to mention this at the time as it wasn’t a big deal to us anyway but some people may find it an issue. 

Positives: 
Room was huge and very clean and tidy the entire stay. We couldn’t fault the size of the room at all. The bed was comfy and the air con kept the room at a very comfortable temperature throughout our stay (very important as we arrived during the heat wave). 

The balcony was amazing and we loved the view. Furniture was clean and we felt it was well laid out. 

No issues with food and drink in the hotel. We ate at the hotel one night and the food tasted very good. We had drinks daily and no complaints. They did run out of soft drinks during our stay but things like this can’t be helped when it is busy. 

We didn’t have to wait more than 5 minutes for the elevator. Although I did notice on the last day as we were leaving that one of the elevators was broken but this didn’t impact us. 

Staff were friendly and helpful throughout. Whenever we needed anything, they were happy to help. 

The hotel is at a great location and I felt safe walking to and from the hotel at all times. We felt this hotel was appropriately priced and based on the stay alone (not including billing issues) I would stay here again without hesitation. 

All photos are of the room and the view from our room.

title: Find anywhere else
text: Just awful. I got in late because all flights were grounded. I was told that they had no more rooms and I should have called to let them about the flights. Then they "remembered" there was a room connected to the elevator. For THREE nights I didn't sleep because of the noise. I asked to change the next day and was told they were full. No one cared to contact me. I'm so disgusted by the lack of customer service. I was there for work and the three days without sleep left me sick. What's more the bathroom was a complete wreck.

title: Hotel básico no Chelsea
text:
Chegamos ao hotel por volta de 9 hs ,bem antes do horário do check in 
(16 hs). Como é um hotel bastante concorrido, ainda não havia quartos disponíveis para nós. Notei a falta de paciência das atendentes na recepção quando perguntadas sobre a possível antecipação da nossa entrada, visto que vínhamos de um voo longo. Finalmente fizeram nosso check in por volta das 13 hs, o que acabou sendo uma agradável surpresa.
A propósito, não aceitam cash, somente cartões.
O quarto era bem compacto, com duas camas de casal (confortáveis), Tv média, ar condicionado e frigobar (mal instalado dentro de um móvel, o que dificultava a sua abertura). A porta do guarda roupa também não abria totalmente, pois encostava no ar-condicionado, que foi instalado abaixo da janela.
O banheiro era compacto mas funcional, chuveiro ótimo, toalhas boas e contava com shampoo, condicionador, shower gel e hidratante da Crabtree & Evelyn.
Os dois elevadores, como eu já sabia, ficavam meio sobrecarregados durante a parte da manhã principalmente, mas felizmente não quebraram durante nossa estadia. A localização do hotel também era boa, perto de metrô, comércio e restaurantes.

title: From A Mechanical Wheelchair User
text: As a mechanical wheelchair user, I appreciate the staff's helpfulness and friendliness at this hotel. They were always willing to assist me with my needs, such as getting a rented recliner into the room. However, I found the hotel to be not very spacious or accessible for someone like me. The rooms, elevators, hallways, lobby, and restaurant were all tight and difficult to maneuver. The roll-in shower had some issues, such as the shampoo and body wash being out of reach, and the bench slamming down easily. The bathroom door was heavy and would not stay open, and there was no emergency switch in case of an emergency. The sink had a board and a stool that blocked me from getting closer to it. The hotel is located in a convenient area, close to many attractions, but it does not have a pool. It does have a spacious patio in front of the hotel’s entrance. I think this hotel could do better in providing mechanical wheelchair accessibility, rather than a band-aid approach. It was not a bad experience, but it was a challenging one.

title: Great location
text: Perfect location to see NYC. Walking distance from Times Square and Subways to get around. The hotel staff were helpful and the rooms were comfortable. My only issue was that the rooms and overall decor were outdated.

title: Other options please
text:
Reviews on elevators is spot on … two elevators for this size hotel is crazy. Took a very long time to get to room every time we went out. 
Walked in and there were candy wrappers on the floor, presumably from prior guests. Floor hadn’t been cleaned as there is a black smudge on it. The desk chair was broken along with the ones they were going to replace it with. Only one wash cloth for two people and nighttime front desk gave me attitude when I rode the dreaded elevator down to get one. 
The little glass shelf above the toilet isn’t bolted to the wall and dumped my toiletries into the toilet. 
Went you take a shower, and even though there is bright fresh caulking around the tub, the grout between the tiles had tons of mold growing in it. Hilton was my go to brand. I’ve lived in them for over six months at a time. This is way below the Hilton standard, in my opinion. Will not stay in this particular hotel again.

title: Extremely Average
text: This is an older property in a great part of town. The rooms, like many in NYC, are pretty small. The accommodations are pretty 'old' with a distinctly 90's feel to the environment. that is good but not very plush bedding, good but not very thick towels, older bathroom fixtures. Everything worked though which was a plus and a clean room. There was a window air condition which was not 'clean' as it had a lot of dust in it and didn't keep the room especially cool. The biggest complaint was that there are only two elevators to serve a 26 story hotel! And apparently no staff elevator either b/c every time we were waiting for an elevator, it would invariably open and there would be housekeeping with their full cart taking up the entire car. This was seriuously an issue - we were burning 5-15 minutes waiting for an elevator whether or not we were going up or coming down. Not something you expect at a modern hotel. Finally at check out, there was a restaurant charge on my bill that wasn't mine. Rather than just 'taking it off', I had to wait about :15-:20 for the clerk to research it, go in the back and pull paper receipts and then finally give me a new bill. Luckily I came down early and wasn't late for my meeting. There are several other choices in the area so I while this isn't a 'hard no' I would definitely look elsewhere before thinking about staying here again.

title: Great location
text: Easy check in and check out, smaller but clean room with a comfortable bed in a great location! Staff was welcoming. Elevators are older and slower but it wasn’t a problem for us. We only stayed one night but we would definitely stay again!!!!

title: Good location - that's it.
text:
Great location, walking distance to alot of the sites and easy access to the subway if you need to travel a bit further. As for the the hotel itself, not what we expected from a Hilton chain. I say this time and time again, the DT Hilton brand no matter where in the world, has always let us down and I will no longer give it the benefit of the doubt. Room is extremely small, which I guess is somewhat expected but it became unbearable after a few days. Hallways are narrow too. Overall it felt very suffocating. Luckily we moved onto another hotel after 4 days so managed to salvage our sanity. Fortunately you're not in the room much but when we were, the 4 of us were constantly knocking into one another or the furniture. Staff were unpleasant and seemed like they didn't want to be there. Service levels were pretty appalling. They have 2 elevators, one of which was out of order for our first 2 nights, which meant there was one old clunky elevator for the entire hotel. Staff were using this too and you can comdortably fit 4-5 people in at one time. There would be a queue to use the elevator on most days. We often had to wait 10-15mins to get up or down as we were on the 16th floor. Often times we would walk down the stairs but with a toddler and stroller, it wasn't the easiest. Especially as the staircase was pretty tight. Housekeeping didn't bother to tidy the room even when we didn't have the DND sign up. When you contacted housekeeping or front desk for help, they were rude and abrasive and requests would take several chase ups to get what you needed. Super noisy AC unit which was incredibly dirty. Cleanliness wasn't a strong point either. Bathroom super compact, basin was the smallest I've ever seen/used in a hotel. Not enough space to put our Toiletries. Windows are not soundproof so you can hear everything going on outside at all times, which meant we were often woken to the sound of binmen or sirens. Didn't use any other facilities such as restaurant etc so can't speak to it. Overall the place is very dated and requires a remodelling. Definitely not a 4* IMO. 

OK if you're alone but not the best experience and as such, would not stay here again since we were a family with a small child.

title: Disappointing and will not return to this Hilton property.  I am a Hilton fan, so this was doubly disappointing.
text: The front desk and housekeeping were a shambles.  My room was not ready when I arrived hours after check in couples with their confusion and lack of ability to communicate when the room may be ready was certainly frustrating.   The chef closed the room service kitchen early because he had somewhere to go.  Had some sort of issues each day I stayed.

title: Fix the elevators and train your staff on customer service!
text:
Positives... the room was nice, some of the staff were welcoming and pleasant, and it was a great location.

The other staff we encountered were very rude.  I called that morning to inquire about early check-in.  The lady who answered was rude and abrupt in her responses and then just went silent.  I had to ask if she was still on the phone.

The elevator was broken causing massive delays to move between floors (on the 26th floor so I couldn't take stairs). We were told it would be working by the next day, but as of 9pm the next day it wasn't.  I think that was a lie. 

Housekeeping kept knocking on the door to see if we were gone as early as 7:37 am and then again at 10:06 am, when check-out was at 11am.  We felt harassed and pushed to get out. Then when we came out she rolled her eyes, as if we were holding her up which was inappropriate.

Bartender was not friendly AT ALL!

title: God awful garbage hotel
text: Hotel is awful garbage. They lie to you and say they have a fridge there is no fridge in the room or microwave. Staff is stupid, weak and totally incompetent. They do not know the difference between a fridge and freezer. Loud at night, whenever you call them line is full of static. Every member of this hotel should be fired.

title: Good location, small room.
text: The hotel is very centrally located in the city, it’s walking distance from the Empire State Building and there are a lot of restaurants nearby. However, the hotel itself is very small. The hallways are small and it feels suffocating a bit. The rooms are also very small and you can hear everything in the hallways which makes it difficult to relax if there’s a kid crying or people moving in or out because it’s quite loud and easy to hear.

title: Spacious and very quiet for Manhattan
text: It was our first time at this Hilton and the room was quite spacious for Manhattan and much more quiet than further up close to Broadway, so we got some really good sleep. Very modern and clean, and staff was extremely helpful and polite. Also, very convenient and close to Penn Station so we could grab the train back home, and easier for our relatives to head back to JFK/LGA since it was not as congested as the Broadway area.

title: Ok, but nothing special, & slightly dated
text:
It was ok. Maybe I expected more from the Hilton brand, but while there was nothing wrong as such with the hotel, there was also nothing particularly special or distinctive - I preferred other places in NYC over this one. It just all felt a bit dated, & no real feel of comfort or semi-luxury as the TV adverts suggest.

It is close to Penn Station, maybe a 10-minute walk, so is good for public transport around the city, as well as arriving from JFK airport by the subway or LIRR.

The room was ok, standard NYC size really (room for the bed & not much else). There was a (very noisy) air conditioner, a decent-sized TV (but which took us a while to work - the TV guide is a channel rather than a separate feature, which it took us a while to work out!). There was a fridge, but it seemed to be a repurposed mini-bar, so not much room to actually keep much in it! The bathroom was very compact, barely enough space around the sink to wash, with a tiny old bathtub, with a showerhead in it - again, nothing wrong with it, just a bit old-fashioned compared to offerings elsewhere. Windows were not particularly soundproof so we were disturbed when bin lorries came in the night - not the fault of the hotel when the services come, but soundproofing improvements would probably be welcomed by guests as & when it becomes possible. Same issue with the door - our room was near the lift doors so we heard a bit of noise as other people on the floor came & went, although we didn't have any problems with noise through the walls.

Service was ok. We arrived quite late at night (after 10pm) due to delays in travel & check-in was a bit perfunctory - I heard later than cookies were usually offered to guests, but we didn't get any offered at check-in, or at any time after. We had breakfast at the hotel a few times as it was included in our rate, but didn't bother the rest of the time as it was nothing special - plate ordering rather than a buffet, & an $18 limit per day per guest, which with tax only covered a few of the dishes on the menu, otherwise you'd be liable for the excess (which for me is not quite 'breakfast included', as such). They did store our luggage for a few hours until it was time to head to the airport though, which was appreciated.

So basically, it was fine as somewhere to stay, but wasn't the best - the experience was not sufficiently impressive to win me over as a Doubletree by Hilton fan, anyway, & would not particularly look to stay here again if there was a similarly-priced option nearby.

title: Disappointed
text:
Rooms small as expected for a more budget hotel, but bathroom really disappointing. Cold water ran constantly warm to hot! Shower was either too hot or cold (thermostat valve clearly not working) 

Tiny sink so far in corner that banging my head on mirror just to brush teeth! If you think of a toilet on an airplane that’s about right.

Come on Hilton you can do better

title: 4 dages ophold på Double Tree By Hilton Hotel
text:
Min datter og jeg havde 4 overnatninger på Hotellet. Værelset var ganske udmærket - sengene var super behagelige, dog bløde - og udsigt til Empire State Building som lovet.
Badeværelse ok, badekar med bruser der godt kunne trænge til en udskiftning ;-) 
Vi fik gjort pænt rent to gange.
Det der specielt trækker ned er måden de tilbyder morgenmad, når dette er inkluderet. Vi kunne vælge på et menukort og med et Max på 18 dollar pr person. Én kop kaffe indgik dog - men juice (saft) kostede 3,5 $ ekstra. Én morgen var der buffet - det var noget bedre.
Maden var såmænd ok - nok typisk Amerikansk og store portioner. 
Der er udover morgenmads restaurant en bar i forbindelse med den. Der er et fint område foran hotellet hvor man kan sidde nyde en drink.
Da vi tjekkede ud, fik vi først kvittering da vi bad om den. 
Den var på tre sider 😅Her var der lagt 165 $  på regningen for morgenmad. De gik dog med til at nedsætte beløbet og vi betalte 20 $ som de havde regnet ud at vi havde brugt udover det beløb vi skulle have retur da vi havde betalt for morgenmad ved bookingen.
Vi var ikke enige men orkede ikke mere bøvl.
Flere af personalet var meget imødekommende - især en ung tjener i morgenmads “restauranten”  - her skal man iøvrigt også være forberedt på et støjende fjernsyn.
Det var et udmærket ophold, men vi vil vælge et andet hotel en anden gang. 
Regningen lød på godt 2200 pr nat og jeg vil mene man kan finde noget bedre til prisen.

title: NYC weekend
text:
Cons: The rooms were like a cruise ship size. We were only there 2 nights to visit the city. Customer service was okay. 
Pros: water bottles were offered. Close to restaurants and shops. 
Construction is heavy in the area.

title: Ottima posizione
text: Ottima posizione, vicina alle attrazioni maggiori e a tutti i sevizi (negozi, metro, ristoranti). Se state tutto il giorno in giro e usate l’albergo per dormire senza necessità di grandi spazi è perfetto!

title: A Very Bland Experience
text: Not a fan of this hotel. Rooms are small and in my opinion, furnished poorly. The lack of rugs is also a bummer as the floor is ice cold. Bathroom is very dull, and with no divider (just a shower curtain) the floor just gets wet when you use the shower. The walls are thin which is not great. There are only two elevators, so patience there is needed. Overall, the rooms have a college dorm feel, which is not comfortable. The staff is pretty nice but I won’t stay here again, and compared to the experiences of other hotels nearby, I am quite disappointed I stayed here in the first place.

title: basit konaklama
text:
Otel merkezi konumda odalar genel olarak düzgün ancak müşteri olanakları zayıf saat 16 dan önce odaya almıyorlar, 20 saat yoldan geldik saat 14.30 da otele vardık 1 tane oda açmadılar. 
tüm tozları yatak altına süpürmüşler.

title: Dejligt ophold midt i NYC
text: Dejligt hotel med den bedste morgenmad vi har fået i USA. Ligger super centralt og er rent og pænt. Personalet er i top og meget venlige. Der er et lille men godt fitnesrum. Værelser lidt små, men det er jo også NYC. Vi havde 4 dejlige og rolige nætter. Glem ikke den fantastiske roof top bar med livemusik om fredagen. Den ligger på 30th etage med udsigt til Imperial State samt de flotteste højhuse.

title: Buen Hotel
text: Hotel bien ubicado en el centro de Manhattan, buena opcion de desayuno.recomendable para familias La unica oega era que solo habia dos ascensores y habia que esperar un poco.Si vuelvo a Nueva York volvere a ospedqrme en este Hotel.

title: A good choice near Penn Station
text: This is a good mid-range option for Manhattan. It has a great location near Penn Station, several subway lines and downtown tourist attractions. My room was small, but clean and attractive. I'll go back.

title: Don’t get a room next to the elevator shaft!!!
text: The rooms right next to the elevator shaft have this awful, grinding, squeaking noise when the elevator goes up and down. Despite my requests to the front desk and to hilton.com to be relocated, I was told I could not be relocated because they were “sold out“ And others had reserve their special rooms. I asked to get a refund, and was denied that by the on-site rep. I checked out and went to a different hotel. Hilton has still not replied to me. Don’t waste your money here if they’re going to put you next to the elevator because you won’t be able to sleep with the noise. The front desk clerk acknowledge that they get complaints about those rooms all the time. Never again

title: Great stay in the city!
text:
Quiet, clean, safe stay. 
Staff members were kind and provided excellent service (and cookies!). Seriously, they probably gave my teen son a dozen cookies over our three nights.  
Close to Penn Station, Madison Square Garden, and Ess-a-Bagel. Reasonable walk to Hudson Yards and Broadway without paying the price for being precisely in those areas. 

My only complaint: one elevator was down for a day of our stay. We were on a lower floor and didn't mind, but it would have been a huge inconvenience if we weren't easily able to take the stairs. I also wish housekeeping didn't come quite so early (before 9am on a weekend?!). 

Rooms are standard NYC tiny but comfy for family travels.

title: Perfect trip to NYC
text: Don’t be discouraged by negative reviews. The hotel was great. Clean rooms and friendly staff. Lively, yet safe neighborhood  within walking distance to many attractions. If not walkable, very close to subway! Rooms were cleaned daily and facilities are well maintained. Super comfy beds. Read many negative comments about cleanliness issues and “slow elevators” and did not encounter any evidence of either issue. Great stay! Would gladly return again!

title: Wonderful!
text: Everything was great. Rooms were small of course just like almost nyc spaces, but the service, cleanliness, hospitality, housekeeping, quality of sleep, it was all great. My family and I arrived a couple hours before check in but they let us do early check in with no extra cost! It was great. I’ve stayed in a lot of hotels in NYC and this one is very good and affordable. I love staying in Chelsea so this was perfect. Would stay here again.

title: Great find
text:
Great location.  Very central for many areas.
Rooms were spotlessly clean. The bed was sooooo comfortable and the bedding brilliantly white and crisp. Very inviting after a tiring day exploring the city.
The bathroom was spotless. Great shower and Crabtree & Evelyn products - shampoo, conditioner, shower gel and body lotion.
We only used the bat and it was a very pleasant area and the drinks were reasonably priced  - for New York!
Previous reviewers had said the lifts were slow. We did not find this, and we were on the 26th floor (out of 27)
Waited a couple of minutes at most but this was very rare.
Staff very helpful and friendly.
Would definitely stay again if in this area.

title: Don’t bother
text:
Faucet in bathroom so loose I had to hold it with one hand while I turned it on with the other, so it wouldn’t fall out. Tray affixed to wall above toilet loose and slanted so everything falls off into the bowl. Staff constantly let stairwell door slam so no napping.  Gym with a broken peloton and a tread not balanced with a wobble making it useless. No freight elevator so staff uses it, too, so sometimes a 10 min wait for elevator. 

Positives: clean and comfortable room, but negatives far outweighed the positives

title: Motel quality
text:
Motel quality experience just about sums it up. Shocked it’s categorized as a 4 star hotel.

Friendly staff but the rest was really lacking.
Got an early check-in as a Diamond member, but no acknowledgment of status nor the usually Diamond amenities such as water or snack. That's fine.

However what wasn't fine - no fridge or microwave in room ( you can get fridge if you ask and its placed in the already small room) room size is smaller and more run down than other Hilton's in NYC, the bathroom configuration is awkward particularly the tiny sink that is crammed against a corner wall, breakfast food was trailer park quality so I skipped, HVAC system went from heat to a/c in the middle of December.

Overall, poor quality and wouldn't recommend unless you stay for lowest tier points (which we did thankfully) or pay a very reasonable price. Mainly given the convenience of the location.

Hilton needs to spend some money to completely revamp this property.

title: Amazing service
text: Amazing stay and views! Checking in was super simple, Peter helped us get our room early as well. Make sure to get a low level room as the elevators are very slow. Close to MSG and Penn Station. Definitely will stay here next time. Also a couple blocks from Times Square

Hotel was nice overall, check in was quick and easy and the bartender Carlos was very pleasant. 10/10 would go back! Def visit the bar and have a chat with Carlos! As for the hotel rooms the pillows were nice :p

title: Ridiculous and insulting
text: This hotel offers an advance check in but only gives the worst rooms as an option. To get even a mediocre room I had to incur a $55 a night surcharge. Whats the point of being a loyal Gold member only to be taken advantage of financially. Plus the location is down right scary, lots of homeless living under the scaffolding that lines the block. Stay somewhere else

title: Rooms are not that great
text: A very nice Hotel, but i can only give 3/5 because of the room. Our Room (2Adults) was too tiny and on the entrence door had a little space where you can enter all your fingers, so you hear every little noise. Pretty and clean but privacy is not garantued. In my opinion, the price is too high.

title: Scarso e non all’altezza del brand
text:
Hotel molto scarso rispetto lo standard medio del brand, tanto da chiedersi perché lo commercializzino  come doubletree.
L’hotel ha un aspetto molto comune, sempre affollato e senza alcun vantaggio rispetto alla categoria. Stessa inadeguatezza per il bar e la sala colazione.
I due unici ascensori non riescono a soddisfare l’affluenza.
Le camere non sono insonorizzate e dai corridoi si sente ogni singola parola pronunciata all’interno.
Letti comodi, bagno essenziale. Pulizia sufficiente.
Servizio front desk impegnato a dare il massimo in un contesto stressante.

title: Rapport qualité /prix décevant
text:
Pas dément vu les prix exorbitants pratiqués à NYC…
L’hôtel est mal insonorisé : réveillé systématiquement par les aller venues dans les couloirs, ascenseurs hors d’âges (jusqu’à 10min d’attente) et petit dej cher pour une qualité très moyenne (autant aller prendre le petit dej à 2 pas).
Bref, pas terrible et rapport qualité/prix décevant pour une enseigne Hilton.

title: Very clean, great location
text: The room was small, but very clean.  I would say this is typical for NYC.  The location is central with many great sites to see and restaurants in the area. The staff was very helpful and friendly. I would stay here again!

title: Not worth it
text: Disappointed how unkept the rooms were. Rooms are small (but it’s Midtown NYC - so this is expected). Elevators were not working half of the time and had to use the emergency exit. No breakfast for HH members.

title: Excellent Location and good value!
text: This was a really nice hotel with food amenities. Breakfast was really good and most of the staff was very attentive. The rooms were a good size for NYC and the AC works perfectly. Will definitely include it on my hotel options fro NYC

title: 10 stars not four
text:
After an 11 hour flight we arrived at seven in the morning at the hotel. I was sure they would send us to put our luggage in custody. and tell us to come back at three.
To my surprise the receptionist filled out forms and let us into the room.
I was ready to kiss her. This is definitely not typical.
The room itself is beautiful and clean, there was a coffee machine, tea and free coffee.
There are many cafes and a supermarket near the hotel.
Highly recommend. It's hard to find such personal attention anywhere. I would give ten stars, not five.

title: Disappointing
text: This hotel is tired fora Doubletree. No cookie at check in! No upgrade or mention of Diamond status. Two elevators, and one was broken for some time. Breakfast is not good. Really, other than location this hotel has not much going for it.

title: I'd stay there again.
text: The staff was great. The room was comfy. The breakfast buffet was yummy and again, the staff was great and very friendly and professional. A room is a room, but the employees made the stay a nice experience.

title: DoubleTree pleased GUEST!!!! NEW YORK! NEW YORK!
text: My friend I were there on Oct. 13-16th from Ho. The hotel team member Nashan was so helpful with our reservation before we even arrived on the phone because I booked 3 hotels before I made the decision forDoubleTree. After we arrived he was there along with two lovely ladies, Kimanda and Wesay. This team was pleasant with other  guest as well. I’m very observant of customer service. They gladly helped us in any way they could during our stay. Nashan even went to look for a cab for us to attend a play because of rainy night. We appreciated it. Going above and beyond. I would stay again and recommend too others. Also, the greeters during breakfast were outstanding and pleasant as well. There were others I don’t remember their names. Overall enjoyed the STAY at DoubleTree!!

title: Good location, great service- accommodations lacking
text:
We stayed here for New York Comic Con. Absolutely do not recommend the 1 bedroom suite for groups more than 2, the rooms were too tiny for more than 2 people’s stuff and bags. 

Like, I know this is NYC and so everything is tiny, but this room and it’s accommodations were smaller than the doubletree we stayed at in Rome, and that room wasn’t a suite!

That said, the service was great: everyone was super nice and accommodating, our housekeeper made sure we had fresh towels and a fresh bed but I don’t think the floor was ever vacuumed during our stay, if that gives you a sense of the level of cleanliness you get. 

Also they kept leaving the housekeeping cart on our floor’s hallway in front of our door so it was really difficult to get to and from the room. I don’t think the building is big enough for a service elevator, it felt like they tried to cram as many hotel rooms as possible in as much space as they could get, and then forgot about needing space for housekeeping, room service, etc.

title: Great location
text:
Hotel was in a great location, easily walkable to many major tourist places and close to a couple of subway stations too.

Staff at check in were friendly and the bar in house had some good drinks available, though slightly overpriced.

Only gripe was the lifts.  Only having 2 lifts meant that there was frequently a 5/6 minute wait to get up/down.  Outside of that, was absolutely great and will definitely stay here again when coming back to the city.

title: bad check in staff
text: entirely due to the checkin person Kimana, she has deliberately & intentionally caused us stress & bank charges by her actions.  we orginally had a booking for 4 nites, we then extended it by 2 nites arriving earlier on 23rd, so now 6 nites in total leaving on Mon 29.8.  The 2 bookings were made seperately & at different times, the 1st lot was paid for prior to arrival the 2nd lot to be paid on arrival when due.  we rung Hilton customer help and advised we had 2 bookings and if possible could we keep the same room for both the stays.  On arrival this confused her immensely then she wanted $ for security reasons then she said we had to checkin & checkout between stays, there was a man hovering around the wonderful Blake.   He had it all sorted in a wink, said we could keep the same room just had to get the keys for that room remade for the 2nd stay.  He could see $688.76 was paid for the first stay, and that $960.96 was owing for the 2nd stay.  So on the 25th we went down to the lobby and got Kimana again, we were going to "exchange" keys for the room I did at that time tell her not to be so very rude which she ignored.  She couldn't cope with something on the computer wanted us to pay more $, and was just foul so I took the key back and joined the line for Blake.  Blake sorted the issue out for her, told her to exchange the keys.  I said to her do you want me to pay for the 2nd stay now I have my card, it is different to the first card used for the first booking.  She said no you can pay for it at the end when you check out just tell them it is a different card you will be using.  I said thanks we left.  At no time did she say thanks or please.  You are extremely lucky to have Blake (and George & Gladys) at your hotel.  The next morning when I am checking my finances, I see that she has put thru the full amount for the 2nd stay ON THE CREDIT CARD I TOLD HER WE WOULD NOT BE USING.  NOT PENDING PUT IT THROUGH.  So I ring for Blake and get her he was out.  Then he was busy.  So I went down and explained the situation to Blake, he could see that had been done, so he took our 2nd credit card for the 2nd stay and ENTERED THE AMOUNT AS PENDING AND HE THEN PUT THRU A REFUND/CREDIT FOR THE FIRST CREDIT CARD WHICH DIDN'T HAVE ENOUGH MONEY LEFT ON IT WHICH WAS WHY IT WASN'T BEING USED.  HOWEVER THIS WAS 4.00PM Friday by then and too late.  SO WE ARE IN THE POSITION NOT OF OUR OWN FAULT OF BEING OVER ON OUR CREDIT CARD AND FACING CHARGES.  OF BOTH CREDIT CARDS BEING USED FOR THE SAME BOOKING.  And this was deliberately done by Kimana.  We now have very little money left for the remainder of our stay in New York while we wait for Blakes credit to reverse a charge that should never have been made, that she did in spite at not being able to do her job efficiently.  I also spoke to Chris about this on Saturday 27/8 he said he could see both charges on 2 seperate cards and the credit that Blake had put thru at 4.00pm Friday and there was nothing further he could do as it was the wkend.  I would really have like to give you a zero but you don't include that, and that wouldn't reflect fairly for Blake, George and Gladys.  But I won't be in a hurry to return to USA and use Hilton again.  We had paid in advance for the first 2 nite stay, she charged us NOT PENDING for the next 4 days stay on the first day of that stay and then Blake put a pending thru for the stay also.  And that was deliberate after I told her we would use a different credit card and she said just tell them at check out time, and then she went and charged us.  You asked for feedback there it is, a very sour experience due to 1 person.

title: Très bon emplacement
text:
Cet hôtel est idéalement situé dans New York. Vous pouvez tout faire à pied (Times Square 20 minutes, Empire State Bulding 15 minutes, Rockefeller Center 20 minutes, Chelsea…) ou alors vous avez les métros à moins de 5 minutes à pieds. De plus, il est parfaitement entouré de restaurants, fast-food, Starbucks, et boulangeries! 
Concernant l’hôtel, il fait le « job », gros problème cependant avec les ascenseurs qui sont assez lents, du coup l’attente est longue dans les étages et au lobby, le ménage n’a pas été fait tous les jours (nous sommes restés 4 jours). 
Petit déjeuner classique au prix de 18 $ par personne, pas très cher pour New York. Chambres petites, mais fonctionnelles, attention les lits sont petits!!! Nous avions opté pour une chambre en étage avec vue sur l’Empire State Bulding.

title: Bad service and not clean
text:
The service was unacceptable to the point of being insulting.
- We were told at reception desk that the room will not be cleaned unless we specifically ask for it. We did not and yet someone made up the room, took the used towels and did not replace them with fresh ones.
- the room was not clean.
- At the reception desk Sean refused to make a reservation for us at a restaurant (we did not have a local US phone to do so ourselves. He said he was busy.
- At checkout I asked to see proof that the 100$ deposit was refunded, they didn't 't know how to show it to me.
- All of these complaints were mentioned to the receptionist and they were dismissive and actually laughed in my face.
- the hotel is very load
- the elevators are slow and small.
I will not stay at this hotel again.

title: Great hotel, fabulous location and the most professional staff
text:
We stayed two nights from July 23-July 25th. Upon check-in, we were greeted by Blake. He let us check-in early which was fabulous because New York City was in the middle of a severe heat wave! He let us pick our room which was on the 10th floor and we had a nice view of the Empire State Building! My 15 year old niece was super happy about that! Blake also gave us great suggestions on things to do that I never thought of! One was to take the Ferry offered by NYC around the East River to see great views of Manhattan and Brooklyn and you can even see the Statue of Liberty. For three people, it was $18 round trip! It was such a great cruise! 
Our room was great! Nice and clean and we even had a cute little fridge which was great to store our water in because it was so hot! No big issues with the room or the view! It was great! 

We arrived back at the hotel and due to the heat, I became very overheated. As I went upstairs to the room to lay down, my sister went to the front desk to ask where we could get a Gatorade for me. She was helped by Wesay the front desk attendant. Wesay told my sister to sit tight and she would be right back. She ran to the store around the corner and purchased me a Gatorade so that I would be OK! I’ve stayed at a lot of hotels and have never had this level of service! It was just so kind and thoughtful and we were eternally grateful for her quick thinking and desire to go above and beyond! 

When it came time to check out, I was honestly sad to be leaving! We had such a nice time and I would recommend this hotel to anyone! The location is perfect being in the Chelsea neighborhood and close to NY Penn Station and Moynihan Station for Amtrak. There’s lots of local places to eat that were great! The rooms in the hotel are not huge… keep in mind in New York City, most rooms are small. But this hotel has something for everyone! Fresh water when you come in and warm chocolate chip cookies! 

A big thank you again to Blake and Wesay! Because you two went above and beyond, I will be back for sure! 👍🏻👍🏻

title: Very disappointing.
text: Was looking for an oasis in the city after a day of roaming around in the heat. What I got was the bear minimum and a subpar night's sleep with noisy ineffective air conditioner. Couldn't even enjoy the morning in a sunless 3rd floor room. The only saving grace was a clean bathroom with enough towels.

title: Summer visit
text: This is the first time we have stayed here and it will probably be our last.  This hotel is not kept up well.  They only have two elevators, and one was broken down for our entire stay.  We were here for a weekend, and we requested housekeeping on our way to breakfast.  They did not come by until 6:00 PM.  The second day, housekeeping never came.  I would recommend staying someplace else if visiting NYC.

title: Not Double Tree Worthy
text:
I rated this hotel a 2 as we felt it's not double Tree worthy,By far the worst double tree ever stayed..it's filthy, outdated and in need of full make over.small room I understand that being in NY, However the aircon was so noisy,the elevator service is almost impossible,so many people use fire escape..
Bar service was not open and restaurant was basically waste of time
Location was handy to everything and staff were helpful in every way

title: Stay anywhere but here!
text:
I haven't felt like writing reviews for some time, but this hotel was so awful I had to express my feelings somewhere. From the dingy corridors lined with rubbish to the tiny, tired rooms and bathrooms, lifts which can't cope with the passenger traffic, leaving long waits to get up and down to rooms, to the breakfast which seemed to have been fished out of another hotel's bins, this was a dreadful experience from start to finish. 

To cap it all, the hotel filched unauthorised and unexplained sums from my credit card account after I checked out. Hilton have accepted that they shouldn't have taken the extra money, but getting a refund from them is like pulling teeth and I have wasted hours of my time trying to get my money back. Their latest offer is to refund me by cheque within 30 days. Who uses cheques in 2022!!??

If you don't mind Hilton using your credit card like their own wallet, you might find the location of the hotel convenient. Otherwise, do yourself a favour and stay anywhere else.

title: Sleep on the street!
text: Filthy, infested, unresponsive, shambolic, just dont stay here. It is a crap part of town anyway I guess so the hotel fits right in! I killed two winged insects and found another one squished on the headboard no doubt from a previous guest! the room was not made up. the rooms on the same floor were used as store rooms and stuff was moved in and out all night. The corridors were bunged up with mattresses, black plastic bags and other stuff. Conrad Hilton is turning in his grave!....and they had the temerity to charge me $850 for two nights!

title: Wonderful Trip
text: I had a WONDERFUL stay during my trip back home to New York. The room was a nice size (smaller room which is expected due to the hotel being in a city area but perfect for me), very clean and must add in I had an amazing view especially at night. The best part of my trip was the amazing staff at the front desk (Will, O’Neil and Wesay). I had the pleasure of speaking with each of them during my stay and all 3 were very polite, professional and friendly from checking to checkout. I would highly recommend this property especially for the service, cleanliness and location.

title: Very good hotel!
text:
Great location, clean spacious room!
Water with ice in the main lobby which was ideal as the weather was very warm, we bought a bottle of water and could refill this everyday in the lobby! 

Easy to check in and out. Wifi worked perfectly also from the lobby and our room which was on the 20th floor.

title: posizione comoda
text: Le stanze sono un pò piccole, ma la posizione è molto comoda. Silenzioso la notte. Non puliscono le stanze tutti i giorni ma ogni quattro giorni (se si vuole una pulizia più frequente si deve chiedere).

title: Good location
text: Room is small and the elevator was constantly on maintenance but for this value and location we would definitely come back, wish an option of breakfast was available as it showed on Booking.com, and maps could be offered on the lobby

title: Horrible Experience
text:
This was the absolute worst hotel experience I have ever had.

My flight was over 6 hours delayed to NYC and when I got to the Hilton Doubletree at 2:30am, Hilton canceled the reservation I had booked because I was late. The staff couldn’t have been less helpful - they proceeded to tell me that the new nightly rate would be $1100 because it would be a brand new reservation but shortly after they said that, the receptionist realized there were no available rooms left. They told me that check in time was at 4pm and if you’re not there shortly after that, Hilton would cancel your reservation. I travel often for work/personal and have never heard of this. 

They did call a Hilton Garden Inn down the street but the nightly rate was $1100 and the room wouldn’t be ready until 6am. I was left to wander the streets of NYC at 3am searching for a hotel. This left me in a very scary/nightmare situation (not to mention, I had morning meetings that day). After walking to every hotel in the area, I finally found a hotel with an available room at 4am. 

This was completely unacceptable - I will never book a Hilton hotel again and will urge my coworkers and friends not to book one either.

title: Best Hotel
text: Everyone was very nice sweet and patient I would definitely recommend this Hotel to anyone,very clean and accommodating staff were super friendly and helpful I love this place I will definitely stay at this Hotel again..

title: Very low level hotel. Misleading the DoubleTree brand
text:
I know Doubletree Hilton since many years. I booked this hotel trusting on the company brand. 
It was a full disappointment 

PRO
Only the location. Well located between the 6th and the 7th Av

CONS
- We discovered the morning after our arrival that no facilities (breakfast, restaurant) were available. They were claiming about some "missed" parts in the kitchen. Very doubtful excuse
- After two days having not cleaned the room the staff said that we have to ask for it. A doggy way to save cleaning personnel. We insisted to clean every day (we spent 8 nights) and after two days again "we not informed them to clean the room". And again they just said " we are sorry"
-Before the main entrance is completely empty. the picture in the website is misleading
-trash on the right side of the premises for several days
-Rooms are ok and they need a refurbishment.
-do not take rooms in the last floor on the back of the hotel. it's extremely noisy due to a huge ventilation machine just across the street.
-Room cleaning. Low average. Air conditioner very dirty
-price quality not worth at all!!!!!

It's a shame for Hilton

title: Average. Won’t stay again.
text:
It was definitely just okay. 
Pros: it was clean enough and safe enough. The a/c was fantastic and kept the room cold. Good area to stay in. The beds are cozy. 
Cons: it was just chaos overall. You can tell everyone who works there is busting their butt to do everything they can to make it good for guests.  But the hotel is is an old building and the rooms are TINY even for NY standards. It was essentially like staying in a dorm room. I had to keep my shoes on as the laminate floors made me feet filthy. It was disorganized af behind the front desk - they were literally writing down notes for each guests’ request so kudos for effort but it was a mess. I had to ask for extra pillows 3 times before they remembered. There is no restaurant on site nor any kind of guest shops for snacks etc. I’m also still waiting for the incidentals to be taken off my credit card. 
So it got the job done for a weekend stay but I wouldn’t book again. Not worth they 300/night, sorry doubletree.

title: Recently re-opened in May 2022
text: Three-night stay here over Memorial Day Weekend 2022. (Closed for some period of time, apparently COVID-related, it re-opened a week or so beforehand.) All staff were VERY welcoming. The hotel is still missing some of its standard amenities, such as on-site dining and outside seating area, but hoping to bring it all back in the not-too-distant future. Easy walking distance to several food options. Convenient to Penn Station--less than a 10-minute walk. Comfortable room; very clean. ESB views worth the extra $. Will stay here again (as I have previously) for future NYC visits.

title: Bilder på booking.com överensstämmer inte med Hotellets verklighet !
text: Jag förstår inte vad som hänt med Hotellet,  lokaliteterna som frukostbufe´/ frukostrum, Hotelbar, fanns överhuvudtaget inte där, enl. Hotell Managern var detta bortrenoverat ! Krävde att det skulle uppdatera hemsidan omgående !! Hotell entre´och Hotell korridor var sunkigt och smutsigt. Städningen av rummen bristfälliga. Hotell personalen okunnig, personalen hade inte en aning om hur deras hemsida på Booking.com såg ut. Visade web sidan till Managern och krävde avdrag av en veckas vistelse, (25/5 - 1/6 , 2022 ) vilket jag fick ! Rekommenderar inte detta Hotellet.

title: Canceled last minute
text: We booked this months ago, only to be told 4 nights in advance that the hotel has been closed most of the year and they were moving our reservation to the Times Square location. Why take reservations they had no intention of honoring?

title: Booked here, moved to worse non doubletree hotel
text:
I booked 6 nights here several months out.  About a month before the stay, I received a mysterious email not from Hilton informing me the hotel was closed and I was being moved to a non-hilton hotel.  I called Hilton first to try and confirm this wasn't a scam, they knew nothing about it.  Was given the run around for a while then finally told yes, the hotel would be closed, that Hilton the brand couldn't help me, just the owners of the actual hotel (who sent me the mysterious email, after all).

The hotel I was moved to (Hub hotel), was in a worse location, had no restaurant, no fitness center, and did not honor any portion of my Hilton Honors benefits.  I received no points for the stay as well.

I fell victim of a hotel bait and switch.

title: A great stay!
text:
When I arrived in New York I was exhausted after the long flight but luckily the staff were so uplifting it cheered me up. As upon arrival we were gifted a bottle of water and warm cookies.
The rooms were clean but basic but you’re not really in them when in New York. This hotel is a few minutes walk to Times Square making it close to everything. Only having one lift working a time was annoying. Some of the staff had an attitude but most were nice. The hotel arranged a taxi for us to tack us to JFK. Overall it was a good stay

title: Ótimo
text:
O hotel DOUBLE tree by HILTONN HOTEL NEW york CITY chelsea  é muito bem locallizado. Perto de tudo.
QUarto limpo e grande.
Banheiro limpo , roupa de cama e banho macios . Recomendo para todo turista. Preço acessivell.

title: Great
text: Staff is always helpful and kind. They continued to provide solid service with a friendly manner despite there being a city-wide and national emergency regarding the virus, I look forward to returning again in happy and safer days.

title: No more free breakfast for Diamond members
text: I have been a longtime Diamond member and have stayed at several Doubletree hotels and have always go free breakfast but now at this one I was told that only a continental breakfast will be served free, that means eggs, bacon, pancakes and such will be an extra charge. This is ridiculous especially since the website shows the full breakfast just like I'm used to. So do not stay here if you are expecting the usual breakfast. I will be changing hotels.

title: Double Trouble is more like it
text: They think they should have a site . What they should worry about is a respectful way in which I was treated then turned 180degrees and ignored me and still go kiss up to many other guests. I felt like I was a bother up there

title: Fantastic Hotel
text: This is a great Doubletree hotel in the perfect location for enjoying NYC. Our room had a great view of The Empire State Building and was well equipped with mini fridge, storage, and coffee maker. The staff are all extremely friendly and we appreciated the cookies and bottled water at check in, in addition to the flavored water at the desk. The hotel is updated, and has a good happy hour deal at the bar downstairs. Thank you!

title: Visiting my roots, Daughter’s 30th Bday Celebration
text:
Let me begin with the positive. I love the DoubleTree. As a matter of fact, if I was a spokeswoman for the hotel and it’s cookies, their profits would triple. That being said, don’t allow anything or anyone to ruin your stay......unless it’s a flea or bedbug.

#1 Regardless of how you reserved your accommodations, guests should be treated exactly according to their mission statement. The problem is, staff forget what that is Connie and Swapna. Upon arrival with a very busy foyer, my family and I were greeted by Connie, she confirmed our reservation and our amenities, so we thought. The room was without refrigeration or a microwave. We had a 5 month old baby with us. We had an unpleasant view of the backside of neighboring hotels and the lower maintenance area of our hotel. As an Hilton Honors member, she confirmed our free breakfast yet we got charged when we went to eat. The food was so bad we couldn’t even eat and left the food. When I addressed this at the front desk, I was rudely and loudly denied that we had free breakfast with again a crowded foyer. The kicker was several people had no problem open mouth coughing and sneezing without regard to children, babies, otherwise healthy guest, and the open display of hot and cold food. Hello Coronavirus.

#2 Our beds were very uncomfortable, which is surprising. The sheets and comforters were very stiff and rough. In the morning, my daughter had large bite marks around her ankles and my granddaughter had red marks on her hands. We thought maybe while she was having tummy time on her blanket on the floor that somehow she hit her hand. The problem came when the little black spots showed up. We thought they were scabs. I got a tweezer to make sure and after trying to gently investigate it, as I finally was able to move the first one, the darn thing jumped, right into my daughter’s plate. We got a napkin to hold it down to make sure it was actually a bug of some sort. When I tried to grab it again with the tweezers it jumped again. It was obviously trying to burrow itself in my granddaughters hand. Once we realized what we were dealing with, we notified management. Regardless of a different room, we got no sleep prior to our morning departure.

#3 Room service. We spoke with the housekeeper specifically. After a long day out and around Manhattan, we returned to half the room being serviced. My sheets merely had the comforter thrown over it and tucked in, my daughters bed wasn’t touched and the trash was left at the door. Really! Why did you even come in?

In a metropolis where you can pick anywhere to stay, we chose DoubleTree because their past hospitality was bar none. This was my first time back home to my roots since childhood. Where you choose to rest your head to refresh yourself after a long day should be a compliment to any establishment.  We were grossly disappointed and embarrassed. All the cookies in the world cannot excuse our experience.

title: Room with a view
text: Mooie kamer met uitzicht op the Empire State Building. Netjes en groot genoeg. Geweldige locatie. Het matras was enigszins aan de zachte kant. Fijn dat er een kleine koelkast aanwezig was. Maar enkele liften dus wat geduld nodig

title: Nice hotel close to Madison Square Garden
text: This is a small hotel located close to MDG, with friendly staff and overall good rooms.  As this is not a popular area, it is not as noisy as hotels in other parts of the city (this is a BIG plus).  Beds are VERY comfortable, with the only observation that hallways are reduced, so when you run into other guests with luggage or housekeeping/room service...just a fun moment.  YES, I would stay here again.

title: very good
text: we stayed here for a quick trip to see a concert. The staff was nice, the food was good, the room was comfy enough, a little small but we werent here to stay at the hotel, so it was good enough for our trip. I would recommend it because it has a fair price.

title: Never Again
text: The worst traveling stay I have ever experienced. Rude staff and criminal parking garage. They stole out of our car and was extremely rude and unaccommodating. Treated us like bums off the street.NEVER A-GAIN!

title: Nice stay
text: Stayed for a week. Location is good, close to Madison Square Garden, Empire State Building and short walk to Times Square and 5th Avenue to go shopping. Nice and welcoming staff. Nice room. Would recommend.

title: Friendly Staff
text: Great Hotel and friendly management. Had some issues, they solved it in no time. I would stay again, Miguel is a very professional and respectful manager.  My only suggestion would be to probably remodel the rooms and hotel a bit so that they are at the standard of the other hotels around. Other than that, friendly staff always make a different and this hotel knows how to carry that.

title: NY Toy Fair
text: I stayed here during the NY Toy Fair and it was a very nice hotel.  It was convenient and easy to get around.  I would definitely stay there again.  Staff was very friendly and service was good.  Great Value!

title: Good hotel in good place
text:
My wife and I wanted to visit New York and we were searching for nice hotel with moderate prices in good localization. Thanks to TripAdvisor / GoogleMaps, we picked DoubleTree by Hilton in Chelsea. When we arrived, it was hard for us to find the entrance, it's a little bit hidden, without any big brand logos. Before coming to USA, I bought some dollars to have nice exchange rate. However during check-in, it was a problem to pay by debit card or cash for hotel stay. Because we were tired after 11 hours of flight, I said to use credit card for  entire bill. So it's not possible to give credit card for additional expenses and pay for stay in another way... that way I lost on poor exchange rate on credit card. At least we received, as usually in DoubleTrees, cookies. 

We received room on 20th floor. It was huge enough with big bed - so comfy! There are many places for clothes and other things. Big TV screen with cable TV - super cool! Internet bandwidth was very good, no problems for video calls or Netflix. Bathroom contains bath (not shower). Many places for hanging additional towels. There are two electro sockets. In bedroom, there were at least 4 or 5 electro sockets with additional USB sockets. There is in-room safe but our was broken. I was able to close it and then open it without entering code. But it wasn't problem for us so I didn't make a complain about it.

One thing must be added about room. Cleanliness. I was in many places around the world and cleaning service was always a problem. Here, my wife was cleaning common places like tv remote control or table with antibacterial tissue and it was white clean! Huge congrats for such a perfect cleaning service.

From my point of view the biggest advantage of the hotel is location. Hotel is located near PennStation (5min walk), Macy's (10min walk) and TimesSquare (15min walk). Subway station (28th St Line1) is just around the corner. We were walking till late hours and there was no issue with safety.

About restaurant I cannot say anything because we didn't try breakfast nor dinner. About breakfast we decided to eat like a local because groceries were everywhere like Walgreens, Target or Duane Reade stores. Dinners we were eating at the city. In room there is small fridge. Huge plus also for coffee machine. Coffee beans (capsules) were refilled every day. 

In afternoon there is hot coffee or chocolate free for guests. 

Before coming to DoubleTree, I was afraid about the elevator issue that some people wrote. Unfortunately I can admit that it's really a problem. Elevators are so slow, stops so frequently. During our stay, only once elevators (both 2) were broken. There was a need to use stairs for 20 floors. Fortunately it was fixed quickly.

During the last evening, we had an occasion to check hotel maintenance service. Something happened and water was pouring down on our heads. After two minutes, hotel crew member came to us and fixed the problem. Huge thanks for that!

To sum up, it was our first stay in New York. What's more, it was our first trip to USA ever. Picking DoubleTree hotel for Valentine's Day period in NYC was a perfect choice. Price-quality ratio, localization, hotel crew, cleaning staff - everything that made our stay unforgettable. 

Will I recommend the hotel? Of course. Will I return? For sure!

title: Location location
text: There are so many choices in New York City with similar prices. I have to go on what is closest to my work and convenient to get to.  So close to Amtrak and a super friendly staff. The hotel is clean but needs an update in the rooms.  Best part was the front desk smiling at me with a cookie. Be careful not to have to many of these cookies.

title: Best place to stay and relax
text:
I had a pleasant stay over here, the food was amazing and room service was great.
The place is also near by to main location and its easy to travel the city from here.
The view from the room is simply great.

title: NICE HOTEL
text: This hotel is super AWESOME according to me... I stayed here for a day, The view from hotel is spectacular. friendly staffs and comfort room  made my day. If I come back, again definitely book room here....

title: Decent hotel
text: Stayed for four nights on a recent trip.  Good location, especially if you are watching any events at MSG, and close to 28th street metro and Penn station.  The room was spacious and very clean, staff on the front desk were extremely friendly.  The only downside was the long wait to get the elevator down, I usually chose to take the stairs.

title: Not happy at all
text: I was questioned/interrogated by the front desk the day of my arrival as to my service animal. My entire stay, my key card/access card did not work. I did alot of going up and down elevators (only 1 of 2 elevators worked at times)to get issued a new key card.

title: Great time spent with my buddies
text: DoubleTree by Hilton Hotel helps me to relax in the comfort of the beautiful city view, we had a great time but the main important things which I forgot to take my Smoochy (Dog), they allow pets here and the staffs were pretty cool.

title: Business
text: This property is simply filthy if you want the experience  A being able to stay in a slum in New York in a safe place then a double tree is most certainly the place for you. With the exception of the  Restaurant manager the staff is  Nice they're just not going to do anything about the problems curtains torn and dry rot rooms filthy carpet hasn't been cleaned in the rooms and in the halls in years glasses throughout the Hall trash on the floor near the elevators as well as the ice machines. The breakfast if you like potatoes you must certainly can survive because that's the only thing that's hot and you gonna have the same thing but the wait staff is to die for their super nice and kind roles are hard and  Old

title: Great Location & Remarkable Service
text:
Super location: close to everything. And, in addition to our room being spacious and spotless, the service was fantastic!

We had an issue with the safe, called the main desk, and a service person arrived in minutes.

Also, when we requested extra coffee, same deal. A person delivered it to our room in minutes.

We had no problems with a late check-out, complimentary baggage storage until our late flight, bottled water and fresh chocolate chip oatmeal cookies!

The folks at the desk were so friendly and helpful, we know we'll be staying here again our next visit.

title: No hot water, nobody cares
text: I have stayed at this hotel many times (Ofer 15) mostly for the great location a couple blocks from Penn Station.   The rooms are small but clean, the walls are paper thin, the towels are worn and thin, but the price is reasonable.   Today I woke up to find no hot water in the room.  The reaction of the front desk was even more annoying than not being able to shower.   I got a blank stare and “when he gets in, I guess the engineer will look at it.”  No offer I’d help, no empathy.    Never again!

title: Great location
text:
What a great location, not far from Maddison square gardens - Times Square !
Rooms small - but if your only sleeping there shouldn’t be too much of problem.
Water & cookies are also complimentary during your stay !
Would definitely stay again NYC & at this hotel aswell !

title: Convenient Location
text: The location is the primary endorsement of this hotel. The rooms are small and dated. Much of the hotel from the dining room to the lobby to the hallways and elevators are small and crowded. The hotel provides great access to New York amenities and may not matter if you don't plan to spend much time in your room.

title: Short-staffed
text:
Excellent location! 5 minutes walk to Penn station, and less than than 10 minutes to Herald Square.
 The staff were friendly and welcoming, but almost all requests require multiple reminder, up to 4 times and 6 hours to fulfill. None of the service dials worked except of the front desk and the wait in the service line to front desk could easily go over 10 minutes. The supplies don't always get replaced/ refilled in the room, and would still get knock on the door even if the do not disturb sign was placed.

title: Wonderful Stay!
text:
The entire staff  (from Chris the front desk manager) and everyone else we encountered was so friendly and accommodating. 
bed/pillows very comfortable.  Shower was great too!
Enjoyed the breakfast buffet. Again, waitstaff very helpful and pleasant!

title: Ok hotell sentralt
text: Ok hotell men ville ikke kalt det 4 stjerner. Hyggelig personale men slitne rom. Trenger nok en oppdatering. Ligger sentralt i forhold til penn station og 5th Avenue og empire. Helt ok og god pris om man ikke er så avhengig av hvordan det ser ut.

title: Top Lage
text:
Wir waren eine Woche im DoubleTree Chelsea.

Das Hotel zeichnet sich durch eine Top Lage aus, wenige Minuten zur Penn Station, außerdem kann man von dort aus ganz Manhattan zu Fuß erkunden.

Als Honors Gold Member konnte man beim Check-In zwischen Extra Punkten oder Frühstück wählen.

Schade dass es nicht Honors Zimmerupgrades wie z.B. in Asien bekommt, da gab es das ein oder andere mal schon eine Suite! Muss aber auch dazu sagen, wir haben nicht nach einem Upgrade gefragt, da wir sie in anderen Hotels der Hilton Gruppe immer vom Hotel aus bekommen hatten.

Beim Frühstück gab es eigentlich die ganze Woche die gleiche Auswahl.

Die Zimmer waren klein, aber sehr sauber. Das Personal immer sehr Freundlich.

Was mich ziemlich gestört hat, ein Aufzug war kaputt, somit war die Wartezeit teilweise über 10 Minuten.

Ansonsten war es ein angenehmer Aufenthalt, nur schade dass Hilton Group Hotels im Heimatland (USA) nicht den Standart bieten, den man in Asien erhält.

title: Perfect hotel in Chelsea.
text: Right in the middle of the garment district.  Walking distance to MSG & subway.  Great view from my room of the Empire State Bldg.  Restaurants in all directions including the best slice of pizza in NYC (NY Suprema) and you also have Koreatown.

title: DoubleTree Chelsea - Rundown
text: I like doubletree hotels in general, but this location is in a rundown condition.  The lobby is tiny and cramped so there is hardly any room to wait.  There is a large pillar in the way of where reception is located so it is poorly designed.  The elevator took 15 mins to come down and get me  and during rush hour in the morning, I waited nearly 20mins going from the highest floor to the lobby because it stopped at almost every single floor.
