There was a foul odor in the hallway as if the plumbing exploded somewhere in the building.  My bathroom shower curtain was installed too high so that it didn't hit the tub--everytime I showered, the water would fall through the gap and soak the entire bathroom.  There were stains on the carpets both in the halls and in the room so they should probably rip up the carpeting and replace it w/ wood or something else.  The staff was all friendly and super nice, so nothing wrong w/ the staff.  I just didn't like how old and rundown this hotel was.  The location was perfect for my work meetings and conferences and within walking distance to Penn Station.

title: Birthday Trip to NYC!
text: I chose this hotel because of its location and price, as well as the reviews provided a lot of positive feedback. I loved the location, staff, free cookies and hot cocoa; however, the only the bed needed an upgrade, because there was an annoying dip that gave me lower back pain. Nonetheless, my stay at DoubleTree was worth it, and I'd definitely come back next time I travel to NYC, as well as let others know how amazing those cookies are lol SO WORTH the stay!! :)

title: Very Shabby
text: I am not a picky traveler, but this hotel was in very poor condition. Was akin to a budget motel, not a 4 star hotel. The condition of the room was terrible. Old, dirty, worn. Bathroom mirror frame was broken, both sink and tub barely drained (stood in 1 foot of water as I showered). Heat in room was barely functioning and I woke up cold most of night as the unit couldn't keep up. Luke warm hot water. Mildew in shower. Scratched tub floor and toilet seat. The list goes on. I would not stay here again and wouldn't recommend this hotel. Not typical of the brand.

title: Excellent hotel
text: Stayed here for three nights on a vacation to NY with my girlfriend. Check-in was easy. We had a room on the 14th floor that had a view of the Empire State Building which was a nice treat. The room was small but perfectly good. The counter space in the bathroom is very small but we were comfortable our entire trip. Bed was extremely comfy. No issues with elevator wait times as others have mentioned. Most we ever waited was maybe a minute. Front desk also allowed us to store our bags for a few hours after checkout before we left which was a nice touch. Would stay here again in a heartbeat if ever back in NY.

title: If you need a good location only
text: This hotel shouldn't use the Hilton last name, it doesn't look like a Hilton is not clean enough as a Hilton, is not confortable enough as a Hilton it looked to me as  a place where they train the personnel

title: Old dated hotel
text:
Very olddated hotel. Rooms are brown. Shower is terrible. Heater and fan makes a lot of noise and turn on automatically during the night. Elevators are terrible. Entrance is not welcoming. Breakfast is okay, although you need to pay extra for cappuccino..
This hotel is not what you expect from a doubletree Hilton hotel.

title: NYC
text: Hotel is very close to Time Square/metro and other "strategic places, very good internet connection. Room was clean, very comfortable beds but too small for 3 person. Moreover, the heating/Air condition was very loud.

title: the review
text:
oom was dirty, it did not get cleaned one day, tea and coffee making was intresting, 1 cup a day and 1 day it did not get replenished.

check out staff rude 

overall not good value

location was close enough to time square

title: All around good hotel.
text: Would definitely stay here again.  Nothing over the top, just a good room at a good rate in a good location.  Offers a hot breakfast in the morning...which is better than coffee and granola that you get in other places, if anything.

title: Good location, service
text: This hotel is convenient to the public transportation and Penn Station.  The service was fine and room was roomy enough for one person.  The restaurant/bar was small and the food choices were limited.  Fine if you just need a quick bite.

title: Couldn’t sleep
text: If you want to be there winter time , you couldn’t sleep all night because you have to turn on A/C Heather but it does work loudest voice, impossible good sleep , and very small room but location is perfect

title: Good location, decent sized room
text: I stayed at the hotel for four nights in a room with a king bed on the 11th floor. I checked in online but my room was not available so I got another one around 2:30pm. Lobby needs upgrading. Very bland and not terribly inviting. Don’t stay in a room on side of elevators. I had a view of an apartment building and barely any natural light.  Bed was comfortable. Appreciated the refrigerator. Shower fixtures didn’t work well—I suggest an update of those as well. They also need to install makeup/shaving mirrors. Barely any space for toiletries. Lots of outlets and USB ports. The location is very good—I walked to St Patrick’s Cathedral, Times Square, theaters and Washington Square. The 1 train is down the block. Nordstrom’s Rack is a couple blocks away if you need some more clothes! I would probably stay here again since it is convenient to the Vamoose bus stop.

title: New Years Day at NYC Double tree
text: Stayed here many time just about near everything we like to do. Really good breakfast buffet and clean rooms. Clean rooms , nice breakfast buffet, nice service. Great bar for evening drinks before hitting the big apple for New Years eve.

title: Great location, terribly elevators
text:
We stayed here for 3 nights between Xmas and New Year and although we loved the location (easy walk to Empire State / Times Sq / Rockefeller etc) there were a few issues which would put me off staying here again. 

1. The whole hotel was rather dated and could use some modernising / deep cleaning.

2. The duvets were not in duvet covers but just placed between 2 loose sheets which slipped off easily and as someone who’s a bit of a clean freak, I kept obsessing about the hygiene of the duvet! 

3. Our TV didn’t work. Not really a problem when you’re in NYC and don’t generally sit in your hotel room but one night we were all very hungover and would’ve liked to have watched a movie in bed! 

4. The bottle of water provided in the room was $5....! Complete rip off! 

5. Finally, the elevators........ There are only 2 small, old, rickety elevators for the whole 27 storey hotel! We were on the 18th floor and when one of the elevators broke down on our 2nd day we spent 20+ mins queuing to get into the one working elevator. We were happy to walk DOWN the 18 floors but anyone who wasn’t able bodied would’ve spent half their day queuing to get up/downstairs. (It didn’t help that some guests were actually queuing on the lower floors to get the elevator down 2 or 3 floors when they could’ve easily walked!)
Having read previous reviews this seems to be a recurring problem and I would certainly not be happy staying here again until this was resolved.

title: Do not stay here unless you want to be charged TWICE
text: I recently stayed in this hotel and they charged me the full amount on the date or arrival and again on the date we checked out. I called them and they were less than helpful. Denied taking the money the first time. So am almost €1000 out of pocket now. Do not stay here. Also along with this the hotel is dated, the staff are not very helpful and cleaning does not come around until evening. When we arrived at 4pm our hotel room was not even ready so we had to walk to streets for 2 hours after our 7 hour flight.

title: Great location, but hotel is dated, very expensive and the elevators are not good enough
text:
The hotel is in a great location but needs a lot of work. The outside is uninviting, and the inside is very dated and looks rundown in some areas. Main problem is the elevators - or lack of! There are only 2 old elevators for 27 floors, and only one was working for one day of our 3 day stay. Constant queues through the foyer (it even went out the front door at one point on a Friday night!) for the elevators and some people waited 20 mins to get into one as they were always full and they were unable to walk up 24 floors! We walked down 18 floors every day as we didn't want to waste time queuing but people with mobility issues would have no choice but to queue. Not good enough for such a busy, expensive hotel.

Small details but there were no tea/coffee making facilities in room and our TV was broken, we weren't planning on using it so it didn't matter to us but when you pay so much for a very small room, you expect the facilities to be decent.

Good points - basically clean, comfortable beds, staff were reasonably friendly and accommodated our need for eg late check out. Location is the only reason I'd stay here again though.

title: What else could go wrong?
text: Rooms were not ready in time.  Multiple parties waiting in the lobby for 2 hrs to check in.  Elevator not working and very angry guests.  We carried our bags down 24 flights. Big gaps under doors that made it feel like people in the hall were in your room.   The hotel created multiple stresses that you don’t need when traveling with kids.  Horrible night of sleep.

title: Disappointing Double Tree
text: This Double Tree is in urgent need of some serious TLC from the front entrance, to the lift and rooms. The sofa bed in our suite (over statement)  needed 6 blankets so that you could not feel the springs dig into you, but the blankets did not hide the wear and tear on the unit. Rooms were to a Manhattan standard on the small size. There is no guest laundry and the lifts are slow (worse when only one was working). We had transferred to this hotel from the Homewood Suites at Edgewater and were sorry. The bus back to NJ was safe and fast. The concierge Duane was the one shinning star who was professional, courteous and knew how to look after guests. Reception staff did only the basics and the cafe staff were nice but run off thier feet. All in all not what is expected from the Double Tree brand and poor in comparison to Homewood suites in Edgewater NJ.

title: Christmas in NYC
text: Our DoubleTree by Hilton NYC Chelsea experience was fantastic.  Great location near MSG and walking distance to Times Square.  Near subway.  Food galore in hotel and nearby.  The evening happy hour was a chance for family to talk and save a couple of dollars on drinks.  The bartender was efficient and created a good drink.  Sorry I didn’t catch her name.

title: Better hotels elsewhere.
text: Poor customer service for a Hilton brand hotel. Elevators were very slow. Check in was cold and disorganized. Rooms are tiny, especially the doubles. Best thing about this hotel was the location. Better hotels elsewhere for the price.

title: The hotel staff lack appropriate people skills.  The bathroom, sink, toilet and heating system was not functional.
text: The bathroom, sink, toilet, and tub didn't function properly my entire stay. The maintenance and housekeepers displayed very  bad attitudes and angry demeanor when they were asked to do their job. Teh housekeepers refused to properly clena my room. I was profiled by my looks and the way I spoke whether I could pay for the room and it take nearly 3 to 4 hours for me to get checked-in.  My card was charged over $3500, however, when I booked the room my total charges promised was $1775.74.  People were smoking marijuana inside the hotel and the smell was coming into my room.  Practically nothing worked, I even had problems with the televison.

title: ok stay, service is great but SMALL place
text: good location, I have no desire to stay at Time Square.  Like the herald square area as you can get around TSQ without going to it and get on all the major lines, this hotel is just 3 walking blocks from there. Chelsea is a great area.  The rooms are SMALL and very close together. So any noise in the hall way or next door is heard.  Sink is small, just small....

title: Excellent Stay
text: I was very happy with all aspects of my stay. I used to work in the hotel industry so I am a bit picky. Especially considering it was very busy with holiday travelers, I thought the staff did a wonderful job.

title: Fine hotel but not great value
text:
Overall the hotel is fine. It’s in a great location as a base to explore all of New York. However it is dated and small. You don’t get what you paid for, but this is New York in December so there is a premium here. Facilities are adequate but no more than that. Small gym so only worth going very early morning or mid/late afternoon. 
Room service was good but staff hang around talking waiting for a tip. Got some attitude when we didn’t leave a cash tip for one staff member.

title: Beware, was not provided what I paid for.
text: I booked a premium room (high floor) with Empire State building view, at a premium price.  I called the day befoe to check on my reservation, everything was a go.  I get there and my room was not available, plumbing issue.  I was given another room for the 1st night but not a credit for the lesser room,just breakfast.  I would have preferred the $100 difference.  Then I asked if we could move our luggage to the "promsed" room the next morning before we headed out for the day.  No, because of "late check out."  Wait, didnt you say it was due to a plumbing issue??  Now i find out it was an oversold issue and the guest had a late checkout.  So DoubleTree did not want to have to credit me the room cost difference.  Thats just the start.  The restaurant is absolutely a disaster.  We, along with other hotel patrons had to go look for the lone waitress chatting in the back.  Food took a long tie to cook.  The hotel bathrooms were dirty. The best part of the stay was the beds, they were great.  The staff however could care less if you are happy...just do not care.  Not what I am used to being a Hilton Honors member.

title: Don’t stay here.
text: This place is terrible. Rooms are dirty and old. Staff did not help resolve my issues. I would never stay here again. There are plenty of other Hilton properties in New York, and this one is awful. Better yet, stay in a boutique hotel

title: pequeño sin desayuno no andaba ascensor
text: muy amables los hosts, muy limpio el cuarto y lindo baño, pequeñas camas ni lugar para abrir la valija. no volverpia a elegirlo, eso si la ubicacion es maravillosa, porque todo queda super cerca caminando

title: IMPRESENTABLES
text:
Llegué a medianoche porque vuelo se retrasó. Lo comuniqué al hotel,que me iba a retrasar un par de horas y que llegaría entre 12 y 1 de la noche. Mi sorpresa fue al llegar!!!! Me habían cancelado mi reserva!!!!! A las 2 de la mañana me encontrè en la calle sin ninguna ayuda ni ninguna explicación por parte de los recepcionistas del hotel. Ni siquiera una compensación..Me tuve que buscar otro hotel y pagar un dineral porque estaba todp lleno por ser el día anterior a Thanlsgiving...Me costó una pasta y ni siquiera me pidieron disculpas....
Al día tuve que volver a ese hotel pq me mantenían la oferta para el día siguiente y resto de estancia en Nueva York. No me quedó otra...Estaban todos los hoteles carísimos y tuve que ir en contra de mi voluntad!!!! Me hicieron un cargo en la tarjeta como fiamza y todavía no me lo han devuelto!!!!! Dejé el hotel hace más de una semana
Con lo cual,mucho cuidadito con este hotel porque te la pueden liar y juegan con lps sentimientos y dinero de todo el mundo
No soy la primera ni la última persona a la que han cancelado su reserva porque sí,dejándonos tirados en la calle literalmente y se quedan con el depósito de tu fianza muchísimos días porque eso le reporta mucho dinero al hotel. Repito,juegan con nuestro dinero.

title: Double Tree Chelsea
text: When I checked I was not greeted as a diamond member had to ask for my bottles of water. Our room was never made up we left our room at 8 am and returned by 4 pm and then left at 5 pm. TV remote did not work and it was very noise at around 4 am

title: NYC for thanksgiving weekend
text: The hotel has a very good location in midtown , Close to MSG , Macy’s , Empire State Building , Central Park , Rockefeller center and many other great things to see .  Very good staff! Was important part of visit to the City!

title: NYC
text:
I would recommend this hotel to anyone, this was my fourth trip to NYC and this has been my favourite hotel so far. Location is great right in the centre of everything subway easily accessible from 28th St/ 34th. Rooms are really clean and housekeeping come on a daily basis to make beds empty bins and leave fresh towels. Staff are friendly and helpful, complimentary internet is also really good no issues with wifi.

Check in time is 16.00 which is the only downfall however staff did let us check in at 13.30 which was great and really appreciated 

We used the coffee machine which was restocked every day and also received warm cookies and water at check in.

Rooms are a great size for two people and this was a really comfortable stay for longer days out in the city

I would stay here again thanks for a lovely comfortable clean stay

title: The best
text:
Aline the bartender was friendly and attentive. Great experience at the bar with her. The food was also excellent and prices very reasonable. 
My room was perfect. Clean.  organized. Fresh. And extremely comfortable bed. 
The entire experience at this hotel exceeded my expectations. 
The 610 stompers appreciates doubletree hotels!

title: You can do better.
text:
Nice staff.  The hotel is rundown. 
The "penthouse" had 1 desk chair.
The patio door was not properly sealed. Cold air blew in all night in November
Torn wallpaper, stained carpets, old scratchy towels, walls with gouges and missing paint. 
It is an embarrassment to the Hilton and Double tree Hotel chain.

title: Check your bank statement
text: The hotel itself was ok. Quite small and in need of a freshen up. But it was a good location, right near the MSG and the staff generally quite helpful. However, since returning back to the UK we have had all sorts of problems. We were charged an extra £660 which they say they had no knowledge of and has taken 2 months to resolve only for the same amount to be taken from our account again. This is an issue we are taking further so just check your statements regularly!

title: Great location and thats about it
text:
We stayed at the Chelsea DoubleTree for five nights. The location is wonderful and convenient. Unfortunately, that is the positive part of the stay. 

There are 26 floors in this hotel and two elevators. I would suggest you ask to stay on the lowest floor possible, we ended up using the stairs everyday at least once a day. This is problematic when you have luggage and are checking out. The only way we could get our luggage downstairs, from the 14th floor, was to catch the elevator going up and then ride it down to the lobby. Not terrible, but having to use the stairs to get down to the lobby every day was annoying. 

The staff was not attentive and they did not try to be helpful. We were told we couldn't change the bill, so that my friend and I could split the room charges, without a manager. There was never a manager available and finally someone told us that we didn't actually need a manager. They are not interested in providing quick service at the front desk and do not ask for anything to be delivered to your room outside of room service. We requested our dry cleaning be returned and they did not have anyone to deliver these items so we had to use the stairs to go down to the lobby to retrieve it. When we requested additional blankets housekeeping was not available. There is always a line at the front desk and often there is only one person working. If you need to speak to someone you will need to wait, I think they are not staffed appropriately. Large groups of people stay at this hotel so you may also find the small lobby stuffed with luggage that needs to be stored.

The rooms are small but not unusually so for New York. The rooms were clean and the location is good so if you do not mind the inconvience of using the stairs everyday (or can book a room on a low floor) and rude staff this may work for you.

title: Decent stay
text: Positives: great location, I got a pretty good price for a last minute booking, clean, comfortable room, and the staff was friendly. Negatives: I had arrived early and knew that my room wouldn't be ready, but was promised I would be contacted when it was. However, upon finally needing the room, I called them to find out the room had been ready for some time. The water pressure was weak in the shower. And even though it didn't bother me, I feel I should mention that there's a wall unit for the thermostat, but it was blank. The heading/cooling had the working controls on the unit itself. Some of the buttons had tape over them but we're still functional. Again, not an issue for me, I just found it odd. I couldn't hear people in the rooms next to mine, but I could hear doors closing and conversations in the hallway quite clearly.

title: Pour l'emplacement
text:
Hôtel plutôt 3 étoiles, tout y est étriqué.
Les chambres sont propres et relativement modernes. Excellent emplacement pour tous les sites de visites. Comme souvent aux usa le personnel n'est pas aimable lorsqu'il n'y pas de pourboires en jeu.

title: Great Mid-town hotel
text: We were in town for a basketball tournament and a benefit concert, both at Madison Square Garden.  This hotel, only a couple of blocks away (and thus only a couple of blocks away from Penn Station) was perfect.  It has high rise rooms with views of the Empire State Building; we prefer lower-level rooms.  We were on the fourth floor on the front (facing 29th Street) and, with the exception of one convoy of fire engines, heard no sounds.  The quiet was remarkable and made for good nights' sleep (unusual for us in any hotel room).  Attentive and friendly staff.  Great French bakery for morning coffee a half-block north at 7th Ave.

title: Friendly staff, rooms sorely needs updating, hotel screwed up charges big time - check your bill carefully
text: My husband and I stayed here for four nights. The staff is friendly and attempt to be helpful. Elevators are slow and small. We stayed in the “penthouse suite” which is actually just a normal sized room for most hotels but it did include a balcony with spectacular views of the city. The room constantly smelled like weed - we suspect staff was entering the room to use the balcony. Our room, at least, was last updated probably in the late 90s and things were worn and dated.  The most frustrating thing has been attempting to deal with billing issues.

title: Good location
text: We chose the hotel for its location and lack of additional taxes or charges. On that front it was great. Bed is comfy. Room and bathroom are a bit tired but fine. Room for New York is a reasonable size. Staff were friendly and helpful.

title: DoubleTree by Hilton
text:
De ligging van het hotel was top. Je kan lopend veel kanten op.
De kamer zag er erg verouderd uit maar was wel ruim opgezet. Verder was de kamer schoon en netjes maar vond het hotel niet echt Hilton waardig.

title: Ideal location for a sight seeing break in the City
text: We stayed here at the end of October as a family of three. I had booked online through Booking.com and paid a little extra for a decent view as it was my husband and sons first trip to NYC. I was happy with the view of the Empire State Building and my young son enjoyed looking to see what colour it was lit up each night. The room had two double beds that were extremely comfortable but possible a little too soft for my back. Bathroom was clean and although the room was on the small side it was ideal for us after a busy day sight seeing. The rooms were cleaned every day which we appreciated and all staff were always very friendly and helpful.we used the baggage storage when we arrived as it was four hours before check in and then again after check out. We also enjoyed the cookies and the complimentary coffee in Reception each morning. There were some comments about the lifts being slow but we didn’t notice this, some mornings they stopped several times but we enjoyed seeing/meeting other guests like this. Overall the ideal spot for a sight seeing visit, I would also recommend eating at Steak and Lobster across the street.

title: Good value
text: It was worth staying there for one night    The rate was good and they gave me a high floor so I didnt have to worry about the noise from the street below  Breakfast was fine, nothing exceptional but it worked

title: Doubletree disappointment
text: This was a first for us staying in the Chelsea area and as a Hilton Honors member I was excited to see a Hilton property in our desired location. The hotel is average but the room is poor! Small, had a stagnant water smell, and the noise in the hallways was deplorable. You could hear everything from the passing of the elevator to the staff and quests in the hallway, all from the bed. Definitely struggled falling asleep and staying that way.

title: Très bon emplacement
text:
Très bon emplacement. On peut aller à pied par tout (ou presque). Personnel très agréable. On a du café et du thé tout les jours... et des cookies chaudes pour bien venue. Mmmm. 
Les lits sont super confortables.

title: Great place to stay.
text: All my stays have been good pretty decent.  The price seems to be lower end for the city, but the upper floors are quiet, and it’s close to where I need it to be, and some delicious restaurants. The staff is always pleasant and helpful. And of course the cookies are delicious!

title: Nice place
text:
The check in at the desk was nice and easy. They were glad to give us suggestions on places to eat at reasonable prices within walking distance. They gave out SUPER good cookies at the desk as well.
The room was nice and the bed was comfy. Breakfast, which we declined, was pricey at $23. But overall would stay here again.

title: Best stay in NYC
text: Weather was super and the Double Tree has the most comfortable beds. Christopher and Hamilton were awesome at welcoming me and getting me to my room. I would highly recommend this pareticular hotel....location was excellent!!!

title: Хороший и чистый отель
text: Хороший отдельно, с просторными кроватями, система и отопления и кондиционер. Всё супер. Даже при заезде угостили горячим печеньем с шоколадом и кофе. Рекомендую, потому что соответствует цена и качество

title: Great Location
text: If you are in NYC and want to visit Hudson Yards, Empire State Building or Time Square this is a great location.  Very close to a subway station to visit other areas.  Read the other reviews and was anticipating long waits for the elevators but even on  sold out night we didn't encounter these delays.  Had a drink in the bar after a day of being a tourist and the service was friendly and quick.  Even though our room wasn't listed as a Empire State Building view room we did have a view of the top at night.

title: Nothing special
text: It's not in a particularly nice part of town, lots of litter outside but seems safe because it's right by a police station. The rooms are small and not as plush as the photos suggest. There is a view of the Empire State building from the room. In the room the fridge was inoperable so I had to get a bucket of ice. The problem is that the staff don't know where the ice machines are located. The bed is comfortable and high floors don't get much street noise.

title: Bad experience for high price
text: Despite rooms being clean and good quality, the hotel was very old and had a lot of noise in the corridors both coming from staff but also from something similar to a vacuum cleaner. Not a relaxing experience

title: Tapis malprope et mauvais odeur
text:
Tapis malpropres et mauvaise odeurs dans l'hotel.
Sous les standards de Hilton.
La qualité/prix pour une telle chambre est décevante.
Heureusement que la qualité du personnel est excellente. Une telle expérience nous laisse un mauvais souvenir de notre voyage.

title: Your better off at the YMCA
text: Hotel unsafe not good for kids to many hazards.  Staff rude and unfriendly.  Rooms dirty and in need of repairs.  Is a good location to tine square but for the price stay somewhere else.  Drinks at bar overpriced

title: Just for a Night
text:
As a Hilton Diamond member, I was recognized by the front desk and I was provided the expected cookies. I wanted to go to the museum, so it was nice of them to let me check in my luggage as it was still too early to check in. The rooms were on the small side, but the location of the hotel is excellent. Yet, do know that the carpet looked worn and stained. The room was clean enough, but you can tell it was a very old and tired room. I actually had a better looking room at the Best Western Premier. 

Other than the room, the complimentary breakfast down at the lobby was actually quite good. The servers at the restaurant were very nice and sweet to all of the guests. I also enjoyed the food. It was quite all right. 

As usual, no Hilton brand hotels in the US has ever provided any complimentary upgrade even if they had available rooms and even if you are a gold or diamond member. Yet, it is not only those Hilton affiliated hotels in the US as I also have never received a free room upgrade in Europe either. 

It does not even matter the steep charges you pay for the room; for you get what you paid for and honestly a base room charge of $180 a night is not cheap when the going rate for rooms in Manhattan were $100 a night on average. I paid an extra $80 a night for the Empire State Building view and it was not worth it and still no room upgrade. Honestly, this pales in comparison to the Hilton or other five star hotels in the Asia Pacific. Other than that, it was all right.

title: Chelsea NYC
text: Convenient but extremely small rooms with guests from other rooms who forget there are other guests on the floor. Any loud noise from the elevator or in the hall way or door banging was heard in my room.

title: Too small; not for a family of 4
text: Not suitable for family, rooms are way to small to even walk around, even for NYC. Had to put suitcases in tub, no closet. Noisy w/ Police precinct nearby, not a great area to be in. Ironing board was half sized and no room to pull out. Ice bucket was in drawer bc there was no room left on dresser!!!!

title: Όντως στο κέντρο του Μανχάταν…
text:
Στα πλαίσια ταξιδιού αναψυχής στην Νέα Υόρκη, και μετά από αναζήτηση στο TripAdvisor, εντοπίσαμε το συγκεκριμένο ξενοδοχείο, το οποίο πληρούσε τις προϋποθέσεις για την κάλυψη των αναγκών μας. 
α) Να βρίσκεται στο Κέντρο της Πόλης και
β) Να είναι σε τιμή που μπορούσαμε να ανταποκριθούμε.
Όντως, μετά την πτήση που μας έφερε στην Νέα Υόρκη, με ταξί φτάσαμε στο ξενοδοχείο DoubleTree. Το περιβάλλον οικείο, με την έννοια, περιβάλλον όπως κάθε μεγαλούπολης, μην ξεχνάμε ότι βρισκόμαστε σε City (NYC).
Οι κοπέλες στην υποδοχή, εκτός από μία, μας εξυπηρέτησαν πολύ βαριεστημένα (με μια ξινή διάθεση ... χωρίς να καταλαβαίνω το γιατί). Η μία κοπέλα όμως, όπως και τα αγόρια, ήταν πολύ φιλικά, ευγενικά και με διάθεση να μας εξυπηρετήσουν σε ότι μας απασχολούσε (πότε είναι ανοικτό το εστιατόριο του ξενοδοχείου, πότε αλλάζονται τα σεντόνια-πετσέτες του ξενοδοχείου, πληροφορίες για την περιοχή, αξιοθέατα, συγκοινωνία, καταστήματα για αγορές κ.λπ.)
Το δωμάτιο μας βρισκόταν στον 11ο όροφο του ξενοδοχείου, αριθμός 10. Το δωμάτιο ήταν σε αξιοπρεπή κατάσταση, σε σχέση με τα χρήματα που δίναμε. Εξαίρεση το καζανάκι που ήταν ειδικού χειρισμού (το καζανάκι ήταν χαλασμένο, στο σημείο του χειριστηρίου… ήταν ξεχαρβαλωμένο… δεν το αναφέραμε, απλά προσέχαμε τον χειρισμό του, να μην διαλύσει τελείως).
Θέα δεν υπήρχε, το παράθυρο που υπήρχε, έβλεπε στον ακάλυπτο.
Το ξενοδοχείο γενικά, αλλά και το δωμάτιο μας ειδικότερα ήταν καθαρά. Κάθε ημέρα μας άλλαζαν πετσέτες (εφόσον τις αφήναμε στο πάτωμα) και σεντόνια κάθε τρεις ημέρες. Ήσυχο ξενοδοχείο, τα άτομα (ένοικοι) που συναντούσαμε άφηναν την αίσθηση ότι πρόκειται για επαγγελματίες που επισκέπτονταν την Νέα Υόρκη.
Το σημείο που βρίσκεται το ξενοδοχείο είναι ιδιαίτερα σημαντικό, γιατί βρίσκεσαι πάρα πολύ κοντά σε όλα…!! κοντά του βρίσκεται το μετρό, κοντά του βρίσκονται πάρα πολλά αξιοθέατα στα οποία μπορείς να φτάσεις με τα πόδια!! Το αυτοκίνητο είναι άχρηστο εντελώς! (περισσότερα προβλήματα δημιουργεί).
Επίσης σε όλους τους χώρους του ξενοδοχείου είχε δωρεάν ελεύθερο internet, και στην τηλεόραση του δωματίου, πάνω από 100 κανάλια. Το δωρεάν internet είναι πολύ σημαντικό, και το σχολιάζω διότι για εμάς που προερχόμαστε από άλλη χώρα, τελικά ήταν πολύ δύσκολο να εξυπηρετηθούμε από τον πάροχο της κινητής τηλεφωνίας μας.
Αυτό που μας άρεσε ιδιαίτερα ήταν ένα ειδικό δοχείο (ένας πύργος διανομέας, συνήθως μπύρας) με δροσερό νερό αναμεμειγμένο με φρεσκοκομμένο φρούτο ανανά, που βρίσκεται δίπλα στις πόρτες των ανελκυστήρων στον προθάλαμο του ξενοδοχείου. Υπήρχαν ποτηράκια μιας χρήσης, σημείο το οποίο ήταν για μας “MUST” και φυσικά σημείο ανάκαμψης…. μετά από τις πολύωρες περιπλανήσεις μας στο Μανχάταν.
Εν κατακλείδι, μείναμε ικανοποιημένοι και όταν με το καλό επισκεφτούμε πάλι την Νέα Υόρκη, θα πάμε στο ίδιο ξενοδοχείο, σε δωμάτιο με καλύτερη θέα... και πιο ψηλά σε όροφο...
Σας ευχαριστούμε.

title: Good hotel
text:
This is a good hotel but it is very basic. The rooms are clean as are the bathrooms, the air conditioning works perfectly which is needed with the heat even at the end of September. The staff are warm and friendly and are always happy to help efficiently and promptly. The hotel is in a good location, madison square gardens is about a 7 minute walk away and Times Square about 15/20 minutes walk. The Empire State is about a 10 minute walk away. 
Aside from the hotel anyone who is coming to New York please bring plenty of money as I’ve never known a city so expensive, although it is amazing!

title: Excellent location for Chelsea attractions
text: We had an excellent experience with our stay at the Hilton Doubletree NYC Chelsea.  We were greeted with an abundance of warm cookies and water.  They offered suggestions on where to eat and how to get to where we wanted.   Additionally, if you are an Honors member- the breakfast is fantastic and free...  can't beat the value.

title: No respetan reservas
text: A pesar de haber reservado y haber hablado por retraso del vuelo el hotel no respetó mi reserva y me dijeron q estaban sold out. No caigan en los descuentos porque terminaran pagando más y buscando otro hotel a las 6 am. No fuimos los únicos a los q nos mandaron a otro hotel mientras liberaban habitaciones. Hay muchos hoteles en la misma zona que seguro tienen buen servicio al cliente.

title: Great for the money
text: I stayed at the Doubletree in Chelsea last weekend and loved having access to everywhere in the city with a good mix of walking, car-sharing services, and public transit.  The street in front of the hotel was a single lane one-way street that was relatively quiet compared to most others.  The room was small as you’d expect for New York but extremely clean.  The breakfast was also a nice option in the morning to grab some basic eggs/bacon/fruit and coffee before heading out.  All of the staff were friendly.  Overall I’d say the price and location were what attracted me to stay here and I felt I got my money’s worth.  There is a nice restaurant across the street, Steak ‘N Lobster which has a great bar.

title: Bon emplacement
text:
Nous avons pris la chambre avec vue sur empire State building, aucun regret à ce niveau, la vue était parfaite. 
Nous ne pouvons pas donner notre avis sur les petits déjeuners, nous avons préféré les prendre aux alentours (maison kayser et gregorie’s café). Endroits où nous n’avons pas été déçus mais qui n’est pas donné mais moins cher qu’à l’hôtel. Aucun regrets non plus. 
Propreté impeccable, literie parfaite! (Vraiment parfaite!), les espaces sont un peu petits mais cela ne nous a posé aucun problème, il suffit juste de s’organiser. 
L’emplacement est aussi très bien! A part et les bus Hop on Hop off, nous avons tout fait à pieds, mais nous marchons beaucoup.

title: Hotel muy correcto.
text:
Hotel con muy buena ubicación., El hotel en si es básico pero muy correcto,nos dieron una habitación en la planta 7,muy oscura, pequeña, con AC ruidoso y colchón cama hundido. Pedimos si nos podían cambiar a un piso superior ya que teniamos una estancia larga y nos pasarón al piso 18, nada que ver, más luz, cama comodissima, baño más nuevo.
Las habitaciones són pequeñas, pero eso es lo común en NYC, estuvimos muy a gusto.
El único problema importante que tiene el hotel es que solo hay 2 ascensores para 27 plantas y el personal de limpieza también usa el mismo, eso hace que la espera sea demasiado larga.

title: Walking around Chelsea
text: This hotel is in a walking distance to the Highline, Vessel at Hudson Yards, Empire State Building and Flatiron. I enjoyed the Empire State Building view from my room window. Excellent restaurants are in walking distance, such as Eataly or Izakaya Nomad.

title: Nasty hotel
text: Staff is nice, good location but dirty and nasty. It need to be renovated. Rooms are small.  Very small hallways. Only two elevators and they are very slow. Need need carpet and be paint job. Trash outside door

title: Hotel d un autre siècle.
text:
A fuir ...
Oublier le restaurant et petit-déjeuner. 
Qualité proche d un ibis ancienne génération... 2 Cm de jour sous les portes.... 
Le business centre n en a que le nom. Table dans un.coin du hotel en plein court d air...bref a fuir tout simplement

title: A Getaway in Chelsea
text: The team at the Chelsea location was extraordinarily helpful. Upon arrival to my room there was a minor issue and staff member Dahria was extremely accommodating in helping relocate my partner and I. It was also his birthday and the staff was kind enough to provide a delicious bottle of wine and a lovely handwritten note. The following day, my family and I were traveling to a wedding on Long Island and Mr.Harrington was extraordinarily kind enough to assist my father in finding us appropriate transportation accommodations. I couldn't be more grateful for such a wonderful stay and will definitely be returning my next time to the city. I will add the parking information on the app is incorrect and the parking garage is now called "icon parking".

title: Bella vista
text: Siamo stati 3 notti, stanza al 26mo piano con vista su downtown molto suggestiva. Stanza veramente minuscola, in 4 non si sa dove aprire le valigie. La posizione è abbastanza comoda per girare New York a piedi e con la metro che è a 2 passi. Per 2 giorni (su 3) non abbiamo avuto servizio di housekeeping, per un problema poi si è  scoperto legato alla serratura difettosa della porta della nostra stanza. Avendo fatto presente la cosa, per il terzo giorno co hanno offerto la colazione, che devo dire non era niente di che per il prezzo che fanno pagare (credo intorno ai 23/25 dollari).

title: Perfect location
text: Convenient to all our sightseeing! Quite and clean and a delightful staff. The elevators were super slow and full, a lot of the time, but if that was all, it was pretty perfect! We didn't part take in the food, room service or the bar, but the patio was a delight, except when the trash was being loaded. The beds VERY comfortable.

title: Doubletree by Hilton. Chelsea New York
text: Many items were in poor repair throughout the room. Although the beds were comfortable and clean, the bathroom was moldy. Spoke to the management twice. Was given a bit of a discount that I still have to verify post travel and some breakfast vouchers. I can’t believe people actually pay for powdered eggs and diluted fake juice mix. The coffee was also terrible. This is not a good value.

title: Just ok
text:
Room was a bit small but overall it was ok for the price in the middle of everything breakfast was not included a little pricy $23 and shower was either hot or cold 
I will stay again if it is just my wife and I

title: Good choice
text: Standard DoubleTree rooms - good but not great.  The desk staff was very helpful.  Did not try the restaurant.  You can wait a bit for the elevators but I would stay here again if the location was what I needed.

title: Świetny srosunek jakości do ceny
text: Bardzo dobrze zlokalizowany hotel. Blisko do wielu atrakcji - Times Squere, Empire State Building to kilka minut pieszo. W pobliżu wiele restauracji, sklepów. Pokoje nieduże, ale wstarczjące. Wygodne łózka, co jest bardzo ważne po całym dniu zwiedzania. W hotelu bardzo czysto. Obsługa pomocna - nie było problemu z transferem na lotnisko, przechowalniem bagażu czy wydrukiem kart pokłdowych. Generalinie idealna baza wypadowa do zwiedzania Nowego Jorku

title: Incredible
text: Everyone was so kind to us while we stayed. My buddies and I went to the downstairs bar for a quick drink before heading out the city for the night and their bartender was great! We all enjoyed our stay here overnight and will definitely come back!

title: Store card details - debiting my acc with no explanation
text:
If I could leave no stars I would. We booked a 4 night stay here through a well known travel agency and paid in full. During our stay I noticed a whopping debit on my card of nearly €500, when queried the staff said the room wasn’t fully paid for. They debited my card details without my authorization, receipt or even letting me know. I noticed by chance when I checked my online banking. 
The staff admitted they shouldn’t have done it and advised they’d refund. Over a week later and still chasing it up. Two days after check out when I was already home I checked my bank account to see two more debits to my card? Totaling in almost €300. This is now almost €800 fraudulently debited from my card. I’ve been on to the bank, the hotel keep chip & pin details from the security deposit you pay upon check in ($50 a night) which you are supposed to get back after 3 days from check out. They have been just debiting my card and won’t respond to my complaint, I’ve had to communicate through twitter. Be weary of staff Venus & Sheldine. They are the staff responsible and assured me no more debits would occur. 
I’ll never stay in any of these hotel again as I’ve looked online and this similar issue happens quite a lot. I will be having it investigated and expect every cent returned to me with explanations. Rooms basic and hotel tiny. Don’t waste your money - there are better for less.

title: Good stay
text: Just back from a four day stay at the Doubletree by Hilton, the hotel was in a great location with the subway only a few hundred yards away, staff were very friendly especially to my two kids, would stay here again.

title: Convenient location
text: Hotel is a short walk from Penn Station and close to fashion district shopping destinations.  Affordable, clean,  quiet room with great water pressure in the shower.  Personable staff at the desk and a cookie!

title: Double tree
text: We stayed at this hotel during a family vacation to New York from August 4-8th.  We were travelling with our 5 year old son. We had a king room and it was just what we needed.  Our boy loved the cookies, and all the interesting water every day! I loved how they restocked our coffee everyday and made sure our room was nice and clean! The staff make this hotel, above and beyond in all areas.  We checked out on our last day but weren’t leaving the city until 6pm and they gladly held our luggage which was much appreciated and gave us more cookies for our travels!  The only complaint I have is that we would want to book a hotel slightly closer to the subway next time we were there with our child.  But that isn’t a fault of the hotel at all. We had a lovely stay! I think I slept better than at home :)

title: a good doubletree
text:
been using the hilton brand in a lot of countries, this is below average, there were a couple of issues in the stay that did not follow the hilton name, it feeled as they are understaffed.

even with this the location is great and I do recommend asking for the street view on the room, so you can have a view of the empire state.

title: Hotel buena calidad precio
text:
Hotel fantásticamente ubicado en el mismo Manhattan, entre la octava y novena avenida, en 40 street. Al lado de todo, con buena comunicación por metro. El hotel dispone de restaurante para desayunar, comer o cenar, te ponen bastante cantidad en los platos. La comida está buena todo lo que ponen, dentro de lo que es la gastronomía americana.
Al lado del hotel hay una pizzería que te venden pizzas al corte, 4 dólares dos cortes de pizza (queso) y una soda. Están muy buenas. También hay un restaurante español al lado del hotel ( de tapas).
Para ir a desayunar, hay un montón de sitios al lado del hotel.
El hotel cumple con creces, habitaciones limpias y suficientes.

title: Awesome
text: Awesome. All the services are very good. Next time we will booking again for business trips. It’s very close to downtown and all features. Rooms are very clean and comfortable. And also security are very good.

title: Great neighborhood, good room, nice staff
text: Great neighborhood, nice friendly staff, small comfortable rooms. Very clean. Restaurant is very good for hotel, breakfast is very good, but gets very crowded  later (after 8am). Elevators can be slow, but not too long of a wait.

title: Perfect Location
text:
Very close to every NY attraction...  very easy to take the subway from the 28th street...  they gave us cookies and water when we checked in... great free internet..  overall surpass our expectation

Thank you!!!

title: Old hotel but fantastic staff!!!!
text:
The hotel is old and like many reviewers have mentioned the rooms are small and cramped. However, the hotel staff is extremely courteous and helpful. The bathroom in our room has a bad smell. Housekeeping came to our room to fix it at 10:00pm with a smile! Truly enjoyed the hospitality. I wish the hotel had updated interiors. Five stars for the staff!!! 
I took off one star just for the condition of the hotel... Not the staff.

title: Great place!
text: This hotel is conveniently located!! It’s by the NJ transit station (3 min walk) and the subway. Walking distance to time square and Madison square gardens. Take a subway to the WTC memorial in under 1/2 hour. It was clean and the staff was awesome! Would recommend it!

title: There is better..
text:
This particular hotel is outdated, small and narrow.  The elevators took a very long time.  None of the vending machines (ice, water, or the vending machines) worked our entire stay.  We could hear the guests in the rooms adjacent to us. 

Our room- the phone didn't work, and the AC was blowing dust back into the room.  The engineer had to replace the phone, and checked the AC filter.  In the process, I saw him rip the filter a little, but didn't replace even though I alerted him that the filter was ripped. We found blood on one of the sheets, the staff apologized and changed the sheets very quickly, but still GROSSSS!

We ran into one nuisance with the shampoo and conditioners.  We indicated in our reservation that there were three guests (girls with long hair) staying in this room.  We requested additional shampoo and conditioner bottles, we received 2 conditioner bottles.  The housekeeping staff did not replace the shampoo bottles we used the next morning.  We requested additional shampoo bottles, and received two conditioner bottles, and one shampoo bottle.  I called the front desk again, who stated they would follow up, and then called back and stated that the houseman gave us three shampoo bottles.  I told them that we received two conditioner bottles and one shampoo bottle.  They sent the houseman back with one additional shampoo bottle.  As a guest, it seemed so unnecessary for the front desk to call me back and tell me what the houseman dropped off, when I am stating what I received, instead of sending some additional bottles.  

The location is convenient, and close to a subway.

title: 紐約市區住宿的好選擇
text:
逸林酒店算是相對而言較平價之品牌，雖然有些歲月痕跡，但房間寬敞，枕頭棉被都很柔軟舒服，插座數量也極為充足。
早餐部分供應到11:30，非常適合想好好休息的旅客，而含熱食（各式Pastry/炒蛋/香腸/薯球）的美式早餐也是品項豐富且美味！
旅館離Subway也是三分鐘內的路程，交通極為便利！

title: MOTEL! AVOID! Sunken Beds, Bad Management, Rude Staff
text: Totally avoid this tourist trap. Rude staff, dirty and no good sleep. There are way better hotels. I literally booked this for location. Saw Double Tree and Hilton name and didn’t think it would be that bad. It is that bad you can not get any good night sleep. No bellman or friendly staff to help with luggage or any needs. Bed so old and springy and sinks in. I tried two rooms same thing. Room smelled. AC vent dirty. Towels dingy and dirty in both rooms tried. Besides strange noises, blinds won’t shut so light kept streaming in. Phone and clock didn’t work. Are you getting the picture? Lady at front desk purposely put me in a worst room after I complained about first one. In the morning woke up pains all over my body and swollen eyes from constantly waking up. Tried to complain to staff and find manager. Staff dissmissive when asking for manager and kind of smirking at my horrible nights stay when I have a serious appointment and things to do that day (next day). General manager very weak in handling situation. So basically this is a motel best used for high priced luggage storage in NYC but unlike most motels they don’t even have human decency to give you a firm bed so you can sleep.

title: Another favorite Hilton property in NYC
text: Good location 2 blocks from Penn Station. Very nice staff. Clean property. Very helpful breakfast staff. It was a great stay. Our first time at this Hilton property in NYC but not our last. Thanks to all

title: Disappointed
text: I was disappointed in my stay at the DoublesTree. The location of the hotel was good for my vacation, but that was my only plus side. The room had q-tips on the ground when we walked in, the curtain was broken, the outlets didn’t work, the elevators were slow and too small to fit our group, and the overall feel of the hotel was just cramped. Feel like I was ripped off considering the cost for a single night stay.

title: Avoid
text: During a family vacation to New York City we decided to at the hotel due to location.  While the location was good, I would not stay in this hotel again.  While the staff was pleasant, the rooms were damp (both carpet and bedding) and smelled like stale water.

title: Too costly, poor service
text: Early Check-in: Woman at front desk great service - man she got to help, was curt, unfriendly, not very helpful. He even walked away as I was chatting with him. The woman eventually found me a room ... several hours later. He did not. Hotel did not call/text as promised when a room became available. Small service stuff matters. I will not return here even though great location. Lobby is also very old so if you do need to hang out and work, its not amenable to that. Very few chairs; one table. Over $300 for one night, with hassles.

title: Buena ubicación
text:
El hotel tiene muy buena ubicación ya que esta cerca de El Madison Square Garden, de la 5ta Avenida, de Central Park, de Times Square, de la estación de Amtrak lo que nos dió la oportunidad de ir a Washington DC y conocer el Capitolio, la Casa Blanca, etc. 

La habitación era pequeña pero acogedora, la limpieza bien, el trato bueno. El aire acondicionado bien.

Nueva York y Washington DC son grandes ciudades hay que caminarlas para conocerlas.

title: Great position but at a cost
text: Like all hotels in NYC this is pricey.  We had a room for four that was very cramped.  The staff were nice. The bar and restaurant was limited and the hotel feels claustrophobic.  Nice outside area and convenient for Chelsea landmarks.

title: Friendly staff, great location
text:
The staff couldn't have been nicer to my 6 year-old son!  The bed was comfy.  The bathroom was quite small, but it was clean.  The hotel is within easy walking distance to and from Penn Station/MSG 
, and subways.  My only complaint is that the carpet had a couple of skeevy stains on it.  I should mention we stayed during a midsummer power outage and were extremely relieved that this hotel was NOT affected--hooray for steady lights and AC on a hot summer night!

title: Horrible room service and room service staff
text: Room service staff were extremely unprofessional on the phone and actually hung up on us. Tray from our Room service wasn't picked up the entire time we were there. We used the laundry service and was overcharged. Thankfully the front desk woman Brittany was great. The room itself was small given the price per night.

title: NYC weekend
text:
We visited NYC and were very happy with our stay at the Double Tree Chelsea for 3 nights in June 2019. Mom and 2 adult daughters.
The hotel was very clean and comfortable. The beds were excellent quality, providing. a great sleep.The bathroom had good quality fixtures, and the shower worked great! 
There are many complaints about the elevators, we stayed on the 21st floor, the hotel was very busy, and we never had any issues. The light on the elevator showed what floor and direction it was travelling. 
Always greeted upon entering the hotel by the staff, and a dispenser of fruit infused water. This was a treat after exploring the city in the June heat.Our stay was during the parade, which kept the street busy with the floats. 
The staff at the hotel were excellent! Everyone we encountered was welcoming and pleasant. We stayed for 3 nights, and our flights left the city late at night, and they were very helpful as we stayed around the hotel area until departure time. All of the friendly faces at the hotel welcomed us very warmly.
I was happy to be able to leave a few parade giveaways for the staff, and they were very thankful! Thank you for making our trip so special!

title: Very rude and bad attitude front desk
text: I haven’t even started my stay and I received a very rude response from the Front Desk (Brittany McQuiller) only because I asked for an early check-in. That’s fine if no possible but doesn’t matter the subject. Customers should be treated ALWAYS with respect. Bad experience so far.

title: DoubleTree in Chelsea
text: Location was good, walking distance to many attractions. It was actually quiet at night, away from main avenues. Breakfast was good, room was actually slightly bigger than expected as many reviews mentioned the room was too small.

title: Pretty good by NYC standard
text: Great location (close to metro station and the train station). The room was clean with all necessary amenities. Indeed the rooms are small, but still very decent by New York standard. One negative thing: it took forever to get on the elevator: there was always a long line waiting, and the elevator was clearly too small for a hotel of its size.

title: Great Value
text: We stayed here because of the location. The price was so reasonable that I was a little wary. But the room was great. It was small (as you would expect in the city) but had everything we needed. The staff was friendly and helpful.

title: Great Location but Disappointing service
text:
Had several disappointments with the hotel service. Very slow and delayed check-in, even though there were no lines and it was a Saturday afternoon. Non responsive room service. Extra supplies we requested never showed up even though the front desk said that they would send it up shortly. They forgot? 
Strange additional charges after checking out with no explanation.

title: Great Stay, Decent location
text: Located on 29th Street which is 3 min walk to the subway station on 28th street. Close walk to Time Square without the huge crowds of people.  AC is the room was nice and cold after a hot July day. Elevators a little slow in the morning for check out. Overall great stay.

title: Good location but noisy in the room
text: The hotel is in a good location but the nosie coming into the room was a bad experience. Our room was located next to a lift and the lift was making a noise like a train. Alos could hear people talking in other rooms. The room was clean and spacious.

title: Friendly staff, very accommodating
text: Rooms are small but it’s New York. King size bed wasn’t a king but the staff was nice and let us check in early. Every time we asked for extra towels, crib, etc we were accommodated very quickly. The cookies were amazing!

title: Great service and location
text:
I stayed here for three days with my family. The staff was pleasant and friendly. The hotel was undergoing a temporary renovation in the lobby and we were informed as we checked-in.

The rooms were on the smaller side, but that was expected as this was in Manhattan. The hotel had a lot of stores nearby and was a short distance from Penn Station, Empire State building and many of the popular tourist attractions.
The service was excellent and prompt.

A heads up: the hotel has only two elevators which can get filled up quickly. So it might take some time to get up or down.

Overall, I would recommend a stay here!

title: Double Tree Chelsea
text: The Hotel is in an excellent location but it needs to be renovated. It was clean but out dated. good restaurant and coffee place close to it. Walking distant to Penn Station, and Subway. People are nice and courteous

title: Voldoende!
text:
Prima hotel op een goede locatie. 
Het gebouw heeft precies zijn beste tijd gehad maar het is in orde. Geen minibar wat jammer is.
Ontbijt is goed maar niet helemaal mijn ding.
Vriendelijk personeel en dat is toch ook belangrijk.

title: Another great stay at the Doubletree Chelsea in NYC!
text:
I recently completed another GREAT stay at the Doubletree Chelsea in NYC.  This has truly become my home away from home whenever I am in NYC for business (formerly monthly now quarterly).  It really means something to be greeted by name whenever I enter this property, from the bellmen, front desk staff, housekeeping and those in the restaurant.  That is what influences me to come back each time.  The ‘good feeling’ developed over the years about this property, even though many employees have changed, keeps me coming back.

My most recent stay was from June 22 – 27, 2019.  My wife accompanied me on this trip.  The same courtesies that are typically extended to me were also extended to her.  This made her feel just as special as I do when I visit.

A special ‘shout out’ to Brittany at the front desk.  We asked if she could make some recommendations of sites to see that are accessible from the nearby subway station.  When we got back from breakfast, she presented us a handwritten list of sites along with the specific trains to take.  She exceeded our expectations when we made this inquiry and were extremely appreciative of taking the time to do this.

All staff members wanted to ensure we had to best possible experience during our stay.  It started with breakfast where Aracelis and Kayti worked.  I shared with their manager Tammy how much we appreciated both ladies.  The front desk staff that included Sheledine, Christopher, Venus, Sianna and others that were relatively new all cheerfully greeted us as we went through that area.  I made sure Musa was aware of the great job they did.  Building services staff members Martin and Christopher were also helpful if we had questions.  I can never forget Duane and Harrington who always greeted us with a smile and asked how we were doing.  That really meant a lot to both of us being southerners.  There were MANY other folks whose names I regretfully don’t remember but were instrumental in ensuring we had a great visit.

General comments I would make is with respect to the recent room upgrades.  I would ‘suggest’ they reconsider placing slightly larger refrigerators in the rooms.  Also given the new height of the closet, one can no longer store luggage on top of it.  Lastly I would suggest they consider a microwave in a common area near the restaurant.  This would be helpful for heating up leftovers as some of us try to save on food expenses.

I definitely recommend this property for those visiting NYC and welcome being treated like a family member that had not been seen in a while.  Thanks to the Doubletree Chelsea for the great training program they obviously have in place for their staff members.

title: Correct
text:
It’s ubicación is great, although de street of the hotel is not nice. 
The elevators didn’t worked well, so you have to wait for them much more time than you think. 
The room was comfortable but it has a disgusting smell because of the carpet. They clean it but the smell was there... 
you have great access to the subway!!!

title: Not for light sleepers
text:
I chose this hotel because I prefer double tree out of the entire Hilton portfolio. This was, however, a mistake as I didn't get a good night's rest the entire week. Because of the compactness and older nature of the building, there are many doors that are in close proximity to one another. Plus, the Halls are not built to dampen noise. Despite turning anything on that could produce white noise in my room, and shoving towels under the door, I was still awoken several times a night by other guys on my floor who let their doors slam as they entered and exited their rooms through the night and early morning. 

Also, I've stay here in the past, some years ago, and the rooms seem exactly the same. They are overdue for a redesign, or at least a carpet replacement.

title: Très bien placé équipe merveilleuse
text: Un hôtel extrêmement bien placé proche de Penn station. L'équipe de l’hôtel est merveilleuse accueillante professionnelle et attentionnée. Une surprise nous attendait pour notre anniversaire de mariage Merci encore très touchée!!! Le ménage impeccable chaque jour, et les petits déjeuner en buffet étaient frais et variés! Non vraiment rien a redire nous nous sommes régalés il faut préciser que la chambre au 27eme étage avec terrasse a une vue Éblouissante sur New York!!! Seule l’evacuation des aérations située directement sur la terrasse de la chambre pose une légère ombre à ce tableau parfait. Je recommande et j’y retournerai avec grand plaisir.

title: Lost but found my suit jacket!
text:
I stayed about 10 days ago (6/14-6/16/2019). As I was so busy with my conference and other work, I mistakenly left my suit jacket in the wardrobe when I checked out. 

I called the hotel on 6/16 and 6/17 and Mirna Rodriguez, Director of Housekeeper, kindly and professionally helped me with this issue. She carefully checked lost/found stuffs (and probably the wardrobe after the next guest checked out) and confirmed she found my jacket in the same week. She even helped me with shipping the jacket using a Fedex shipping label I created as I live in Illinois. 

Today (6/26), I received my jacket with everything in the pockets. I truly appreciate her kind help and professional service. If I need to stay in NYC, I will definitely choose DoubleTree NYC Chelsea again.

title: Molto da rivedere.
text: La camera al secondo piano accanto al magazzino della pulizia delle camere. Ogni volta che uscivamo dovevamo scansare i carrelli della pulizia. Solo due ascensori per 27 piani assolutamente insufficienti. Colazione con gluten free con il solo muffin e qualche volta i biscotti. Rumori che si sentivano da ogni camera del piano.

title: Do yourself a favor and look for another hotel.
text: Not recommending this place. Receptionists are rude. Must learn what good customer service is. Made us wait 4 hours for our room. Told us that they will call when the room would be ready. But 4 hours later, we never received any call. We decided to go back to the hotel and the receptionist greeted us with "Oh I remember you." Yes right. You remember us but didn't remember to give us a call when our room was ready. Do yourself a favor and book for another hotel.

title: Friendly Staff, Stuffy Room
text: The staff was consistently friendly, and the breakfast was good. One of the elevators was out of commission for a day, and after it was “fixed”, it wobbled and made noise all the way up to our room on the 21st floor. The room was stuffy, and there was about a three degree variation from where it was set, meaning that at a 74 degree setting, the temperature varied from 72-77 degrees. Although the bed was comfortable and the room was clean, I would not recommend this hotel.

title: Family Vacation
text: Family Vacation in June 2019. Great experience and we really enjoyed the hotel and the location! The staff were friendly, helpful, and accommodating! Thank you for helping this to be a great vacation for us!

title: Elevator TRAFFIC nightmare
text:
Great staff & location.  

Average facility.

Terrible elevators - never thought that would be a driver of a hotel review but 15 to 20min wait to get up /down to 24th floor was a big downer.  Only 2 elevators - for all the guests & all the staff - nightmare (I can only imagine if there one was out of service)

title: Great stay!
text: Outstanding stay and very good value . The location is absolutely perfect just under and a five minute walk to Penn Station and easy access to Central Park and the culture of the down town area. Could easily walk almost anywhere you'd want to go in Manhattan. Clean decent size rooms and comfortable bed. Exceptional staff and an exceptional stay.

title: Excellent
text:
Enjoyed the stay. Very hospitable! Thank you!
We love Hilton - it was nice to be close to everything
and be -accessible. We traveled from abroad and it
was so relaxing.  We appreciate staff friendliness.

title: Excellent hotel.
text: Great hotel. Affordable, clean, and central - walking distance to Penn Station, and all local transit, just blocks from Whole Foods and great coffeeshops, bakeries and restaurants. Staff was friendly, efficient and attentive. Only complaint: wifi was free but unsecured.

title: Too many better options in NYC
text:
I was very disappointed with this hotel.First, upon arrival, there was no car valet available in spite of the fact that valet parking was included in my rate. I was told that I should go around the block and park it myself. Not a big deal, just not what I expected or was sold.

This hotel is in need of renovation and upgrades. The entrance includes a large amount of trash that runs along the right side of the way in as one enters the lobby. The lobby itself is small and not very attractive. The elevators are so slow that on a few occasions we were forced to walk downstairs from the 9th floor. The morning of my departure, with our bags, I was forced to wait about 10 min at least before an elevator with room arrived.

Then there is the room. We were very disappointed. First, the corners of the room had dirt and poor caulking visible all over. Other problems: (1) dirty light shades; (2) a closet that remains open due to the safe door swinging open; (3) a drain in the tub that had apparently come apart and the pieces were sitting in the bottom of the tub - this was the way it was when we walked in to the room; and (4) a bathroom mirror that should have been replaced long ago as it is chipping and falling apart.

There were other issues, but I think you get the idea. On a positive note, the staff is very nice and friendly, and do their best to be helpful.

I should also note that I will probably not be staying in a Double Tree again, as this is the second time we were disappointed. I find that the quality control of Hilton brand hotels seem to somewhat lacking and the name is of little significance in determining the quality, other than for the top brands such as Waldorf.

title: Friendly staff and a great location
text: Very friendly staff. A five-minute walk from Penn Station makes it especially convenient when traveling with children. Small rooms, typical of NYC hotels--comfortable beds, mini refrigerator, great views of Empire State Building, if you opt for that upgrade.  Oh, and delicious, warm walnut-chocolate chip cookies at check-in. We'll be back.

title: Great front desk service and clean
text: We were greeted by two individuals at the front desk who already seemed to know we were coming and had everything waiting for us including their signature warm cookies. This hotel is in a great location for pretty much everything. Yes the rooms are small but really how much are you in your room...it’s New York City! Very clean and the lady who cleaned our room answered our requests for more washcloths. Overall we would definitely stay here again!

title: Mysigt och trevligt hotell
text: Rummen var väldigt mysiga med supergoa sängar och kuddar, beroende på vilken sida man får rum på kan man få en väldigt vacker utsikt över empire state building eller en rätt kelig utsikt mot en annan byggnad. Supertrevlig personal som vid ankomst stod och delade ut vattenflaskor och supergoda kakor. God mat och dricka i restaurangen/baren och en god frukost, den färska frukten var ett stort plus. Som många tidigare nämnt så är det krångel med hissarna, har man en tid att passa är det bra att vara några (ca 10) minuter tidig för man kan få vänta ett tag på hissen. Snabbt och bra internet och bra städning. Dock städades inte vårt rum en av dagarna, när vi kom tillbaks till kvällen var varken vårt eller svärföräldrarnas rum städat. Annars var städningen noggrann och bra.

title: Sehr gute Lage, in die Jahre gekommen, Service top.
text:
Wir waren Anfang Mai 19 in diesem Hotel in New York. Unser Zimmer war im 6.Stock. Leider mit Teppich und muffig. Es war sehr staubig, darum kümmerte sich aber sofort jemand vom Hotel. Der Service war allgemein zügig, nett und zufriedenstellend.
Das Zimmer allgemein war eng (ca 18 m2), alt und die Ausstattung ist (wie oft in NY nicht aus diesem Jahrtausend) 
Vorsicht beim frühstück, völlig überteuert (~28$ p.P.) und das Büffet war um halb 10 leergeräumt und wurde auch nicht aufgefüllt. Die Auswahl ist bescheiden.
Wir haben immer auswärts gefrühstückt, meine Empfehlung THE DONUT PUB, 14th Strasse direkt bei der U-Bahn Station. 
Ich würde dieses Hotel wieder buchen, weil es sehr zentral ist und es in NY zu diesem Preis schlechtere Hotels gibt, aber man ist schon ein wenig enttäusch wenn man schonmal in einem Hilton Doubletree war (Yerevan oder Ras al Khaimah). 
Hoffen wir das die Zimmer mal generalsaniert werden.
Es hat übrigens nur 2 Aufzüge, was entsprechende Wartezeiten bedeutet.

title: A level below Hilton Expectations
text: This hotel misses the Hilton mark. NYC accommodations are always a little tight, but it doesn't create an excuse for run-down rooms and no special accommodations for Honors Status. It was affordable, but I would recommend spending the extra few bucks to stay at another partner hotel in the area.

title: Great stay
text: I would definitely stay here again. Rooms were bigger than expected, especially for NYC. Great location, and the customer service at the front desk was fantastic. It had everything we needed, and the price was right!

title: 5 Days in New York
text: On arrival the street where it was situated seemed a bit run down but 2 minute walk and we were on 7th Avenue and 10 minute walk to times square. Our room was clean and the beds were so comfortable. The room was cleaned every day. Only problem we had was after check out. Our pre-booked airport shuttle didn't turn up. We asked at reception if they could help and was told "we don't deal with airport shuttles" and told to ring the number on our booking receipt which had a pre-fix +1 which we did but it wouldn't connect saying no such number. I asked at the reception if they could advise what pre-fix number to use and the response was "sorry can't help you" Surely this is something that they should be able to help with. We felt like we had checked out and that we weren't their problem. We jumped into a taxi which cost 70 dollars.

title: Great Staff, fabulous location
text:
The Doubletree Chelsea is just a few blocks from the Empire State Building, Times Square and Shopping, shopping, shopping. 
I stayed there for work and enjoyed the cooked to order or buffet style breakfast and fast internet. 
I choose it over other properties!!

title: It’s fine brand wise and great Penn Station Location.
text:
Newark flight was cancelled, rebooked our if LaGuardia the next day so took the train bro Penn Station for $13 and walked to hotel. Great access location wise!! Hotel was reasonably priced given last minute and room by NY standards was decent sized. 

Love the electronic key and no need to stop at the front desk, which was packed.  Gym was nice but hot.  Given its NY, everything is small but it’s been somewhat recently remodeled or built and clean.  The gym was nice and there were several restaurants really close to dash to in the pouring rain that cancelled my flight. 

Given the price, location and size, I’d stay here again.

title: Great staff/location, rooms aren't quiet
text:
I typically stay at the Fashion District Hilton when I am in Chelsea and was in NYC with a friend who had a room here so decided to stay here instead.

Great location, very convenient to Penn Station if you are using JFK or EWR for train service to the airport and to the 1 line and easy walk to a couple other subway lines.   Staff was top notch.

Breakfast was a buffet with a lot of hot items but not much in the way of healthy choices like fresh fruit or healthier cereal.   The breakfast hours were late into the morning which was nice for late risers.   

Lacked in the area of a lot of other diamond benefits.   Didn't receive an upgrade as a diamond even though the app offered me the chance to "buy up" and there were upgraded rooms available to book.   No Exec Lounge and no premium wifi.   

Rooms aren't soundproof at all.   I could hear a lot of noise throughout the night from people in the hallway and a baby crying in another room on the floor so if you are a light sleep I'd avoid this hotel.

Only two elevators so I'd recommend getting a lower floor room so you can take the stairs to exit.   I was on the 3rd floor and my friend was on the 5th so I mainly used the stairs to save time and almost every time I went to use the stairs housekeeping had stuff all over the landing and you had to walk around and step over the trash (see pic attached).   Not only was this inconvenient it would be a hazard if the hotel had to evacuate using the stairs due to an emergency.

Fridges in the room that was a nice amenity.   Drawer space is very limited and the bathrooms and bedrooms are very small.   The HVAC was also a pain to control, wall themostat and it was an old wall style unit.

I'll stick to the Fashion District Hilton for future stays in Chelsea.   Outside of the great staff and good location nothing else really stood out.

title: Good option in Chelsea
text: Came in to visit family nearby and have stayed in almost every hotel in the area. It’s clean and convenient for our needs, but nothing exceptional. Bathroom is truly tiny without storage. Extra toilet paper was found in a drawer in bedroom!  Bed was comfortable and room in the back of hotel was fairly quiet.

title: This is not of the Normal Doubletree Quality
text: This Doubletree is very very tired! The hotel needs updating drastically and for what they are charging it is embarrassing, We had a junior suite and the room was somewhat clean. Very very small and when we attempted to use the pull out couch and it wasn't made up, we had to ask to have it made up. My daughter tried to sleep on the bed and we had to turn the mattress side ways becasue there was a spring coming through the mattress. The staff at this hotel makes up for the poor condition this hotel is in. The lead desk person Musa Goodman bent over backwards to accommodate us. We were in NYC for a graduation for my grand daughter, Musa was kind enough to give us an open room to change when our room was not ready. The bell hop / concierge Devaun was more than helpful storing our bags and suggesting answers to our questions. If it weren't for the very courteous and professional staff, this hotel would have been unbearable!

title: posizione strategica
text: un hotel bello per la posizione e la comodita' nello spostarsi a manhattan. le camere non sono molto spaziose cosi come i bagni ma nel complesso sono molto comode con tutti i servizi compreso asse stiro e la cassaforte. la pulizia potrebbe migliorare . insonorizzazione non perfetta.  qualita' del sonno molto buona. non ho provato la colazione. personale della reception cortese. prezzi nella media per il centro di new york

title: Great Location!
text: For my purpose the location was perfect, close to FIT and many restaurants and shopping venues.  There is a sidewalk patio and a small dining area with a bar.  The rooms are a little small but typical for NYC accommodations but they have all the necessary amenities.  Great value and price as well.

title: Amazing customer service
text:
The hotel staff was personable.
The hotel was cozy and very clean.
The bar was convienent and had a great selection. Will recommend to stay there again.
The convienence of the location and it’s close proximity was ideal.

title: Just don’t go there!
text:
I live in NY and my family and friends come to visit me very often. I booked my mom at the Doubletree on 29th street and I fully paid the room. The day she arrived I was at work (I work from 10 am to 6 pm) she checked in at 1 pm and they requested the security deposit. She tried to pay with the debit card that she has (Italian debit card) and the card wasn’t working, then she offered to the guy at the reception desk to pay the security deposit with cash.. and he refused. She told to the guy at the reception (the manager I think) to wait for me because I have US credit card and she asked to Check in and to provide my credit card later for the Security deposit. He rudely told her that she couldn’t check in until the Payment of the security deposit and he told her to wait for me until 6pm. He asked to a 60 years old woman that she just did a 12 hour flight to wait 4 hours in the hotel lobby for her daughter!! At the end she waited for me! If this is hospitality!! 

Second, I paid the room for 2 people to stay with my mom.. and the room was furnished for 1 person only! I asked additional towels and shampoo but I received everything the day after!!

title: Worst hotel stay in years
text: They do not have refrigerators as advertised.  The rooms are much smaller and dingier than pictured.  They scrimp on towels and washcloths, you have to ask for more if you want more than one washcloth for two people.  You have to remove the iron and ironing board from the tiny wardrobe in order to hang shirts properly.  They did a poor job cleaning and refreshing the room during our stay.  The staff was rude from check in to check out.  I need a refrigerator for medication and they refused to provide one.  The coolers they claim are fridges have signs inside saying not to store any perishable items or medication in them.

title: weekend stay
text: Quick trip to the city for a couple of shows,  Great hotel, friendly staff, close to transportation hub.  room was clean and comfortable, all we could ask for at a reasonable price.  highly recommend this hotel.

title: Amazing
text: The staff in all areas were always friendly and helpful. Loved getting fresh chocolate chip cookies every day. would stay here again. The beds were so comfortable, I got the most amazing nights sleep every night.

title: Basic room, great locatkom
text:
