Pros: easy walk to the subway, restaurants (try 2bros dollar slice pizza), tourist attractions, Chelsea market, koreatown. Quiet at night. Comfy bed, well designed room, good water pressure in the shower, WiFi worked well. Reasonable price 

Cons: small room (but that’s NYC for you), tiny lobby, nothing special about the hotel decor, no breakfast included

title: Not bad, Good Location, Probably Wouldn't Repeat
text: Location was good. Most reception people very friendly. Elevators very slow and room very very small. All and all satisfied. Last experience at a Hilton property in New Orleans was awful so definitely a big improvement. Cookies were yummy!

title: Friendly and efficient staff
text:
I stayed at the DoubleTree by Hilton in Chelsea in early April for two nights.  I booked the room via hotwire.com and got a reasonable rate for the 'penthouse' king on the 27th floor.  It was an ordinary king room - not that big but larger than a lot of hotel rooms in New York City.  My sister and I shared the room, and we had a balcony which was nice, with a decent view of the Empire State Building.  The lock on the door to the balcony was broken, but the chances of anyone entering the room via the balcony were slim!  I asked in advance for a rollaway to be put in the room.  When I checked in, I asked if a cot had been placed in the room, as previously requested.  I got the names mixed up because when I got to the room, there was a rollaway as well as a cot for a baby!  My mistake.  The cot was removed!  

More about checking in - I was a little early so I said I'll go to get a drink in their bar/restaurant, which was adjacent to the reception area.  The young lady at the desk (I think her name was Venus) said she would come and get me when the room was ready.  I thought that was a nice gesture.  Sure enough, I didn't have to wait long before Venus came and delivered the room keycards to me, together with a cookie and bottled water.  One of the downsides of this hotel is that there are only two elevators serving 27th floors, and they're not very big.  Consequently, they fill up quickly and you may find yourself waiting a bit for the next one.
  
The hotel offered both a continental and a hot buffet breakfast.  My sister and I opted for the hot buffet both mornings which was $25 each.  I thought that was quite reasonable, and the food was good.  Scrambled eggs, with or without cheese, bacon, sausage, waffles (everything was hot and not cold and soggy), as well as bagels, toast, etc.  We ate as much as we could which set us up nicely for lots of walking around NYC!!  

Overall, I was pleasantly surprised at the efficiency and friendliness of the staff, both at check-in/check-out, and in the restaurant.  Considering the Hilton is a chain, this particular hotel is a good choice - not too big, not too small.  The location is convenient - not in the middle of Chelsea, but a good base if you want to do your own walking tours.  It was quite noisy on the Saturday night (even on a high floor), with sirens wailing, but that's New York for you.  I would most likely stay there again.

title: Good hotel in a great location in New York City
text: Have stayed at this hotel numerous times before when traveling to New York city.  There are several good places to eat close by.  There are several subway connects that are also very close to the hotel.  Herald Square is just north east of the hotel and Penn station is a little north west of the hotel.  It's small but clean and very easy to get in and out of when in a hurry.

title: NYC  april 2019
text:
Bra läge i Nomad distriktet. 
Personalen är guldklimpen på detta hotel. 
Problemet med detta hotel är hissarna. Även om bägge hissarna funkar får man vänta länge. Denna gången funkade bara en av hissarna och få blev det katastrof. Fick vänta över 10 min på en hiss. 
Inte ok alls.

title: Great location, Right Price
text: I stayed at the DoubleTree Chelsea around Easter.  I was in NYC for business trip and my family joined me for a long weekend.  The hotel is in a great location - easy walking distance to FlatIron, Empire State, and really any other site in NYC.  Subway close too.  Street is quieter.  Hotel was clean and every staff member we encountered was very friendly!  Room is cozy but I haven't stayed in a room in NY yet that isn't.  Best price I could find in the city that weekend (for this hotel quality). We had 2 double beds and a great view from the 26th floor.  Being on the 26th, we didn't run into the elevator issues that others describe because it was empty for us - but we typically stopped at least 5 times going down but never had an issue getting on - but can see how others could.  They have fresh chocolate chip cookies (YUM) and cold, fruit infused water in the lobby which we really enjoyed.  For AM, head across the street to Luna Coffee for the best NY bagels!  Cool vibe too.  Enjoy!

title: Great Location In NYC
text:
Hotel is an ideal location on 29th Street between 6th and 7th Avenues, especially if you commute in to Penn Station.  Plenty of Subway options to get around the City, plenty of coffee shops and restaurants nearby.  

The Hotel itself was very nice, although the rooms were a bit small for a family of four.  Workable for a short trip, but might be tougher for a longer stay.

title: Amazing Location.
text:
I stayed at this hotel from 4th-9th April 2019. Just as I was about to board my flight to NYC I received a email from the hotel explaining that my card details have not been authorised and I would need to provide an updated credit card otherwise my booking would be cancelled. Whilst I take full responsibility as I provided a old credit card I would have appreciated to receive the email at least a few days before my stay. However I was able to call the property and provide them with my new updated credit card details which they verified everything to me over the phone. 

I had read a few reviews of customers not being allocated the room that they initially reserved which I was worried about however I had issues with this. Upon
arrival check in was easy and quick under 5 minutes and I received warm cookies & bottled water on arrival which was a nice touch. 

I booked a king suite the room was perfect and had more space than expected, the bathroom was quite small however this was not a problem at all. The bed was comfortable and large and it was nice having a separate living room area to relax and watch some tv. The room was fully equip with a coffee machine and coffee and tea, which was nice to have hot drinks whenever you pleased. I only had room service once during my stay as I did not feel it was necessary especially as I had spent a lot of my time outside. 

Before arrival I had read a lot of reviews on trip advisor stating that the lifts were a problem however I had no issues at all with the lifts as I never had to wait more than a minute for a lift. Yes the walls are quite thin and you could hear the lifts at time but this was no bother at all. 

The main attraction of this hotel is the location which was the main reason why I had booked this hotel. My stay in New York was based around Wrestlemania which took place at the Met Life Stadium. Transport to get to the Met Life was via Penn Station which was under a 5 minute walk from the hotel. This made it easy when I was travelling back from the Met Life stadium at 1am to get back to my hotel as quickly as possible. 

The only downfall I would say about this hotel is the street that the hotel is located on. Sometimes at night when walking back to the hotel you would come across certain people standing/lying on the street. Even though they do not do you any harm it can be quite intimidating and felt uncomfortable at times. 

Other than that this hotel is under a 15 minute walk to times square which makes it easy to walk to the chaos however nice because it is out of the way. Numerous of subway lines around the hotel which made it easy to get around and the staff at the hotel were amazing and always happy to help. Did not have the breakfast so I am unable to comment about that. 

Bottom line is that I would definitely stay at this hotel again when travelling to New York especially at the rate which I paid- more than value for money.

title: Great location!
text:
Close to several subways, walkable to Times Square and next to Korea town! Several food options close by including several breakfast options.

Walk from Penn station if arriving from EWR or on Amtrak trains.

title: First NY trip
text: Room was on the smaller side, but that’s NY!!! Hotel, bar and restaurant provided absolutely the BEST customer service received in a while!!!! VERY convenient to Penn Station!!!! Food was delicious and drinks were flowing!!!! Will be back

title: Großartiges Hotel in toller Lage
text:
Das Hotel liegt zentral, ideal um Manhattan zu Fuß oder mit der Metro zu erkunden.
Zimmer sind tadellos: tolle Betten, gutes WLAN, Flat screen TV, ausreichend große Badezimmer.
Das Hotelpersonal ist ausgesprochen freundlich und hilfsbereit.
Vorm Hotel stehen ein paar Tische und Sofas zur Verfügung, wo man auch rauchen/trinken darf.
In unmittelbarer Umgebung finden sich ausreichend Einkaufs- und take-away-Möglichkeiten für Essen, Trinken, Kaffee, …

title: Not a DoubleTree quality property
text: This property should be rebranded as a Hampton Inn or removed completely from the Hilton portfolio. Waiting on follow up from Customer Service about issues reported since the weekend. Every room is near the noisy broken elevator.

title: Bra boende
text: Bra boende nära till allt. Kylskåp, USB, + många vägguttag, tyst och lugnt.Bra gratisinternet. Från flygplatsen JFK åker man direkt med tunnelbanan till Penn station, därifrån är det bara ca:10 min gångväg till hotellet. Alldeles för dyr frukost 22,95 USD + tax per person och dag

title: Good location
text: We stayed here for 4 nights and the 1st night was in a double, double which was poky at best for the price.  We then moved to a suite which was far better. Spacious and well equipped. All in all very good, however as there were no stirrers for the coffee I had to use a pen which I left out and asked for stirrers to be left - they instead left the dirty pen and gave me two more pens but no stirrers!

title: Avoid
text: Stayed at this hotel for 4 nights at start of the month on arrival had to pay $200 for the room deposit which was fine as was told that it would be refunded after we left within 5 working days. Now the 5 working days has past and still no refund so this needless to say replaced any good feeling we had about the hotel whilst staying there. Location great but due to non refund I would avoid at all costs.

title: Ottima posizione
text:
Vero punto di forza è la posizione centrale e sicura dell'albergo
 Anche tornando alla sera dopo mezzanotte non abbiamo mai avuto problemi in quanto la zona è molto frequentata. Trovandosi a pochi centinaia di metri da penn station è molto comodo anche per chi vuole prendere il treno della Lirr per l'aereoporto (soluzione economica e veloce). Vicinissimo a diverse fermate della metro aperte sempre (tutte tranne la  vicinissima 28 st che è chiusa la sera e nel weekend). Circondato da locali dove mangiare sia per colazione che cena. Letto king comodo, vasca/doccia funzionale, abbastanza silenziosa la camera ma si potrebbe migliorare in quanto le finestre non sono il massimo dell'isolamento (qualche spiffero entrava essendo a metà marzo..). Noi eravamo al 14 piano e pur avendo una camera standard avevamo la vista sull'empire. Nel complesso la camera è accogliente (anche se in stile non proprio moderno) ma non molto spaziosa (ma in 2 non abbiamo avuto problemi). Grande difetto è la rumorosità del fan coil (impianto di riscaldamento ad aria) che ci costringeva a spegnerlo prima di andare a dormire con conseguente raffreddamento della stanza durante la notte (essendo a marzo la notte eravamo quasi sottozero esternamente). Qualche volta ci siamo svegliati dal freddo in piena notte e l'abbiamo dovuto accendere. La cosa assurda è che ti trovavi davanti una tv bellissima ed enorme (che sinceramente abbiamo acceso un paio di volte) e poi questi vecchissimi fan coil che chiedevano di essere sostituiti. Preciso che una volta partiti poi la camera si riscaldava in un attimo e quindi da accesi non faceva assolutamente freddo. Abbiamo avuto un piccolo disguido in quanto ci sono stati prelevati dalla carta di credito i soldi per due notti che, per un errore, pensavano non avessimo pagato. Ma spiegando che avevamo già pagato tutto in anticipo, hanno prontamente annulato l'operazione. Quindi nel complesso se sostituissero gli impianti di riscaldamento (o andando nelle mezze stagioni dove non è così necessario il loro utilizzo) ci tornerei tranquillamente.

title: Matchbox small
text:
Not only did I not get the room I signed up for, with an Empire State view, it was beyond small for 4 people with two beds, barely enough room to walk no where to place luggage not even on a luggage rack. 
I will say the hotel was clean, staff were nice and helpful.

title: Great position and value, small rooms but awesome breakfast
text:
Came on business as near Penn station and stayed 1 night. Am a Hilton regular and the room was small but Comfortable with good bathroom. I could see Empire State from my room and went down to gym which was similarly small with ok equipment but limited.
Then breakfast was a real surprise - absolutely fantastic. Better choice and quality than all of the other Hilton’s and Marriotts I have been while being in New York (about 10 hotels) which are all more expensive!!

title: Great hotel, very happy
text:
I checked in about 7pm last Friday and my room was ready, clean and warm. I booked a 2 room king suite, was given 1710 and it was excellent. Like my own little apartment in NYC!

Re: the lift situation, I never waited more than 60 seconds for a lift. In fact, had I not read the reviews on here I'd never have noticed. 

The front desk were always available, kind and polite. They clearly work at double speed so thank you for your efforts. 

I didnt visit the bar or order room service. 

I would happily stay here again. I found it to be very enjoyable.

title: Front Desk was Great!
text: My friend and I were just looking for a place to sleep for the night after sight seeing in the city.  The hotel is very close to Madison Square Garden and very clean. Sheldine at the front desk was extremly helpful and vert welcoming. I would definitely stay here next time I'm back in the city.

title: Good Location. Fine Accomodations
text:
Our room was tiny, but updated, clean, and totally adequate for our 2 night stay in NYC. When someone else on the floor opened their door or shut their door, all the hotel rooms would rattle. The room was very hot, but we put the air conditioning on and that quickly cooled the room down, and also provided white noise to hallway noise.
We did not spend much time in the room as we were out in the city from morning through night. If you want to spend time in the hotel room, this tiny room would not be my choice to do so in. 
Once we checked in we did not interact with the front desk at all. Whenever we entered the lobby, they were right there, and never looked up to greet guests. I am sure they would answer questions and be helpful if asked, but if not engaged, they did not engage you.
The hotel is in a good location. Very close to Penn station, and a good starting point for venturing into Manhattan and all of it's neighborhoods. 
One odd thing: the garbage and dirty linens are lined up, outside the hotel entrance 24/7. I guess this is just a lack of space/NYC thing, and while it did not impact my stay it was a bit unappealing.
What the other reviews say about the elevators is true. There are only 2. They are small. You will need to wait for them.

title: Not worth the money
text:
My business booked this hotel on my behalf and was told the only thing I would be responsible for covering was incidentals.  I arrived, the receptionist rudely and coldly told me that wasn’t true, charging the full amount to my card, and offered me a warm cookie as if that would smooth things over.  As someone who’s worked in the customer service industry, I am certain there was a more professional and friendly way of handling the situation.

When I arrived in my room, it appeared as if it had barely been cleaned.  There wasn’t even a fitted sheet on the bed, the tub’s drain was broken, and basic hotel comforts like a blow dryer or a bottle of water were missing. 

This hotel was also extremely loud. I understand it’s NYC, but between the street noise, the extremely thin walls, and being placed in a room directly across from the elevator, I couldn’t get one moment of peace. 

For the $286 charged to my card, I wouldn’t have paid more than $30 for the experience I was offered.

title: Super 👍
text:
Mycket bra boenden mitt i smeten av Manhattan. Superskön säng och massa goa kuddar, vi hade bokat ”rum med utsikt” och fick Empire State Building utanför fönstret. Personalen är mycket trevlig och hjälpsam. Enkel in och utcheckning och bra Wi-Fi.

annaeliette

title: Moyen
text: Accueil correct mais la chambre, Matelas inconfortable (draps pas changés) chambre  pas aspirée. Il ne vaut pas un 4 étoile seul les serviettes sont changés tout les jours. Le seul  point positif situation géographique

title: A nice stay!
text: This hotel had a great location and very polite staff! We stayed on the 17th floor with a great view and did not experience long waits with the elevators. Our only issue was not enough soap provided in the room at check-in. This was quickly solved after we spoke with the front desk.

title: fantastisch personeel en locatie, maar slecht hotel.
text: Als je de lobby binnenstapt bekruipt je het gevoel dat je het verkeerde hotel bent binnengestapt. De uitstraling en inrichting is Hilton-onwaardig Het lijkt wel een hostel.. En inderdaad de kamers zijn wel heel erg klein en donker en dat je voor alle kamers maar 2 liften hebt is bijna niet te doen. Gelukkig is het personeel uitermate vriendelijk behulpzaam etc. Dat haalt de scherpe kantjes ervan af.

title: Great Stay
text: Recently spent 4 nights here and couldn't have been more pleased with our hotel choice.  Very reasonably priced, and had no resort fee, like so many hotels.  The staff at check-in was excellent and friendly. We received a complimentary upgrade to an Empire State Building view room.  The location was ideal for us - not far from subway stations, and easily walkable to Penn Station (which was ideal since we flew in/out of Newark). Housekeeping staff did a great job making up the room everyday.  Will definitely stay here again.

title: Nice location and staff
text:
The hotel is situated at 29th street, in the heart of Manhattan, between the 6th and 7th Avenue. There are a lot of restaurants and stores around, and subway stations. The location allow the guests to go walking to many touristic attractions of the city such as Empire State Building, Times Square, Hudson Yards, Rockefeller Center, Bryant Park and others around.
The negative point is the room.. too small, and the furniture seems to be very old, but conservated. One point is very important: for two people, the room size is ok. 
P.S: they have amazing cookies and staff (I liked them so much). The bed is sooo comfortable (very good to rest).
That’s it!

title: Good location, but dated decor and often-crowded lifts
text: This is a very tall thin building, so If you book a room with a view of the Empire State Building ( a definite plus on a good day, not so good if it's raining ), then you will have to use the lifts. There are two. Their behaviour is somewhat erratic (not frightening, they just occasionally stop at floors when nobody is there). The room we had was rather dated - scrupulously clean, but old-fashioned (60s-70s). It was quiet and the beds were comfortable, but it felt that we were in a time warp - and we would really have preferred one big double bed to two relatively narrow ones. It would have made the rather small room seem bigger. The one really positive point was the helpfulness of the staff. If they refurbished the hotel and kept the staff it could be a winner!

title: Can't beat location!!
text: I have to give a 5 for the convenience of the hotel to Time Square, 5th Ave, Madison Square Garden and more....Yes, hotel is old but kept up nicely.  Yes, it is small however that is to be expected.  Staff were super accommodating from getting us a room early on check in day and getting us a late check out.  They were helpful with providing directions to the subway and getting us extra toiletries as we needed them.  We were on the 26th floor with a view of the Freedom Tower which we did not even request.  Patience is just helpful with the elevators as they are slow and small.  That seemed to be just a minor inconvenience as we were  just happy to be on vacation in beautiful NYC.  Lots of value for the money in my opinion.

title: Rooms are tired and desparately need a renovation.
text: The staff is very friendly and accommodating and the location is great!   Everything in the rooms however are very worn.  The shower and the hair drier didn't work very well.  There weren't glasses in the room and the second day I had to call for replacement towels.

title: Warm Chocolate Chip Cookies
text: This hotel is in a good location in Chelsea and provided a clean, comfortable, quiet room for a good night's sleep.  The staff was welcoming and accommodating.  Renovations are in the works, and this will improve the look of the hotel.  Warm chocolate chip cookies at check-in sweeten the travel experience.

title: Good Value - basic level hotel in Midtown NYC
text: All in all, a good standard hotel on a budget in NYC. Hotel is fairly centrally located so depending on your agenda - you should be able to reach most things apart from the southern districts of NYC on foot. About 10 minutes from Times Square and plenty of bars and eateries fairly local too. Good stay overall with no complaints.

title: 値段の割に
text:
ニューヨークのホテルはどこも高い。

学生旅行だったのでなるべく価格を抑えて良いところに泊まろうと思った。色々探した結果こちらのホテルに泊まった。

私の訪問した時期は2人でだと1泊9000円くらいだった。しかし私の経験の中での1泊9000円はかなり良い部屋に泊まれるという価値観だった。
日本での価値観をそのまま持って行ったら少しがっかりします。
ニューヨークはどこのホテルも狭いし値段は高い。値段が高いからとあまり期待してはいけない。
ホテルのフロントの方は感じの良さそうな人達だった。
立地はとても良いと思う。
注意点としてはバゲージは無料で預かってくれるが事前に知らせておく予定の時間を過ぎてしまうと追加料金がかかる。

title: You get what you pay for
text: stayed in 3 different hotels, 1 each week. this one was the worst.....But you get what you pay for. $120 a night you cant beat that. Really close to penn station which is nice too. Dont get breakfast there, its like any other complimentary hotel breakfast, except it cost $25 a person. Just go to a breakfast restaurant....Youre in NYC afterall

title: Great for a short stay
text: Chose this spot for an overnight to see a show in Greenwich Village. It would also be convenient for BWay. Close to subway, Penn Station, easy access to many destinations. Walkable. Rooms are a bit small but that's NYC!

title: Filthy!
text: Our room was so dusty. Clock, towel racks were covered in dust. Elevators broke, water always empty. Our neighbors were smoking and we called front desk and listened as we heard employee tell neighbors if they smoke to “cover door”. So disgusting and our toddler was miserable from the smell.

title: Was even better second time around!
text:
After my last stay at this hotel back in June last year, we took up the management's invitation to come back when the renovations were fnished.  Sure enough the scaffolding around the entrance was gone and the checkin  desk is on the opposite side of the lobby.

Again the hotel met our expectations, nothing was any trouble for the staff.  We had issues with the safe which wouldn't lock and someone was sent up in less than 10 minutes.  The following morning, I went to use the coffee machine and it obviously hadn't been used for a long time as the creamer portions had curdled and needed ro be replaced......again new ones were sent to our room expediently.

The location is excellent, two blocks from Penn Station which is brilliant for Newark Airport, and it is close to, but not actually in Midtown (although saying it is in Chelsea is a bit of a stretch....)  We were also attending an ice hockey game at Madison Square Garden and it is literally 3 minutes walk away.  Criticisms are few....this is not a spacious hotel by any means as the building is a tiny little tower sandwiched between two other buildings and the rooms are well.....cramped.  The two elevators serving the hotel are not enough at peak times.  And the entrance plaza isn't particularly inviting with garbage bins right next to the front door. 

At checkout the staff arranged our car transfer back to Newark and the doorman took our luggage out without having to be asked.  Pricewise we paid $130 a night which is pretty typical for a big name hotel of this standard in Manhattan at this time of year.  Overall it was a great stay from beginning to end and we will definitely be back.

title: Easy access
text: This property is in a great location for easy access by foot or subway to the Village, Times Square, Broadway shows and more.  Though not huge, the room was spacious with a great view of the Empire State building.

title: Small rooms but great location
text: Excellent location, small but clean rooms, excellent service - Highly recommend - Easy walk to time square and a number of restaurants excellent bar on same street with games.  HIGHLY recommend Cigar bar across the street!!

title: Needs a refurbishment
text: I have stayed here every month for a year or more now on business Staff are terrific but they cannot make up for the tired rooms and facilities. Why can't a maid wipe behind the TV stand and not just half the front so its thick with dust. Toilet was tough to flush and heating didn't warm up as prompted by control in room. 4 inch Shelf above toilet (only shelf in bathroom ) is not wide enough to place bath bag  Water took a full 5 mins of running to get hot. Bath mat literally had  holes in it and towels are getting thinner by the week. Good location and staff really are helpful and do their best. Don't stay above floor 11 if you don't want to wait for 10 + mins for elevator when maids are on shifts as there are no service elevators.

title: Great hotel!
text: The rooms were clean and the staff was friendly. I was able to arrange for a late check in since my flight landed after midnight. The beds were comfortable and provided everything I needed. I would recommend this hotel.

title: Amazing Staff Who Go Above and Beyond
text: This property is our go-to hotel in New York. What makes the property so wonderful is the thoughtful, warm, and excellent customer service. Staff clearly value making sure guests have a comfortable stay, which we've learned through our constant travel (my husband is a Hilton Diamond member), is more important than any other hotel amenity. A special recognition for Musa, who repeatedly went above and beyond for us. We look forward to our next visit!

title: ペンステーションから徒歩5分
text:
立地はペンステーションまで徒歩圏内のため深夜にJFK到着でLIRR利用でも問題ないと思う。メイシーズや、ホールフーズ、ターゲットなども10分以内のため、便利です。

高層階であれば、エンパイアステートビルも見ることが可能です。

総じて宿泊料金の高いマンハッタンではコスパは良いものの値段なりにスタッフや部屋の狭さ、クリーニングの適当さなどは、我慢するべきです。

title: Great for a long weekend
text: Good location to be within walking distance of a lot to do. Wish there were more elevators, but not a deal breaker. Very clean and helpful staff. Rooms are a little small, but perfect for a couple or 2 friends.

title: アクセス良好、コスパよし
text:
Midtownに行くにも、Downtownに行くにもアクセスが良好で、最寄りは28 Street Station（徒歩3,4分）。
28 Street Stationからは①②番線、34 St - Herald Sq Subway StationからはB,D,F,N,Q,R,W線が出ておりアクセス抜群である。５番街へも徒歩でアクセス可能。

title: Chelsea Hilton
text:
Convenient to Maddison Square Garden, Amtrak, nyc subway. Good restaurants within walking distance.  
Lobby very small so no real gathering space if traveling with a group.
Midtown was easy location to catch subway uptown or downtown.  Hotel had driver available (for a fee) for above ground travel, we used it due to snow & rain, very reasonable for 4 passengers.
We stayed in room with two beds which made the room a little tight, next time we will go one king bed.thats why I gave rooms lower mark.
The staff we excellent, friendly & helpful.  
We ordered off menu for breakfast portions were very good & food tasty.

title: Excellent value!
text: Staff friendly and helpful, great location, clean rooms in a perfect location- especially when seeing events at Madison Square Garden.  Stay here every time we go to NYC and definitely recommend to others!

title: No to Doubletree Hotel Chelsea
text:
I am a loyal Hilton Honors Member, but I will not be choosing the Chelsea again...just a few of the issues I had on my last stay...
Room: I was not provided the room I checked into and I was not offered an upgrade even after asking for it although a team-member that checked in less than 20 minutes later was given an option of an upgrade...we are both Diamond members. 
Bed: The fitted bed sheet was torn. I did call and ask for it to be replaced, but this was not  addressed and changed until the next day. 
Heating: The heating did not stay on and I had to ask twice for someone to take a look at the system. On the second request, someone did come up and explained that the wall mount did not function properly and that we needed to turn it up past 80 degrees for it to stay on and heat the room properly and that the was aware of the issue and that they need to change the devices. 
Bathroom: The light in the bathroom would not stay on the first day of arrival. I called and they assured that someone would come up to correct the issue. I had to call down again on the second day before someone would come up to take a look. They did "fix" it while I was gone and left what looked like dust or particles in the sink after they removed the light fixture. 
The lobby was often dirty and the linens were always out front of the hotel which you need to walk by every time you enter the building. It felt dirty and unkept. 
As a loyal Hilton Honors member, I was extremely disappointed in this hotel and will not be staying there again on future visits.

title: NYC - Feb. 2019 Carnegie Hall Trip
text: Doubletree Chelsea is a great location off the loud 7th. Avenue in NYC. Minimum noise as it sits in the middle of 6th and 7th with great access to many nearby subways. I would definitely stay here again. No issues recommending this clean hotel to NYC travelers.

title: Great location and affordable.
text: I rarely write reviews but I wanted to give a shout out to the staff at the Double Tree hotel in Chelsea, NYC. Every staff member I came across was helpful and courteous. Though the room was small - typical in Manhattan - it was clean and well cared for. The location of the hotel was perfect. We were able to walk to many great restaurants and shops. Very happy with our visit and would definitely stay here again.

title: Great experience
text: I came to NYC for a job interview. I chose this hotel for its price on the weekend I was there as well as its proximity to Penn Station (I took Amtrak). It was in a great location, easy to use as a home base while in town for my interview.

title: you DON'T get what you pay for
text: Very low value for money (even considering the already well known poor value for money in Manhattan).I did not get the room I had reserved. I did not hear a single "sorry for the inconvenience".Not a nice way to start your stay.

title: Clean, convenient, value, small rooms
text: Here on business and great location for my work and of course convenient walking distance to just about anything downtown you want to visit. small but functional rooms, no frills, clean, comfortable but noisy air conditioning/heating. Breakfast with room if you pay a high enough rate, not included in my AARP rate. Bar and snacks available during normal times but I did not find vending machines nor amenities book in the room to tell me about guest services. A bit dark. Here only one night so was not able to utilize whatever facilities they have available to guests. Enjoyed the hot cookie upon check in, the water, the free wifi and friendly staff.

title: Great Hotel, Great Location to MSG
text: We stayed for a concert at MSG.  2 1/2 blocks away.  Great pubs and restaurants nearby.  Very nice, reasonable hotel.  Staff was accommodating.  We did not happen to eat at the hotel but it seemed busy all days.

title: Better properties out there.
text: Problem on arrival with my reservation.  Inattention and inconsiderate check in staff.  I was kept waiting 1.5 hours while they sorted it out.  No offer to make the wait more comfortable.   The hotel lobby is tiny and ugly.  The room floor halls tiny.  The rooms small.   The noise from the halls and adjacent rooms loud.  The cleaning staff pleasant.  The room was clean. The bed comfortable.

title: Como en casa, gran atención y muy bien ubicado!
text:
Estuvimos 20 días en total, llegamos antes por el vuelo y debíamos esperar un rato para el check-in por lo que decidimos dejar las valijas (las guardan sin problema) pudimos ir al baño y salimos a recorrer la zona (a 3 cuadras del empire state y 5 de macy's) muy amables y serviciales en la recepción!
La habitación era doble con 2 camas grandes, sencilla, agradable y muy limpia. Cuenta con wifi gratuito de buena velocidad. Estuvimos en piso 9 al frente (desde donde se podía ver la antena del empire) Nos dieron a diario las famosas cookies, que son deliciosas! la hab. tiene cafetera gratuita  para tomar algo caliente para afrontar el día. En subsuelo tiene el gimnasio para utilizar sin cargo. y el lobby cuenta con una pc con acceso a internet e imprsora gratis.
Utilizamos el restaurant-bar para el 31 de diciembre y la cena antes de volver y resulto excelente.Reciben paquetes de amazon sin cargo. 
La excelente ubicación del hotel hace que puedas caminar 15 minutos y estar en Times square y tiene 2 estaciones de subte cerca (28st y 34st-penn station)
Definitivamente volveria sin dudarlo!

title: A good average
text:
I got a good deal. The location was perfect as we had plans at Madison Square Garden. We walked there, movies and subway. 
The room was small but clean. We ordered a sandwich from room service that came in a respectable time and it was good. The bar made ok cocktails. My husband wasn't happy with the service at the bar. The front desk service was friendly. Parking is located across the street. Would I stay again? Yes. Great location. They have those foam top beds, if you have issues with that. The cookies are still good.

title: Winter at the MET
text:
Arrived at the hotel on a very cold day. Parking is just before the hotel, quick stop there. The front desk welcome us with a nice smile, he give us an upgrade, very nice of him.
Our room face the Empire State building, very modern with all proper amenities.
Breakfast buffet with lots of choices under an atrium room, staff was friendly and the coffee was excellent. 
Perfect location close to the metro, and tons of restaurants and shops around. Major attractions close by as well.
My only dissatisfaction was, right before the front entrance of the hotel, a pile of large laundry carts all pushed up against each other, right as you walk in the door.
Not the best first impression.
Everything else is great, we will be back.

title: Nice property. Easy walk from Penn Station and The Garden
text: This hotel is a nice Doubletree with attentive staff. It is an easy walk to Penn Station, The Garden and plenty of local eating a drinking spots. Always a fair price for a nice stay. I have stayed here multiple times.

title: Decent and clean...but those elevators!!
text:
Stayed December 2018, family of 4, 2 boys 18 & 15

For the most part, this Doubletree location is perfectly fine for a quick stay in NYC (as we did during Christmas week)

Our room had two double beds and was clean, quiet and everything worked. The room had a mini-fridge which was not plugged in when we came into the room. As we wanted to use it, I tried to find the outlet to plug it in but could not locate it anywhere on the wall behind its location. I had to take it out of its cabinet and plug it in elsewhere. Not a big deal really, just an annoyance.

This being a NYC hotel, space is at a premium, so we still booked the room with its' two double beds (as we would have preferred two queen beds) and brought a air mattress for one of our boys (otherwise, there would have been a struggle for space while sleeping so the air mattress was the best solution - trust me - the air mattress fit in the room - barely)

The only complaint I have is with the elevators - especially around check out in the morning. There are only two elevators and the wait for one was incredibly long - at least 20 minutes or more. As we had to leave for an appointment, I could only wait just so long and ended up dragging our luggage down 7 flights! So either check out earlier than the posted time or have a lot of patience.

All in all though, this Doubletree location was fine.

title: Perfect location
text: The hotel is not the best, the rooms are quite small BUT... location is perfect (34th street subway and Penn Station) and service is good. The wifi is working well, perfect for a business trip in the city

title: Poor quality for a Hilton Group hotel
text:
First, it’s been renovated and entering it was tricky. Getting with one of the slow elevators to the room was a challenge and could take up to 10’. For a small hotel, this is unacceptable.

Breakfasts in Doubletrees are never a great experience, but here it was embarrassing: small choice at high prices; all being catered; in a cold and windy yard... Better pick any of the bakeries around the hotel!

The room on 24th floor had a terrace with view on Empire State Building - wow!

Else it was shabby, eg the mattress was too small for the frame and dangerous metal pieces jutted out (and we hurt ourselves well enough). Balcony door didn’t properly close and it was cooling down fast, when windy or rainy.

For amenities, personnel had to be reminded nearly daily to replenish.

Despite it’s great location, the hotel is a disappointing experience for the typical high prices in this area.

title: Wasn't an enjoyable experience
text:
We have stayed at quite a few Doubletree hotels and have mostly enjoyed them. This was not the case for this hotel.

We arrived at 10pm after a 24+ hr flight, one of our rooms were available, the other room we were told was unavailable for the night. We were sent to another room to spend the our first night. We dropped our bags off and went to get some food. We got back to the room at 11:30pm and discovered that our room for 3 only had 1 bed and the sofa bed had not been unpacked or had sheets on it. I called down to the front desk to ask them for assistance, they told me that it would be a while before they could do anything given the time. At 1am and after a few more calls, a knock on the door occurred and a plastic bag with sheets and a towel was left at the door. I made my own bed and had a shower after the long flight and went to bed pretty angry. Given they knew, we were coming as a room of 3 and they knew we were staying in this room for the night, I don't understand why it wasn't prepared properly.

The next morning, I went to the front desk to inform the staff, that the actions of the night before were pretty pitiful. They informed me that the night staff are apparently not allowed in the room as it may disturb those sleeping, I responded that nobody was sleeping as we didn't have a bed made to sleep in. No resolution came from this. 

That day the elevator broke, leaving a long line for the one remaining elevator, taking 30 mins to get to our floor. The management engaged the manual override only allowing elevator to go up and not pick people up coming down. We were told to take the stairs, which was impossible as one of our party  needs a walking stick and isn't able to use the stairs. The elevator also doesn't return to the lobby after it is finished, meaning it took a long time to ever use it.

After the one night in the spare room, we were told to leave our luggage in our room and someone would move it to our new room during the day. We arrived back at the hotel at around 5pm and were told our room was still not ready and they had collected the keys to our old room, meaning we were roomless. We found our luggage sitting unattended on the floor our new room was going to be on. I was very angry that our luggage was left unattended in the hallway. The management apologised. 

Once we were in our room for the next 7 nights, we had three instances of only receiving two towels instead of three and had to call up for it to be corrected. In addition, on another day, the housekeeping just left the empty roll of toilet paper on the holder without replacing it. I went to the front desk to ask for another roll as it didn't make sense why it was not replaced. The lady told me that they sometimes leave spare rolls under the TV. This made no sense as the TV is not near the bathroom. She told me that I should check their before requesting toilet paper. I said to just send me toilet paper regardless, I did check under the TV and there was no toilet paper there, so I don't know what she was talking about. 

The rooms were very small and didn't comfortably fit three adults with luggage. The bathroom was standard, we didn't have a drain filter or plug for the shower/bath. The shower was also leaking. 

The breakfast wasn't worth the price, the options for food were very small. 

I won't be staying here again.

title: Will stay again
text: All of the staff members that I came into contact with were friendly and accommodating. The rooms were clean and the beds were very comfortable. The location was a perfect one for us.  If you're planning on driving there, the parking rates are affordable.

title: Bene ma da migliorare
text: Per quello che ho speso è stato perfetto. Unica pecca il sistema di climatizzazione troppo rumoroso e poco confortevole. Posizione perfetta. Camera piccola ma con letto king e molti cassetti. Bar e parti comuni da migliorare

title: Bon rapport qualité - prix
text: Hôtel bien situé, proche de tout (métro, attractions, commerces), chambres petites mais propres, petit déjeuner classique, ... Internet de bonne qualité, personnel avenant avec des hauts et des bas en ce qui concerne le service. Mais généralement positif.

title: Great stay with a short walk from Times Square
text: Recently renovated, the Double Tree in Chelsea was great. Fresh interior and comfy appointments. A short walk to Broadway theatres and Times Square (15 blocks) and the Empire State Building (5 block). Fun little bar a few doors down with real pinball machines, good mishmash of music, and a great beverage selection.

title: A hidden gem.
text: The Hillton Doubltree-Chelsea is a hidden gem.  Although the front entrance is a bit dark and cluttered, once you step inside the hotel it is neat, clean and up-to-date.  Staff is was very helpful and friendly.

title: Great place to stay
text: Great stay! The hotel was near the train station I needed to be near, easy walking to many areas, lots of close by places to dine. the room was quiet, never heard a horn honk or siren wail all night!!

title: Great once again!
text: I have stayed  at this hotel quite a few times over the last four or five years. Each time my experience is even better than the last! In addition to the hotel being centrally located, neat and clean,  and recently renovated – actually just a couple of months before my most recent visit - it is all about the people! The staff truly makes you feel like you are at your home away from home and they go out of their way to anticipate your every need. While everyone is great, I want  to call special attention to Duane’. He has been with the hotel for a number of years and is an outstanding professional. He is at the heart of the welcoming and caring nature of this hotel. Thank you Duane and thank you all! I will definitely be back soon.

title: OK Rooms
text: Coming from Australia we found the rooms a little on the small size, and expensive for what you got, but that's New York!  Don't be afraid to ask for a fridge and/or some firm pillows.  They happily supplied both.

title: Small room but service was great
text:
As is typical of NYC, our room was teeny for 4 people, although I was very happy with the service. We arrived early and were able to check in since there was a room available for us. The front desk service was friendly and responsive.
The location of this hotel is great. Very close to the Empire State building/Herald Square/ Penn Station.

title: No space!
text: The rooms are extremely small, even by NY standards, for the price. Only two elevators service 26 floors plus staff. One elevator broke down during our stay.  The lobby became a mad house, overcrowded.

title: Early check-out due to noisy and people smoking !
text:
Checked-in for 6 nights,  had to leave after the first night due to drunk people, partying and smoking in the room the entire night.
Informed the reception at 5 in thé morning and the hotel charged us USD 300 for early check-out ! What a joke !! 
Unfriendly, helpless and without empathy reception staff.
Didn't even consider not to charge the 300 dollars.
DO NOT GO THERE !!
Better hotels located next street !

title: Stay Away - Truly Psycho Staff
text:
We stayed here twice in 10 days. The first time went ok, and while the room itself is fine, the 2nd time was awful!

Upon trying to check in two staff members began arguing with each other over our room. After an hour or so waiting, they offered us two room instead of of my booked one room suite. We said ok, but after another hour waiting, we got the key to the suite? Thinking all is fine the next morning, they pulled us aside to charge for the 2nd room; the one they offered us complimentary and we never used! Needless to say we simply left.

Oh and the 2 super small elevators are way under capacity for the size of the hotel; forget using them with luggage carts - or even getting your entire family in at once.

title: Christmas 2018
text: Great location and even better staff. Small rooms, which are to be expected in Manhattan, but comfortable nonetheless. They held luggage both before check in and after check out, and the process was quick and reliable.  And of utmost importance, the cookies are delicious.

title: Double Tree Chelsea
text: Mala experiencia, cuarto sucio, colchón horrible, tubería del baño sucio, la calefacción muy ruidosa, no nos dieron solución al problema y no quisieron reembolsar el pago y tuvimos que buscar otro hotel.

title: Average room in average hotel
text: We were excited to find the penthouse suite available at a decent price over Christmas.  The view from the room was stunning, the room large, and the bed comfortable.  However, there was only a desk chair to sit on other than the bed.  It was too chilly to sit (or grab a chair from) the balcony.  The hotel lobby is small and gets quickly full of people waiting for rooms to be ready.  The outside is under renovation, leaving 4 plastic chairs lined in a row where people smoke, making the walk into and out of the hotel one full of the small of cigarettes.  The location is good.  Easy to walk everywhere in Manhatten.

title: Good location, shame about the interior
text:
Location is good if you want to be near enough to Times Square and shopping district. A lot of stuff happens round here but you don’t get the noise from Times Square and lights.
-Cleaners didn’t hoover the floor even after we mentioned it
-Room was really cold because the heater released cold air all the time even when you turn it on, dust comes out of it also.
-The interior is highly dated for a Hilton, not what we expected in comparison to others we have stayed in before.
-In the bathroom there were electrical sockets right behind the tap which is a huge hazard.
-There are 2 extremely slow lifts in the whole hotel which don’t have enough room to swing a cat in. So it takes ages to get down to the lobby or your room.
-Waste bags are left on the street outside the property and there was an occasion of someone going through the hotel rubbish on one day.
-Beds are extremely soft! So if you need a firm bed for back reasons do not stay here.

title: Very good stay, great location, clean
text:
I am a long-time Hilton Honors member and use points and cash to book over Christmas. For what we wanted, a clean room with comfortable bed, good shower, good location, this was perfect. Situated just 1-2 blocks from both the QRNW and 1,2,3 trains,
you can get anywhere in the city. Close to everything, from Times Square and the Theater District, to east and Greenwich Village, yet quieter, it’s the perfect location. Restaurant is good for breakfast, and there is a small bar. If you expect to be out and about in the city, and not interested in staying one location, it’s a great place. Nothing fancy, just what we needed.

title: What an unwelcome welcome
text:
Should be a no-brainer - give weary travelers a decent welcome. But no, an officious welcome, which gave the clear message 'this place is run for the convenience of staff, not that of guests'. 

Just a downright rude, unpleasant check-in experience. Today 23rd December

Not what I expect as diamond hhonors member, and well below what should be expected from the brand.

Avoid.

title: Hotel is below par for a Hilton/Doubletree property
text: The hotel is below par, the quality of the service within the room is poor.  We had to call to have our toilet repaired upon checking in, first morning in the room we had to call to have maintenance  fix the shower as it was broken.  The water situation is well documented, showers are luke warm.  Pain on the ceiling was chipped throughout the room and falling off.  One elevator was broken for a portion of the stay.  As a Diamond level member I filed a compliant, and the response from the staff was "what would you like us to do".  When you have to tell them how to resolve an issue, that is the issue.  I stay at hilton properties every week, the staff did nothing to resolve the issues.

title: Web Site Said 'in final stages of remodeling"
text:
My wife and I decided to take our first trip to the Big Apple together to celebrate her birthday We choose the Chelsea DT for the close proximity to everything we wanted to get done while in the city. 

Day 1: From the start, things looked like they were not going to go well. The entire front courtyard was full of items under tarps and very limited sitting, mostly just a smoking area. If you're not a smoker, you know that you'll have no desire to sit have a drink right next to a bunch of smokers. When we went to check in, the lobby was closed in due to the remodeling down to the size of a NYC one bedroom apartment. Imagine 6 or 7 people checking in and being almost shoulder to shoulder. When I got to the desk, I was informed that the higher level room was not available due to the current guest staying over an extra day. I asked to insure that what ever room I did have, would have a view of the Empire State Bldg. From the 16th floor, I could see the spire and a little below. Also when we arrived in our room, the Champaign and cheese and fruit tray were not in the room. After we had settled into the room, I went down stairs to inquire about the view and extra service items that I had paid for. As far as the room I was limited to that room due to the NYU graduation and the hotel was booked to capacity. The extra service items apparently were not in the booking, but when they made a call, there seemed to be a glitch but they were ready to make it good. They asked when I would like the it delivered to the room, I informed them we were going out to dinner and watch a band but would be back around 11:00pm so please have it there before then. The night out in the city was great until we returned. No service was delivered to the room and the kitchen never prepared the platter. 

Day 2: I'm an early riser so let my wife sleep in and headed down for breakfast, read the paper and just chill out before we got our day started. when I finished up and was headed up to the room, I thought make shift breakfast in bed would be nice. Well forget that, they would not allow me to take anything up because that would then be considered room service, really! Before I went up, I asked about the platter and bottle service that was not delivered. they thought that it had been delivered, well I guess that miscommunication is allowable and I asked that it be delivered that evening. I talked to the GM about our lack of view as was told if I wanted, they would take our things up to a higher floor. My wife was just not ready to re-pack for a move. I asked for a reduction in rate due to their lack of availability and was only offered honor points. 

When we went to head out for the day, I also found out that the parking was not included in our bill. That it was a guest rate with their 3rd party vendor. I believe that things like this that are considered extra charges should be spelled out in the booking on the Hilton website. 

when we returned, you guessed it not service platter and bottle in the room for the second day. On our way out the door headed to a show on Broadway, I notified them that the service had still not been delivered and to please have it in the room by that evening upon our return. well you guess it again, when we returned, nothing in the room. I went down to see what the issue was  and they had no excuse this time. they offered just a bottle of wine and fruit basket haphazardly put together. I declined just because I found it very insulting to not get what we paid for. 

Day 3: After a long day the prior day, we slept in and made sure this time to get downstairs with my wife so she could get breakfast. it was about 1 hour before that were wrapping up breakfast, but what and issue. We had to ask for items that were either not replenished or were Luke warm at best not the breakfast bar. My wife gave up and just had scraps of the mixed fruit, cereal and toast. When we addressed the platter and bottle issue for the third time, all they said was they were going to give us more honor point, I guess they just gave up at that point. the remainder of our stay was uneventful but after all that had happened, I just can't imagine that we'll return to that Hilton property. the entire visit with DT Chelsea can be summed in one phrase. "over promised and under delivered"

title: Muy buena opcion
text: Una reunión excelente opción y experiencia con habitaciones pequeñas pero muy acogedoras con todos los servicios y una hubicacion conveniente muy cerca de time square y al centro de Manhattan con diferentes accesos

title: Great location
text: The Doubletree is located near Madison Square Gardens and Times Square (both a short walk). The rooms are super clean, albeit super small (although I'm told that's a normal size for NYCity). The beds were super comfortable! There is a great bagel shop just a short walk called Friedmans that is highly recommended too. We would definitely stay here again because of the ease to everything that is fun to see in NY. The valet service was super easy both with checking in and out!

title: Dovolenka
text: Páčil sa mi hotel, personál, raňajky, slnkom zaliata izba, pohodlná posteľ povlecená novým prádlom, celková čistota čo tam snáď chýbalo bol fén na vlasy. Tiež sa nachádza super v pešej zóne tak že všetko na blízku určite sa tam v budúcnosti vrátim. RUŽENA

title: Better places with valet
text: The penthouse is the only reason to stay, and it’s only that because of the balcony and the slightly larger room.  I hate that there’s no valet here and there’s no water every 2 mins so good luck with that.  They seemed unphased when I reported it so I guess it’s normal.   I wouldn’t stay here if it wasn’t for the 2701 room.

title: Not the freshest looking but good hotel
text:
I prefer the Double Tree Metropolitan compared to this one, as the overall perception is not very fresh and modern. The elevators are old such as most of the building interiors. Besides this, the hotel is very strategically situated in mid town. The staff is friendly and all Double Tree by Hilton comfort is present.
The bar isn’t very cozy but it does the job, just as the breakfast room.
It’s an ok hotel.

title: Très bon emplacement, chambres un peu vieillottes
text: Bon séjour dans cet hôtel qui bénéficie d'un très bon emplacement permettant de faire (presque) tout à pied. Le personnel est agréable et à l'écoute mais les chambres sont un peu vieillottes (déco, chauffage, etc.).

title: The Best Hotel I've stayed at in a long time.
text: Loved this Doubletree!  The staff was exceptional.  Our flight arrived early in the morning well before check in time.  The front desk held our bags and called me when my rooms were ready a couple hours ahead of check in time.  My kids went to the front desk multiple times for warm cookies. They were all so courtesy and friendly during a busy Thanksgiving holiday.

title: AMAZING Staff, Excellent Location
text:
I was really pleasantly surprised by my stay here. The rate was affordable, especially around Thanksgiving. It’s in a really good location, which you can see from looking at a map, but it doesn’t quite sink in how great a location it is until you’re there and walking it. 

The hotel is dog friendly and the per stay fee is $50. PER STAY! What a bargain! There’s also a park across the street that makes for a great spot to walk your pet if you’re traveling together.

The rooms are dated, but very clean and efficient. The mirror in my room’s bathroom badly needed to be replaced, but that’s really my only complaint... which isn’t really a complaint, more an observation. The bed and pillows are like clouds. Thoroughly enjoyed sinking into it every night. I was right by the elevator, but had no issue with noise. 

I’ve saved the best for last... the staff at this hotel. ALL of the staff, every single shift, were INCREDIBLE. They are so kind and friendly without being overbearing. It was truly a joy to interact with them. They were absolutely wonderful and I really can’t say enough nice things about them!

I would definitely stay here again, primarily because of the service I received.

title: Great hotel close to Penn Station
text: Stayed at Doubletree for a quick overnight trip in NYC. Close to everything and quick walk to and from Penn Station.  Very comfy bed and great view of the Empire State Building. Would definitely stay here again

title: Ottimo hotel in una posizione perfetta
text: Hotel ottimo, vicino al medison square garden e a pochi passi da Times Square. Ottimo servizio, personale cordiale e attento alle esigenze! Se devo trovare un’unica piccola pecca, la stanza era poco insonorizzata, non tra camera e camera ma tra porta e corridoio. Se la gente in corridoio parlava ad alta voce si sentiva tutto! Per il resto ottimo, consigliatissimo!

title: Great staff, great location.
text: The hotel exceeded our expectations. The location was great. Two subway lines were nearby. The only drawback was the room size. The room was small, like many hotel rooms in NYC. There were just two of us. I’m not sure 3 would have been comfortable in the room for long. However, the room was nice and clean.

title: En el lobby te reciben con amabilidad, galletas y agua de sabor!
text: La ubicacion es excelente, muy cerca de dos estaciones de subway (Penn Station y 28th). Las habitaciones no son muy grandes (como la mayoria en Nueva York) pero son muy limpias y comodas. El staff te recibe increiblemente son muy amables y atentos ademas te regalan galletas y agua de sabor en el lobby.

title: Welcomed like we were old friends!!
text: I want to take the time to acknowledge Michael at the front desk. He was very polite and courteous. He took the time to explain the area for us and give us directions and some really great food suggestions. He made us feel very welcome so far away from home. Thanks Michael!!!

title: Be prepared for a small room
text:
i spent four nights at this hotel this past week.

The hotel is nice but be prepared for a very small room with an even smaller bathroom. 

There is a minimal amount of shelf and vanity space in the bathroom and you will need to close the door in order to even brush your teeth. 

The location is very good, centrally located on 19th Street .  

Also, the restaurant down stairs was fine for breakfast, you don't only have to order from the Buffet, i ordered an omelet on morning , over easy eggs another morning and pancakes the last morning. All were very good.

title: Great 1st impression by DoubleTree by Hilton!
text: I had a positive experience staying at this Doubletree Hotel Chelsea - New York City on 11/9/2018. At check-in, you get a warm chocolate chip cookie!The Miso Ramen soup was very good made with fresh ingredients!

title: Very Nice Small NY Room
text: Family of 4 stayed in room 2504 and had a view of Empire State bldg. Beds were comfortable, everything was clean and nice to look at. Staff were very nice and accommodating of our needs.  Room was tight for 4 adult sized people, but not atypical for Lower Manhattan.

title: Elton John Concert!
text: We stayed here so we could see Elton John in concert at Madison Square Garden. It was a three minute walk (2 1/2 blocks away)! So convenient! We parked our car for the weekend and did not have to use it again, which is always a bonus in New York city!!

title: Update review with two-rooms suite
text:
I have just wanted to share photos of their suites after a four nights stay.  The two-room suites are decent with a nice living room area.  The new room come with additional power outlets by the bed and by the desk.  However the problems remain with the tiny closet despite having space for at least one more closet, and the strange location of the bathrooms by the entrance of the room, and the small sink area. 

The hotel is still under renovation and the service remains cordial but mostly indifferent.  
Locations are good but if the service is better, I will book here more often.  I also want to point out the elevator situation, which remains unsatisfactory.  On a busy Sunday night, it took four elevator going by before stepping in.

title: Very nice stay
text: Stayed here as we went to an event at MSG.  Very nice and accommodating staff. As a Hilton member we received a free upgrade without asking and a late checkout. Very clean and comfortable. Excellent location. Close to MSG and lots of shopping. All walking. Rooms are small but lots of places are small in New York unless you are in Times Square.

title: New York City marathon
text: Great location!  Mattress was old and I rolled to the middle. Staff very friendly and helpful. Cleanliness was fair. We enjoyed our stay and I would recommend this hotel to my friends and family. Thanks for a nice stay.

title: Très bien
text: J’y ai séjourné du 26 Octobre au 4 novembre dans le cadre du mariage d’un couple d’amis et tourisme. Hôtel très bien placé. Chambre petite (courant à NY) mais propre, silencieuse et bien équipée. Wifi au top. Vue sur l’Empire State Building. Je n’ai pas mangé à l’hôtel donc je ne peux parler des repas. Il y a plein de Deli Gourmet autour donc nikel pour petit déjeuner et déjeuner par cher ! Pour avoir visité les hôtels de mes amis ... je le recommande ! Vue depuis la chambre en photo !

title: Great find on the run!
text:
We booked this hotel last minute while in New York for the marathon. We originally stayed in Brooklyn but wanted to be in the city for our last night to be closer to LaGuardia Airport. This place is on a busy street in Manhattan with PLENTY of food options within a block or two.2 blocks from the NJ transit center as well as the subway entrance. The rooms were clean and comfortable and the staff was very friendly at all times of the day/night. 
Big shout out to Duane W., the porter on duty during our stay. I stayed in the lobby for an hour waiting to go to the airport and I observed him being extremely hospitable and kind to everyone he came in contact with. Not normally typical for what I expect in New York. He even helped us with a celebrity sighting 😍 Thabks Duane!

title: Hotel undergoing improvements
text: I wish we knew the hotel was undergoing renovation before booking as this information was not made available on Expedia or Hilton website. We only learnt about it from the information board in front of the lift when we arrived. Carpets looked dusty in lobby and hallways, there were pieces of old furniture in front of the hotel for the duration of our stay, wall paper was peeling next to the lift. Room was cleaned well, but decor looked very eighties, veneered furniture, brown wall paper and old stained carpet, mold on tiles' grout in the bathroom. The hotel is on a very rundown street as well. The highlight were super service from staff and the walking distance to the major attractions.

title: Great location but disappointing hotel
text: Room was small and not very clean.  We got a handicapped room with a double bed even though we reserved a king.  We were told that we’d have to change rooms the next day if we wanted a different room.  Hotel had few amenities.  It was however, only 2 blocks from Madison Square Garden so it was really easy to get to the NBA game we had come to NY for.   Best feature of this hotel is its location.

title: Bra läge och god frukost
text:
Vid vår första vistelse i NYC blev vi positivt överraskade av hur fräscht det var på hotellet.
Vi uppskattade närheten till Subway och att det va gångavstånd till så många sevärdheter. I receptionen fick vi bra tips om bra restauranger.

title: Tiny Room , even for NYC
text: For the price I paid (over $400 a night) I expected more. The room was tiny. The lobby was tiny. The 2 people at the reception desk were always busy with the phone/computer. the elevators were slow and often busy. the street wasn't very friendly at night, unlike many other streets in the neighborhood. there was a nice view of the empire state building at an angle.

title: Great experience in New York.
text: Very satisfied with my experience at the Doubletree Hotel in Chelsea. Room comfortable,  staff very friendly & efficient and location good & near transportation & great coffee shops.  As a single, senior female I felt very comfortable  & safe.

title: SingleTree for sure
text: This was a very non-Doubletree hotel. Room was extremely small and smelly. The bathroom was nothing to rave about. In fact, the taps gave out only boiling hot water or freezing cold water. Nothing in between. The breakfast menu was also blah. Again, not very DoubleTree like, that generally has a very large spread. The floor hallways were noisy, and I couldn't sleep at night.

title: Great place to stay
text: We really enjoyed our recent visit. The location is great with many places within walking distance. The room size was ideal for the two of us. We had a full tub in the bathroom, lots of outlets for electronics, room for our open suitcases. Easy access to the elevators. The cookies were awesome!

title: Very disappointed by the property and its management
text: This hotel provided me with the worst experience of all my NYC stays ever. There was a lot of construction work ongoing and the elevators were crowded, this is understandable and not a big issue. The room condition was more of an issue. See pictures. I talked to the manager, Natasha, and she promised me to fix it and deposit some points on my account. The housekeeping staff visited my room as well to discuss the issues. Nothing happened since. The points were never deposited and there was no follow up. Also, the welcome points I accepted instead of free breakfast were never deposited to my account.

title: Friendly people make the difference
text: I’ve been staying here for about six years now. I think it’s a great place for people who have to be here regularly. Convenient to Penn station.The facility itself is newly renovated and fine for New York. It's really all about the people who work here. Someone said to me this morning that it must come from the top because the staff is so consistently friendly. Not officious or pretentious; just comfortable, friendly and nice. (You be nice too; why not ;-) Give yourself a little extra time at the elevator. Neighborhood has everything you need just outside of the tourist zones. Koreatown is around the corner. Biricchino and Ocabanon for Italian and French down the street. Kean’s for the best steak in town.

title: Room for show
text: It’s been at least two years since I’ve visited New York. We had tickets for a performer at the Highline Ballroom and I was looking for accommodations that were close by. I typically stay in the Penn station locale but this location seemed better. The staff were very friendly and provided good insight to the area. The room was fairly quite and clean although there was a stain on the carpet. We had driven 3.5 hrs to get to NY and after the drive we were hungry, tired and looking for some lunch. The restaurant was small and uninviting but the food was good. Overall it was a pleasant experience.

title: Perfect location and great staff
text:
Stayed here for our girl's weekend in NYC. Perfect location because we were within a 25 minute walk to Times Square, NYU, East Village, etc. Great restaurants and vibe makes you feel like a local. (Stop at the store on the corner for a bagel and coffee and walk walk walk!)
The staff was incredible! Thanks to everyone involved.

title: Excellent hotel.
text: I had the pleasure of staying at the Doubletree Chelsea on October 18. I am a Hilton honors gold member and was treated as such.Michael went out of his way to make my stay enjoyable and he did.If I am in the area or going to a concert at Madison Square Garden, I will definitely stay there again. The entire staff was friendly and helpful.

title: Location is decent but the hotel needs to finish their rehab
text:
+ At first brush the location seems awkward but actually provides a nice intermediate point to head in all directions
+ Decent value by Manhattan standards
+ Access to good selection of F&B nearby
- The restaurant is basically not a restaurant, almost feels like a cafeteria
- Rooms are slightly tired
- Lobby is tight
- Construction going on

title: Great location!
text: The hotel is convenient to amtrak (Penn Station) and subway.  Everyone at the hotel was very welcoming, kind and helpful. Room was nice and clean.  Had a great trip and would definitely stay here again.

title: Comodidad, gran ubicación y unas galletas para morirse!
text:
Nos hospedamos allí, básicamente por su precio y ubicación. La habitación era pequeña (dos camas matrimoniales bastante pegadas, un escritorio y un baño cómodo con bañadera), pero logramos tener una vista parcial hacia el Empire State que nos alegró todas las noches.
Nuestro desayuno constaba de las galletas que podés pedir para llevar. Son unas cookies de avena, chispas de chocolate y nuez que te hacen perder la cabeza (y encontrar unos quilitos de más). Con eso bajo el brazo, salís a recorrer la ciudad.
EL hotel está a una cuadra del metro, y entre las avenidas 5ta y 6ta. Ideales para caminar, ir y venir.

title: Polite staff but very odd location
text: The staff was very warming, Not much explaining of the hotel or amenities but I will say they were very welcoming and polite. The lobby is tiny and there was a lot of people always, elevators at checkout times were horrible packed (would pass by my floor about 3 times I would have to jump on the up to eventually go down) the lobby and bar and restaurant do not look at all like the pictures here so that is very annoying rooms are very small ALL not like the pictures at all. That’s very misleading.

title: Close to everything
text: Great location for midtown to the Village sight seeing on foot. Nice view of the Empire State Building. Comfortable bed. Room a bit tight but adequate. Friendly and helpful staff. Some traffic noise, but then it is New York!

title: Stay Far Away
text:
I am a frequent traveler, and Hilton Diamond member, and I stay in hotels frequently and I have never posted a review. This stay was so beyond horrible that I must provide details to people out there.
1. They did not have sheets, it was a dirty comforter only 
2. They do not have duvet covers like other Hiltons, this was just a dirty comforter.
3. The water did not work, it was Hot Water only in the room, which meant it would burn your skin. - No showers.
4. Gross visible white goopy stains on the carpet.
5. Customer Service was polite but ineffective.

I reviewed these items with the front desk, and they told me they would fix them. My second day nothing was fixed, and they said "sorry, it should have gotten fixed". They had no open rooms to move me, it was horrible.

This hotel disgraces the Hilton name, stay away.

title: Avoid This Property
text: Hotel is small and overpriced, even for New York. Renovations in progress which made several amenities (e.g., business center) unavailable to guests. The restaurant was disappointing, to say the least.

title: Smooth and Comfortable
text: The check-in process was smooth & the valet parking was well worth it. Our room was on the smaller side but it was clean & comfortable. Fitness center was lackluster but, oh well. It was a 1-nite stay.

title: Great location. Near MSG
text: This is a great location near penn station and MSG. Take the train from EWR to penn station and walk 3 blocks to the hotel.  Food and bar on site. Only knock is 2 elevators and can be slow when staying on a high floor.

title: Great Base for an NYC Adventure
text:
Excellent location in midtown between 6th & 7th Avenue. Just a 10-15 minute walk to Times Square, Macy’s, Empire State, 5th Avenue etc. so we ended up seeing a lot of these amazing places during our trip. 

Clean with friendly, helpful staff and decent beds so it was perfect for us. We didn’t want or need anything else from the hotel as it’s just not that type of holiday.

Got a room with 2 double beds and a view of the Empire State which was great.

Subway station is at the end of the block (2-3 minute walk). I’d recommend downloading an app to help navigate (there’s a few good ones to choose from) as I found it more confusing than the underground in London for more complex journeys - simple uptown / downtown journeys are really easy though.

I’d definitely stay at the hotel again.

title: NYC - Doubletree
text: In Chelsea for a wedding. The Doubletree was comfortable and convenient. Reasonable price for Manhattan. There was a renovation going on but did not affect the stay at all. Staff was very friendly and helpful...

title: Kudos to Doubletree Hotel
text: The staff at the Doubletree Hotel was extremely courteous and actually fun to be around.  The room was exceptionally clean and pleasant.  The amenities available were impressive. Overall, my experience was very positive.

title: Solid property
text: Returned for another stay here, always a food experience. Location cannot be beat (close to Penn Station and transportation/Chelsea and Times Square). Lobby is in the middle of a remodel, but not really an issue. Check in was a tad slow, both agents were busy typing on the computer and took a few minutes for either to even look up and acknowledge us. We were early, bags stowed and off to explore. We received a call a couple hours later (around noon) that our room was ready, very nice! Room is as expected-small but functional with many outlets, a safe and a very comfortable bed. Bathroom is small, but includes everything you would need. included wifi is easy to connect to and fast. Great place to stay, just wish they could move all the laundry carts that line the entrance to the hotel, not what you want to see upon entering

title: Over priced and average at best
text:
Pros
- decent location 
- free WiFi is relatively fast
- nice size TV with a ton of channels
- bed was comfortable 

Cons
- expensive for what you get 
- water pressure in shower fluctuates as you shower from strong to weak
- there are only 2 elevators and they are extremely slow. I literally waited 8 minutes staying on the 24th floor
- pillows are flat and not supportive. Very cheap.

title: Small rooms, not friendly
text: My room was small, I really needed breakfast on my first day. It didn't arrive because no one picked up the card. If you want to be a number in a hotel chain, you're welcome to go. I'll find somewhere else to stay on my next trip.

title: overall very good
text: Excellent rooms, but annoying to have to change room the day after arrival due to ongoing renovation. Also took a long time to get our room on arrival, at 1.30AM, we were very tired and just wanted to get to our room. Aside from that, great place.

title: Really Good Deal
text: I never stayed here before but was really pleasantly surprised. My daughter lives in the West Village so I was relatively close to her & only a block & a half from where the bus left us off from Bethesda (DC area). It was quiet & clean which are really important to me.

title: Comfortable, but....
text: There are always fatal issues with elevator. There is no service elevator so staff often uses it, stops it, then there is only one elevator, 90% of the time too full to enter, especially with bags. I have to also add I kissed an appointment due to a 20 minute wait for the elevator. Not acceptable.

title: Avoid
text:
This hotel is under major renovation but we were not advised of this prior to our arrival.If we had been made aware of this we would NOT of stayed.
The outside resembled a dumping ground with dirty plastic chairs amongst building materials,fixtures and fittings.The lobby was partly closed and  boarded and taped off. When entering we walked through dust and building rubble and dodged work men.
There were no pleasant communal seating areas and the restaurant and bar did not resemble any of the hotel images .The room also had an unpleasant smell and the carpets throughout were dirty. This was not a cheap hotel stay and the whole experience was hugely disappointing.
I would not recommend!

title: excellent location
text: We have been to the hotel during its renovations and had no trouble at all. We didn't hear any noise, since we got out of the room every morning and only returned in the evening. We first recieved a room at the 3rd floor which was very noisy because it was above the AC engines of the entire hotel, so we asked the next morning to replace it and the staff was helpful and did it for us while we were out touring the city.There are many restaurants and cafes nearby. The nearest subway station is half a block away and we felt safe walking around at night with our daughter.

title: 非常方便的地點
text: 非常方便的地點，距離Penn station 走路就可以到的距離，離帝國大廈、時代廣場和百老匯都不遠,服務人員非常貼心，非常好的住宿體驗

title: Under renovation!!!
text: Try to avoid it until reno ia completely done. Location is good! But there was only one elevator working being used by everyone (moving company housekeeping workers). No service door so everything all the debris are decorating the front of the building. The staff seemed not to care about all the inconveniences for the guests.

title: Hilton does not care for ther guests
text: This trip was highly disappointing.  Two of the nights there was construction going on during sleeping hours after midnight and it was very noisy.
