After working 18 hours I wanted to come back to my room and sleep not hear hammering at 2AM and beyond.  There should have been no guests on the 2nd floor of the hotel if you are doing construction during sleeping hours.  I feel the management and Doubletree did not care about their guests.  Offering me ear plugs as a solution was highly insulting.  I paid a high price for that room, and all I wanted was a good night sleep.  I did not get it two of the nights I was there.  This left a bad taste in my mouth in regards to Doubletree and Hilton and I feel they do not value their customers.

title: Fun in NYC
text: Excellent central location!  Our room had a great view... We were close to the subway to check out the faraway sites, but close enough to walk to plenty of downtown stuff.  They're doing some renovating right now.

title: Construction was a hassle
text: The construction will not be done until end of Sept.  It was noisy at night and messy in lobby.  Breakfast did not serve many healthy options.  Maybe this hotel will be better after the construction is done.

title: Great staff, great penthouse views!
text: This place was undergoing construction when I was there and the staff was handling situations with other irritated guests very well. Can’t wait to stay again after the renovation! Food is good. Rooms are clean. Penthouse is awesome!Staff is AMAZING!

title: Mala experiencia en una gran ciudad.....
text: Mala zona, mal hotel. Hotel en reparación. Personal indiferente: no encontraban mi reserva y mucho menos mi pedido de up grade. Olor a humedad en las alfombras de la habitación. Precio carísimo para la oferta del hotel. Definitivamente no volvería.

title: Location, Location, Location
text: You can't beat the location of this hotel. It is close to everything and everywhere. The subway is just around the corner, Macy's yes that Macy's is a short walk away.The room which was a bit small was clean and well appointed. One of my gripes with it is that even though there were two of us in the room they consistently left only one wash cloth.The second gripe is breakfast. Continental Breakfast! We did not pay for breakfast as part of our accommodation because we wanted to explore the city, but the first and only morning we went there it cost us $53 for two. We could have gone around the corner and eat like a King & Queen for that much. So beware of the breakfast. Eat out.

title: Do NOT stay at this hotel
text: Stayed with wedding party at this hotel for 4 nights. Hotel is under major construction. Housekeeping and construction workers use main elevator meaning you wait up to 25 mins for the elevator or stop on every floor while packed like sardines inside. I was on the 23rd floor so it was a hassle coming or going from your room. Rooms are approx. 24'x12' and with 2 double beds, only one person can move in room while other sits on bed or stands in corner. Closet measures 12"x12" with rod going from front to back instead of side to side. You have to empty closet each time you want to get your clothes.  The main lobby has one small bench for seating, otherwise, you stand in the 10x10 space or escape outside. The outdoor terrace is on the street with half of it piled with dirty laundry and the other half with construction materials. There are 5 dirty plastic chairs lined up against the building that you can sit -behind the dirty laundry carts. The bellman is extremely helpful and insistent in getting you a cab-BEWARE- once you arrive at your destination the driver quotes some outrageous fare. Took me from hotel to JFK morning of departure (17.1 miles) and said fare was $90.00- fare for cab to hotel was $46.00. He reduced to $82.50 after I complained. I have since disputed with my credit card company and having charge reversed.  Get your own cab or uber and save yourself some money.  The restaurant/bar looks like a garage with cheap tables and chairs for dining and the bar (same as dining room) consists of liquor rolled in on a cart  and the bartender turning on a radio full blast.  The only positives from the entire stay were the front desk, maintenance, and housekeeping staffs.

title: Mediocrity
text: I reserved my room on the internet about two or three weeks in advamce. The website specifically asked me if a room with a good view was important to me. I said yes it was. I want the room with the view! I would have paid extra. They ignored or miscomminicated that and gave me a room with a view of a brick wall. Why promise a nice view to a customer if you can't come through? Renovations were ongoing when I stayed. It was quiet but the lobby was a bit messy. Service was ok. Wifi was ok. Bed was ok. Water pressure can strip paint. My only complaint was the view. Staying in the heart of New York City, with engineering marvels and magnificent architecture all around, and they gave me a view of a brick wall. I was so disappointed that I won't ever stay there again.

title: Central location and great value
text: Great centrally located hotel with amazing staff. Only complaint was they continually didn't leave hand towels in the room after cleaning it. Other than that, it exceeded my expectations. Also the hotel is close to the subway, time-square and Madison square garden.

title: Don't stay here until the construction is finished
text: The front of the hotel and lobby are under major construction that spills over into the guest area.  Add to this stinking garbage in the same area and you'll be glad to leave. The pictures of the new lobby look lovely, but wait until it's finished.

title: Penthouse with balcony and view
text:
One night stay in late August. Stayed in the penthouse with balcony. Room was very clean with average furnishings. The size was comfortable for 2 people, do not recommend a 3rd person, as you would need a rollaway bed and space would be tight. The hotel is being renovated and there is no lobby, bar or seating area. If this is important to you, do not stay here. This is not a luxury hotel. The tiny outdoor seating area off the lobby only had a few chairs, and was filled with construction supplies. I had requested early check in at 12 noon, which was not available. When we arrived the guy at the desk (Christopher?), immediately called housekeeping and asked that our room be expedited for cleaning. He was friendly and helpful. We left to walk the nearby High Line, and returned at 2PM to find our room ready. Only 2 rooms on the 27th floor penthouse level. It was a quiet oasis in the sky! What a view! We did not have any issues with waiting for the elevators.

Easy walking distance to MSG, Macys, High Line etc. Safe enough part of NYC. Great restaurants nearby. Discounted parking lot across the street. Treat someone you love to a night in NYC.

title: Satisfactory
text: I was made aware of the construction prior to booking. I needed a total of 5 bedrooms for last weekend and contacted Hilton directly. It was the only hotel that was available to accommodate my party. I made the booking and read the reviews before my stay and was worried.However, I was worried for no reason! The construction, although it was an eyesore, it did not affect my stay. The rooms were comfortable for my guests and I. It wasn't the best, but for the price I paid for, it was a great value.For the reviews I've read that complained that the rooms were small and expensive, it is NEW YORK CITY! Most hotels and the rooms are small and everything in the city is expensive! With my experience with other hotels in the NYC area, it was fine. If you are looking for a luxury hotel, then this is not the right hotel for you.My group was for 20 people and the staff was friendly and helpful to us all. The hotel was in walking distance to most places, which was very convenient. Only complaint I have would be the elevators. There were 2 small elevators that were really slow. The stairs were really for fire emergency, but I saw people and staff using the stairs anyways, since the elevators were so slow.

title: Great place to stay for MSG events
text: Just two blocks away from MSG and Macy’s. The hotel was friendly and helpful. The front desk was great with directions and professional. Love the cookies. Nice touch. At every turn the staff was friendly. Hotel lobby is under remodel. The room was excellent - clean, quiet, loved the safe, and steady hot water. Just a couple blocks from the subway. Highly recommended!

title: Hotel très bien situé, parfait !
text:
Hôtel très bien situé à 10 minutes de Time Square, madison square garden...
Vue sur l'empire state building ! 

 A côté :  station de métro, supermarchés, restaurants, pizzas à emporter pour 1$ (intéressant pour un voyage en famille)

Accueil : 

Agréable et souriant à tout heure, cookies à l'arrivée, café et journaux le matin, eau fraiche toute la journée.
Le dernier jour, on a déposé nos bagages à la conciergerie, afin de profiter de notre dernière journée.

Chambre :
 
Un peu juste pour quatre personnes, mais comme on y était juste pour dormir...
Très bien insonorisé, on se croyait seul dans l'hotel ! literie très confortable, machine à café, thé...eau fraiche et glaçons à l'étage.

Hôtel qui est en train d’être restauré entièrement, mais qui ne gêne en rien la clientèle.

Excellent rapport qualité/prix !

title: Great location in the city
text: We picked this location because it was close to Penn Station where we could catch the train in and out of the city. Close enough to walk to Times Square or Union Station... easy walking distance to subway. We really only spent time at the hotel to sleep at night. But TV was great. Having a fridge in our hotel room was an extra perk. The staff were friendly and attentive. I would stay here again.

title: Dump
text: Elevators not working, unable to get reservation I requested, restaurant was like a trailer park reception room, Under construction.  staff unapologetically stating "its out of our control"  Expensive for the conditions I had to tolerate.  No cancellation allowed on reservation

title: Small rooms - good location - nothing special though
text: No luxury here just a typical hotel found in every city in America but in Manhattan. Small rooms, super slow lifts, staff need to put a smile on and stop ignoring guests, but value and location balance all this back out.

title: Would not recommend staying at this location
text: The rooms here are incredibly small. You can not fit 4 adults in the room. Only enough room for really one adult. I would not recommend this location. Amenities at this location are not great. You really only get the bar/restaurant downstairs.

title: Good Location; Poor Hotel
text:
I booked in to stay at the Doubletree Chelsea for 10 nights in August 2018. The positives of the hotel is that it is very centrally located (more midtown than Chelsea, to be honest) and very close to the 28th street subway station. It has lots of restaurants and supermarkets around if you need anything as well.

But beyond this, I had numerous problems with my stay at this hotel:

1. Upon check-in, I was told the room level I booked was unavailable, because 'Expedia overbooks our hotel'. It seems unfair that their flawed arrangements with Expedia should impact upon guests, but there you go. I was given an 'upgrade' for just that night, then told I would have to move out of that room the next day once the price of room I had booked was available. I.e. a full check out then check in on my 2nd day of staying in the hotel. If that wasn't annoying enough, the next morning after packing up ALL my things and taking my suitcase to reception, I was told I could actually stay in the room I had been given. It would have been nice to get a call informing me of this before I went down at midday fully ready to check out then check back in.

2. When things arrived for me at the front desk, they always insisted I come down to get it and never offered for someone to take anything to my room.

3. The lifts are SO SLOW. There are two lifts for 27 or so floors, and I often would wait for 15 minutes for the lift only to see it was completely full then have to wait again. I often walked up the stairs instead of using the lift, even though I was on level 25.

4. My room was serviced only twice out of my 7 nights with the hotel. Multiple times I went down to reception requesting service, and no one ever came. I often did this in the morning ~10am, then left the entire day and came back to a still dirty room. 

3 nights before I was due to checkout, I left the hotel with a refund that Expedia was able to organise. It seemed absurd to be paying ~$400 a night only to have no maid service, poorly working lifts, extensive construction, and quite aloof and unhelpful service.

I would never stay here again.

title: Solid
text: The staff were very friendly, the hotel was clean. They were very accommodating. The room price and parking were very reasonable for New York City. Parking is close, right across the street.  When I checked in, we were welcomed and given warm cookies and bottled waters. Checkout was at noon which was even better. They held my bags while I spent the day in the city. Customer service was excellent. My only complaints were: House keeping kept knocking on my door and waking me up, and there were no do not disturb tags for the door. They are renovating the hotel so it was pretty loud in the morning.

title: Great location and very friendly staff
text: Enjoyed the stay overall. The staff was friendly and helpful throughout my stay. Checkin was not as simple and convenient. Once we were checked in, things went smoothly. I would like for them to make the hilton honors breakfast benefit an easier prices.

title: Great staff - facilities need major improvements
text:
Starting with the positive, you could not ask for a more friendly and helpful staff from front desk to restaurant to cleaning to management, 

They are spending big bucks on renovations, but it appears to be putting lipstick on a pig. The money seems to being spent on lobby and restaurant and in theory upgrading the elevators. This does NOT address the key issue of only TWO elevators (if they are both working which they weren't again this visit) for 27 floors. And elevators are used by both guests and staff! The rooms are TINY, even by NYC standards.

title: Muy bueno
text: Me hospede en noviembre del año pasado, ya conocía ny por lo que fui a varios hoteles y este me encantó, la cama muy cómoda (nunca dormí tan bien) y nos recibían con una galletita caliente después de caminar en el frío. Volvería sin duda, además que está muy cerca de times Square y de la zona de compras por lo que el precio que pagué fue bastante accesible pasa su ubicación

title: My NYC home away from home
text:
I arrived on 8/4 with my youngest children (twins, 21 y/o), who accompanied me as a part of their 'present' for their recent college graduations.  Yes, the hotel was under construction however it did not take away from the always friendly service from the hotel staff.  I know once the construction finished, this hotel will continue to be a destination for me.  

Refrigerators will now be in every room, meaning they won't have to be ordered once you arrive.  It could be a little bigger however it is better than nothing.  I also like that the  outlets now have USB ports on them.  For 'multi-device' guests/families traveling, this was welcome.

I especially would like to give 'shout outs' to the front desk staffers, especially Sheledine, Christopher, Brittany and the morning crew (sorry I didn't get everyone's names).  Seeing how I was traveling, they worked with us to find the best accommodations possible.  Those that worked in Chelton's were great also.  My children had a GREAT time as a result of this experience.  I wholeheatedly recommend this property for all the great staffers at this property.  They really make a point to see that guests have an enjoyable time

We were convenient to most modes of travel.  Within 1 block was a subway stop and a 10 minute walk put us at NY Penn Station.  Given the food prices in NYC, I'm also glad a Jack's 99 cent store was nearby for snacks.  You may want to purchase milk from there to go along with your cookie.

I look forward to my next stay at the Doubletree Chelsea.  If you are looking for a great and affordable property in the midtown Manhattan area, I definitely recommend this one.

title: Nice Stay but will be nicer when Construction is Complete
text: This hotel had ample clean rooms and were reasonably priced. Close to subway station but yet we walked most places. Great location. The hotel staff were very friendly especially the bellhop and bag check guy! Kudos to the staff!

title: Under Construction
text: The hotel is undergoing reservations, which I did not told when I booked the room.   As if this was not bad enough, they only had one elevator working.  This made for long delays getting to my room and leaving.  There was no acknowledgement of this by the staff and when I check out, no one bothered to ask how my stay was.

title: Not recommended
text: I don’t recommend this hotel, the geographical location is ok but the construction inside the hotel is really tacky, loud and messy. The carpets are stained and it feels like a motel 6. Don’t eat the breakfast there when you can get a better breakfast and for a way better price just around the corner. I thought this would be a safe bet being a doubletree but you can find a better deal and room elsewhere. This is a below average hotel.

title: Not bad, but definitely under renovation
text:
Stayed in early August 2018. Hotel, as numerous others have noted, is under pretty significant renovations.

Big bonus that this property doesn't charge the dreaded Amenities fee (aka: bait & switch pricing)

Let me first say that I sympathize with the management. Not sure that I could do any better at project managing something as substantial as a full renovation on a downtown NYC hotel that intends on continuing "normal" operations throughout. With that being said, there are definitely elements of the hotel that due to the renovations or otherwise are not up to the type of standards one would expect given the rates being charged.

Our room was, for the most part, clean and adequate. Kudos to the housekeeping staff who did a great job every day under less than ideal conditions. The bathroom was quite shabby and in need of some aesthetic and hardware repairs, though I suspect that's the type of work being done via the renovations. The lobby and entrance was a mess due to renovations. The day we checked out, construction crews were using an industrial jackhammer on tile floors in the lobby (the poor desk staff who didn't have noise protection...).

We were fortunate that we seemed to be coming and going at off-peak times because the elevators were a definite problem. Having just 2 elevators for a hotel that large would be an issue on the best of days, but particularly so when 1 is frequently used to transport construction crews and debris from the renovations.

Had a couple of 5 to 10 minute delays waiting for an available elevator, one time we just gave up and walked down 11 stories which we understand would not be an option for many folks.

Overall could have been far worse

title: Great location
text:
The location of this hotel is absolutely fantastic. 5 minutes from the Empire State Building or Madison Square Garden. The bus routes for the tourist are only a few minute walk away.
There’s lots of shops and restaurants in the area. 
The staff are very friendly and even though there is work being done it does not spoil your visit as it’s only a base as there is so much to explore in the city. 
My only problem was the room size was small but we were a family of 4 so found it very tight, but for a weekend wasn’t really a problem. 
It was very clean and had what you need for a hotel room.

title: Remodel blues
text: I stay at this hotel often when I come to NYC for business. The rooms are clean and nice. The staff is helpful. The breakfasts are great, but a bit costly. Recently they have begun renovations in earnest. This is a annoyance to me as it has cluttered the lobby and entrance...not to mention delaying the already slow elevators. While my current stay is a 3/5 stars, due to the remodeling, I give them an overall rating of 4. I will stay here again.

title: Let down badly
text:
Booked the most expensive balcony suite based on pictures and description on website. Checked in with my wife and son and on first impression was surprised how small the room was and that there was no bed set up for my son (we had booked and paid for three). Also entrance to room was essentially through a worksite. (See photo) Got housekeeping to come up and a rollaway was set up (which took most of the spare space in the room) and then shortly after had to get them up again to provide a third (scratchy!) towel. Soon found out that the private balcony door was jammed and had to get maintenance up to open the door for us. Soon after we also found that the tv was not working - maintenance guy again - and we started to settle in. 
Next morning my son became aware that there was someone on our ‘private’ balcony that can only be accessed through the room? Turns out that a workman had used a ladder to lower himself from the roof onto the balcony where he was able to see straight into the room. A gross invasion of privacy given that we were not notified or even made aware that this might happen. 
Other issues included a shower that went through a 60 second cycle of ok pressure to completely stopped and then back again - didn’t bother getting maintenance up for this. 
Oh - and be prepared for long waits at the lift (up to 10 to 15 minutes) during peak times. 
Complained to the front desk and Brittany assured me that the manager would be in touch - never happened. 
Complained to management through my Hilton diamond account and was offered some points (by Venus) to compensate for the shortfall but these never were followed up on. 
In short - I paid a lot of money for a very poor experience and would warn against staying here (at least in the expensive rooms). Management is either inept or do not care.

title: Do not book this hotel during remodel
text: We stayed at the hotel during a remodel in July 2018. The lobby was under construction and the front entrance was filled with furniture. The tight space became even smaller very quickly. When we left our luggage with the concierge, it was stored in the lobby which I did not feel was very secure but we were left with no other option. It was nearly impossible to get an elevator, we had to take the stairs to our 6th floor room with an 8-year-old and a 5-year-old. This included check-out which required us to carry large suitcases down 6-flights of stairs to an outside exit and we had to walk around the building to get to the lobby. The rooms were dusty from the remodel and the a/c unit was disgusting on the interior. I would avoid visiting this hotel during the remodel. The staff was friendly but the pros did not outweigh the cons.

title: Service below expectations
text: Good location, convenient to Penn Station, Chelsea, midtown.  Our television did not work and after a couple of requests, no one came to fix it.  There are renovations going on that we did not know about and that impacted the use of the lobby and restaurants and elevators.  Clean room, but the bathroom had towels and wash clothes for one, not two people.  Overall, we were disappointed as we expect more from the Doubletree brand.  Good cookies.

title: Hotel is under HEAVY renovation
text:
I really wish the hotel had told us about the renovation ahead of time so that I could have changed hotels. The staff did the best they could and i was SERIOUSLY impressed with the night shift folks in particular who were very helpful and did the best they could to make us feel comfortable - I needed a fridge in my room for my kids meds and they had it up in a flash. Christopher and Sheldine - well done take a bow. Sadly there was just too much construction going on which affected the restaurant, room service and the fact that the lobby was effectively non-existant. For the price,and the Hilton brand - I was dissappointed.

Like another one of the reviews suggested - wait till the renewal is done! There's a hotel like this one on almost every parallel street so try one of those meantime...

title: Stay Away
text: For context, I have stayed here several times over the years, so I was comfortable booking a room for this trip. Presently staying here. Hotel mgmt is non existent in spite of asking to speak with them multiple times. Rooms smell like a urinal. We have been in three rooms in our first 24 hours. First room smelled so bad we had to switch. Second room didn’t smell, but light switches didn’t work, tv didn’t work, refrigerator not plugged in. Third room smells like a urinal like the first. Elevators have taken as much as 15 minutes. Clearly, this is a hotel that does not care about the guest experience.

title: Under construction: Avoid!
text:
Notice of construction was not given when the reservation was made nor when the one-week reminder was sent.  We were not that concerned about it when we checked in at night, but the deafening drilling began at 8:30am on the Saturday.  We might still have put up with it, but then we had a 10 minute wait for the elevator as it turned out that one of the two ( for a 26 floor hotel) was booked off for construction and staff.

We left early, and the front desk staff were extremely helpful and nice about it.

Wait for the construction to end...

title: Stay somewhere else
text:
We are Hilton honor members and always pick a Hilton when traveling as they are usually fantastic. However , this hotel does not meet the Hilton quality.  First, let me say if you are driving to hotel self parking lot is located at the Icon parking lot on right side before you reach the hotel. Then you need to have your ticket validated. We checked on the website before we arrived and the parking lot location is nowhere to be found .  After a frustrating long drive I just wanted to park and get to my room but instead I needed to call and ask where to park . Took me another 10 mins just to get around the block so I could get back to the parking lot . Makes no sense to me why it is not mentioned on the website .  On side note, I didn’t get my cookies until I went back to ask for them . (Favorite part of staying at a double tree ..lol).
Upon check in the staff couldn’t not find my reservation under my name or my husbands.  He even had my drivers license. Luckily I had my confirmation printed and suddenly he found my room . My daughter and I got to our very cramped room which smelled terrible . The bathroom smelled like mold or urine (hard to say ). Smelled silmilar to the subway station .  Rugs were dirty too .  Thank goodness they are planning on updating the hotel. At these prices you should expect more .
The outside of the hotel is under construction but didn’t effect us in any way . I actually found the construction workers more pleasant than the front desk staff . One worker offered to get out the elevator to allow room for more guests !
One night after getting back late from our show we witnessed another guest being told that he had to pay to get his luggage out of storage after 11pm .  Needless to say he was irritated and refused to pay . The staff litterally had to walk across the tiny lobby to a room to get his luggage. What a joke !!
So do yourself a favor and stay somewhere else . Lots of choices in NYC .

title: Had a wonderful stay
text: The only two qualms I have about the hotel at all are quite trivial. The breakfast is very expensive (a whopping $22 a person) and there was construction going on outside. However, there’s almost always construction anywhere you turn in NYC and the solution to the breakfast issue is to walk a block to McDonalds for a sausage biscuit etc. The staff were very friendly and made conversations with us about where we were from and sports teams we enjoyed etc. The hotel is also located at one of the best locations, it’s very central and you can walk almost anywhere from its 29th and 7th Avenue spot.

title: Family vacation!
text: Conveniently located! Very clean rooms ... nice views of the city and some with Empire State Building views ... parking garage across the hotel gives discounts for being a guest which helped a lot . Would definitely stay at this location again .

title: Un engaño absoluto
text:
Reservé mi habitación pensando en que, hospedándome en un hotel de la cadena Hilton cumpliría ciertos estándares. Al llegar al edificio, me encontré con una obra en construcción que dificultaba el ingreso ante los incesantes idas y venidas de los trabajadores. Los únicos dos ascensores que había eran compartidos por el personal de construcción, los trabajadores de limpieza y los huéspedes. Tardaban siglos en llegar ya que sólo eran 2 en total.
Adicional con esto, el calor era sofocante en NY y esperaba poder mantener bebidas frías para refrescarme en mi habitación, sin embargo no fue posible. Es el primer hotel en que me hospedo y no posee heladera. Lo comentamos en front desk y nos dijeron que había que solicitarla, cosa que hicimos el día 1. Transcurrida una semana de estadía JAMÁS nos dieron la heladera. Una verguenza!
No recomendaría a nadie este hotel ni volvería a visitar ningún hotel de la cadena.

title: Great location
text: No complaints about the hotel at all! We didn't mind the outside of the hotel being worked on. The hotel rooms are a bit dated but we were out most of the time so didn't mind. We didn't have towels when we arrived but they were brought up in about five mins. Close to everything that you need, good night's sleep, air con is good. Reception are really helpful and the ladies in the bar are very helpful.

title: Turismo
text: Muito ruim. O quarto não atende ao que foi ofertado ( 4 pessoas). É muito pequeno, apertadissimo e não há lugar para colocar as malas. Estava com mal cheiro.  O banheiro muito pequeno. Tem camas boas, mas poderiam ser de tamanho queen.

title: No issues atall!
text: Arrived late evening at the hotel to be greeted by a friendly face who quickly checked us in and was very pleased to have a room upgrade and cookies,stayed on the 22nd floor with amazing views of the empire state building,the room was big enough for two of us,quiet,coffee machine,comfy big bed,we had no issues with waiting long for the lift,yes there is work going on at the front of the hotel but this didnt effect our time there what so ever.would def recomend staying here easy walking distance to times square etc thanks for making our stay soo enjoyable

title: Not worth the price paid
text:
All seemed to be wrong with the hotels, just to begin, when we arrived the hotel was under construction, which was not informed at the moment we made the reservation. As soon as we arrived 10pm we didn't have a room available, the only one left was having maintenance problems and we had to wait until it as fixed 0:30 am next day. Their suggestion, go to Times Square to spend some time, at least they offered breakfast free for 2 day for that inconvenience. Once in the room, it didn't smell quite well, but it was the only one available. In the days of the stay, we never could get as many towels as people in the room. The elevators were terrible, always with construction workers an materials, and wait times of 10 minutes to arrive.
Overall, we didn't get what we paid for, or we paid extremely high for what we got.

title: OMG... Is this a Hilton Property?
text: Getting towels were a joke!  Almost as if they were a rationed item!  Traveled for 12 hours.  All I wanted to do is take a shower, but the hotel was out of towels!  For two days!  Staffs excuse was being short staffed!  I will never stay there again!

title: Nice hotel in a convenient "village" like location
text: Nice hotel and good sized rooms for New York City.  Great location, easily walkable from Penn Station with lots of nice local shops, restaurants, and sights.  I like to hit the hotel up when doing business in the mid-town area.

title: Horrible service and hotel experience
text: Won't be staying there again. I was told my reservation was cancelled although it had a late check in guarantee. We had to frequently wait over 10 minutes for the elevator because they were doing construction and have no service elevator. The pull out was extremely uncomfortable and there were not extra linens or towels in the room. Overall just a poor experience in a cramped suite.

title: Misleading pictures
text:
The WORSE vacation ever because of this place!!
This place published misleading pictures because it is under renovation!!
Everyone was using the elevators except people who stayed there so we have to take the stairs or wait forever for one of those dirty elevators.
No towels for 2 days because the delivery truck couldn’t make it!
Water problem in my kids room 2410 for 2 days even the technician checked it twice and approved changing the room but the front desk refused then we change it after a big argument with the manager in the 3rd day.
Leaking in the roof on top of the shower in my room 1408 and the technician showed up after 11 pm to check it even we called 4 times for it.
Housekeeping only did the bed for 4 days without cleaning anything or changing the linen or even put Shampoo or coffee so we have to go to the front and complain then have everything in hand from them (Anthony was very helpful)
The front desk manager was so rude and refused to discuss any of our issues.
By the way I payed $1888.56 for this unpleasant stay and it was not free !!!!

title: Not worth the aggravation
text: I’m here now on day 2 and I am beyond frustrated. Yes the hotel is under construction and you have to share the 2 cramped elevators that they have with not just other hotel guests but with housekeeping, maintenance AND the construction crew. YES the construction crew. But my main frustration is being charged $50 per day per room (I booked 2) so I do not have access to $450 that I was counting on to feed my 3 children. Management says it’s a “Hilton” thing and EVERY Hilton hotel charges a deposit. I have never had to pay a deposit and I’ve stayed at Hilton’s all over the country but when I called Hilton they say it’s at the hotels discretion. Maybe it’s a NYC thing? And that’s okay but I wish they were up front about the deposit and the amount of money they would “hold”. NO WHERE on their site even when you confirm does it state that there is a deposit required. Anyone else have this problem or is it just me?

title: Do not stay here. Do not purchase discover NYC package
text:
Hhonors offered a package for this hotel that included the NYC pass to a lot of tourist locations for a higher rate. The hotel had never heard of this and down not honor it. All of our money was tied up in the hotel so we did not get to experience anything we planned on. We were charged a parking fee after the valet refused to take our car. The only reason we chose this hotel was the pent house and balcony only to find out we couldn't use the balcony. 

This hotel ruined our whole trip by not honoring the package we purchased. We had a strict budget, and we're offered our first night free for the aggravation. But our money was still on a hold for the full amount and we couldn't use it for any of the attractions that were supposed to be included. 
The stairwells were full garbage and old food that smells terrible. People slamming doors during the construction. The only other room on our floor was fighting, screaming and slamming things until about 4am. 
Just pick a cheaper hotel where you will actually get your money's worth.

title: Never again.
text: I have stayed at many hotels and this is by far THE WORST I have ever experienced. The staff being pleasant was not even enough for me contemplate giving 2 stars, and the 1 star is only for the location. Extremely small, extremely outdated rooms, so if you have a family of 3 or more look elsewhere or you will be piled on top of one another. We had 4 people (2 adults, 2 children) in our room and had to call for towels EVERY DAY of our stay. Sometimes we got them, sometimes we didnt, sometimes we had to wait hours because there was only ONE housekeeping person (never heard of at any hotel ive ever stayed at!), or they were waiting for the laundry company to bring more (???). I mean, what kind of housekeeping takes your dirty towels and DOES NOT REPLACE THEM?? Besides the major major need for a complete overhaul of the rooms  (I felt like I was in someones decrepit apartment), the service is absolutely unacceptable. Again, the employees were polite, but being polite does not substitute for awful service on simple things such as towels! You have guest that are out in the city all day in the dirt and grime of New York, you think they dont want to take a shower when they return to their room??? I am beyond pissed that I have to pay almost $1k for a hotel experience worth $250. Fair warning if you are looking at this location and are not traveling alone!

title: Buena ubicación para time Square. Mal los elevadores...
text:
Este hotel.

Lo bueno.- La ubicación, sin ser tan costoso, estás a unas cuadras de Time Square a pie. En la esquina una tienda de abarrotes para compras del día a día . 

Nos regalaron 2 días de desayuno por el error de las reservaciones.

Las galletas que te regalan al hacer check in deliciosas.

Lo malo.- Tuvimos problemas con la reservación, pues el primer día , a pesar de tener reserva para cuarto con dos camas individuales y pagar un poco más por ellas. No pudieron respetar la reserva, y tuvimos que dormir una noche en cama King size. 

Problema también el Elevador. Pues siempre estaba ocupado, y vaya que subir escaleras fue historia de todos los días. Para salir rápido del edificio.

Un lobby muy reducido.

title: Hilton horror
text: This hotel is a disgrace to Hilton brand,front desk staff couldn’t care less they were unfriendly and not at all welcoming doesn’t matter if your a Hilton member .Our first room was an absolute horror after complaining to the front desk we were moved to another room which was better but not wonderful the whole room needed a good clean I dropped something behind the bed so moved the bed out which was easy as it was on rollers and the dust behind the back of the bed must have been at least 2 years worth of non cleaning. Our towels and bath mat were thread bare and I know we keep hearing how the hotel is going through renovations but please tell me how this effects the towels and bed linen. There was no luggage stool in our room so when I went to front desk and asked if I could please have one the staff argued with me saying there was one in the room finally they relented and said they would send a stool up. Hilton you should be embarrassed to have your name associated with this hotel. A lot of the staff had attitude mainly front desk staff ,others you meet in hall way and lifts were very friendly and polite. The hotel does have a good location but that’s about all . My advice go to another Hilton .

title: Not worthy of Double Tree Brand
text: This hotel is old and worn out.  Small rooms, small bathrooms, may be normal for NY.  No mini fridge, wood veneer missing on closet, carpets in halways and rooms old.  Wall covernigs in hallways are old.  Narrow hallways.  Rooms and hallways need renovation.  Lobby are is being renovated now.

title: June 2018 NYC
text: Great hotel - great staff - highly recommend - reasonably quiet and will be even better when the restoration is complete. For NYC - this is pretty much a bargain. Location was perfect to Pennsylvania Station. Exactly what I was looking for

title: Disappointed
text: You charged me double for my room when I thought I was only being charged for the deposit. When I questioned it and showed the receipt for the room having been paid for already, you told me there was nothing you could do. This left me with almost no money for the rest of my trip. I had to annoy family and my travel agent in Australia to get this fixed because your front counter staff were adamant there was nothing they could do. This was eventually fixed but stressed me to the point of crying. You need more elevators, sometimes I had to wait 5-10 minutes. I was not climbing 21 flights of stairs. The rooms were very small, we could barely move once our cases were in. The water pressure in the shower is awful, it's either too hard or not enough. My sheet has had a hole in it since the day I arrived. You will probably charge me for this and the mark on top of the bed that was also been there since I arrived. The beds were comfy and it has a great location but I would not stay here again.

title: Business in NY
text: Although the hotel is undergoing renovations and the exterior entrance curb appeal was not the best, the stay was pleasant and comfortable.  Rooms are small but clean and comfortable.  I would stay there again.

title: Under Construction - Under Serviced
text: Hotel is close to high line and a brisk walk to Javitz Center.  For so many floors / rooms there are only 2 elevators so be prepared to wait.  Then be prepared to wait at the front desk because there was usually only one person behind the desk.  Bell Desk Staff was great as were the bartenders.  Rooms are tight (small) but  very clean and the beds are comfortable; although Hotel is under Construction so don't plan on sleeping in!

title: Not what I expected for a Hilton hotel
text:
Overall the hotel was ok. The staff were friendly and helpful, the room was ok although quite dated. The hotel location was pretty good, close to the subway and walking distance to Times Square.
Overall I feel that the hotel was overpriced for what it was and in need of some tlc.

title: Wunderbares hotel für New York
text:
Super hotel zentral sehr gut alles zu Fuß zu erreichen!!!
Größe der Zimmer für New York riesig 
Preisleistung stimmt!!!
Frühstück gut 
Viele Restaurants in der Nähe 
Shopping Möglichkeit überall 
Angenehme Wohngegend

title: Fantastic location and solid hotel
text:
The purpose of this trip was a wedding: my sister was getting married in Central Park and this was to be our base for the trip. We were warmly welcomed - with a number of rooms on the same booking, it was complicated but handled efficiently and with friendliness and patience (the member of front desk staff was really lovely). 

The hotel itself was undergoing works - and, to be honest, could probably do with having more work done on it as it looks somewhat tired, particularly in the public areas. The rooms can really only be accessed by lift (there is no proper internal staircase and the stairs there are (which you are allowed to use - the fire exit stairs) were used as a storage area) and there are only 2 lifts, one of which was out for most of our time we were there. This meant lengthy queues to get a lift and it being very cramped in the lift. Unfortunately the smoking area is around chairs directly outside of the front door, meaning you walk out into a cloud of smoke, which isn't very pleasant. 

Each floor is relatively small and in true New York style so are the rooms. However, this is by no means a criticism - it's the way of things in this city. The rooms were comfortable with a clean and efficient bathroom - albeit that the air conditioning unit was very loud at night. The complimentary products were also of very good quality. 

One of the real upsides to this hotel is its location: very close to Penn Station, for the Long Island Railroad to/from JFK airport and well located for the subway and other New York attractions. 

Overall this is a solid - if not spectacular - hotel. Reliable, albeit that there are a few things which could improve the experience.

title: The Worst Hilton We’ve Ever Stayed In
text:
This is my first ever negative Trip Advisor review but this hotel truly warrants it. My wife and I paid US$400+ per night last month to stay in a “King Bed – Penthouse – Balcony” room for 5 nights.  There was so much we disliked about this poor excuse for a Hilton it’s hard to know where to start. Our room décor was straight out of the eighties with thick dusty old curtains that didn’t cover the windows, a noisy wall-mounted aircon unit and chipped furniture that should have been thrown out 25 years ago. Our so-called king bed consisted of two standard six foot single beds pushed together. Especially uncomfortable if, like me, you’re over 6 feet tall. The bathroom complimented the rest of the room perfectly….it was also awful… complete with an over-bath shower that regularly stopped working mid-shower and then restarted again several seconds later. Some of the towels and sheets provided during our stay were so threadbare we’d be embarrassed to donate them to charity. Our room was never restocked properly. There was always something missing….sugar, toilet paper, laundry bag etc. Housekeeping never got it right. Nor did the hotels so called “CareLine”…the inhouse number guests are asked to call when they need something. We called it three times to receive the items that housekeeping forgot to leave and on each occasion had to call them back again an hour or so later to chase them up. Nobody seemed to care. With just a few exceptions we found the staff to be surly and unengaging…including reception where there was zero Hilton Honors recognition at check-in and no water provided. We called down for it but guess what….it never turned up. Which was probably because the hotel has just two small elevators catering for its 27 guest floors which means moving between floors often takes an eternity. 
Hotel management will blame poor reviews such as this on renovations and assure readers that they are continually “striving” for this, that or the other. Let’s hope they all strive a lot harder than they have been in the past because the Hilton Doubletree Chelsea is currently not a good hotel. It’s a shame really because staying at a Hilton once meant something.

title: Top Choice in Chelsea - 10 Min Walk to Penn Station - Near Restaurants and Sights
text: I have stayed at this hotel three times and love every experience.  The hotel is about a 10 minute walk from Penn Station.  This is good to know if you want to take the bus or train into the city.  After traveling into NYC, nothing spells pleasure like a warm chocolate chip cookie.  I will admit, I have had my fair share of these delights and they are delicious upon arrival.  The front desk staff are eager to get you in and out of the lobby and straight to your room.  The rooms are nice and offer all of the amenities you need to be comfortable for the evening, including lots of outlets for phones, laptops and iPads.  I also like the elevators because they are fast and not slow like some of the larger hotels.  I would opt for a room with a view of the Empire State Building because it is iconic.  There are some rooms that offer balconies as well.  Last, the hotel is in the perfect part of New York City.  Chelsea is amazing and there are things to do 24 hours a day in the area.  The hotel is excellent for all of my work and pleasure needs.  I am thinking about those cookies now and can't wait to take a bite into them....

title: Happy
text: Had a very nice stay everything was great except the parking the parking garage charge ever time you move your vehicle over $40 bucks. That's the only reason we will not stay there again. Love love love the hotel

title: Average Hotel Under Renovation
text: The hotel's location was pretty good in the Chelsea neighborhood. The scaffolding outside did not bother me as they can be seen everywhere in NYC, but might be unsightly to others. We did have an issue with our shower water randomly turning off and back on again throughout our showers. The rooms are small and dated, but going through renovations this year. We were woken up several times at night to slamming doors in the hallway. They should have something to soften the close. It would be nice to have a fridge in the room without paying for it. The cookies were a nice touch though.

title: Great View in NYC
text: Stayed in NYC to see the ballet.  Great room with a great view of the Empire State Building.  The location is close enough that we could walk to Penn Station.  Street entrance has construction going on so the front was dark at night, but other than that, pleasant stay.

title: Absolutely brilliant hotel room
text: This hotel was really fabulous.  Great locality near lots of great places and very near metro and Penn stations.  The room was spacious and clean and best of all totally quiet with no noise from outside or adjoining rooms.  Bathroom perfect.  Staff friendly.  Great security for leaving bags before or after check in and a very capacious safe in the room cupboard affording the great luxury of not having to lug around valuable items such as laptops and camera.  Excellent TV and coffee/tea in room.  The air-conditioning system was quiet and efficient and fully adjustable so that the comfort level was perfect  - neither too cold nor too hot as is usually the case everywhere.  The only addition that we could think of that would be useful is a small bar fridge.   It was also great value and we would highly recommend this hotel to anyone wanting to have a hassle free New York experience.

title: Great little hotel - perfect for a short stay
text:
Stayed in this hotel for three nights taking my family to NYC for a short break.  I had a twin room for my kids - done for free on Hilton Honors points but my own room was paid at a pricey $290 a night.....but then again this is Manhattan in tourist season so par for the course unfortunately.

It is in an excellent location, literally a couple of blocks away from the Penn Station / Madison Square Garden complex, with Times Square, the theatre district and all the shops just a little further.  There is also a Subway stop on the 1+2 lines a block down so it is very easy to get downtown.  The hotel is very small - sandwiched in between surrounding buildings and as a result the rooms are a bit on the compact side.  However I have no complaints with the cleanliness or the facilities in the rooms which were spotless and up to a typical Hilton DoubleTree standard.

The only downside was that there was construction work going on at the front of the hotel so the entrance plaza is completely shielded by scaffolding, but to be honest this never impacted our stay nor were we ever bothered by construction noise.  The staff at the hotel were all courteous and friendly to us and I would have no hesitation in considering this hotel again for a future stay in New York City.

title: Great location...looking forward to renovation completion.
text: You can't beat the location, right near MSG, Empire State,Times Square and the Highline.  They are under construction now, the rooms are very small but the staff is friendly and helpful.  The view of the Empire State Building was spectacular at night!

title: Don’t waste your time and money, stay somewhere else.
text: This Hilton Hotel GM Chanel Spencer falls short of what you would expect from Hilton Honors. There are way too many hotels in that same area that would be more than willing to take your 300.00 dollars per night and provide you with a quiet room and not ignore your request to speak with the GM. They charge you a set price for your stay, then put out a better rate because no one staying there because of construction. I requested to speak with GM upon checking in and was avoided like the plague. They said they posted there was construction on the website but when I made my reservations a month in advanced it was not there.

title: Tourists trap.
text:
Hell in NY.
The more you pay the less you get, this should be their lema.

Rubbish at the entrance, piles of old stuff including air cons and chairs that noone removed in 1 week. Nothing to do with the photos on their website.

The lady at the front desk gave us a welcome cookie and two bottles of complimentary water -but because we are Honors- and that was all... not even a smile.

We paid more than 3000 dollars for 8 nights at the penthouse room with terrace and views at the top floor, well, the terrace was in a deplorable condition, dangeours nails, broken tiles all around, a rope! rubbish, empty bottles of coke and water etc... later we learnt Floor 26th terrace was under renovation but they never told us about!! I presume they did not want to lose their 3000 dollars reservation, right.... I still have the pictures that I will try to upload.

Staff not empathic at all. Only one of the members (I think his name is Chris) told us he would speak to the supervisor and got us a "discount" as compensation for not being able to use the terrace in that condition. They also offered 2 breakfasts for free and I am lucky I did not pay for them... barely cereals, some milk and awful croissants and coffee... 

I still have to see the refund in my credit card... and if I finally get it, will be only because I insisted 3 times on it and asked the young man, Chris, to put it in written as by check-out noone seemed to know anything about that! It took me more than 30 min to get the amended invoice -they claimed all the time they would send it to me via email... yeah... go and trust them.

Oh and guess what? They never repaired or cleaned the terrace after our formal complaint to the supervisor but CLOSED our door with screws to prevent us from accessing it! Well, sorry, I need to say the did in fact repair it our LAST day there! One of the guys at the reception even asked us if we had enjoyed the terrace our last day... what kind of joke was that?? 

Like in Kafkas stories, the supervisor never showed up to say sorry... brilliant management...

Not to mention the fire alarm that start sounding at 2 am our second night there... finally it was a false alarm but noone told us, noone even bothered to called into the rooms to calm guests down... nothing!! We thought something serious was going out outside... could not sleep at all. 

I felt totally ripped off, total waste of money and they almost ruined our 7 days holiday in NY. Luckily I speak some English and could complain and explain the staff how disappointed we felt about Hilton Double Tree and the Honors members program . But believe me, all that you will hear is "sorry", no solutions at all. 

Other that the comfy bed and bathroom facilities (and the views from the penthouse that we could NEVER enjoyed) I have nothing good to say, all looks old and messed and the worst thing is that they do not even care about their image or their guests welfare. 

Maybe this is normal in NY, maybe just a matter of bad luck... but in Europe where I live this hotel would be closed, not to mention it would be a 1 or 2 stars maximum.

Avoid it !!

title: Nos sentimos profundamente engañados.
text:
Pagamos por una de las habitaciones más caras, la Penthouse de la planta 27, precisamente por las vistas que ofrecía. Su precio, 3.400 dólares por 8 noches sin incluir desayuno. 

Bien, el recibimiento fue de lo más lamentable. Para comenzar, la entrada está llena de porquería, trastos viejos acumulados, que no retiran, etc... un hall diminuto, en la recepción, una señora se limitó a comprobar nuestro nombre, darnos una cookie de bienvenida y una bolsa con dos aguas de cortesía (porque somos Honors) y nada más. 

Lo peor vino al subir a la habitación. La habitación en sí, ni fu ni fa. Únicamente destacar la comodidad de la cama, que es uno de los puntos fuertes de la cadena Hilton. Pero la terraza... la terraza!!! Baldosas rotas, clavos del tamaño de un puño dispersos por el suelo, una soga enrollada de más de dos metros, escombros de obra, una escalera de mano, cojines tirados por el suelo, botellas de refresco igualmente tiradas, etc... no ya deplorable sino PELIGROSO! Llegamos cansados, muy entrada la noche y ya no hicimos nada, pero sí fuimos a reclamar a recepción al día siguiente. 

Allí tuvimos que hablar con hasta 3 empleados diferentes. Todos pretendiendo ignorar lo sucedido. Afortunadamente hablo inglés... al fin nos dijeron que la terraza estaba en OBRAS y que nos tenían que haber advertido, pues bien, seguramente para no perder la reserva, no, nadie nos había avisado. Nos dijeron que había que esperar a la supervisora para ofrecernos una solución... nos dieron el desayuno gratis, un desayuno ridículo para un hotel de ****. Por la tarde, al volver de visitar la ciudad, había otra persona distinta en recepción que no sabía nada del tema... vuelta a explicar todo, fue a ver a la supervisora (nosotros ni tan siquiera le vimos la cara) nos ofrecieron un descuento de 50 dols. más impuestos por noche en compensación y otro desayuno... o bien otra habitación que no tenía terraza, decidimos quedarnos en la misma pero por la vista, con la esperanza que al menos limpiaran la terraza al día siguiente. Pero NO, en lugar de eso, CONDENARON la puerta de salida a la terraza (seguramente para evitar que nos lastimáramos con tamaña porquería y clavos) lo que nos impidió disfrutar de ella en los 8 días de estancia. Lo mejor? Que la ARREGLARON el día antes de irnos y en recepción, al check out, tuvieron la cara de preguntarnos si habíamos podido disfrutar de ella la última noche!!! 

Ni se os ocurra ir.

title: No volvería
text:
Nunca había estado en un hotel tan sucio, oscuro y estrecho. 
La pieza no tenía luz, el aire acondicionado hacía ruido horrible y goteaba, estaba sucia y mal atendida.
El baño estaba limpio el primer día, luego pareció que nunca lo hubiesen limpiado.
Las amenidades extras a tras mano h de mala calidad

title: Good place
text: I lived here for three weeks and I found it worked for what I needed. The area isn't clean, but it's NYC. There is a good burger place nearby and also the flower street is too. Easy to transportation and friendly staff.

title: Hotel Hell
text: Unless you are a masochist or have very low standards, avoid this place like the plague. You'll see part of the reason right up front when the sight of scaffolding,and  patio furniture piled high and haphazardly on both sides of an entry greet you. Once inside, the corridors will bring out the claustrophobic in anyone, and the rooms are more like cells. Mine was freezing cold and the thermostatic didn't work. So I could either freeze or shut it off completely and suffocate. The "kingsize" bed could barely accommodate my 6-foot frame and the rest of the furnishings were used and abused cheap fiberboard that made excessive noises at the slightest touch. My tiny room also seemed to have chronic water problems. A fabric shower curtain with no plastic liner assured that the bathroom floor got soaked whenever I showered. Toiletries consistently fell off the glass shelf in the bathroom as well because it was so small and somewhat slanted downward.  The in-room coffee maker leaked as well, soaking the desk and papers I had stupidly placed there.  I was freezing and wet much of the first night's stay. I left the tag for breakfast from room service on the door but it went ignored. I never saw ANY evidence of room service of any kind. After working in the city for two days I was ready for a good night's sleep on the second night, looking forward to leaving in the morning. No such luck. The fire alarm went off at 2 am, but the ringing units on my floor did not relay any sense of urgency or danger. Once I heard people piling out of their rooms I realized that there might indeed be a problem. Turns out it was a false alarm. In the chaos in the lobby all I could hear was a frustrated and annoyed fireman trying to learn from staff whether or not there really was any means of fire escape. Finally, I mistakenly left my glasses in the room. After several calls, housekeeping called me back and said they had found them. But, i had to send fedex or UPS labels to the hotel to get them back. Why?  Out of pure courtesy and customer service couldn't they just mail them?  Fedex does not issue labels any more, no to my knowledge does UPS.  What's so difficult about sending me my glasses. I doubt I will ever see them again.  Bottom line, this place is a joke and barely functioning, like a car running on two cylinders. And it cost me a hell of a lot to learn never to stay at at Hilton again.

title: Reasonable place
text:
Reasonable small hotel centrally located in Manhattan New York City
rooms are small and compact, easy access to public transport. Good eating places nearby. Walking distance to most shopping as well.
Enjoy.

title: Weekend Getaway
text: The staff was great and treated us to the weekend we wanted.  They were quick to set up transportation when we needed it.  They were knowledgeable and were quick with great recommendations.  The rooms are small, it’s New York, but very clean and comfortable.  We look forward to coming back.

title: Close to Penn Station
text: We had a 24 hour layover before departing for Europe.  In NYC do you waste that day in a hotel by the airport?? Heck no!  We took the train into the city and spent the night at the Double tree Chelsea.  Super easy walk from Penn Station (maybe 10 min), sun stop a block away.  We were able to check in early (easy process), receive the yummy cookies and free water (got to love the Hilton honors perks) and drop out bags off before exploring the city for a day!  For NYC I think our room was a good size.  We had the basic 2 double beds, desk, closet.  Everything was clean (which is paramount to me), even the towels smelled fresh.  But the number one thing about this room was the view- the Empire State Building sparked in the evening in all its glory.  We had a super quiet floor (think we were on 26). Also worth mentioning that the restaurant in the hotel has a good breakfast with excellent service.   Definitely looking forward to coming back again. Thumbs up to all the staff as well- girls at the front desk were so nice at check in/out. Oh!!!! I almost forgot- I would give the desk gals 6 stars if I could because they chose me as the first of the day!!!! We got a goodie bag of snacks and coupons!  I felt like the queen of NYC for a day!  :)

title: Cramped Accommodations, watch the hidden fees
text: Dont let the Doubletree brand fool you into thinking this is a nice hotel. its tiny, carmped and very basic low end rooms. TV was not working when we checked in and we never got the AC to work right. in addition watch for the hidden early departure fee, its two clicks down in the fine print in your reservation but after paying them $2000 for four nights of an originally booked 5 night stay and needing to leave a day early they slapped me with a huge early departure fee. So now Hilton and hotels are like Airlines, where profits not people matter, and they are finding ways to charge us fees wherever they can. And when I tried to challenge it they came at with me with both barrels making feel like they were doing me a favor letting me stay there. the fee was so buried it was close to a deceptive trade practice

title: Perfect location for a quick trip into the city for work
text: Being so close to Penn station means I can get to the city on NJ transit, drop off my bag at the hotel, go to work - and when I am done work I simply go back to the hotel and the room is ready.  The rooms are normal sized for NYC, always clean, and well taken care of. And the service is friendly.

title: great weekend
text: Friendly staff and convenient location.....rode the subway the entire weekend and it was so easy and fast.....hotel rooms were small but very clean and beds were comfortable...had everything that we needed for the weekend......the outside was being renovated and would have like the outside space to sit but it rained most of the weekend so was a moot point...

title: Average Manhattan
text:
Stayed at this hotel because of location, needed to be in Chelsea to be near Parsons for my daughters graduation.

Small average NYC hotel room in Chelsea, near the school (and near NYU and FIT).  If weather would have been nice, it would have been walking distance but rained every day we were there.

Complimentary breakfast was nice, wouldn't have paid the price for the breakfast served (but was completely in line with NYC hotel prices).  Panera and Starbucks both right around the corner.

Room was quiet, and bathroom was typical for NYC hotels.

Not the lap of luxury, but who wants to pay $1000 night for that.  For the price, would recommend staying if you have family or business in the neighborhood

title: Gute Lage, Preis/Leistung stimmt
text: Die Lage ist ideal um die Stadt zu erkunden und zum shoppen. Die Umgebung lässt etwas zu wünschen übrig. Vor dem Hotelei gang steht ein Gerüst und die Abfallsammelstelle befindet sich draussen. Die Zimmer sind okay, auf jeden Fall sauber und bequeme Betten. Die Kissenbezüge haben irgendwie nach chinesischem Essen gerochen. Das Reinigungspersonal ist sehr freundlich, die Rezeption könnte durchaus etwas kundenfreundlicher sein. Alles in allem stimmte das Preis/Leistungsverhältnis.

title: Ok hotel that is close a lot of things
text: This hotel looks like it on an alley. The room I had was decent but I couldn't get the air too work. My room was on the 11th floor so I couldn't hear any of the outside noise but my friends who were on the 5th and 6th floors told me that they could hear everything at night. I really didn't like that my friends got complimentary breakfast and when I asked how did they qualify for it, I was informed that you must be certain criteria but receptionist couldn't explain what the criteria was. There are a ton of restaurants and attractions within walking distance.

title: Even for a Honors Diamond member: They just lie into your face - canceled my room without notice
text:
This has hardly happened to my - Booked Hotel through the Corporate Travel Agent a few weeks ago, agreed late arrival, received confirmation - all good

When I arrived at the hotel round midnight, the 'manager' told me that my Credit Card was declined so they canceled my room. An absolute lie, as this was the credit card of a leading corporation worldwide.

1) No help offered 
2) Hilton Diamond Hotline did not pick up the phone

Booked another Hotel, but I cannot recommend this place!

title: Bella Vista
text:
Non potevamo chiedere di meglio, vicino al centro , metro vicina e la camera offriva una vista su Empire, pulizie giornaliere buone , accoglienza sufficiente, camera piccola ma con tutti i confort .
Bellissima esperienza!!

title: Rude staff and dirty rooms
text: My guaranteed room was not available at check in and I was not even offered an upgrade for my inconvenience.  Staff was rude and preferred to talk to one another or gossip in the back room rather than help guests.  No way I will go back to this hotel.

title: Every travellers nightmare
text: Was horrified to arrive at the Doubletree by Hilton Chelsea late in the night to find that my reservation, made directly with the hotel 4 months prior and with my Hilton rewards membership, had been cancelled that same day without any notification or contact with me. Not only that, but my 5 nights accommodation had already been booked out so I had nowhere to stay. The man at the front desk did his best to find me another motel for the night, but with no explanation for why my booking was cancelled without my knowledge and the manager who had done so not there and not answering her phone, I was left on my own at midnight to find something else last minute on a busy weekend in New York. So incredibly frustrated and disappointed at Doubletree by Hilton Chelsea, and won't trust another Hilton hotel again. Hopefully others will learn from my nightmare experience and be wary when booking with Doubletree, or better yet just book somewhere else.

title: OTTIMA ESPERIENZA
text: Ho pernottato in questo hotel ad aprile 2018, devo dire che sono rimasta piacevolmente colpita dalla pulizia dedicata alla camera e dal cambio asciugamani effettuato ogni giorno. Il letto molto molto comodo. Qualche pecca c'è: mancanza di frigobar in camera, e ascensore poco funzionante. Ma nel complesso consiglio questo Hotel, soprattutto per la posizione strategica.

title: Little sounding thing that can ruin a visit
text: 2 Elevators, no service elevator. Used by maids, maintenance, giant trash containers staff all the time down to basement where they pick up supplies. Hilton Honors floor is 26, took 22 minutes to get down to lobby. This was not a one off. I would not stay again just for this reason. Infrastructure just can't cope with number of rooms.Hilton Fashion nearby has no such issues.

title: Very Good
text: Great Staff and Very good room. Great Service and location to my customers. Friendly and very professional. I was amazed at how all the staff were very welcoming. I would highly recommend this hotel to alll

title: Small but excellent staff!!
text: Me and my now husband and our wedding party stayed here for 5 days. Firstly yes the rooms are quite small but perfectly adequate after all if you are in NYC there is far too much exploring to be done to stay in your room! Our room was clean and the bed very comfortable. The location of this hotel is excellent,walking distance to many off the main attractions and very close to Penn station. The biggest selling point of this hotel was some of the front desk staff in particular jaquelynne who was great in making sure our wedding party were put in rooms close together but more importantly was always helpful and friendly. Even the housekeeping greeted you with smiles!Yes we did experience some elevator issues, one was broken for a majority of our stay and being on the 20th floor that was an issue. That is the reason why it's not 5*, a few issues but compensated for by the wonderful staff.

title: It is what it isn
text: Stayed here for a week. Location is decent, quite near Times Square and the big Macy’s which was handy but still a bit of a walk; we didn’t mind though. Room was basic, comfortable and clean bed, also a sofa bed but bedding wasn’t provided for that, we had to ask for it. Breakfast was good and staff were really friendly and happy to help. The cookies were a nice touch. It’s a good hotel if you know you’ll be busy for most of your visit - it served us well as a simple place to sleep. Other than that nothing too special.

title: Sad
text:
The property needs help. One of the two elevators serving this 27 floor property was not working. We had to use the stairs almost every time we needed to get down. The stairwells were dirty and had trash bags and other junk lying around. The breakfast buffet was quite horrible. But I shouldn’t  complain about that since it was complimentary. However. I must say that they need help with the dishwashing and cleaning. Drinking glasses, though cleaned, were filthy. Same goes for utensils. Location of hotel is good. That’s the only plus.

The rooms were okay sized but carpets were filthy. The outside hallway carpets were worse. Linens did not feel very clean.

title: Great place to stay if u want to be in the middle of the city!
text: There is nothing particular or fantastic about this place except its location. Saying that, the service is acceptable and so is the space. Now, you are next to everything walking distance or by train or by cab. Everything! I could see the Empire State Building from my w1ndow! No special request!

title: Il giusto e comodo compromesso
text:
Ho soggiornato qui con il mio ragazzo a cavallo tra marzo e aprile nella stanza KING (letto grandissimo e comodo)! Staff disponibile e attento alle esigenze (al momento del check-in hanno pensato fosse opportuno assegnarci una stanza ai piani più alti dal momento che avremmo soggiornato lì per 10 notti, e così è stato anche se non aveva una vista mozzafiato).  Cookie di benvenuto e bottiglietta d'acqua d'arrivederci graditissimi!
Pulizia della stanza e del bagno rigorosa (lasciando le asciugamani sul pavimento queste venivano cambiate senza dover aspettare obbligatoriamente i 3 giorni di default, idem per le lenzuola se si lasciava l'apposito cartellino sul letto). Stanza capiente con bagno altrettanto spazioso.. per niente angusta! Specchio lungo, scrivania, armadio e cassettoni e comodini con cassetti, poggia valigia,ferro da stiro e buon Phon.
Due ascensori sempre funzionanti (un giorno se ne è guastato uno dei due e l'hanno riparato in giornata).
Posizione eccellente poichè in un buon quartiere, affatto caotica nonostante sia a un passo da Broadway e Time Square, per niente isolata, e paradossalmente vicinissima a tantissime attrazioni (empire, madison square garden...), inoltre a pochi minuti da Penn Station (comoda da e per l'aeroporto), con tutte le linee della metro a 2 minuti a piedi... Comodità garantita per la visita della Grande Mela! Contornato da deli per ogni evenienza, e posti ottimi per la colazione qualora si decidesse di non farla in hotel. 
Nessuna complicazione con il pagamento e la prenotazione.
Uniche due note negative ma tollerabili: 
1. Il condizionatore tardava molto nel mettersi in marcia quindi per 10-15 min iniziali espelleva aria fredda prima di iniziare a riscaldare l'ambiente. 
2. I vicini di stanza alle 7 di mattina aprivano e chiudevano sbattendo la porta ogni 5 minuti ed è stato come se non esistessero pareti!

Lo consiglio.

title: Great location and bed, rundown facilities
text: The hotel is 3 blocks away from Penn Station.  I was able to walk with my suitcases to the hotel. The bed was very comfortable. The furniture and the carpet looked very old and worn out. There were loud noises outside around 2am. It sounded like heavy equipment. This lasted about 20 minutes. The breakfast buffet was very good.

title: So Many Things Wrong....
text: We had the penthouse for 2 nights. The minuses were the size of the room (quite small), the staff (rude & unhelpful), the hallway (not air conditioned), & the elevators (only 2 and very slow). The only plus was, after they temporarily lost our breakfast order, the food was quite good.

title: Great Service
text: the service i was offered was great i had no issues aside from a minor reservation issue that was fixed before i arrived i stayed with my family and we enjoyed our stay and would recommend to others as well

title: Clean, Comfortable, Pleasent
text: It was perfect for the price.  Location was good, not too far of a walk to time square or the Empire State Building.  People were nice, room was clean, room service was good and fast.  It was quite enough to sleep.  Overall... happy

title: Good location, not the best hotel!
text:
I stayed in the DoubleTree Chelsea in December 2017, the location of the hotel itself was quite good being close enough to Times Square, Chelsea, High line, Empire State Building, etc. however I wouldn't recommend walking back to the hotel too late/in the dark by yourself - it was quite daunting as 3 young women and it didn't feel that safe. 

The hotel itself was ok, we arrived around 10pm a little hungry and thirsty from our flight luckily we managed to get a quick snack from the hotel restaurant/bar before it shut at 11pm however it wasn't that impressive. We didn't bother visiting the restaurant/bar again throughout our stay. 

Our room was booked for 3 adults but it was only set up for two guests - we were only provided with two tea/coffee cups, towels, etc. we had to request addtional of each. We also didn't have a great view - it's advertised as city views/Empire State Building Views but unfortunately we just had views of the dirty empty building opposite us.

It was fairly clean overall however the bedsheets were not changed enough during our 7 night stay and were not clean upon arrival (make up stains before any of us even touched the beds) 

The worst thing was the lifts! There were only two for the entire 29 floors and only one working throughout the entire trip with the second stopping and starting. This was a bit of a nightmare considering they were both tiny and could only fit about 4/5 people comfortably in - even less during check-in/check-out times. Luckily we were only on the 6th floor so was able to use the stairs however they led to the fire exit straight out of the building which isn't helpful if you need to go to reception/gym/internet room. 

The staff were not at all friendly or helpful, they did not make any recommendations on where or what to do on our trip or even ask if we had anything planned or see if we needed help with anything! They were rude and unapproachable on the front desk also.

I loved New York in general and will definitely go back, however will definitely not be staying here again!

title: Great stay!
text: My daughter was viewing some colleges in the Princeton area and we are very happy we chose to stay at the DoubleTree Princeton. We were warmly greeted and all staff was friendly and professional. Our room was large and beds were very comfortable. Breakfast buffet had a nice variety and food was very good. We definitely recommend this hotel for family travel!

title: Just OK
text: Reasonably close to many tourist attractions. Surrounding areas are nice. Friendly staff at reception and restaurant. But the quality of breakfast buffet is not that great - we stayed three nights and by third day felt like skipping breakfast.

title: Worst Service and Experience
text: We booked this hotel through our credit card travel agency for two nights total - one night through my husband's cc and one night through my credit cc.  Apparently there was major construction and we complained.  It was the worst two nights we had there.  We asked to be relocated, but they said multiple times that the noise level would be the same and we should have known there was construction.  The front desk was the worst, the sales director Julie was appalling.  They lie through their teeth and don't provide customer service. I am pregnant and they put me through hoops.  Don't stay here, worst hotel experience I've had.

title: Very Good for Value & Business
text: It was a nice clean hotel with a comfortable bed.  I also had a great view of the Empire State Building.  The room size is pretty good compared to other's in the city.  I was happy with the location as it was close to my office and near great coffee shops and restaurants.

title: Comfortable and Clean!
text: Basic amenities. Very clean room, not large, in good location close to all. Only complaint was street noise from deliveries happening early morning. Restaurant serves breakfast, but price tag was too expensive.

title: bad place you can do better
text: Not happy, asked fridge 3 times didnt' get, breakfast made me sick, ice machine didn't work, staff brought towels for bath no hand towels, maid banged on door before checkout even w/ do not disturb over all BAD>

title: Excellent hotel
text: Stayed here for 4 nights with 4 friends. 3 in  one room was a bit tight as rooms quite small, heating didnt work so was a bit cold at times and were surprised there were no extra blankets in room. Room was really clean and reception staff and porters couldnt do enough for you. Would definitely stay again.

title: nice
text: Hotel was nice, elevator was slow waiting on it. Not enough elevators for the amount of floors in the hotel. But I would certainly stay here again! Walking distance to the Peloton studio and that's what mattered to us!

title: Great Location
text: Selected this hotel as it  was a close to MSG.  We were attending a concert and this is about 2 blocks from MSG. The hotel staff was friendly.  The room was typical NYC room.
