They were able to accommodate an early check in.  Parking garage across the street is a plus.  They did store our bags early on check in and also after check out.  I would definitely recommend this hotel for its parking, location and service.  Great Job Staff

title: Sadly disappointing all the way around
text:
First of all, I should preface this by saying I am a regular Hilton user and have come to expect a certain level of service and attention by Hilton staff.  There is much I could say here, but the incident that remains with me the most is the inability of the staff to clean my room in a timely manner.  I left the hotel at 9:00 am one morning and asked the front desk, as I was leaving the building, to please have my room cleaned as soon as possible.  The clerk told me he would call housekeeping immediately to have it cleaned.  I returned at 10:30 am and it was not touched.  I called downstairs and told them it had not been done yet.  They again told me that housekeeping was on its way to clean my room.  I went downstairs to the lobby to wait until it was done.  At 11:15, my room had still not been touched.  At 12:00 noon, it was still not done.  Finally, just after 12:10 pm, I was told that my room had been completed.  Waiting in the lobby, which is rather small, when I would have much preferred to be in my room, left me with a very sour experience.

What makes this worse is that afterwards I complained in my post-stay survey that they sent to me.  I was even more explicit in that response about what I didn't like. I received an automated message saying that my response had been received and then later a corporate response saying how glad they were that the local Doubletree had already responded to my concerns--except they hadn't.  To this day, I have not received anything from the local Doubletree even though their national office believes that I have.  I informed them that the local Doubletree had not contacted me, but I received no reponse.  

C'est la vie!

title: expected more, much more
text:
Let me begin saying that I am an Hilton Honors member (silver level) and have comfortably stayed in Doubletree Hotels.  In fact, just prior to this I stayed at a comfortable and welcoming Doubletree in Philly.  I usually stay at the Hilton Midtown and am always pleased.  But that Hilton was booked so I ended up at the Doubletree on West 29th.

I was disappointed.  It's a hotel with few amenities, a cramped lobby, small windows, and and tiny, drab rooms.  Overall, it's a depressing hotel.  I get that this is New York and space is at a premium.  But lacking any nice touches in the rooms such as a business desk or nice window, it's a drag even to rest in the hotel.  To say this hotel is in Chelsea seems stretch.  The neighborhood is safe and there are plentiful restaurants, but it seems miles away from the charm of Chelsea or Soho.  For what I paid for two double beds, it really felt like I was being taken.  Little measures up the standards that I associate with Hilton.

title: B&B
text: Absolutely best part of this hotel is breakfast. Visited hotel with the family of 2+2. Kids just loved the variety of different options in the breakfast. Room and in practice the whole hotel would require a refurbishment. Location very peaceful.

title: So small
text: Booked a room at DoubleTree by Hilton New York City - Chelsea due to its close location to MSG and because we are Hilton Honors members.  What we did not know was that if we book through a 3rd party (Travelocity, etc..) we cannot get points for our stay.  There are THOUSANDS of hotels in NYC and we could have stayed anywhere, so it was very frustrating to be told that at check in.  The room was so tiny, smaller than expected. There was no way our King bed was really a King.  We have a King at home.  I'm only 5'5" and my feet hung off the edge. The bathroom was literally 3 steps from the bed and so small.  We could never have stayed in that room for more than the 1 night we were there.  On the plus side, the staff was nice & the hotel was clean

title: What one would expect from a Hilton
text:
Finding the Doubletree Hotel Chelsea was fairly easy thanks to New York's grid format. It's amazing how many Hilton branded hotels are nearby though, easy to get confused as they all look pretty much the same. However, we had selected this hotel for our stay. Arrival was perhaps the most disappointing part of the stay, although the hotel rectified it admirably. The room we had booked was a King Size but they only had a double available for our first night. Therefore, we would move rooms the next night. Further to this, other guests upon check in were given a bag of cookies, whereas we weren't. We did book the hotel through someone other than Hilton but I am a Hilton Honours member, so found that a bit disappointing particularly as it seemed most people were receiving them. The following morning we woke up to receive a complementary breakfast through the door, which was a very nice touch by way of an apology for the room move. The breakfast was lovely. 

The hotel itself is nicely appointed. Rooms are your standard Hilton affair, which means they are well equipped. There was a great large TV, fairly decent Wi-Fi and a very useful in room safe. The room was nice and clean too which always helps. Upon check out, the hotel offers a concierge service which takes care of your suitcases so you can enjoy a last day of sightseeing before an evening flight. This was an efficient process. Staff were generally on the whole fairly decent and friendly. 

The only other criticism we would have beyond the check in is the lift situation. We were only on floor 2 but still had to use the lifts. We tried to find a staircase to the main lobby but did not succeed. Therefore, it was quite frustrating waiting for the lifts and they're not particularly quick! 

However, the Doubletree Hotel Chelsea was a nice hotel overall. Staff did a good job to make up for the issues at check in and the room was nice and perfect for the trip we made. Would consider staying here again .. although, as said at the start of the review, it doesn't really matter which Hilton you stay in, they're all essentially the same. It all comes down to price, and this hotel won on that front.

title: Excelente localização, mas a limpeza deixa muito a desejar
text: Muito bom a localização e silencioso , custo beneficio excelente! Porém a limpeza e tamanho dos quartos deixa muito a desejar e por ter um café da manhã caro, pago a parte! Poderiam melhorar e muito com uma melhor qualidade na limpeza e um café da manhã incluso na diária ! Gostei da experiência , porém se voltar a NY procurarei outro hotel, na mesma localização e preço, mas com quartos e limpezas melhores e café da manhã incluso nesse valor! E sei que tem!

title: Nothing Special
text: Rooms were small but clean.  Bar service for dinner was very good and professional.  Fitness center was poor to average.  Planned a lunch meeting there and was rudely told that they no longer serve lunch.  Wish they would have published that on their website and in the rooms.

title: Average hotel, disappointing
text: I have stayed in many Doubletree hotels and been quite satisfied in the past.  This hotel is quite tall with only two elevators servicing the entire building.  It was usually faster to walk down the stairs, even in the middle of the day on a Friday.  No complaints with service, front desk staff was kind and helpful.  Rooms were small, but that's part of staying in New York.  Overall would choose another hotel in the future, especially when you can stay at a Westin or Hyatt for a similar price per night.

title: Bra läge, fräscht & fint
text:
Hamnade på detta hotell via ett sista minuten-erbjudande och fick ett riktigt, riktigt fint och rymligt rum. 
Jättebra läge, nära till det transport och bra utgångsläge för att nå områden uppåt och nedåt av intresse.
Gatan var lite småläskig men annars trivdes vi toppenbra och bra service från personal!!!

title: Nice hotel, but too small rooms!
text: First of all, let me say that the stay was a good one... Staff was very friendly and accommodating, the hotel is actually nice.  That said, I am not sure I would stay here again...  maybe it's just me, but I was put off by the very small rooms and hallways.  The hotel designers and management should have put a little more emphasis on customer space.  Now am not a frequent visitor to Manhattan or New York... so I can't speak to other locations...  I am sure most people will say something along the line of, "Well, that's New York." or, "You get what you paid for..." or something similar.  Me, however, I need more space, especially since there were 3 of us in a room that was barely built for 2.  Not a lot of storage space in the room, case in point...  The hotel staff place the towels in the short on a rack above.  So, if you like to take a shower and you are good at splashing, you will have towels that are wet before you need it to dry off.  This sink is extremely small... just a functioning sink you would find in most half bathrooms.  We opted for the higher floors to get a vantage point of the hotel and surrounding area.  We were on the 23rd floor... there really wasn't much to see because most of the other buildings were that tall or taller.  We could see the Empire State Building off in the distance at an angle, part of it anyway. I was a little concerned with some of the other TripAdvisor reviewers talking about the elevators being slow... I did not find this to be case.  Yes, I waited, but did not think it was longer than normal.  One thing that irked me was there were no laundry facilities on site.  Really??? you couldn't have used one room designated for laundry facilities???  This was very frustrating... Yes, the hotel offers a dry clean option, but not on Sundays...  which is when I needed to wash my clothes.  I do have to give a shout out and thank you to the following individuals.. They made our stay.  Sandra at the front desk was very helpful and made sure I got the vouchers I needed for breakfast.  Jose in the dining hall was a great waiter.  Very friendly!  He should be commended for his work there and it appeared he was handling the room by himself, both mornings.

title: Dit hotel is een ideale uitvalbasis voor het ontdekken van New York”
text: Het hotel heeft een ideale locatie dichtbij Empire State en Times Square. De kamer was verouderd, vooral de badkamer heeft nood aan een opknapbeurt maar alles was wel proper. De bedden waren van goede kwaliteit, goed geslapen. Heel vriendelijk personeel aan de balie. Je kan ook gratis je fles vullen met water op verschillende verdiepingen van het hotel.

title: Nickel and Dime you
text:
Just a heads up to anyone thinking about staying here.

1. They charge $25 per bag at bell if it’s past 11pm 

2. They don’t have all day housekeeping so if you miss the service in the morning, They won’t come back.

3. The doors are heavy and they should change the hinges because you hear doors slam very loud from inside your room. 

4. They forgot to change the clock ahead an hour so we thought we had an extra hour of sleep but no.. they charged us $100 late checkout fee. And they didn’t even call us to warn us. 

5. The front desk people, All of them so far have been non accommodating. 

For a last minute deal it’s good but be warned they will try to nickel and dime you.

title: Good hotel
text: We wanted a reasonably priced centrally located hotel. It was clean quiet and friendly staff. There are plenty of restaurants close by and easy access to public transportation. The rooms are spacious for NYC.

title: Great location and service.
text: Great location and service. Love the that they will store your bags after checkout for free. Very clean rooms and comfortable beds. Rooms are a little small and no mini fridge which would be a great addition. Very friendly staff.

title: Una settimana nella grande mela
text:
Sono stata a New York con due miei amiche e abbiamo soggiornato in questo hotel per 5 notti.
Hotel centrale a 10 min di cammino da Times square, metro a pochi passi, e non troppo caotico. 
Avevamo la stanza 1709 al 17esimo piano, non era grandissima ma comunque era pulita e  offriva tutto l’occorrente necessario. 
Unica pecca quando abbiamo prenotato online l camera non era indicato che servisse una carta di credito per bloccare una cauzione di 250$ che ci sarebbe stata restituita alla fine del soggiorno. 
Consiglio!!

title: Good rooms at good price in conveniebt locatiin
text:
The location is great.  It is an easy walk to almost anywhere.

Rooms are reasonably sized for NYC.  The rooms are clean. Towels are ok-  but not fluffy - and not numerous.

The staff is very pleasant and helpful.

title: Quick Walk to Penn Station and Madison Square Garden
text: We spent 3 nights in NYC for our anniversary and I was glad we chose this hotel. Fantastic, friendly staff. Small but clean room on the 17th floor. On site restaurant offered a la cart or buffett breakfast options. Location was perfect for those traveling around the city by metro. We walked back from Times Square and felt comfortable doing so. Would stay here again!

title: Excellent location and knowledgeable staff
text: Great location, staff super friendly and helpful - they even give you a list of local restaurants and bars that they recommend, which was great. Room on the small side and the shower could have had more power but that is New York for you.

title: Silencioso e barato
text: Excelente hotel, barato, justo e perto de tudo. A localização, aliás, é excepcional. Ainda dão um cookie na entrada e receberam pacotes meus da Amazon, sem cobrar. Atendimento excelente. A atendente realmente se preocupa com os clientes. Bons restaurantes próximos.

title: Great location
text: Stayed there in March 18, hotel is in a great location near time square and other attractions, the hotel was clean and well looked after, staff were very helpful and nothing was to much trouble, only negative was that we couldn’t regulate the heater in our room it was either full on at 85 or nothing, but to be fair we only slept there as we were out all day. Would definitely stay there again. Can’t rate the food as we ate out.

title: Great location and nice hotel
text:
We arrived at 11.30am and were really lucky to be able to check straight in. Reception staff very helpful and friendly. The welcome cookie and water was great and a nice touch.

Our room was a perfectly good size considering there were 3 of us sharing and there was space for our suitcases etc.

The bathroom was basic but everything we needed.

Never had problems with the lift, we were on the 17th floor and actually if you didn't want to get the lift it didn't actually take that long to walk down the stairs which I did most mornings by choice.

The beds were really comfy and plenty of pillows too.

The location was really good, close to Penn station which is really helpful and super speedy to get to the north and south of Manhattan.

Lots of eaters 5 mins walk from the hotel and some lovely rooftop bars nearby too.

Would def stay here again as feel the hotel was a good price especially given the location.

title: Customer Service was incredible!
text: Our team was staying at the hotel for over a week. During my stay the staff welcome our team back and handed us cookies without asking at the end of each work day. We pay have gained a little weight but they were so worth it! They were so kind and did their jobs effortlessly. I'd highly recommend staying again.

title: Super noisy
text:
Constant slamming doors, ice machin was on my floor and very loud. My room smelled like smoke when I walked but improved when I turned the air on.  Elevators are painfully slow.

Even with earplugs I am struggling with all the doors slamming. Only stay here if you are not a light sleeper.

title: Great last minute find
text: Book a last-minute trip to New York and scored this hotel for a very decent price. The rooms were average size for New York City hotels and was clean. It was conveniently located near Madison Square Garden, Penn Station, and 28th Street subway station. Received chocolate chip cookies upon check-in Andover all enjoyed our stay.

title: buon compromesso
text:
buona soluzione in zona centrale, camere piccole come nella stragrande maggioranza degli hotels di New York, dove se non si ha il budget per hotels da 4 stelle in su si e' destinati a camere da 16/18mq magari con due letti ad una piazza e mezza come nel nostro caso.
Camera comunque funzionale al 26esimo piano con vista empire, servizio di pulizia non il massimo ma comunque accettabile salvo che per una settimana ho chiesto 4 teli per la doccia (essendo in 4 in camera) e puntualmente ne trovavo 3.
Colazione a buffet buona e varia.
Molto attenti, gentili e professionali sia i ragazzi del ricevimento che i camerieri della sala colazione. deposito bagaglio gratuito e concierge disponibile nell'organizzare il trasferimento per l'aeroporto.

title: Horrible experience!
text:
Worse experience EVER! This hotel was on Lexington in New York City. 
I stayed at this hotel last week. I paid for 2 nights and could only stay for 1 night which meant I lost my money for the 2nd night. 
My daughter and I called down to management FOUR times the 1st night to let them know that the man staying in the room next to us was smoking dope. 
They would knock on everyone’s doors and tell them to make sure they are not smoking due to complaints. However, they knew who I stated was smoking the dope but they chose not to address him personally until the next morning when we had to call in and complain AGAIN! 
When they spoke with him he ADMITTED smoking pot and stated that “the smell should go away in an hour.” 
They never once kicked him out or tried to move him to another room or anything else for that matter. 
Being that I get drug tested at work, I could not risk losing my job over this crap..... so I checked out and told them why I was leaving a day early. 
The lady at checkout didn’t apologize or try to refund anything! Instead her response was “you know you will still be charged for that night.” 
If you have a job and want to keep it DON’T stay at doubletree hotels! 
If you want to stay in a facility that doesn’t tolerate drugs.....DON’T stay at doubletree hotels! 
Just a little advice for you from one paying customer to the next.

title: Comfortable Stay
text: The team at the desk, lobby personnel and restaurant employees were all friendly and helpful.  I ended up moving after one night to the back of the hotel due to truck activity at 2 a.m. (reversing noise - beep, beep, beep etc.) even though my room was higher than the 20th floor.  They handled the move pleasantly and I enjoyed my non-view updated room and slept very well.  The original room had a view of the Empire State building which was nice. Both rooms were clean, the beds were comfortable and the room offered everything I needed.

title: Great customer service
text: We were able to check in early and when we checked out they were able to hold our bags for us. Rooms are small but thats to be expected in NYC. 3 blocks from MSG so very walkable. Appreciated the cookies (beware of nuts) and water provided.

title: Muy cómodo, muy limpio, bien ubicado y muy amables!
text: No es un hotel de lujo pero es muy cómodo y volvería sin problema. Las habitaciones son normales, colchones muy buenos, buenísima limpieza e internet perfecto todo el tiempo. Por lo poco que estás en un hotel visitando New York y por el precio bastante módico para esa ciudad, volvería sin dudarlo! Estás a 2 cuadras de la 5 av. y podes ir caminando para donde quieras. Algunas empleadas hablan español.

title: Mitigé
text:
L’hôtel est un peu vieillissant mais très bien placé, 10-15 minutes de marche de time square seulement.
L’accueil est correct, la propreté aussi cependant la douche est un peu vieille et les chambres beaucoup trop petites. Le chauffage fait un bruit infernal en se mettant en route toute les 10 mn.
La literie est correcte et certaines chambres ont une très belle vue sur l’empire State Building (la notre au 20eme).
Je recommande seulement si vous passez peu de temps dans la chambre et n’êtes pas dérangé par le bruit.

title: unforgettable customer from Duane the Concierge
text: Duane the Concierge was outstanding with service and knowledge of the area, (very impressive) the front desk attendants were also very welcoming and thankful upon leaving. The rooms were typical NYC size and very clean and comfortable.

title: Pleasant and Welcoming
text: The staff was very helpful and quickly responded to all requests from extra towels replacing a remote control. This will be the hotel we use when visiting New York City in the future. The location is close to great food and excellent shopping.

title: Average hotel- ridiculous elevator
text: I read the reviews about the elevator and assumed everyone was just whiny...they weren't, it's crazy. One morning it took 13 minutes for us to get an elevator, then 16 minutes to get down our 23 floors because it stopped at ever floor. That's an extra 30 minutes you have to plan for, just to go downstairs.

title: Nice place Great Value
text: Very friendly greeting. Terrific service. Elevators a little slow. Room was decent. Clean. Bathroom a little tight but standard fare in NYC. Quiet stay - did not hear other guests when inside my room.

title: Average Hotel, Small
text: This hotel is a more run down Double tree. Rooms are very small, like you’re in a closet. Carpet didn’t look too clean and furniture. It does the job, as you’ll probably just be there to sleep. I had the double bed room and only one person could fit through the little hallway. The neighborhood was noisy, you would hear yelling in the middle of the night and wasn’t in the nicest area.

title: Always a pleasure
text: We've stayed at this hotel several times.  It's in an excellent location to enjoy the city.  Staff is friendly and rooms are clean and well maintained.  The rooms are on the small side and occasionally you have to wait a bit for the elevator but nothing that would make me hesitate to recommend it.

title: Comfy room with fantastic view and staff
text: Enjoyed our stay at Doubletree - every single staff member was nice & helpful, views of skyline & Empire State Building were fantastic from 2204. Convenient location w great food choices close by. Love the cookies & local recommendations from the front desk. Elevators were great most of the time. Shower & beds were great; 2 double room was larger than the king rooms. Bathroom floor could have been cleaner w hair & under furniture there were things that weren't ours, but the beds were super comfy. Only one downside - assumed it was night staff/security - someone kept letting the stairwell door loudly slam through the wee hours of the morning - 2-4 a.m., waking us up many times throughout our stay. Can't imagine guests would be using stairs on 22nd floor at that time; maybe they could catch the door before it slams? Other than that, would stay again & recommend.

title: Clean and Comfortable Room
text: Quick and easy check in, friendly receptionists.  We booked a King Room with Empire State Building View.  Our room on the 15th floor had the view advertised on the website.  Room was quite small but spotlessly clean, Kingsize bed was very comfortable and clean, had a great nights sleep.  We had a bit of a problem with the heating on the first night, it was too hot and we couldn't adjust the temperature. This was reported to reception and was working fine when we returned after our day out.  Bathroom was clean, shower quite powerful, towels soft and spotlessly clean.  A bit dated but facilities compare well to other Doubletree Hotels we have stayed in.

title: Excellent Location and Amenities
text: I always enjoy staying at a Hilton brand hotel. This Doubletree in Chelsea goes above and beyond! Not all Hilton brand hotels have a Hilton Honors floor. This Doubletree does. Great view from the 24th floor! Love the cookie!

title: Trip to New York at the Doubletree!
text: Love this hotel and the staff! They take great care of their clientele. My room was clean and in perfect condition. I was greeted warmly and made to feel at home.  Breakfast was great and the staff serving breakfast are the best around. I travel a lot so I would know. I definitely would recommend this Doubletree!

title: Nice, good location
text: Small room, but adequate. Nice staff, great location. Nice breakfast. Easy to walk to great area restaurants. Experienced pretty slow elevators which I attribute to the cleaning staff using, so inconvenient for guests. Don't be in a hurry!

title: Perfect stay at this hotel!
text: I love this property because the first time I stayed here I fell in love with the staff.  They are all fantastic, warm, kind and go above and beyond to be of service and happy to do so!  I have stayed here 5 times now and each time is fabulous.  They are all so great!  Beds are so comfortable as well.

title: Not like the DoubleTree’s we’ve stayed at before
text: We absolutely love staying at the Doubletree. This one was a first time bad experience for us. In the first room, the TV did not work. It would black out every two minutes. We had to wait until the next day to get a new room. In the new room the sink would not drain. Disasterous. The staff did not seem to care about the problems. The rooms were small. And the cookies were not warm like they used to be.

title: Great location for downtown NYC
text: This doubletree is in a great location if you want to be in downtown NY. It is on 29th street off of 6th avenue. A short walk for tourists to the Empire State Building and Madison Square Garden & Macys. Really a very reasonable walk to Broadway shows and Times Square. Also great restaurants in the area. Although the area could look shady to out of towners later in night it is a safe area. The hotel itself is a 27 story hotel. Rooms are well NYC size--space is a premium--but any hotel you stay in NYC will be small--it has the necessities--bed, and bathroom. Rooms are very quiet--the higher you go the quieter it gets from outside street noise but this hotel is located in the middle of the street so it is quieter than most hotels that are on a corner. Rooms are comfortable. The only draw back is that there are only 2 elevators so it could take some time to get up or down. rates are very reasonable.

title: Clean and Convenient
text: This hotel is very clean, comfortable, and convenient to Madison Square Garden. The staff was friendly and helpful, too. The rooms were a bit small and the elevators were a little slow, but overall we were happy with our stay! (And you can’t be mad about free cookies!)

title: muy viejo y sin mantenimiento.
text: El  hotel es viejo y no han hecho remodelaciones. Alfombra sucia, y baño feo y descuidado. buena ubicación. no volvería a hospedarme ahí.  Conozco  otros hoteles de la misma cadena en mucho mejor estado.

title: Subpar Hotel
text: This Doubletree Hotel is conveniently located about 2 1/2 blocks from Penn Station and Madison Square Garden and the staff were friendly and courteous. Otherwise, staying here was a poor experience. I’ve stayed in a lot of hotels, and as a Hilton Diamond Member I have stayed at a lot of Doubletree Hotels, but this one is not up to par. First off, the lobby is small, the front desk is small, there are only 2 elevators serving 27 floors and a couple hundred rooms, so expect a long wait, the hallways are extremely narrow, so much so that it is difficult to pass the housekeeping cart with luggage, the room is small, the bathroom is small, and the beds only have one very thin blanket. Next, dinner in the hotel restaurant was average, expensive, and the service was very slow. The sole employee we saw was seating people, taking orders, serving food, busing tables, and working the bar and he couldn’t keep up. When we returned to our room for the night, we found that the deadbolt on the room door wouldn’t latch and the tv didn’t work. After almost 40 minutes of waiting while engineering tried to make repairs, we asked for another room. The tv remote in our second room didn’t work but was quickly repaired. Finally, breakfast was an average hotel buffet, and the room that it was served in was a glass atrium, so it was a very cold dining experience on a January morning. I chose this hotel because it is part of the Hilton chain, but it does not reflect well on the Hilton brand, and I would not stay here again.

title: Great hotel, poor elevators
text: This hotel was wonderful.  Rooms are tiny, but very luxurious.  Very clean, great staff.  And the price was INSANELY low!!!  The only issue is the hotel only has two elevators...and one was taken out of service.  One elevator servicing an entire hotel that is 30 stories is insanity.  That needs to be addressed ASAP.

title: Gutes Hotel zu fairen in Preisen in ausgezeichneter Lage
text:
Das Doubletree Hotel Chelsea ist definitiv eine Empfehlung, wenn man in NY ist und vor hat sich vornehmlich in Manhattan zu bewegen. Durch die perfekte Lage ist im Grunde alles in Manhattan fußläufig zu erreichen, die Penn Station ist sonst aber auch direkt um die Ecke.
Die Zimmer und der Service sind absolut in Ordnung.

title: Great Location
text: This was a quick overnight stay into town for the Winter Classic hockey game; hotel is a great location for traveling in and out by train and going to events at MSG. Convenient to subway stations in the heart of Manhattan. The staff was friendly and the hotel and room was clean.

title: NYC
text: Perfect location wonderful food the staff was excellent. We were all so pleased with how informative and sweet they all were. I love the fact parking is right in front too that really was convenienant

title: Un inferno
text:
Non saprei da dove iniziare.... 
posso dire che che ho fotografato tutti i particolari della camera 2603 che viene classificata come familiare.... invece si camina sulle valige perché possiede un armadio di 1 anta....fosse questo il problema? Noooo , invece è talmente piccola che abbiamo ammassato le valige ed ogni giorno dovevamo aprirle per tirare furori i vestiti.
Detto ciò nulla di grave... ancora .... ma se aggiungo una moquette sporca ( ho le foto) al punto da essere schifosa... le ragnatele sul soffitto ( foto) il soffitto che cade e che ha le chiazze di umidità con i pezzi di calce che pendono... il bordo della vasca scrostato è attaccato con una specie di collante ovviamente a vista fatto in maniera molto,ma molto casuale, l'odore della moquette ....io non posso descrivere questo incubo. 
Piano al 26 con ascensore che funziona un giorno sì e uno no con le code all'ingresso.
Il primo giorno mi hanno dato due doppie scusandosi dicendo che c'era stato un allagamento nella camera, e mi hanno dato la colazione Free... infatti quel signore alla reception ( unico alla receptiion e ci tengo a dirlo ) gentile, ha detto che la nostra camera sarebbe stata disponibile il giorno successivo.....sorpresa la,2603...quando sono scesa e c'erano queste 2 signore alla reception ho mostrato le foto di questo scempio chiedendo di avere nuovamente 2 camere ... oltre alla loro apparente gentilezza ( mi sentivo presa in giro) mi hanno,detto che se volevo mi davano una camera uguale a quella che avevo .... ho,risposto ciao grazie... ed ho,scritto una email su Hilton.... ma NULLA.
Oggi visto che domani c'è in arrivò una tempesta ho chiesto di avere un late check out...pensavo che visti tutti i disaggi magari una gentilezza da parte di questo assurdo hotel poteva esserci ma invece ancora no... oltre a mettersi a ridere ( le due della reception) ci,guardavano pure male... noi ovviamente eravamo in coda come sempre per salire in camera perché l'ascensore non funzionava (20 minuti) meno male il conserge persona meravigliosa che ringrazio si è avvicinato offrendoci dell'acqua.
Caro doubletree Hilton Chelsea non meritate essere chiamati albergo ma al massimo rifugio siete pessimi mi stupisci e che Hilton dia il suo nome.
Ho,sempre usato,la catena Hilton MAI PIÙ !!!!!

title: Great Service and Great Beds
text:
Our hotel had great service from the staff. The hotel didn't have a lot of amenities that we normally like (Common for New York City) but it worked well as a last minute vacation. I always enjoy Hilton Hotels. 

The staff here were great and very helpful. After a long day of walking they would always give us a water bottles when we came in and offered us some snacks  to tide us over before supper. It's little things like this I appreciate. 

When in New York you will be doing a lot of walking so for us the rooms are important. Rooms are common size for New York but the beds are great, very comfortable.

The location was good. An easy walk to the Empire State building, Flatiron, Union Square and Bryant Park (for the Christmas Markets). 

There are also a few good restaurants in the area. I'd recommend this place.

title: 年越しNY
text:
年末30日のチェックインの2日前に予約が取れて、4泊しました。立地はエンパイアステイトビルの近くで、周りにはショッピングエリアがあったりと、比較的移動するのに便利な位置です。部屋も1人だと十分な広さだと思います。バスタブがあるのが良かったですね！
ちなみに冷蔵庫はないのでご注意を！ 上階になるとエレベーターがタイミングによりなかなか来なかったり、乗れなかったりする（笑） 私の部屋からはエンパイアステイトビルも見れて良かったと思いました！

title: Pleasant Surprise
text: This hotel is small, but extremely pleasant with lovely service, delicious food--great dinner, which was a surprise!  Great location in Chelsea.  The staff could not have been nicer. Rooms are very quiet--no noise from other rooms at all.  Small but well appointed.  Plenty of electric outlets!!!

title: Christmas visit
text: Good location.  Hotel was clean and employees were polite and helpful.  Could have used a little more shelves in the bathroom. The bed was comfortable and the room (for NYC) was a good size.  Overall a nice experience.

title: Una buena opcion
text:
Si bien la habitacion fue muy pequena, no teniamos mucho lugar para ubicar las valijas, la limpieza, la vista y los servicios fueron decentes - Te dan cookies gratis todos los dias en la recepcion, hablan espanol casi todos los empleados- el WiFi no funcionaba muy bien y se desconectaba facilmente - el cable funciono perfecto - la calefaccion se podia regular facilmente - 
la ubicacion es buena, esta a pocas cuadras del Empire State Building y de Herald Square - El desayuno que ofrecen es caro y no vale la pena, es bufet pero las opciones son pocas, hay muffins pequenos, cafe en jarra en la mesa, te, huevos revueltos, bacon, etc - una mezcla entre americano y continental - hay algunas frutas tambien - 
Al ingresar al hotel se huele a canela, lo cual lo hace muy agradable -

title: Do not book!
text: Me and my partner had this hotel booked on booking.com from june at a very good rate for four nights 660 dollars from 15th december to 19th of december. We set off at 4am british time and finally arrived at the hotel after trying to get from newark airport to the hotel through snow and heavy traffic reaching the hotel at 18.25 ( 23.25 british time) we had been travelling for over 19hours in total. I gave the receptionist my id and booking and after staring at the screen for a minute or so went to get her manager. Meanwhile another guest was arguing about cockroaches in his room with another receptionist who basically said he was a liar even though the photo on his mobile clearly showed the cockroaches. Then there was another elderly woman trying to check in but they said they had no record of her booking on the system also. Finally the receptionist that was dealing with me appeared with the manager who i clearly heard tell her weve sold the room! She then told me that booking.com had cancelled my room. This was impossible as i still had the live booking on my mobile showing it still active and when i rang booking.com they said the booking was still live also at their end. The hotel said there was no rooms available for me and me and my patrner had to go out in the snow and cold in a city we had never visited beforeto try and find accomodation at nearly 12 oclock at night. The hotel receptonist were downright rude and did not give two hoots about customer service. They had obviously sold my room to someone who had clearly turned up at thehotel willing to pay over twice as much as i had reserved the room for months earlier. Only advice i can give is dont bother booking this disgrace of a hotel with staff that lie and treat customers with utter disrespect! Ive gave it a 1 rating as 0 was not an option.

title: Bad stay
text:
Too many things wrong my room was next to the elevator which is opposite of my Hilton honors reccomadation 
The noise was terrible in and outside the Hotel. The room was tiny and they only have two elevators and one was broken both days of my stay

title: Great location but not so great accommodation
text: We'll below expectations. Room was tired and old. Bed was uncomfortable and internet didn't work for the majority of the trip. I stay in Hilton hotels over 60 nights a year and this is the worst room I have ever seen in their portfolio,

title: Comfortable, Convenient and Friendly
text: This Doubletree is at 7th and 29th, only a couple of blocks from Penn Station, MSG, Macy's, the Fashion Institute, etc.  Staff is friendly and helpful, rooms are quiet, clean and comfortable and rates are reasonable.

title: Outstanding staff
text: Every single person we spoke to at this hotel was warm, friendly, helpful and a great ambassador for your company.  Natasha checked us in and she just made us so glad we were there.  We shared an elevator with a workman who was so friendly that we hated to see him leave the elevator.  I can't tell you how refreshing it was to encounter one kind person after another.  Everything else about our stay was great too and we loved the location.

title: Meh, but good location
text: Conveniently located near my office, this was a no brainer. Upon arrival, I was surprised to see how small the lobby was, with seas of suitcases blocking the desk in the lobby. My room wasn't ready when I checked in, but I was early, so it's all good. They were happy to store my suitcase, and the concierge was very friendly. Upon check in, I was given 2 bottles of water in a little welcome bag, and a warm chocolate chip cookie..a nice touch. When I came back that evening to get my room, a bit of disappointment kicked in. The room is small, but that's to be expected in NYC, and really, who needs a big hotel room in Chelsea?  The room itself left much to be desired.  From the dirty/old carpet, to the awful and dusty dust ruffle on the bed, i took one look around and realized this was a place I wouldn't let my suitcase touch the floor. There were old wet marks on the ceiling, dust all over the remote, no hand towels hanging in the bathroom, and a really nasty phone in the room. It's not so gross that I would walk away, but if you want cleanliness, dust free surfaces, etc look elsewhere.  For a hundred bucks less, I wouldn't have bat an eyelash. The TV has Guide, a great bonus, but a few channels didn't work (ahem, HGTV).  Bottom line: fine place to crash, no frills, kind of dusty/dirty, just okay customer service. If you want convenience, this is a good spot. I personally won't visit again.

title: New York trip
text: Sehr schönes Hotel in Midtown. Madison Sqare Garden, Macys ist zu Fuss zu erreichen. Zum Empfang die besten warmen Cokies😍😍. Frühstück war ok mit Rührei, Bacon, Würstchen, Obst, Joghurt und kleinen Kuchen. Das Personal war fantastisch.👍👍😍😍

title: Hotel is good enough
text: 3 of stayed in a double room on the 5th floor at this hotel. The room was not very spacious but for the time we spent there it was ok. Bathroom was very clean, good shower and plenty of towels. Beds were very comfortable and room temperature was fine but easily adjustable. My only complaint would be the coffee/tea machine - we were only supplied with enough tea/coffee for 1 drink each despite requesting more. A proper kettle and drink selection  would've been appreciated! Location wise the hotel is 20ish min walk to Times Sq.  Or 30 mins to Greenwich, so although not totally central   it is close enough. Staff were very helpful, efficient and friendly. Our checkout day was Monday morning and the elevators were exceptionally busy. We waited 20 mins with our luggage to get in the lift so make sure you are not checking out in a rush!! Overall decent hotel if you are looking for a base during your visit.

title: Fine
text: Everything is was fine, room small and the bed felt short. I know that sounds odd but either it isn't a king size bed or it was rotated 90 degrees.  I am 6 foot 6 and my feet were at the end of bed and head hitting the top.

title: Midtown stay
text: This wasn’t my first trip to New York, but the most ‘uptown’ I have stayed, & loved it. Being quite central on Manhattan, we walked to & from many sights. It’s only 3-4 blocks to Penn Station, & 28th st subway, so you can get around quickly using that as well. Rooms are compact, as are most NY hotels, but it was clean. The lifts are a bit slow, especially at checkout time when everyone wanted them..but not something that would deter me from staying here again.

title: Disappointed
text:
This hotel is otherwise average but it was plagued by elevator issues during my stay.  There are only two elevators (staff and guest use them both) and several times during my stay one was out of service.  Two elevators for such a tall building with so many rooms is insufficient on its own, one elevator is unacceptable.  It appears that this issue has been going for some time based on other reviews. I took to the stairs several times in stead of waiting what could have been 15 plus minutes to stand in a cramped over full elevator.  The stair wells were unkept as well because there were service items in the stair well like old room service stuff and other things, probably because the staff couldnt clear it away given one elevator.  
Also, in spite of my request to face the back of hte hotel to avoid street noise they did not accommodate this even though I got there at 2pm and reiterated the request (already in my reservation) and waited till after 8 to get to my room which in the midst of the elevator mayhem was facing the front of the building and the street with all the noise that entails.  In light of the elevator problems I decided to just stay put and not inconvenience myself with a move the next day to another room.
The room was on the small side as is common in NYC.  Comfortable bed.  Somewhat worn out in places.  
Id probably not return to this property, certainly hope they can sort their elevator situation out because two working ones is already underserving, just one working is unacceptable. If it was fixed and consistently working, this would be ranking of three of five.

title: Great Location
text:
The stuff are great, the loction is also very good, there is a self parking near the hotel with great price for this area (no in & out).
the room is good clean and comfortable.
wifi is free for members and work good.

title: Very nice accomidations & service
text: Was welcomed at the door and had a great stay all the way through my  visit. Would definitely stay at this hotel again. Conveniently located, parking, internet, front desk, room service, all were excellent.   My colleagues had the same experience.

title: Hated this hotel, small and noisy
text: Stayed one night and moved.  Loud, small, old, cramped,honestly nothing good to say about this hotel.   We stayed here because I am a Hilton diamond member and I had free rooms with my points, but it wasn’t worth it.  Yuck, it was terrible.

title: Average at best
text: Small rooms coupled with poor decision by hotel management to service elevator each evening despite overflow guests gave a mixed message...are guests more important or staff? Don’t expect many surprises unless you like mediocrity or mild disappointment.

title: Friendliest Staff
text: I was very impressed with the friendly staff at the Doubletree. Everyone said hello when I passed them and was eager to assist when I needed help or appeared lost. The location is very convenient as it is a nice long walk to Time Square and shows and quick trip to Penn Station.

title: Note, only two elevators for this tall hotel
text: This tall hotel only has two elevators.  This is a challenge when both are running, but really frustrating when one is out of order, as it was during my stay.  There is a very small lobby and limited open space with small bathroom vanities.  So, don't expected much elbow room.

title: Happy Family
text: This was a family trip - it was great. We were welcomed & processed quickly. Staff was very friendly & very helpful. Location was fairly centralized for our plans, most places were within walking distance. Breakfast menu was great!!!

title: Buena ubicación, mala calidad para un Double Tree by Hilton
text:
El hotel esta muy bien ubicado si lo que quieres es pasear en Chelsea, Meatpacking, Soho, etc. El hotel no tiene nada que ver con las imágenes que publicita la marca. Las habitaciones son super chicas, apenas cabíamos con dos maletas grandes. El hotel huele a humedad y las alfombras se ve que no las han lavado nunca! El desayuno es malo- mala calidad de los alimentos. El elevador tarda años en subir y bajar porque son veinti tantos pisos y solo 2 elevadores viejos. Un día no hicieron la limpieza de la habitación y ni siquiera pidieron disculpas. 
Vale la pena pagar un poquito mas y quedarse en un mejor hotel.

title: Disappointing Doubletree in chelsea
text: The hotel is older and in need of renovation. The carpets need replacement as they were dirty and very thin. The room had broken drapery and a broken morrow. The entrance to the hotel had debris bins piled high with trash and lines. The rooms are extremely small and the AC is very loud.

title: Would never stay here ever again
text:
I went there for a weekend in the big apple with my wife.
The first impression I got was bad, they only have 2 elevators for a 27 story building, so be prepare to be waiting at least 5 minutes every time your are going to your room.
The rooms are tiny, I know that is normal in New York, but for the price per night I was waiting for a little more. 
In the morning one of the elevators was out of service, and I had to wait 20 minutes for the one working to arrive, and it was full, so I had to wait 15minutes more!

When checking out I forgot the valet ticket, I told  Bianca (girl at the front desk) that I was very late for my flight and I needed the ticket asap, but she didn't pay me attention and decide to take care of another customer before letting know to maintenance so they can pick it up, I told her again and she didn't care and was very rude and respond with and attitude.

title: Nice Hotel but a better staff
text: Typical New York City Hotel. Small rooms but very clean. The staff was great especially Harrington the concierge. He was a great resource and never steered us wrong on anything. He is a great asset to the facility. Thanks Harrington for everything!

title: Brilliant !!
text:
Firstly .... why people Moan about this hotel baffles me! The beds are Amazing, the room was clean, hotel staff were friendly and it’s in the best location. We stopped here for six nights over thanks giving and were located in room 2002. We had in total four suitcases and I don’t travel lightly. There was more than enough room for my 6.2f fiancé and myself to move around the room. Yes okay there isn’t enough room to throw a party but we were there to visit New York. The hotel room itself had good amenities. There is a hair dryer in the room which was good. The coffee facilities were fab as you could take the coffee with you as the hotel provided take away cups. I am definitely recommending this hotel. 

For anyone put off by the negative reviews don’t be. We had a brilliant experience and if I go back to New York I would again stop here

title: Hotel sujo e velho
text:
EN: Disappointing! From the photos here and other sites they published and for being the Hilton network I made the purchase thinking it was a good hotel. The room was not cleaned (they only picked up the trash, set up the bed and cleaned the bathroom sink), the torn towels, the sheet was torn as well. There were stains of dirt and rust on the stall, the air conditioner was probably never sanitized. The lobby of the hotel was dirty too. It was very expensive to stay in relation to the quality of the hotel. The only positive point was the reception (friendly staff) and the location, although not the best, but that also depends on the point of view of each according to their interests.

PT: Decepcionante! Pelas fotos aqui e em outros sites por eles publicados e por se tratar da rede Hilton fiz a compra pensando ser um bom hotel. O quarto não era limpo (somente recolhiam o lixo, arrumavam a cama e limpavam a pia do banheiro), as toalhas rasgadas, o lençol também era rasgado. Havia manchas de sujeira e ferrugem no box, o aparelho de ar condicionado provavelmente nunca foi higienizado. O lobby do hotel era sujo também. Foi muito cara a hospedagem em relação a qualidade do hotel. O único ponto positivo foi a recepção (funcionários gentis) e a localização (perto de tudo), embora não fosse das melhores, mas isso depende também do ponto de vista de cada um conforme seus interesses.

title: Worn and dirty and noisy location. Not what you expect for a Hilton Doubletree.
text: This hotel looks nothing like the photos you see on line.  Location is very noisy and a bit seedy. Rooms are incredibly small and housekeeping leaves a lot to be desired.  First and last vist for us for sure!

title: Hoyel double tree by hilton chelsea New York
text: Nous avons réservé une chambre dans cet hôtel à notre arrivée nous avons été surprises par la petitesse de la chambre. Néanmoins nous n y allions que pour dormir. La literie est confortable le ménage est fait tous les jours il y a des petites attentions telles que des sachets de café ou de thé et de délicieux cookies donnés à la réception. Le personnel est agréable le concierge s est montré au top pour notre départ.  Nous n avons pas utilisé le restaurant de l hôtel car nous partions en visite le matin tôt. Hôtel très bien situé.

title: Very clean, updated and confortable
text: We were in town for a show and this hotel was located perfectly in relation to the theater.  Very convenient to get around and short distance to main attractions. The staff was friendly, hotel and room were very clean and confortable.

title: Happy in NoMad
text: The NoMad area is booming and this hotel puts us at the center of the action. It is a lovely hotel and has become our destination of choice when we make a weekend getaway in the city. New restaurants seem to open weekly in the neighborhood and it is walking distance from our favorite jazz club, Jazz Gallery.

title: この立地とヒルトンブランドでリーズナブル
text:
オフシーズンながら、マンハッタン中心部でダブルツリー・バイ・ヒルトンというのにツインで一泊100ドルちょっとと、同日程の他のホテルと比較しても非常にリーズナブルな価格でした。
チェルシーでの活動のために選びましたが、ペンステーションやエンパイアステートビルからも歩ける素晴らしい立地で、朝食はコンプリメンタリーのブッフェでお粥やフルーツなどもあり、むしろ他のヒルトンよりも満足できました。
航空会社より当日朝の結構連絡、臨時便への振り替えとなったため、深夜到着となりましたが、レイトチェックインに快く対応していただき、またホテルの外ですれ違ったフロントマンには私の名で声を掛けて貰いました。
スタッフの全てが終始フレンドリーで気持ちのよい対応をしてくれ、今後定宿にするつもりです。
近隣には24時間安心して出入りできるデリも多く、アジアの味が恋しくなればコリアンタウンまですぐ、中長期の滞在にも適していると思います。

title: GREAT AREA
text: Great area away from the crowd. Good prices. Great breakfast. People was nice. Good hot breakfast. Great internet. Quiet area. Has exercise room if you want to work out. Free cookies and water when you check in.

title: No tiene nada bueno! Way below in category!
text:
La experiencia devuelta a cambio de pagar 200 usd por noche, pesima. 

El hotel esta muy bien ubicado, pero las instalaciones... vaya! Pesimo! Parece que esta en un hotel de 5ta! Apesta literalmente todo el tiempo en todos los pasillos y lobby, a basura o a cloro como hospital. A trapo sucio. 

Hay 2 elevadores para abastecer 26 pisos. Naturalmente, para bajar de algun piso, tardara en promedio 10 minutos. Igual para subir. A tal grado que se aglomera gente en el lobby. Mas de 20 pax. 

El buffet es pesimo. El huevo es hecho de los que vienen en polvo y sabe a rayos. Las salchichas y tocino dan asco. Solo hay 3 cereales y jugos, ademas de eso. No hay mas. Pesima calidad. 

Los cuartos son muy chicos y no corresponden con las fotografias del sitio web. Apenas cabe la cama. 

Fácilmente podría ser un hotel en Queens de 50 usd por noche, no uno en la 29th Street y 6 Ave en Manhattan. Pesimo. Cero recomendable, fuera de la ubicacion.

No tiene nada que ver con un Double Tree by Hilton. Es un hotelucho adaptado y de mala forma. Solo es el nombre. 
Se escucha todo el ruido entre cuartos y pasillos. Todo!

Huyan!

title: Lo mejor, la ubicación
text: El hotel está bastante bien, aunque nuestro cuarto era un poco chico y había olor a humedad.La gente de recepción es muy amable. Sin lugar a dudas, lo mejor es la ubicación, ya que desde allí es muy fácil moverse hacia cualquier lado.

title: Centrally Located
text: Upon arrival guests are given warm cookies. It’s a welcoming touch. The room was extremely small for two double beds, otherwise it was clean and adequately stocked. Insufficient elevators for the amount of floors.

title: November stay
text: Great value for room. Lobby is very cramped and long lines to Great value for spacious room. Cramped lobby and long lines to use elevator. Steps to fitness center look dilapidated. Overall friendly and attentive staff. Happy with stay.

title: El Empire en mi ventana!
text: Me encantó!! Bien ubicado. Muy limpio. El personal súper amable y dispuesto a ayudar. Free WiFi muy bueno. Tuve la suerte de tener una habitación con vista al Empire y eso probablemente haya sesgado mi opinión con respecto a este hotel. Las habitaciones son un poco chicas, pero quien va a NY a quedarse en el hotel? Miles de lugares cerca para comer. Subte cerca. De noche la zona es un poco solitaria pero nunca volvimos antes de las 12 y no tuvimos sensación alguna de estar en peligro. Suuuper recomendable, salvo que estés buscando un hotel de súper lujo...

title: Worst elevator system in the world
text: Such a shame. Great location. Friendly attentive staff. Clean and reasonably priced.  However there are only two elevators and it takes forever to get down as all elevators are stuffed full. A total turn off.

title: Excellent location for business travel (and Vaca) in Chelsea
text: Nicely tucked away from the lunacy that is midtown Manhattan, yet close enough that you can walk to many NYC attractions.  My room was small, which I've come to accept as "NYC normal", but was very clean and well appointed with all the amenities a modern traveler needs.  There are plenty of good restraint around, so you'll be fed well...

title: excellent location
text: Hotel has an excellent location.  Room was small, which is the norm for NYC hotels, however room was very clean and well appointed with all things needed for a great business stay. There are plenty of restaurants within walking distance from the hotel

title: My Overnight Experience
text: This hotel is in a prime location and walking distance to Macy's, Time Square and eateries. The double room was small but the bed was comfortable and the window view was nice. The staff was friendly and helpful. I would stay at this hotel again.

title: Loved the hotel EXCEPT ...
text: I love the Doubletree brand, and the staff here are awesome.  But ... they have the worst elevator system I've used, and with over 200 rooms, the pain was evident.  That's my only complaint - otherwise great stay!

title: Excellent
text: Enjoyed the stay, good place, friendly staff. Suggest others consider staying there.  Had everything we were looking for and needed for our stay.  Cookies upon arrival and upon request were outstanding.

title: Great location
text: The hotel is right in the heart of New York. Getting about is really easy as there are stations close by and lots of Uber/Lyft rides in the area. I also had a room with a view of the Empire State Building. Value for money and the service is great! I’d recommend it and will be back next time I’m in New York.

title: Comfortable hotel in a great location.
text: I got to the hotel after 10pm by taxi as it seemed the easiest and quickest at that time of night from La Guardia.  I was staying with my adult daughter in a twin room, which size wise, was more than adequate.  The room had a safe, iron and board, great coffee making machine which I made good use of and Crabtree and Evelyn bathroom amenities.  The bedding was comfortable and the pillows were beautifully soft.  Clean, comfortable and functional.  Near Penn Station, Macy's, Empire State Building.  Good mid priced hotel midtown.

title: They need new bedding
text: This hotel is nice, it’s in a good location, and it’s affordable. (We paid around $350 per night.) The rooms are tiny, but that’s no different than any other hotel in the city, so I don’t hold that against them. Since this hotel is very central, we were able to walk to a lot of places which was nice. The main issue we had was the bedding. We have stayed in tons of Hilton family hotels, and the bedding is always nice. The sheets are soft, the duvets are fluffy, and you feel like you can really relax in the beds. These sheets were old, and not as soft as usual, but the worst was the duvet. It was situated between two sheets, which is fine if the duvet seems nice, but it was stiff and if you held it up to the light you could see that only about 10% of each square had anything in it. We slept horribly. I know it’s just one problem, but for me it’s kind of deal breaker to have bedding that is overused, and worn out. We probably wouldn’t go back to this hotel.

title: Dirty
text: The people were nice...But...Dirt was coming out of the heater, the room was not cleaned, and the drain in the tub didn't work. So overall, I cannot recommend this hotel. The minimum requirement is a clean and functional room!

title: Good location
text: Good mid-town location. Typical tiny Manhattan rooms, very clean, comfortable beds, free cookies and water bottles daily. Staff is excellent and extremely helpful. Natasha at the front desk is outstanding!  She was friendly, efficient and very helpful with directions and suggestions of places to visit and to eat.

title: Great Location
text: Only stayed one night here but this was a quiet, clean place to stay. I loved being in the flower district and it was close to many famous attractions. The staff were very friendly and helpful. Overall it was a great stay.

title: A short stay - but pleasant
text: Rooms were small, and I am more accustomed to the NYC expectation for a room.  But I found the front desk to be pleasant and helpful when I was making a mad dash to drop my luggage before dropping off a rental car (with only a few moments to spare). I would return

title: Atención muy buena
text: Fuimos en enero 2015. Se nos había cancelado el vuelo por lo que dimos aviso y sin ningún problema cambiaron las fechas y el monto. El hotel es muy confortable. No incluye desayuno. La zona tranquila y linda, al límite con midtown!

title: Small Rooms But Very Good Staff, And Improper Booking Practices
text: Diamond member booked five consecutive nights for one king with high floor. Booked with government rate since working on public project. Arrived at 2am to ground floor two queen bed no view. So much for honoring Diamond status. But it is this property's practice to overbook and bypass respecting guests confirmed and prepaid reservations, and so redirect the unlucky guests to a sister property, rate not honored at transfer either so take your risk booking here. Rather invest in your reservation being respected at the Millenium across WTC. We switched hotels due to the greedy business practice of this property to overbook and not help cheated guests. I would have given one star for this practice alone but the hotel was saved by its excellent bellman, Duane. He saw me crying in hallway about this stuff and stopped to be human with me and make a proper apology on behalf of the hotel staff, so the injury from disappointment at check in did not stay on to ruin my visit to New York City.  Duane saved the day, and Jennifer at front desk made amends by comping a free night because it was wrong to shortchange paying guests their promised room, especially Diamond member! Some other things.... the internet is a little slow, it's hard to get cell phone signals sometimes, and the breakfast is best changed out for points.... if you have HHonors, go for the points and not the breakfast as the breakfast is basically prepackaged foods released from saranwrapped boxes and put under hot lamp where other guests cough. Rather find a bodega or diner. Plenty around. Um, otherwise excellent location. And again, Duane saved the day as did Jennifer.

title: Another Great Doubletree!
text: Great Stay at the Doubletree this time in NYC.  Always happy to be in one of the Hilton Properties.  Easy access to everything I needed to get to and from in the city.  I'll definitely stay here again the the future... hopefully, the NEAR future!!  LOVE NYC

title: Tiny rooms, run down, cluttered hallways
text: Tiny rooms, run down, cluttered hallways. Room had water stains on ceilings and walls. Always vacuums, dirty laundry or housekeeping carts and items in hallways. We were their 4 days and always housekeeping stuff in tiny hallways. At least the cookies are good.

title: Very Disappointed
text: This hotel is in serious need of upgrades. You would think a Hilton would be great...think again. Rooms are old and tiny, hallways smaller, and elevators a mess. There are only two elevators for 30 floors.... it takes forever to get up and down in this place. Breakfast was a small buffet and they charge 30 bucks. Too many great NYC hotels to stay here

title: Worst hotel ever
text: This was the absolute worst Double Tree hotel I have ever stayed in over the past 20+ years. The customer service at the front desk was horrible. There were always lines waiting to meet with the one front desk attendant. If there were other staff that were supposed to be at the front desk, I never saw them. The elevators were extremely slow and very small, which meant people were always waiting in lines to grab an elevator. The lobby looked like a college dorm lobby. The hallways to the rooms were gloomy and depressing. The carpets in the hallway and in the room felt and looked dirty and grimy. The overall experience was horrible. I will never stay at this hotel ever again and will advise my family, friends, and colleagues to avoid this hotel at all costs.

title: Great location for MSG / Penn Station
text:
A standard friendly hotel with really easy access to NY Penn station / Madison Square Garden area - Pretty much what you'd expect for a classic Doubletree Hilton Hotel.  I felt the pictures on the website are reflective of what you get.  About ten rooms per floor, with approx 25 floors so tall and thin hotel, modern style.  I don’t think all rooms are the same size on each floor, from looking at the corridor layout, but can't confirm that.  My friend said her room was small, I thought mine was fine - (I was given a wheelchair accessible room, so it may possibly have been larger?) - I was in a standard queen bed room.  I've stayed in much smaller rooms in NYC, so I thought this was a relatively ok size. For anyone in a wheelchair, you could have wheeled all around the bed and into the bathroom and the entrance to the room was at an angle and seemed slightly larger and switches and plugs were at a sensible/accessible height.  I counted 16 plug sockets from standing at the end of the bed!  I don't know if this was specific to an accessible room or all rooms?
My room was located at the back of the hotel - very quiet/zero road noise - my fave location!  Air conditioning efficient and not too noisy. Quieter than many I’ve experienced. No complaints at all about room noise. 
The room was nicely decorated in a sort of latte coffee color - pleasant but not too bland with a patterned wallpaper behind the bed. The bed was comfortable with nice white sheets, firm mattress. Room had a coffee maker, safe, ironing board, wardrobe and chest of drawers, desk and a full length mirror as well as a large mirror above the desk. There was space to store a suitcase without falling over it.
Bathroom had a shower curtain and a seat, for easy access. Bathroom nicely decorated, granite counter top. Small amenity bottles, included hair shampoo, conditioner, body lotion, plus a bar of soap. Plenty of towels and hand rails for convenience.  Not much space for a wash bag, ok for a small one.   My room and bathroom were both clean - no housekeeping issues at all.
Check in was very friendly and I was given a cookie and bottle of water upon arrival. I was even able to check in early which was great. They were really doing some nice decorations for Halloween which was fun.
There’s a surprisingly decent restaurant out the back. It opens out into a sort of frosted glass conservatory so is light and spacious. Breakfast, whilst not cheap ($23 for omelet and coffee and toast) was good.  Work booked me the room, so price was not an issue regarding breakfast!  Staff were really friendly in the restaurant - efficient good service, plus they were happy for us to sit and chat and not rush us!  I can't comment on any other meals apart from breakfast.
I did notice late at night, we had to use our room key to access the foyer. There were staff if you'd not checked in, but it meant no one could just walk in off the street - so an additional safety feature.  
Only thing I didn’t like, as the hotel is tall and thin, you may wait a while for an elevator and they did tend to stop at nearly every floor.
This one ticked all my boxes for a standard, comfy, decent overnight stay in NYC. Would be happy to stay there again.

title: Good location for my workshop
text:
I chose this location as it was less than a block from a 3 day workshop.  It was pricey, but it is in a good location for Times Square (although I did not go on this trip).  The staff was very nice and I did not have issues with them.  

The first night, I was so exhausted, I ordered room service, which is pricey for what they provided.  Ordered the turkey burger and is was horrible.  The fries were good so that helped.  The service was good as well.  They did check up.

The hallway at times smelled musty.  There were a few stains on the desk and lamp shade I noticed.   The biggest issue I noticed after a while was that the smoke detector had been removed from the room.  I did alert the front desk to this issue. 

I was only there two nights, but I would stay again.  The cookies are so good!

title: Great week in NY
text:
Ottima Location, in pieno centro che consente di muoversi benissimo. Avevo una stanza al 26mo piano con vista empire!! AWESOME.
Fantastica colazione!!! french toast, pancakes e muffin e molto molto altro.
stanza piccola, ma funzionale (come tutte le stanze di NY)
OTTIMI i cookies offerti quotidianamente  in reception.

title: Terrific location but with several disadvantages.
text:
This hotel has a very small footprint which means the rooms are tiny, corridors very narrow and only a handful of rooms per floor. That also means it goes up 27 floors.

The rooms are tiny and if you had to spend any amount of waking time there it would be very claustrophobic. The corridors are very narrow and the decor is scruffy. Carpets in the hallways look dirty and in need of a refurbishment.

The beds are very comfortable with quality linens and nice pillows so a good nights sleep is very easy. Rooms are clean with good amenities as you would expect from Doubletree.

One draw back of the narrow property and high floors is that the elevators , of which there are two of them, are also small. The wait for an elevator can be a long time especially at peak hours and also trying to get down from the lower floors ( 12 and under). I waited through four elevators before giving up and walking down 8 floors. That would not be possible with luggage so allow for extra time when checking out at peak time especially if you have a flight to catch.

The location is excellent - close to good shopping and attractions but far enough away from the chaos of Times Square.

Overall good Hilton service and standards but with very small rooms and long waits for elevators.

title: Disappointed by lack of cleanliness
text: We stayed at this hotel in the suite for one night on a family visit. The staff was professional and courteous at check in and on the phone. The entrance to the hotel was not clean and gave a bad impression of the hotel as we walked in. The airconditioning vents were dirty and needed cleaning. Room service was for three and only two orders were brought in and one had the bacon missing. Staff was courteous and corrected that in about 20 minutes. He had to take the stairs to bring back the food because an elevator was broken at that time. Overall we are deeply disappointed with our experience at This Double Tree.

title: Puts the brand Hilton to shame. Beware!
text: One of the most disgusting hotel experiences i have ever had. We booked the Hilton via booking.com for a stay in September 2016. I had booked the hotel room a few months in advance at a great rate and was really pleased. Unbeknown to me that week of our stay coincided with a visit from the United Nations so a lot of the hotels shot up in price. To add, I have had a booking.com account for years and I have never had a problem. We arrived in NYC to not only a lot of traffic at 9pm but in the middle of a bomb that had been detonated in Chelsea. Luckily we managed to get into the hotel and when we got to check in, I was told that the room had been released because they had tried to call me during the day as they had incorrect card details and because they'd couldn't get through to me (as I was on a plane I tried to add) they cancelled the room. I however, had no texts to say i had missed calls nor did I have any emails like they said they had sent me. On top of this, all the hotels were sold out and the receptionist did NOTHING to help locate us elsewhere. After a long flight, we weren't even offered a glass of water. After over 2 hours on the phone to booking.com they managed to find us another hotel, but due to the bomb, we had to walk 4 blocks with huge suitcases at 1am in the morning, the hotel did nothing to help. On arrival at the Morgan we told our bell boy what had happened and he apologised on behalf of a hotel that he doesn't even work in and said he would never work for Hilton as they "do this all the time." He said Because the room rate had  gone up due to the UN visit, they cancelled my room so they could get more money for it. It was "standard procedure" for that hotel. During my holiday I had also booked a Marriott in Philadelphia using booking.com - so I called them to double check all was okay, and what do you know - it was! They took payment from my card no questions asked - there was nothing wrong with it at all. I have never known such appalling customer service from such a renowned name. The hotel next door were the ones that told me to call booking, the Hilton did sweet FA. Literally nothing. Be careful. I have also stayed here before which is why I rebooked and the rooms are outdated so beware. I just chose it again because of location but there are nicer, friendlier hotels in NYC to stay in.

title: Fantastic Hotel
text: Just fab. Room luxurious (to me anyway!)comfortable,spacious for NYC. Location amazing-tourist attractions within walking distance and subway station just around the corner. Lots of shops and restaurants on doorstep - bakery and takeaway pizzas very close by when you need some chill out time in the hotel (didn't try restaurant -menu looked nice if a little expensive) Staff friendly,welcoming and very helpful - always offering cookies and bottles of water to my little boy😊. Lifts x2 -we didnt experience any long waits. We loved absolutely everything and won't bother looking for any other hotel next time!

title: Spring cleaning needs to take place
text: It is a shame the rooms were dirty not cleaned right and the elevators had the smell of garbage there was garbage down the fire escape and overall disappointed. Restaurant had a B rating which means this is also not clean. I felt uneasy a woman had her bag stolen out front.

title: Hotel is dirty
text: I checked in Oct 6th and reported later in the evening that their was no hot water. I was told engineering was working on the problem but could not resolve the issue. I was told that they had to call in an outside plumber the next morning to get the problems fixed. The rooms are dark and outdated and the hallways had a terrible smell. I was not a happy camper during my stay. The restaurant was B rated and the meals were cold and no prepared well during the morning at 7 am.

title: Clean and comfy
text: The staff at the DoubleTree Chelsea was very welcoming, friendly and helpful. The room was clean and comfortable. Like all New York hotel rooms it was a bit small, but didn't feel cramped at all. And we had a view of the Empire State Building.

title: Poor Hotel
text: Location is good and restaurant staff and Bell Staff are great but front desk customer service is bad. Room was not ready until 4.30pm.  Room is not cleaned. Will not allow late check out pass 1pm even with Hilton Loyalty Program.

title: Amazing overnight experience!
text: My sister in law and I wanted thank you again and let everyone know about the wonderful stay we had at the Double Tree Chelsea last weekend. We received the most amazing service from Natasha and Harrington. They could not have been more welcoming!  Upon check in, we inquired if our room had a view. without hesitation Natasha processed an upgrade that had become available. Needless to say we had a terrific view of the Empire State building. The accommodations were spotless, modern and roomy, Natasha also provided us with 2 drink vouchers so we could experience the hotel lounge. There we enjoyed delicious Coconut Margarita's for happy hour and got a little tour of the dining area from Harrington, who could not have been more kind. When we arrived Harrington handled our bags and very thoughtfully offered directions to shops, restaurants or taxi service. He was always there, during our stay,  to offer his assistance before we even asked, which was very much appreciated.  Thank you Natasha and Harrington for being so thoughtful. We appreciate your outstanding service and look forward to coming back very soon,

title: Amazing Stay, Great Location!!!!!!!
text:
What can I say a great stay. The trip was due to me turning 30 so when I booked the hotel I asked in the message box for a room facing the Empire State Building. I didn't get that but instead I got a room facing the One World Trade Centre tower which was still just as good. It was nice at night seeing it lit up. 

On arrival I was given the free chocolate and nut cookies I read about and they were really nice. The hotel kindly provided me with a free breakfast certificate and drinks coupon because of my birthday which was really nice of them. 

The room was nice. A little small compared to other hotels in America and this size I would expect in Europe but as I had done my research about standard hotel rooms being smaller in New York, I was not surprised. 

One concern I did have before the stay was about the lift as I read that it could take a while for it to come up and down with their being only two. That was true. There was about 27 floors and 2 lifts and I was on the 26th floor so it did take a while for the lift to come up and vice verses when I was coming back to the hotel it took a while for the lift to come down. Do be mindful that in the mornings the lift can stop a lot. I swear one morning the lift stopped about 10 times before getting to the lobby. 

The location is amazing, only being a few minutes away from Penn station which is a great hub for travelling on the subway to the rest of New York. I was able to travel with ease to a number of different places such as the Yankee Stadium, the Statue of Liberty, Brooklyn Bridge and the 9/11 memorial museum. 

I did initially want to stay in Times Square but now I am glad I stayed in the area I did and this hotel. Along with being near Penn station, Madison Square Gardens is next to Penn Station which was perfect for the Garden tour I booked and also the concert I was attending. Macy's, Victoria's Secret, Sephora and a whole bunch of other shops are nearby.

There are plenty of choices for food nearby too. Yes there were about 3 Mcdonald's and Starbucks within 15 minutes from the hotel but there were other places to eat such as Parnera, Brother Jimmy's and Panda Express. 

I would definitely stay in this hotel again and recommend anyone else to.

title: Nice stay
text: Nice, clean, well appointed hotel. Room was quite nice. Bathroom could use some shelves for guests to store stuff. I loved that they had gluten free cookies available as an alternative to their standard complimentary cookies they give at check in.

title: GREAT LOCATION!
text: We found that the location was perfect as it was walking distance to Madison Square Garden and the Empire State Bldg.  We were pleased to find out that the subway location was only around the corner so very convenient when it was time to visit the other major sites!

title: nice place to stay in the center
text: the hotel is very well located, walking distance to Times Square, Penn station and the bus terminal) highly reccomend going to the "Wicked" show, also walking distance. the hotel itself is nothing unique, but the receptionists are very nice and its quiet inside. the bed is comfy) what else do u need in New York?)))) i ordered room service once - not good food... but the cookies they give u while checking in are delicoius. there is a local bar right in the building, on the left from the hotel

title: We would stay here again for cookies!!
text: We loved our stay here. The staff at front desk are all very friendly and helpful. The highlight was actually the walnut and chic chip cookies that they give you! They are baked freshly and taste divine! My children loved them! The fruit infused water was great! Room was small for 4 of us but enough! and clean. There is a macdonalds very close by so that was hand. A lot of homeless people sleeping around the hotel on the streets. I would absolutely stay at this hotel again.

title: Good hotel for a couple of days
text:
We stayed for 3 nights in a King bedroom. The bedroom itself was on the small size, but it is NYC so that was to be expected. There was a huge king size bed which was honestly the most comfortable bed I've ever slept in. This was the best part of the hotel stay for us.

The hotel was close to Chelsea and had a subway station close by. The street outside the hotel wasn't very well lit at night however, for those walking back after being out late (not the hotels fault obviously).

The hotel itself is a little dated, especially the very small reception area downstairs, while the bedrooms could do with updating also. It was however very clean and the housekeeping service was faultless. We didn't try the restaurant so I can't comment on that.

All in all, I would recommend the hotel for a night or two, if only to try out the amazing bed!

title: not that bad I must say
text:
First of all, yes the room is small and a bit old but can't really complain.
