The street is so so with some odd people at night hanging outside but you are in the middle of everything.
Good wifi for free but the breakfast costs more than 20 dollars ???!!!!! (I think actually 22 + taxes) hello?? this is far too expensive, sorry...
I could not hear any noise from the street but as the hotel is old, you can hear all other guests doors and talk from the hallway.

title: Parfait pour nous
text:
Personnel très sympathique et serviable, le cookies chaud en signe de bienvenue est un délice.

Les chambres sont assez petite, mais bon c'est juste pour dormir.

La literie est bonne malgré que les lits ne soit pas fort large, 140cm.

L'hôtel est bien situé, Subway à proximité.

Times Square à 10min à pieds ainsi que l'Empire State Building, celui ci est visible dans certaine chambre.

title: Hidden fees!!!
text: Don't be fooled! We had a 1pm checkout from the 27th floor. The elevator took forever which was fine but when we reached the desk, a very rude attendant had already charged me 50% of the room charge for a late check out! Also, no parking offered! This cheap, crappy room cost me over $500 for one night. You're going to get screwed on cost! Save yourself the trouble and book a luxury hotel where it's at least worth the extra money!

title: 8 night stay
text: We booked this via Expedia in July 2017 for an 8 day stay for the end of September into October with a Empire State Building view. On arrival we met by cheerful and very helpful staff who made sure we had cookies and water. Our room on the 20th floor had a good view of the ESB but be aware it's between 2 other buildings. As views go it's pretty good. Our room had 2 double beds a smallish robe, tv, and bathroom with shower and bath. It is not big, for the 4 of us it was a squeeze especially with our luggage, this I think though is synonymous with cities like NY. Close to 28 st and Penn / 34 st stations, and has loads of various food outlets nearby and a good coffee shop opposite (Luna). Personally I thought it was good especially the staff. The bar shuts at 11pm, quite early for the city that never sleeps though. Recommended

title: Enjoyable stay
text: I only stayed one night and to be honest it was by accident that I stayed at this Hotel and were it not for the fact that mid week prices out priced me for the next night I would have stayed here for my second night. Instead I stayed elsewhere not related to the Doubletree and did not enjoy it at all. I would have much rather stayed at this Hotel for another night. It was comfy, clean, I could see the Empire State Building from my window and it felt safe as a single person.

title: Fabulous location, brilliant hotel
text: My husband, myself & our 2 year old stayed here for a week. I emailed the hotel in advance advising it would be my husbands 30th during our stay. As we checked in we had a complimentary upgrade to the suite on the 21st floor. The room had a bathroom, living area & bedroom. We requested a cot for our daughter & one was brought up immediately. The hotel is in a fabulous location about 10 minute walk from times sqaure, local to a subway & plenty of places to eat nearby. The room itself was very clean & was well maintained during our stay they have coffee facilities & a fridge in the room which was very handy with us travelling with our daughter. I would highly recommend this hotel. The warm cookies that are given upon check in are out of this world we also got extra through our stay which was nice after a busy day walking around NYC. There are water machines on a few floors to refill water bottles which was also very useful. We really enjoyed our stay here.

title: Excellent location
text:
Small rooms as expected for central NY location but enough space for multiple large suitcases. Excellent shower. Windows that open to allow fresh air and a very responsive air conditioner. 
Lifts small and almost very trip downstairs required a wait for another lift as so full. 
Location was fabulous, close to everything, excellent cafes and restaurant within very c,one walking distance.

title: My home away from home...
text: I love the Doubletree Chelsea for two reasons - convenient location and amazing staff.  However, the rooms are a little bit shabby and in need of upgrading.  That said, the staff consistently makes my experience wonderful - they take great care of me.

title: NEVER STAY AT THIS PROPERTY FOR YOUR SAKES
text: Being in the hospitality business (owning a couple hotels), this must be the worst property Hilton has branded.  This is my first time reviewing another hotel property, and felt the need to do so.  Who else would feel comfortable being moved to another room with 20 vacuums being parked in the corridor for storage.  Dirty vacuums that being.  My first room smelled worse than the fitness center honestly, wet towels and a mix of chlorox fresher.   Everything from the broken tv, broken blow dryer, broken mirror, peeling frames, terrible front staff and mishandled situations, I will never risk staying at another double tree and maybe Hilton in NYC.

title: Good location, comfotable accomodations
text: Hotel is located between 6th and Broadway with some nice restaurants in the area. Front desk staff is very helpful. Found a great Italian restaurant at 29th and 7th.   Rooms are small as expected. Beds are comfortable, clean bedding. Carpets need to be cleaned. Bathroom door in the way of using the sink.

title: Decent Hotel but overpriced
text: Room was very small but clean and practical. The lobby was dirty, crowded and loud. Not enough elevators to service all the floors/customers which meant waiting up to 5 mins for an elevator at peak times. Location is good though.

title: Great location, good price for this standard in NYC
text:
The hotel is perfectly located within a 15 minute walk to Times Square and Empire State Building. Also a block away from a subway station and not far to Penn station.
As with most New York City hotels it is a lot more expensive than what you pay in most places for this standard of hotel, but for NYC it isn't bad at all.
The hotel itself is clean and fairly basic, but has everything you need for staying in New York. The front desk were helpful when needed.
Overall, the hotel is ideal for a few nights stay in New York as a tourist.

title: Nice, clean hotel at a fair price
text: Spent one night here.  Room was small but clean and well laid out.  The bathroom had a great shower and lots of light.  The staff was very friendly and helpful.  Hotel location is ok.  Not really in the heart of things but you're in midtown so you can get anywhere easily. (And you could see the Empire State Building from our window!). I'd go back.

title: Excellent location and great value for NYC
text:
Stayed here for 1 night.

Location is perfect, a 10 minute walk from times square, 5 minutes from Penn station and 2 minutes away form the local subway.

The rooms are small but you have to expect that from a NY hotel, unless you are willing to splash out for the space.  If you are looking for a place to stay while sightseeing, this offers excellent value for money for a basic but comfortable room.

The staff are amazing, I felt welcome from the moment I walked in to the moment I left.

Highly recommend staying there.

title: Very old
text:
We stayed here for over a week. Overall the rooms were very disappointing.  Very dark and dingy and the carpets were really really old and stained - definitely need to be updated.
We paid extra and got a suite which was a little better - especially when you are doing business and need to be in the room doing reports etc. as this has a separate lounge desk area. Basic rooms  are very tiny.  No where to put your toiletry bag in the bathroom, only on the floor.
The staff tho were amazing and very helpful and friendly, top marks to them.
The location of this hotel is great.  If you just need a room to sleep there is nothing wrong with it.

title: Basic hotel in NY
text:
Pretty basic hotel in rather loud area of town. Rooms are clean and comfortable. Restaurant n BA onsite. I liked the free water and cookie at check in. Service was friendly, coffee maker in room. 

Rates were higher than what it is worth but city was full.

title: Terrific hotel and a great NYC value
text:
For NYC, the price and the rooms are terrific, particularly if you book one of the King Suites (shocking amount of room, at least for New York). The beds are really comfortable, and many of the views are terrific. Even better, the staff across the board is incredible. Really friendly in a genuine way and everyone goes out of their way to help, whatever the need. 

Also, the location is terrific. You can walk any direction and easily get to where you might want to go. There is a wonderful local coffee shop, with food, right across the street - Luna Coffee (excellent!) and in a block radius, a great deli, a local burger and pizza place, a 5 Guys burger, etc. 

Ultimately, the *great* staff, a comfortable bed and pillows, excellent location and a very reasonable price for NYC make this can't miss.

title: Great location for the Garden, nice hotel
text: Location is awesome for the Garden. Rooms are a bit small (but this is NYC) but very comfortable and quiet. No view to speak of. Good overall service. Valet was responsive and quick. Would stay here again.

title: Good location, bad customer service.
text: Overll nice hotel if you want to be close to Soho and the Village.  However the customer service is terrible.  If your a Diamond member you may not want to stay here because they do not treat you any differently. In addition, the manager was rude about a key for my guest.  Overall rooms were clean though.  If you don't mind front desk customer service and want a clean room in a good area then this place might be ok for you but don't expect good customer service.

title: First experience at Double Tree
text: Bad internet, goes away every day and very hard to login. Especially no good for business traveler. Not helpful to provide us a larger room when we were 3 adults and 1 infant although I tired but was ignored in spite been a member of Hh, CAA and a tour operator/travel agent. They should realize it themselves so the stay was too tight and uncomfortable.

title: Taking a Bite of The Big Apple
text: My stay was overnight as I traveled from Philadelphia for the Eric Clapton concert. From the staff to the room itself, it was a wonderful place to stay! Everyone was friendly and made me feel right at home. The room was absolutely spotless. I highly recommend this hotel to everyone. Excellent!

title: good except for their best price Guarantee program
text: The Hotels Best Price Guarantee is a scam. By the time they investigated my claim the cheaper prices on the website that I had found had risen (overnight) and therefore they did not honour my claim. Other than that it was a pleasant stay.

title: Great Service
text: Very central location, helpful staff , always smiling and service oriented. Breakfast was simple but fresh and tasty. The Hotel was a few minutes walk to the Empire Estate Building, had many good locations around like the High Walk to the Chelsea market.

title: Small older rooms in convenient location
text: The rooms are small and there's really not much room for luggage.  We had 2 carry on size suitcases, 1 briefcase and 1 backpack.  1 suitcase was able to sit on a rack that took up the space between the bed and the wall.  The other suitcase had to sit on the desk.  There was no where else to put anything.  It was a stretch to say room had view of Empire State Building.  It did if you went up to window and looked out to right you could see it.  Room was definitely worn - Knicks and dents on walls and mirror in bathroom.  Comforter between sheets on one of the beds had a brown stain on it.  Elevators are small and somewhat slow unless at non-popular times.  Would not stay here again unless no option.  Room was relatively quite.  Convenient to Penn Station, Empire State Building, Macy's, etc..  Friendly staff.  Breakfast / Bar area is quite small.

title: Good location
text: The property need some updating especially the hallway, it smells. It also an eyesore when they stuck the bins of used and clean linens and towels in front of the hotel. I know that space is very limited in NYC especially to this location but they need to do something. It makes look and feel that this property is one of those cheap motel. The lobby also need some updating and decorating.

title: Conveniently located hotel; very friendly staff
text: We enjoyed staying at the Doubletree on 29th St because we could walk everywhere we wanted to (Central Park, 5th Avenue, Empire State Building, Times Square, Intrepid Sea/Air/Space Museum, HighLine, Chelsea Market, Macy's and other shops, cafes, subway stations, etc.)  The staff was very friendly and accommodating, the bed was super comfortable, and the chocolate-chip cookies at check-in were deeeeelicious!

title: The room
text: It is a very nice place to stay and yes I would come back here again. Only I would change would be the bed mattress need to be just a little harder. The price for breakfast is not worth it. Go out the front door to your left half down the block on your left is a very nice breakfast place and it is cheaper and you get more

title: Excellent value. Good location
text: Situated on West 29th St was OK. It is a 20 min to half hour walk to Time Square but close to Empire State & Madison SG. Great free cookies at reception every day. Lovely rooms but a little small. Worth the money. The staff were really helpful, especially when explaining how to get around the subway. One Metro card. Load it with $50 and you can scan through each family member and then yourself!

title: Texas 2 FIT
text: Third stay at this location. Central to my activities . Accommodations are grea. Room was upgraded being A Honors Member. Colors and granite a nice touch. Bedding and pillows gave a great nights sleep. Love those cookies

title: Good location, value and service
text: The hotel is well located, priced and clean. Digital Key is perfect. Love it. Staff very welcoming. There are 2 slow elevators, so patience needed. Around the corner, there are shops and billion restaurants. Very close to High-Line. I recommend this hotel.

title: can do better
text: too many things, just look for another place to stay. bathtub chipped really badly, all outlets dont charge phones, cancelled my reservation but the rest of my group was fine. only 2 elevators for 28 floors-long waits in the morning. rug had rolls that i tripped on looked dirty but didnt smell

title: Not Bad
text: Hotel was centrally located to all attractions. Room was a good size for New York spaces.  Staff was friendly and helpful.  Only problem I had was the sour smell in the bathroom all three days we stayed.  The maids came in and "cleaned everyday, but still the smell.  Lysol ans a new shower curtain would help, no windows and exhaust system not great.  But over all, not bad.

title: Great Hotel
text: I love staying at DoubleTrees! After flying for hours, the warm cookie at check-in melts your problems away. The two bottles of water for Hilton Honors members makes life that much easier during your trip. The room was exactly what I needed; a clean, comfortable, safe, quiet place to stay at night with a way to make tea in the morning. The breakfast was delicious and convenient. The staff were incredibly friendly. I would definitely stay here again.

title: Parfait pour nous
text: Nous avons passé 3 nuits à cet hôtel. Le personnel est extrêmement courtois et sympathique. Malgré la petitesse de notre chambre, nous nous sommes très bien accommodé des 2 lits doubles. Avec la vue sur l'Empire State building, c'était parfait pour nous. Nous aurions apprécié un frigo par contre, mais encore, la chambre ne nous servait qu'à dormir et se laver donc je ne considère pas ça comme un point négatif. L'hôtel est très bien situé avec un accès facile pour se rendre partout sur l'île. Pour nous, c'était parfait!

title: Ottima soluzione
text:
Abbiamo fatto un'ampia ricerca, essendoci già trovati a Manhattan due settimane fa nel quartiere di Wall Street (albergo deludente e tantissimi soldi spesi in taxi).
Per il nostro ultimo giorno a NY e ultima tappa del viaggio abbiamo optato per il centro, che però ha prezzi scandalosamente alti con poche eccezioni. Tra i meno esosi, a 129 dollari a notte ci siamo conquistati una king in questo Hilton che, seppure probabilmente lontano dagli standard Hilton come ce li immaginiamo (ma anche il prezzo lo è!) è carino, pulito e dignitoso. Inoltre è centralissimo. La stanza che ci hanno assegnato non è poi tanto piccola (le valigie si aprono entrambe contemporaneamente e resta lo spazio per passare) ed è piacevolmente arredata. 
Se non avete un maxi budget e siete in 2 va più che bene.

title: Noisy 2nd Floor
text:
Stayed here recently with my husband and son in the final days of our tour around the US. Great location for getting to all the usual places that you would want to visit, although I did find the situation of the hotel a little run down and upon entering the hotel, the reception is a little dingy and could do with updating and the rugs need a good Hoover.  The reception staff are very courteous and friendly, however, when checking in, alarm bells did begin to ring when we were informed that we were on the 2nd floor and the chap behind the desk apologised, letting us know that no other rooms were available! When we arrived at our room by the elevator, I could see why the apology was made, as we were greeted by roughly 15 hoovers, which left us a little bemused.  When I popped to the ice machine, it was apparent that we were in fact next to where the cleaners keep all there items to clean the rooms, hence the hoovers.  Come the following morning at roughly 6am we were all woken up by the "charge of the Hoover brigade" it was so noisy with cleaners talking to each over walkie talkies, slamming doors and moving hoovers.  I've never stayed in a hotel where rooms are next to the cleaning utility room, perhaps it is not the best idea to have bedrooms situated in the same area.

On a positive note, although the rooms are small, I found our bedroom really cosy and the bed was remarkable...bit of double glazing or soundproofing would be advantageous when rooms are on the lower levels as the outside noise can be clearly heard unfortunately.

Avoid room 208 if you can.

title: A fuir.
text: Hôtel a fuir. Séjour d'1 semaine 2 adultes et un enfant. Le seul point positif est le personnel qui est à l'écoute et très sympathique. Chambre avec lit trop petit impossible de dormir confortablement a 2 adultes. En ce qui concerne le ménage ils changent les serviette tout les jours et c'est tout !! Les lits sont seulement refait les draps ne sont pas changés l'aspirateur n'est pas passé pour une chambre avec moquette c'est pas le top, très poussiéreux et humide, de plus les équipements ne sont vraiment pas digne d'un hilton nous venons tout les ans a new York et c'est le plus mauvais hôtel que nous avons fait, les chambres ne disposent pas de frigo ni de lecteur DVD ou de station d'accueil pour iPhone et literie très moyenne. Très déçu nous ne reviendrons pas.

title: Nice and convenient
text: I stay at this location because of business. It is centrally located near MSG.The staff is very good. You are greeted warmly and they are attentive to any issues. Stay at higher floors to reduce street noise but it is New York City after all Elevators are a bit slow but overall the hotel has all that is needed for a stay

title: Muy buen hotel precio/calidad
text:
Nos hospedamos en agosto. El hotel está muy bien ubicado, son muy amables en la atención. Incluye un café a la mañana para lo cual te dejan la máquina y en conserjería retiras un cokie por persona. En verano en el lobby hay limonada para servirse.
El desayuno me pareció caro U$S 21 más tax 
29 street es un poco oscura de noche pero caminamos cerca de la madrugada y no tuvimos ningún problema
Por lo demás todo muy bien

title: Convenient, clean, great staff
text: Convenient to Penn Station and Madison Square Garden.  Clean hotel with helpful, friendly staff.  Wi-fi was a little slow, but useable.  Fruit infused water available in lobby. We walked back from a show at Madison Square Garden at night and felt comfortable walking in the area.  Highly recommended!

title: Great place to stay
text: Centrally located with easy access to Penn Station. The hotel service was impeccable and the front desk was very welcoming.  The neighborhood is walkable with lots of tasty restaurants and bars nearby.

title: First time stay in New York City.
text: Hotel perfect for what we wanted, clean, tidy, pillows very comfortable and accessible to everything. The staff at the front desk were helpful especially Natasha, she knew anything you asked her and was very happy to help and go above and beyond. The concierge on the other hand did not seem to know very much about tours as he made out because several things were wrong for timings and he was not very clear with the details. One thing I would say is that I wish they had thought about putting more than 2 lifts in a building when they were building the place which has 27 floors, when staff and guests are trying to use them all at the same time it is not very quick and we were staying on the 21st floor so would not have been walking down, but felt like it when we had waited and it had taken 10 minutes to get to the ground floor.

title: Poor front desk services
text: A/C not working well. Asked for an extra blanket 4 times during 4-night stay but was totally ignored. Also asked for a plastic comb three times. Of course, it was ignored. Front desk staff were not particularly friendly. However, restaurant staff and housekeeping staff are fairly friendly and helpful.

title: review of Hilton Hotel in Chelsea, New York
text: My family stayed here for a wedding this week and the staff was extremely helpful. The room is small but hey, this is NYC. It was clean, modern, and very comfortable. In fact, the bed was one of the most comfortable I"ve slept in in any hotel. Breakfast can be included or purchased for an up charge and looked very appealing and delicious. We had a private brunch at the hotel which was lovely.

title: In town for a few days for business
text:
This is not a four star hotel. It's living on its Hilton name but it certainly not to the standards of other Hiltons I have dated in 
Room size : Small 
Waste disposal garbage area : outside the front door 
Lifts: only 2 for 27 storeys 
Staff: do their job well but hear complaints on room size every day .
Price: for the price I paid I could have done way better and have done way better in New York in the past . 

I give two stars 1 is for location and the second one is because I didn't want to give just one as hilton have served me well in the past. I looked back on the reviews on trip advisor. It would not be anyway possible for anyone to give this hotel 5 stars . ( this kinda worries me) 

My suggestion, look elsewhere unless you get this place for less than $120 bucks  a night including all taxes and and charges.

title: Natasha!!
text: Natasha was organized -made everything ready and easy.kind -prepared -she held the wedding party /family together!! She had an answer to every question -and no question was too much!! Clearly she loves her job

title: Ubicación inmejorable con buen precio
text:
Segunda marca del Hilton, sin grandes lujos.
Más que suficiente para in hospedaje que sólo utilizamos para dormir.
Me tocó piso 9 contrafrente, muy silencioso por suerte.
Personal de recepción muy macanudo. Siempre agua fresca saborizada disponible en el hall.
La habitación era limpia y más grande de lo que esperábamos. Con gran pantalla de tv con canales en español y cafetera-tetera gratis y caja fuerte. El baño perfecto con inodoro muy alto, ja.
Wifi gratis.
Para la vuelta ellos mismos nos pidieron un transfer al JFK con un chofer 100 puntos por 75 dolares totales y además le di 15 de propina  Tienen un interesante transfer en coches privados hacia el aeropuerto, muy interesante de precio, sobre todo si sois varias personas.
Lo mejor: la ubicación, cerca de varios subtes, 4 lineas mínimo a uno o dos minutos caminando. 
Lo bueno: cerca de muchos locales de primeras marcas de ropa y electrónica. Cerca para comer de Pret a Manger, Five Guys, Wholesale Market y otros lindos y baratos lugares para comer.
Lo malo: 
Inherente al hotel: entrada al hotel con muchos tachos del lado izquierdo que afean la fachada.
Ajeno al Hotel: situado en una calle muy sucia, sobre todo saliendo para el lado de la séptima avenida.

title: Fun time in NYC
text: My wife and I came to New York for simple fun. We met with old friends, saw the taping of the Late Show, and saw two shows at MSG. The hotel was in a perfect location for us and everyone was great. Cookies were awesome a D they had fruit infused water in the lobby.

title: Friendly staff
text:
I booked two rooms at the hotel for my family through booking.com. On arrival the receptionist was really friendly and added the booking onto my Hilton honours number. 
We had first floor rooms, a King size bedded room and a double/double twin room. Both rooms were very clean.
Although the hotel is not near to a tube stop, Imperial Wharf over ground station was opposite. There was also a Tesco Metro opposite the hotel. On weekdays it was also possible to get the water taxi into the city.
We had breakfast each day which was good. The staff were very good at ensuring all food stations were clean and the buffet food well presented. 
The only downside was on our second day there, our room was not serviced. I rang reception who sent someone with a clean towel. Once she saw that our room had not been cleaned, she sent someone to do that. We told her not to worry - we had just needed the clean towels, tea and coffee refilling and our bin emptying. There was also a slight mix up with our bill on leaving the hotel. We had been overcharged and once the supervisor had seen our original booking paperwork; she gave us the refund and it was sorted.
Overall it was a good place to stay.

title: Well kept secret
text: The hotel is located perfectly for midtown access. The view is great. The room was clean and the bed was great. The staff is phenomenal. The restaurant and bar were welcoming and offered good choices.

title: Pay a little extra
text:
Stayed here for 6 nights in July with my partner and my 7 year old son and although the rooms were spotless and the staff were fabulous (my son particularly enjoyed free cookies everyday) the place is shabby, dark and run down.

Definitely recommend the walk to Times Square as it's within 25 minutes with fabulous views, photo opportunities and also passing Macy's. Madison square gardens is within a 10 minute walk and Empire State within around 5.

Recommend if you're not bothered about decor as we spent hardly anytime in here. Fab location 

If you're thinking of going on one of the bus tours please barter with them as we only paid $50 dollars for the 3 of us! Particularly recommend the night time tour as the views are absolutely immense! 

On a Friday the Natural History Museum allow you to give a 'suggested donation' this is anything from 25 cents! 

On a Tuesday the 911 let out a certain number of FREE tickets - you can find this information out online

title: Near city centre
text:
Good:
Location, excellent service and breakfast (e.g. porridge and fresh fruit), effective aircon in room (altough dusty), great wiews from upper floors.
Not so good:
Rooms are small and have quite dirty carpeting, occasionally poor wifi signal in room (at least Hilton-wifi).
Only two lifts in 27 storey building.

title: New York City- Chelsea
text: Excellent location-close to subways and walking distance to many sights.  Has rooms with 2 double beds which seems rare in  smaller NYC hotels.  Front desk staff was friendly and helpful. Reasonable price for NYC.

title: Parfait !
text:
Après tous les avis négatifs que j'avais pu lire, j'étais assez inquiète. 
Notre séjour de 16 nuits a été parfait !
Literie très confortable, chambre propre et suffisamment grande pour un séjour en vacances (vous êtes à NY, pas dans une ville de province), sanitaires nickels. 
Le personnel très aimable, toujours arrangeant. 
J'avais demandé une chambre en hauteur, j'ai eu le 17ème étage avec vue sur l'Empire State Building ! Superbe !
Cet hotel est idéalement placé : Times Square, Empire State Building, Flatiron, Madison Square Garden : tout à pied, proche de l'hôtel !
Et le métro est dans le même bloc (28th St)
Concernant les ascenseurs (beaucoup se plaignent de leur lenteur), nous ne l'avons vraiment attendu longtemps qu'une seule fois ! En 16 jours ! 
Et N'oubliez pas que ce sont souvent les gens mécontents qui laissent des commentaires !

title: La posizione
text: Da scegliere solo per la posizione in cui si trova, vicino all'Empire, a Times Square, alla 6 Ave e alla fermata della metro. La nostra stanza era da 4,  piccolissima e composta da 2 letti "matrimoniali" (più piccoli dei nostri italiani) di cui uno era appoggiato al muro così che uno dei due occupanti poteva scendere solo dal lato dei piedi, il bagno vecchio e con la cornice dello specchio "gonfiata" dall'acqua nella parte inferiore. Non avevamo nemmeno lo spazio per appoggiare i bagagli

title: Great Location
text: The Doubletree by Hilton Hotel in Chelsea is a nice place to stay.  The location is within walking distance to the Empire State Building as well as 5th Ave.  The area surrounding the hotel is safe to walk in at night.  The street was a fairly quiet street.  There is fast food and restaurants as well as drug stores and a grocery store within easy walking distance.  The staff is friendly and helpful.  I asked several questions about different sites and they answered me cheerfully and quickly.  Our family of 4 stayed in a room with 2 queen beds.  It was very small.  There is no closet but does have a small armoire.  The bathroom has no place to store toiletries.  We were on top of each other with little room to navigate the entire stay.  I did expect a small room, but it was smaller than I had imagined.  The hotel made up for it with location, cleanliness, and friendliness of staff.  I would stay there again.

title: Gutes Hotel, gute Lage
text:
Zimmer sind recht klein, ist halt Großstadt. Aber sauber und o.k.. Wir hatten eins mit Blick auf Empire State Bildung. Metrostation sehr nah. Drum herum gibt es auch Möglichkeiten, zu frühstücken bzw. Drugstore.
Klimaanlage ist recht laut.

title: Best place in the city
text: Very nice rooms and service. Kathy the front desk manager was so helpful. got the empire state building view. room..will def'ly stay there next time..Nice beds, clean bathroom and AC. well priced for the quality in the city!

title: Great location
text: The Doubletree hotel Chelsea was welcoming and clean and tidy. We walked to all of the places of interest from this hotel, great location. My boys were very happy with their welcome cookies. Thank you 😊

title: Use Different Standards for NYC
text: I guess hotel rooms in Manhattan are going to cost a lot for very small spaces. This hotel wasn't that expensive and it was well located for where we needed to go.The staff was friendly and it was reasonably clean although very dated looking. There are only 2 elevators, and at times, I was grateful not to be on the upper floors. The room was ok - a bit drab and in need of updating. The bed was comfortable, but there wasn't even a little fridge in the room. In the morning, there is free coffee, but it just sits on the bar in carafes, not too inviting or fresh. You have to request decaf if you want that. All in all, it was fine. The people made it better, and of course, the warm chocolate chip cookies!!!

title: Clean, friendly - a yes
text:
The only downside is that there are only 2 (slow) elevators.
The staff was very always friendly-although they had to change the whole bed because I spilled coffee aaaaall over it.
Gym is a bit tiny, but there is a Blink-gym just next street.
The hotel is very close to the Penn station - so sub&train within 3min walk.

title: Close to Flat Iron and Kids Park
text:
The hotel room was small, but that's to be expected from a hotel room in NYC. The staff were very friendly and made my kids' day by handing out the standard Doubletree cookies. So yummy! 

The location was great for us and the staff were helpful as always. We would definitely stay here again. 

As for the hotel room rate - I was able to get a corporate rate through my employer. Hence the reason for my excellent rating on the value question.

title: Inmejorable relación calidad-precio.
text:
Hotel céntrico de 27 plantas, aunque situado en una calle sucia, algo típico en Nueva York.
Es de la cadena Hilton, aunque sin grandes pretenciones ni lujos.
El personal de recepción, muy bien: atentos, agradables y comprometidos, algo que no es muy frecuente en los hoteles de esta ciudad. Te reciben con botellas de agua gratis y sabrosas galletas de nueces y chocolate.
La habitación era limpia, aceptable de tamaño para dos adultos y un niño (dos camas grandes). Están provistas de gran pantalla de tv y cafetera-tetera gratis. Eso si, se echa de menos un poco más de espacio en el armario. El baño, bastante correcto.
Otro dato negativo son las vistas: el lado donde estábamos nosotros, da directamente a la fachada del edificio de enfrente.
Cuando salgáis por las mañanas, pedid en recepción agua y galletas y os las darán encantados cada jornada.
El wifi es gratis y funciona correctamente, aunque no "vuela".
Tienen un interesante transfer en coches privados hacia el aeropuerto, muy interesante de precio, sobre todo si sois varias personas. Nosotros éramos 6 en total, y nos pusieron un cochazo todoterreno de 8 plazas, con un chófer hispano, súper agradable y profesional. Creo recordar que fueron 120 dólares en total. Una ganga.
En definitiva, hotel muy correcto y agradable, a precios estupendos, dado lo extracaro que resultan en Nueva York. 
Muy recomendable sin duda.

title: Would stay here again!
text: The staff were amazing! From the front desk to all service personnel. Everyone was knowledgeable, courteous, prompt and presentable; all with a smile. We were traveling with a friend who is currently a part of the Hilton honors program. As of our arrival, we were not a part of the program but because of our tremendous service and the benefits that the staff extended to us because we were traveling with a member, we signed up for the program during our stay. When visiting the NYC area we will always stay at this location.

title: A Refreshing Respite from the Heat of the Day
text: As always Hilton provides the little amenities that make you glad you chose them :) I had arrived in NYC amidst an air quality warning and an extreme heat warning. It was 95 with a heat index of 105. I was wilted and exhausted from travel and business and the hotel staff were pleasant and helpful. We got to our rooms to find they were already chilled to a delightful 68 degrees and help was offered with our bags! All the staff were friendly, and checking in was fast and we were back out to dinner in less than 20 minutes after arriving! That's the type of service I've come to expect from Hilton, consistent and quality.

title: Great value in NYC - even better location!
text:
I stayed at the Doubletree Hotel in Chelsea for 3 nights with my sister.  There were no major issues at all.  Anything we asked for was accommodated.

The hotel room wasn't excessively spacious, but good enough to get our bags in and still some walking room.  The washroom was also completely functional and clean.

The front desk and concierge were all very kind and always willing to offer advice/recommendations in the city.

Also, the maintenance staff must have been some of the most pleasant people that we have ever seen.  Every time one of them were in the elevator, they were always sure to hold the door and greet us very kindly.

The best part about the Doubletree Hotel in Chelsea must have been the location!  We felt that we were always just a few subway stops from anything north or south that we wanted to see, which was perfect!

Overall, great stay and would consider the hotel again and/or recommend it to others.

title: Gem in the City
text: Location is great. The roooms are clean and well maintained, the staff is attentive, and great wifi! Hotel is relatively small so it doesn't suffer from the chaos of many larger hotels. Easy access to the subway.

title: Solid NYC value
text:
Stop reading right here if you are looking for a huge room, expansive lobby, and bells and whistles.  Regular rooms are small, but efficient.  Very clean, coffee maker, hair dryer iron, decent a/c.  Of, and of course warm cookies 😉

We chose this hotel for it's proximity to penn station.  Came in via amtrak, about 5 minute walk!  Nice when u have a little luggage.  Close to attractions and transit.  Tons of restaurants, with varying prices for every budget, within a block or two.

Everyone from checkin, to checkout, maids, etc., super friendly.  Bathroom, decent size, good water pressure.  

Here's some random prices for nick nacks we needed.
Luna coffe shop ( across street) large ice coffee...4.25.
Duane reed (1 block away). 
20z soda...2.19
1 liter h2o...1.99
Famous Amos cookies 8 z...2.99
1 gal generic h2o...1.39

So in general, decent pricing.

Will be back!

title: Great service, perfect location
text: This location was very close to everywhere I needed to be for my business trip.  I checked in via the app and used the digital key. I completely bypassed the front desk for checkin, during and checkout.   The bar has great service and cheesecake.   The breakfast was hot and fast each morning. I'll definitely stay there again.

title: Super comfy bed
text: I chose the Chelsea part of Manhattan area because I travel with my kids.Compare to Times square are. The place is not so loud. Their bed is so comfy. You can sleep all day on that bed. The rooms are very clean. And also the Room attendants did a good job of cleaning our room too. They also give complimentary chocolate chip cookie upon arrival.

title: New York City
text: This was my first trip to NYC. this hotel was in Mid Town. In walking distance to lots of attractions such as Empire State Building, Penn Station, Madison Square Garden. Grand Central Station and Rockefeller Center. Time Square was about a 10 min walk. Stayed in room 401. Clean great A/C. Loved the cookies.  Make sure you are Hilton Rewards member to get some water bottles and WiFi. Hotel Restaurant was great too - reasonable price for NYC. Breakfast was also great - ordered off the menu. So Glad we got the NY City Pass for discounts on attractions. Only downside was parking - about $30 a day with hotel discount and no Pool.

title: Familyvacation
text: Great location. Short way to shoppingareas, markets and restaurants. But it was a small room for four people. Recommend kingsize bed if you travel with older kids. The staff was ok, but not so helpful when we needed a cab to the airport.

title: Do Not Stay Here
text: This hotel is listed in the Chelsea area; that is a stretch. Area around hotel is dirty and under massive construction. The King Room has barely enough space for 1 person; two people cannot move around the room at the same time!

title: Personal de recepción inepto.
text:
El hotel está muy bien situado y muy limpio. El Centro de negocios y el patio resultan muy útiles. Las habitaciones y los pasillos son ridículamente pequeños y esperar el ascensor puede ser una odisea. 
El personal que atiende la recepción es inepto. Éramos un grupo de 15 personas, formado por cuatro familias. Fueron totalmente incapaces de organizar las habitaciones por familias e incluso cobrar cada habitación a la familia correspondiente o emitir un recibo al nombre de cada uno. Y por supuesto, muy mal educados cuando nos quejamos. Nunca me había encontrado con un personal tan desagradable y poco cualificado en un hotel.

title: Extremely disappointed for a Hilton
text: Stayed here for a week for our wedding anniversary. Daytime hotel staff was rude and surely. Nighttime staff was excellent! My room was on the Honors floor, was extremely small, room 2206, and did had a tiny view of the Empire State Building. My sheets had holes in them, the towels were threadbare, and my coffee pot was broken. My room was not cleaned for 5 days. Although I reported the sheets and coffee pot, no one did anything to remedy the situation until day 5 when I was persistent and in their face at the desk. Sadly, the manager never contacted us during our stay even though messages were left for him. As for the location, I was fearful every night going back to the hotel. Very sketchy area of town. I was not happy with this hotel or our stay here. I would not recommend it.

title: Good base for exploring
text: When we arrived I thought the lobby was very tired and disappointing as is the outside area. It wouldn't take much to sort this out. However the room was very good, comfortable bed and pillows. Decent bathroom. Staff all polite and helpful.

title: GEM on 29th Street
text: For the price, the location, hospitality at the front desk, this is the best.  Yes, it's a lil small, but this hotel has it all. Water and cookie when you check in,  elevator right there, FOR those travelers who can't wander around huge hallways and foyers and lobbies, this is perfect.  STEPS from everything.  No reason to stay anywhere else.

title: rapport qualité/prix parfaite/tres bon séjour
text: 7 nuits passées dans cet hotel.rien à redire.les chambres sont un peu petite mais propres,le menage est fait tout les jours,la literie est trés comfortable,le personel agréable,lles petits dejeuner sont trés bon et copieux,de plus il beneficie d'un super emplacement entre la 6 eme et la 7 eme avenue.je recommande cette adresse.

title: Perfect and convenient location to all NYC attractions
text:
We had a great stay at the doubletree hotel. Upon arrival we were greeted with very helpful staff and a yummy warm chocolate cookie. The rooms are not massive but we have stayed in NYC before and the room size is pretty standard. 
The hotel is central to all the attractions and you can easily get a taxi right out the front or take the subway just one block over. The taxi cost us $15 to get to the top end of Central Park and $15 to get to battery park.

title: Great experience
text: I traveled to NYC from 6/30-7/2 and it was a great experience. The hotel was centrally located to everything (about 2 blocks from Penn Station, close to the Empire State Building, Manhattan mall, many other shopping and food choices). The staff was all extremely friendly and accommodating. Absolutely nothing to complain about.

title: Best hotel near Madison Square Garden
text: Everyone at the hotel from start to finish we're great friendly accommodating. They hotels location was great. Oh yes those cookies were amazing. The restaurants breakfast was satisfying and made for a great start. We will stay here again.

title: Great Place to stay and wonderful staff.
text:
“Great place to stay”
Reviewed 2 weeks ago
This was a truly wonderful experience.The hotel let me extend my checkout time to 1:30 PM. I check out at 12 PM. The staff were wonderful with a smile always. Breakfast was good and the food was just delightful.

Stayed June 2017, traveled as a couple
Value
Location
Sleep Quality
Rooms
Cleanliness
Service
Review collected in partnership with DoubleTree by Hilton 
Helpful? Thank 95caesara
 Report
Ask 95caesara about Doubletree Hotel Chelsea - New York City

title: Bon emplacement, bon hôtel
text: Nous cherchions un hôtel pour aller voir un spectacle au Madison Square Garden (MSG) à Pâques. Malgré la période, le prix était correct (cher, quand même, New York à Pâques oblige). L'hôtel est construit en hauteur (un peu comme une tour). Les chambres ne sont pas très grandes, mais confortables et propres. Il est bien situé, on pouvait se rendre au MSG à pied (5 minutes). Il y avait aussi, presque en face, un petit café (Luna Coffee Shop) fort sympathique avec du vrai bon café et ce qu'il faut pour un déjeuner rapide avant de partir visiter. Les ascenseurs étaient un peu lents (vu que construit en hauteur, tout le monde les attend), nous avons donc opté pour les escaliers à quelques reprises pour descendre.

title: overprice
text: please do yourself a favor and stay away from this and thank me later.. outdated , rude staff , horrible room conditions , location is convenient but you can stay in other hotels close to this and have a better experience

title: Best place to stay in Chelsea
text: Wonderful hotel.  Delightful staff!  My favorite place to stay in New York!  Front desk staff is super friendly - in the best possible way.  Harrington (valet) takes wonderful care of your car (if you drive) and your luggage.  Rooms are super comfortable and quite large for New York.  I sleep better here than I do at home!

title: Bien situé pour visiter
text:
Hotel très bien situé dans chelsea. Tout est accessible à pied ou en taxi. 
Équipe très sympa et pensez à leur demander conseils !ils ont de bonnes adresses. 
Notre chambre était un peu petite pour 4 avec les valises, mais pour le prix et le temps passer dans la chambre, c'était pzrfzit et propre.

title: Great location, rooms are very very small.
text: Noisy AC, did not go lower than 75, small. We lived out of our suitcase. Slow elevators, only two, and they were not always running. The rooms need to be remodeled. The air quality and dirt visible from the filters was gross.

title: Please upgrade
text: For safety, please upgrade your elevators because you have a 27 story hotel packed with guests and you have 2 tiny elevators that are slow and one was non functional when I was there. Also, the internet was slow. Location was convenient, though, as it was near everything worthy to see in Manhattan.

title: Friendly staff...small rooms
text: I had a double room on the 4th floor.  Room was smaller than what I normally stay in NYC.  Everything was clean and bed was comfortable.  Some of the furnishings are starting to look a little dated but are well maintained.  I was on a work trip so not in the room a lot but no problems with noise around my room.  Ate in the on site restaurant one evening and food was pretty good.  Wait/bar staff were attentive.  Easy (prob 15ish minute) walk to Times Square.  Close to shopping.

title: Centrally located and good price
text: The hotel room is clean and adequate for a quick trip stay in New York City.  The room is small by US standards but still larger than what you'll find in Europe.  You're about five blocks away from the Empire State building about seven blocks away from time square, and also walking distance to Madison Square Garden  so good location to walk around.   Subway stations are nearby, cabs are very easy to get, all using credit cards these days.   There are also a couple really good places to eat nearby one called American whiskey which has incredible Ribs!   The Haymaker Bar and kitchen is two blocks away offering some great craft beer.   The hotel also has a small restaurant inside that offers food services and a bar.  I would recommend staying here and I would stay here again.

title: Helpful staff, very small room
text: Located on nondescript 29th Street between 6th and 7th Avenues, this hotel is well located if you want to be close to shopping, Penn Station and subways.  Front desk staff were helpful and did their best to get me a room before official check in time.  The room was OK.   It was clean but in need of updating and the furniture looked worn.  I found the bed rather soft.  The air conditioner was noisy.  The bathroom was small but satisfactory. All in all it was an adequate stay for the price.  Checkout was quick and efficient but beware the very slow elevators.  There are only two small elevators and at peak check out times you might have to wait, like I did, for a very long time before an elevator with enough space stopped at our floor.

title: Friendly with a twist
text: Very small dusty rooms, clean overall, but you can not get rid of the blowing dusty air from air conditioning unit, which is positioned less than 30 cm from your bed. The outdated bathroom does not add to the appearance. The attitude at the front desk: do I have to to get up, everything they do is presented as a favour, although all staff is friendly. I guess customer service training needs the significant update. Breakfast is without any excitement. Hilton has better options in NY.

title: Very rude staff not helpful. General Manager was not available on weekends and my entire stay GM should not work in hote
text: I made prepaid reservation arriving on June 9, 2017 and paid $984+ Upon arrival, desk clerk advised that they sold my room. I am with my grandkids and late night at 1.30am on June 10. It is New Yourk and with family and at late night and I am Hilton Houners Platinum Member I advise every one not to stay with this hotel

title: Expensive and hard to access working. No vended laundry is available and I was not greeted as a HHonors member.
text: I would not recommend this DBT for future travel needs and would encourage guests to look elsewhere in the market. NYC has an abundance of options and this property really needs to step up its game in a big way.

title: I would recommend this hotel
text: The hotel is very clean, the rooms are not spacious but are very clean and the beds are very comfortable. The staff stands out for me at this hotel. They are all very courteous and always willing to help. Oh and their cookies are fantastic :)

title: Good experience
text: Excellent location, good service, fair prices. Is very close to places of interest, quiet and easy to find. Is a small hotel with everything to please the guests. Try to stay in a room away from the exits doors in order to have a good night sleep. Otherwise, the continuous entrance of the other guests can interrupt your rest.

title: Great place to stay
text: This was a truly wonderful experience.The hotel let me extend my checkout time to 1:30 PM. I check out at 12 PM. The staff were wonderful with a smile always. Breakfast was good and the food was just delightful.

title: Good value.
text: This hotel was a good value for NYC.  We were treated well.  The facility is older but was clean and neat and everything was in working order in our room.  The front desk staff was outstanding.  Breakfast in the hotel restaurant was very good and the wait staff there were fantastic.  I recommend this hotel for budget-minded family travel.

title: Friendly staff and a great location
text:
The room was a good size as was the bathroom. The lighting in the room however wasn't great, made putting on make up a little harder.

The real joy of this hotel is the incredibly friendly and helpful staff. The location is great you can walk to time square and broadway in about 15 minutes. 

Food is cheaper nearer the hotel than further down into times square area.

You get a free warm cookie on arrival which is a lovely touch.

The actual street the hotel is on is not the cleanest, but is much like many side streets in New York. 

I really enjoyed my stay, the room was cleaned well daily and was immaculate on arrival as was the bathroom. 

The subway links are no more than a 3 minute walk from the hotel as is Penn station and maddison square garden. Macy's is close also.

Its not exactly the most elegant hotel but it is still a great stay. I would recommend it.

title: Excellent hotel with friendly staff
text: I have rarely stayed at a hotel where the staff did everything possible to make our stay a special one.  This is not a luxury brand, but the rooms are well appointed, clean, and the bathroom is well designed.

title: Not great
text: Putting Doubletree on my list of hotels that I won't stay at.  The rooms here are small and the windows are small so the rooms are dark.  They only have two antiquated elevators and one of them caused a horrendous rattle which is right next to my room.  Thankfully they shut down that elevator at 9:30 pm so guests can sleep.  I was hoping to work from my room today but that isn't going to happen. The morning rush for the elevators today was a zoo.  People were lined up on every floor (26) trying to get an elevator that had room - and like us they were extremely unhappy.  It took 18 minutes to get from our room on 18 to the lobby... The hotel could be cleaner too - it's a bit worn.  The lobby was dirty and the phone took precedence over those of us waiting in line to check in.  Won't be back --

title: Great Front Desk staff. Rooms are too small and worn.
text: The rooms are too small and the bathroom is so small you have to close the door to blow dry your hair. The carpet in room was dirty, shower had rust stains. I took pictures. I will not be back to this hotel.

title: Value stay
text: Bed and room were nice for the price but updates are needed.  Nicer but more expensive hotels out there.  Lobby area is not exciting so don't plan on hanging out at the hotel bar. This was great for extended stay.   Plan to go back in the future.

title: Equivalent to motel 6 rooms. BAD!
text:
Copied from my survey. 

Fix the bathroom in room 1101. The sink mirror was held together by black duct tape. The tap wore of and exposed the whole inside lining of the middle. The toilet handle completely popped out of the socket when the toilet is flushed. When we requests a move, we were assigned to 807 where to bathroom fan vent when Turned on for more than ten minutes would produce a high volume Screech. Internet wifi was extremely slow and didn't load anything for us so we had use cellular data. I always advocate for hotels while my sister prefers air bnb, and sadly this hotel proved her right. My last four hotel stays were with Hilton, and I can say I am extremely disappointed. The elevator maintenance issue was terrible. Every elevator ride had to exceed the max occupancy allowed which had everyone packed like sardines. Only one out of two elevators working during morning hours for a 20+ story hotel is terrible. The staff however were nice and professional.

title: Double tree Chelsea un ottimo hotel
text: Un hotel a chelsea molto comodo con un eccelente servizio. Pulito e silenzioso specie se vi assegnano un piano alto come e successo a me. L'hotel dispone di una piccola palestra di connessione internet e di un innovativo servizio di chiave digitale. In pratica si scarica un app grazie alla quale possiamo aprire la porta della stanza con il telefonino. Occhio a non far scaricare le batterie !

title: Small but Mighty!
text: We had a good experience at the Doubletree in March 2017.  We stayed here on the front end of a spring break trip.  The city had just received a foot of snow, and the hotel did a great job keeping the property and the sidewalk clear for people to walk safely.  The front desk people were so friendly and helpful.  They even gave my mom and me two free comps for a breakfast buffet one day.  The buffet is awesome, but it's pricey normally.  There are a lot of great delis and food options around, if you don't want to pay for that.  Our room was small, but the bathroom was an accessible one and large.  The only issue is that the bathroom door wouldn't stay propped open, and it always slammed closed.  Also, we couldn't figure out if there was a fan in the bathroom or not.  The bed was comfortable and the pillows were awesome.  Overall, the room was very clean.  Our floor was quiet, but with only two elevators and a very tall hotel, sometimes you had to wait a while for a free one.  The bar had a good happy hour special on wine, and of course, we loved the cookies!  If you want to stay in NYC, this is a good option, especially since it is close to a subway station (just around the corner), and Penn Station is within walking distance.  It had views of the Empire State Building too, although our room did not.  You can't go wrong with this property!

title: Broken Elevator and Small Room
text: My room was much smaller than I thought it would be.  I have stayed at many different hotels in NYC and this room was the smallest ever.  My daughter and I were going to go out for a bite to eat after we checked in.  We waited for the elevator and a man came out drenched in sweat because he was stuck in the elevator for a while.  We decided to be safe and take the stairs.., we were on the 25th floor!!!!

title: Small but adequate
text: Very small boutique atmosphere. Great view of the Empire State Building. Excellent cable channels. Small bathroom I had to move everything off the toilet and small counter to use my toiletries.  Shower and bed were great. Very clean but elevator was horrible. Pick a high floor you'll get on but stop on all floors.  Pick a low floor you might not get on the elevators were very very small. I think I'll stay at a different Hilton property closer to Broadway next time.

title: Check you Bank Statement
text: Make sure when you check out, you tell them without any certainty that you have checked out so you don't get a charged and extra $100 Then demand the hotel removes it immediately and not wait for it to drop off your account.

title: Okay location but needs remodeling
text: A colleague suggested we stay at this hotel with our client.  We were disappointed with how old and tired the rooms appeared.    My room was pretty quiet except for the bathroom fan, and I was able to get to sleep without any issues.  I probably wouldn't stay here again unless they remodel the rooms.

title: I was guest of the Day!
text: OMG.. what fun. I was guest of the day. I got 3 cookies an upgrade to a suite, free breakfast, and an adorable stuffed animal. NO other hotel has ever done that. Thank you Doubletree. I feel so special. You are the best!

title: Buen hotel, buena opcion
text:
Hotel pequeño pero con habitaciones de tamaño justo, muy limpias y con vistas al Empire...
El personal de recepción muy amable siempre.
En mitad de todo y al lado del metro si no quieres andar...
Por poner alguna pega, el tiempo que había q esperar para bajar en ascensor por las mañanas...y es que solo hay dos ascensores para 27 plantas.
Totalmente recomendable.

title: Great Hotel in Chelsea
text: Not much to say.  Great hotel for business travel. Good location, clean and well kept up.  Great breakfast and location.  Staff very nice and helpful.  Close to time square if you don't mind a small walk and Korean town is close!

title: What's that smell?
text: Room was so small one of the three of us had to lay on the bed or go into the bathroom in order to move from one side to other. Greeted by an odor that can only be described as January 1, a combination of urine and throw up. Asked to be moved and front desk staff preferred to argue. Called Hilton corporate as we are Diamond level members and was told that they couldn't help. You choose hotels based on a level of expectation from the brand. This was by far the worst Hilton or DoubleTree I've EVER stayed in or booked. We moved down the block to the Hilton in Times Square.

title: Great location, not up to expectations
text: The location is great, staff very good. Rooms very small and strong bleach smell in room. Hallways were not kept clean. Too bad beacause this is a nice property. We have stayed here in the past and this hotel has an amazing view of the Empire State Building. The staff tries and are very friendly.

title: Delightful stay
text: I was very impressed with my stay here despite some previous reviews. Prompt service, no problem with the elevator, clean room. Everything met my expectations and more. The room size wasn't so bad either.

title: Great location!
text:
We stayed at this double tree for two nights and were pleased. We loved the location as it was so close to Madison square garden and walking distance to times square. 

The rooms and are sized, clean, and comfortable. The staff were courteous and friendly. 

The only negative was that the elevator was a bit slow - the hotel has over 25 floors but only two small elevators.  

Other than that we had a great stay.

title: Staff accommodating, but hotel just O.K.
text: This is an average Hilton. The staff was friendly and helpful. The front desk was happy to find me an upgraded room (I am a Diamond member). The breakfast staff was friendly and obliging as well, although breakfast was just average. The small lobby is busy and anyone can get on the elevator, which I was uncomfortable with because I was travelling alone. They do not have a system that requires your key to be swiped to go up in the elevator. I would have felt better if they did. The room was fine, but not especially clean like other properties. Housekeeping did fulfill my requests (left a tip). It is a good location in Chelsea, but with so many Hilton's to choose from in NYC, I would only stay if found a good deal.

title: Great location, professional service
text: Wife and I stayed here twice, once in October, 2015, and again May 2017, both times for weekend getaways.  Both visits we arrived to a smooth and quick check in, clean room, clean (but small) bathroom, and friendly service both at the desk and the door.  This place is located perfectly between 6th & 7th and 3 short blocks from Penn Station, dozens of food choices all around you.  NYC Doubletree rooms can be a bit smaller than outside NYC, but the great location makes up for it.  Highly recommend especially if you need to be near the trains.

title: Completely positive.
text: The staff at this property was outstanding.  Eager to help and upbeat.  It is a city hotel so rooms aren't huge but ours was very nice, comfortable, clean, and had a view of the Empire State Bldg.  I would definitely stay here again and recommend it to anyone.

title: Business visit
text: DO NOT STAY HERE!! This has by far been my worst Hilton stay ever. This hotel is in major need of renovations. The staff is very nice and accommodating but they alone cannot make up for this worn out, broken, dirty hotel. Had to change rooms three times.

title: Good location
text:
The location was the main selling point for us really. We only had one night left of our trip and decided to treat ourselves in a Hilton. Rooms are fairly small but this is standard for New York really. The one thing I have to say is the windows need replacing! Our room window faced out into the street and it was so noisy I really struggled to sleep!! Maybe need extra glazed windows. The reception were very helpful the following morning,
Stored our bags and arranged a car to the airport for us later on in the day.

title: Good Cost-Benefit
text:
I was surprised with this hotel. Starting with the check-in, where all guests receive a bottle of water and a fresh and warm Cookie!!

By the way, you can ask the receptionist for more free cookies during your stay!

Free internet working well in the room.

All staff was very nice.

Location is also good, close to 2 subway stations of different lines.

The Room has a good size for 2 people and was very clean.

Loved it!

title: Adequate
text:
We stayed for only one night. 

Excellent location.

Check in was quick, the cookies and bottles of water are a nice touch. 

The room was fairly basic and small. 

Bathroom was tiny and poorly ventilated. 

Would we stay here again...doubtful. I'd look for some that cost less as this wasn't worth the extra $$$

title: Doubletree Chelsea Delivers
text: From the staff to the location, this hotel exceed all my expectations. Everyone tried to ensure that my stay was above average. The hotel was very quiet from outside distractions. The grounds staff was always very accommodating. But the best thing about this hotel was that my bed was absolutely comfortable. So comfortable, i missed some meetings just sleeping in.

title: Another nice stay!
text:
This is my second time staying at the Double Tree in Chelsea for work while in NYC.   I will probably stay here again. I have no real complaints with the exception that the bathroom is on the smaller side. The toiletries situated atop the commode were toppling over the whole time. And there was no space to place my toiletries on the sink counter. 

Everything else about this hotel is great: the decor, cleanliness, service, breakfast (they have made order omelette) and fitness area.  Speaking of, the fitness center must have recently been painted as there was a strong paint smell in the room. 

Definitely will stay here again!

title: Bra hotell med nära till det mesta
text: Bra hotell med nära till det mesta.Både tunnelbana och sevärdheter. Bra hotell i centrum till ett hyfsat pris. Små men fina rum med underbara sängar och bra badrum. Bodde på våning 9 och hade ingen utsikt men man ser ju en massa hela dagarna så det spelar ingen roll.Bra frukost inte som hemma men bra ändå.Det fanns ganska mycket att välja på så dom flesta blev nöjda.Bara två hissar och det var kanske lite lite men inget stort problem. Trevlig och hjälpsam personal.Liten mysig bar på hotellet.

title: Great room, great service, convenient location
text: Small, clean room. Very friendly staff, and located near activities and mass transportation.  Great for what I need. I only use the hotel for sleeping and washing up. I do not need a lot of expensive, added on amenities.

title: Excellent customer service
text: The reason why I gave excellent customer service is because it was outstanding customer service I think Hilton needs to recognize the hotel for is excellent customer service.  I will come back to the hotel every time I visit New York and actually give this hotel as recommendations for family friends to stay

title: Girlies 40's Week
text: Nice central hotel and staff very friendly.  Cleaned everyday and free wifi and printing facilities were a big help.  4 ladies stayed in a double twin for 6 nights.  Not the biggest room but was enough for us as we were mostly out.  Would definately recommend if looking for a basic but central base.

title: Disappointing
text: The location is convenient to get around town, but so are most locations in Manhattan. The rooms are dated, worn down, and in need of serious updating. The elevator situation, as others have described, is terrible! In other NYC hotels with limited elevators and many rooms, staff prioritize guests to make sure they're not waiting to get up/down. At Doubletree Chelsea New York, you will be waiting for the housekeeping, maintenance, and other staff to get on/off, and while they hold elevators at random floors before you'll ever get down to the lobby or up to your room. Plan for a 10+ minute wait for the elevators either way, and then plan to be packed like sardines for each trip. A disappointing stay, to say the least.

title: Simple and perfect
text: I am not too mobile and everything was comfortable clean and easy. No long hikes through long halls. Great restaurants and coffee shops nearby  staff was unusually attentive friendly and helpful. Close to everything.

title: Chelsea Stay
text: I understand that there is little room for growth in the Chelsea area, but I was still surprised by how small the guest rooms were. My air conditioner could not be controlled inside the room and seemed to just do it's own thing. For some reason it bothered me that the office behind the lobby counter always had its door open and it was a mess so it gave me the feeling that the hotel was operated in the same general manner.

title: Great staff, mediocre hotel
text: Good location near Penn Station.  Great staff very pleasant and helpful.  Hotel not in best physical shape.  Business center computers continually reboot and get message indicating unauthorized copy of Windows 7.  Room a bit shabby with mirror frame peeling, no suitcase stand, minimum amenities in bath room.  Usually stay at a nearby Hampton inn but tried this for a change.

title: Neat and Tidy little option mid-town NY- great space, service, and chocolate chip cookie!
text: Happy to have stayed here for 2 business trips when I needed a place to get rest before early business meetings the next day, avoiding drive in or train in travel during rush hour.  But forget all that, why am I writing the review? Because they were excellent.  Really.  You walk in, give a name and your credit card, they hand you the key, a brown bag with 2 bottles of water, a delicious chocolate chip/oatmeal cookie (to die for really), and the wifi code.  Whether it's a studio-like room or a full suite with an extra living room/sleeper, you're getting a great deal.  Rooms are immaculately clean, well furnished, towels are actually soft and fluffy (not having bleach washed a million times), and everything just works, hassle free.  I have the choice to stay just about anywhere in the city, but I find myself always gravitating to Hilton, for these reasons.  Oh, and you get breakfast buffet for free, and what a spread!  So if you need more than the free coffee/tea they leave you in the room, you'll definitely enjoy the muffins, bagels, eggs, etc with a plethora of drinks.  What a way to start your day!

title: A Hilton....Really?
text: Our experience was short. The lobby was old and dirty, like the street outside.  Service was OK but the rooms were sad and bad. We had the "Penthouse suite" which had no furniture except for a crappy office chair. No couch, just the bed to sit on.  The door to the bathroom ope ns into the toilet.  Nice design. The furniture was old, very old.  We only were there for about an hour as we got nice rooms at the Eventi and moved around the corner.  The Eventi was an excellent hotel.

title: Disappointing Hilton property
text: Great location for heading out in any direction and very comfortable bed. Also the staff was--for the most part--helpful and friendly. For the price, however, this is ultimately a disappointing place, not at all comparable to other Hilton properties where I've stayed in Manhattan. We had problems with hot water (lack of it, I mean) for three days of our week-long stay. Compensation offered by the front desk: breakfast vouchers (mediocre breakfast buffet, should be free anyway); and a small number of Hilton Honors points (I did receive more when I called Hilton to complain--but it's annoying that I had to make the effort and spend my time on this). The entrance and lobby to the hotel are cramped and unappealing, and we had to walk through clouds of cigarette smoke from the patio beside the front door (still wondering if smoking there is legal, but it looked like the patio tables had ashtrays on them).

title: Terrible customer service.
text: Worst Hilton Honors experience ever.  Don't use you points on this one!!!  I was told over the phone while making the reservation breakfast was complimentary.  I found out the hard way it was not.  I was charged extra upon check out.  There was no hot water.  Took a cold shower.  Place was below expectations.  I wrote Hilton Honors my complaints.  I received no phone call.  It's been a week.

title: Medelmåttigt Hotell
text: Hotellets läge är bra och centralt på Manhattan. Det var nära till Subway och nära till butiker,varuhus, restauranger, Madison Square Garden och annat. Rummen på hotellet är små och det finns inga garderober eller plats för väskorna. Ingen utsikt från hotellet utom gatan. Sängarna på rummen är däremot väldigt bra med en hög komfort. Hissarna på hotellet är två stycken och det kan bli väldigt lång väntan ibland. Frukosten är bra och kan rekommenderas att lägga till om den inte ingår.

title: Doubletree NYC Chelsea
text: An average hotel with average service.  It's close to Penn Station, but otherwise there are other hotels nearby that either offer more for the same price or have better pricing for the small room and average amenities.

title: Hotel Staff - "It's Not My Fault"
text: I booked my room through Hilton Honors and the hotel didn't see my advance payment so put a hold on my card again for the full room charge plus incidents.  When I attempted to get my funds back available, I was basically told it wasn't the hotel's fault and I had to wait 5 days for it to be released - call Hilton Honors.  The issue continued for days after and encountered the same hotel staff attitude - no concern for my issues and it wasn't their fault.  Also had issues with hot water (or lack of) and hotel did nothing to either provide me status or make alternate arrangements.  That free cookie and water is not considered customer service.  While the hotel was clean and beds comfortable, the staff did not meet my expectations.

title: Solid hotel
text: Solid tourist hotel in great location.  Room small but fine.  Everything worked.   Staff was ver helpful.  Elevator can get slow when a tour group checks in or out.   Water temp in shower stayed steady, a real plus.  Would stay again no problem.   Near penn station

title: Excellent location and value
text: This was our second stay at the Hilton Double Tree Chelsea. It was recommended by a friend after previous not very satisfactory stays at similarly priced hotels near Wall Street. Both times we have been very pleased with the quality of service and price/value ratio offered by the Hilton Double Tree Chelsea, not to mention its proximity to good restaurants, museums, Central Park, and Broadway theaters.

title: THIRD STAY , ROCKY START BUT GREAT ENDING
text: Arrived to be told matter of factly by an uninterested receptionist that the penthouse suite we had booked for 7 nights was not available for the first night , obviously not happy but hotel did give us a standard suite and refunded the first night so all good in the end- The next 6 days the hotel couldn't do enough for us and we really enjoyed our stay as we always do - Breakfast is brilliant and the waitress Arecelis is fantastic and a credit to the hotel , The manager Chanel was outstanding and even though we didn't let her do the Beyonce dance she offered im sure it would have been fun ! lol but thats the Doubletree Chelsea the staff are superb , welcoming and friendly and although we had an issue on check in we wouldnt stay anywhere else in Nyc - I will say regarding the penthouse suite its nothing great but it does have a roof terrace overlooking the Empire state building so really fantastic views however if you are looking for suite standards this is not one for you , its basically a large L shaped hotel room with fridge and microwave nothing remotely suite like about it and the biggest issue which could be fixed in half an hour is there is nowhere in the room to sit , there's a desk and a chair and thats it , loads of floor space so put in a sofa or table and chairs and it would work much better -

title: Good location
text: Nice location with a view of the Empire State Building. Close to Macy's Herald Square. Rooms are a little small for a family but is what I expected for NYC. Not much of a lobby. Staff was very helpful and friendly.

title: Hotel bom no coração da cidade
text: A localização do hotel é bem conveniente, fica a menos de 5 minutos de uma estação de metrô da linha vermelha (o problema é que a estação é Local e não Expressa). O pessoal da recepção bem como os demais funcionários do Hotel são bastante cordiais e estão sempre à disposição para te ajudar a sanar dúvidas e resolver problemas. O wifi funciona bem no hotel todo. O quarto tem um tamanho razoável, assim como o banheiro. O único problema no quarto é o sistema de climatização ambiente (trata-se de uma espécie de ar-condicionado barulhento colocado abaixo da janela, com vedação duvidosa para o ambiente externo). Às vezes, durante a noite, eu sentia uma corrente de vento vindo das laterais mal-vedadas do ar. Além disso, ele seca bastante o ambiente, tornando seu uso contínuo bastante desconfortável. A academia do hotel é satisfatória para manter os exercícios em dia. Eles oferecem um cookie de cortesia no momento de check-in.

title: Lo basico nada excitante
text: Este hotel es comodo y limpio. La atencion del personal es bastante buena. Lo mejor es la localzacion. Eso si, pocos servicios. Esteticamente deja que desear. No tuvimos problemas de ruido. Recomendado pero no para todo el mundo.

title: Good spot
text: Enjoyed my stay - hotel was close to Pier 59 golf and sports complex, running and bike trail, highland talking path and near good places to eat dinner.  On-site Breakfast was very good. Staff were very pleasant.

title: Goed hotel, ideaal gelegen
text: Goed hotel, ideaal gelegen voor een bezoek aan New York. Mooi en prachtig uitzicht. zeer vriendelijk personeel. Kamers waren niet supergroot maar dat is normaal in NY. Ontbijt was goed. Een aangenaam verblijf gehad

title: This is NOT typical doubletree
text: This hotel is WAY too small, and the rooms are tiny.  Usually at Doubletree you have larger rooms or suites.  But these were TINY.  Also there are only 2 elevators and no staff elevators, so the staff (housekeeping) has to use the same elevators as guests.  This means you have to wait for multiple elevators to come if you are trying to go down to the lobby as they open and they are all full.  I once got on with 4 cleaning staff with their buckets and cleaning tools.  There was hardly any room.  If you are trying to go up from the lobby there is often a line.  All this negative, on a positive note the breakfast is good and the staff is friendly and it is in convenient location, but I would never stay here again.  I would opt for the nearly Hampton, which I think is better than this Doubletree.

title: Ok hotel
text: Rooms are clean and well maintained.  Smaller than other DoubleTrees but typical for NYC. Staff is pleasant but not proactively helpful.  Basic amenities.  Close to a subway and easy walk to Empire State Building, Flat Iron, and the High Line.

title: Juste comme il faut
text: Cet hôtel est idéalement situé à New York. À quelques minutes de Time Square. Les chambres sont propres et bien entretenues. Nous étions 2 adultes et 2 enfants. La chambre n'est pas grande mais parfaite pour le temps que nous y avons passé, avec quand même une vue sur l'Empire State Building comme prévu. Le personnel de l'accueil a été adorable et disponible, y compris pour nous aider à réserver le taxi collectif du retour par téléphone. Nous n'avons pas testé le petit déjeuner ou le dîner, trop cher. Le quartier regorge de solutions pour se restaurer à toute heure. Un excellent séjour. Et les cookies de l'accueil sont délicieux.

title: Good location, terribly unclean
text:
Stayed in a room with view on empire state building for 4 nights. Room size was ok considering it's NYC and we got a high floor which was a plus. 

Pros
Hotel location is pretty good. Close to subway and central enough to make visiting the different tourist attractions  very easy.
Front desk and 'handymen' were welcoming and helpful.
Warm cookies was a nice touch

Cons
What the other reviewers say about the cleanliness is actually true.  The carpet was incredibly dusty. You could even see a grey film of dust on the sides the walls. You could make out the path where people tend to walk - that's how dusty it was. I picked up my chapstick which rolled under the tv stand and the amount of dust below it was unreal!
Cleaners let this hotel down: first night, our duvet cover had a stain, which i think they should have seen when making the bed.
I spilled some sugar on the carpet and it stayed there for the duration of our stay.
On our last evening we came back to the room and found that the room had not been cleaned.
