Walls are pretty thin if you're a light sleeper. I used ear plugs from the second night onwards.

I might have just been unlucky with all the issues i got but all in all I would not stay there again.

title: Good location
text: Friendly staff. Nice room, small, facing south with great view (from 25th floor) of the One World Trade Center.  Good location in Chelsea for walking to the High Line, Chelsea Market, restaurants, and subway.  Only 2 small elevators so at times there is a wait going up or down.  Hilton property, always a good choice.

title: Dwtwn NYC
text: A pleasant experience staying in Downtown Manhattan , hotels location offered me close proximity to all my interests.The wedding I attended @ Chelsea Piers, all of wedding party stayed at Double Tree-Hilton and was pleased we were all close enough to visit for 2 days at this location. A very pleasurable experience.

title: Natasha P is amazing
text: I stayed here for two weeks on business. The hotel is well placed but not in the best part of Chelsea. Try to avoid staying at the back of the hotel in the disabled rooms as they face another building, it's dark and you're overlooked by others. The rooms generally aren't that big but I think that's the norm for NYC. Natasha P was the best part of the hotel. Friendly, super helpful and a joy to be around. She very kindly went out her way to find me a better room, taking the time to bring the key up after her shift! She changed my whole feeling about the hotel. You have to try the french onion soup in the hotel restaurant - it's awesome! Avoid breakfast though, disappointing

title: April Stay 2017
text: Liked location of hotel, close to places of interest. All of the staff were very friendly to the customers and to each other. Food and drinks good and reasonable price. I had to call back for itemized receipt after I lost it, they promptly emailed it.

title: Bog standard chain hotel, conveniently located
text: When in NYC a hotel is just a place to sleep. Regularly stay here and another Hilton group of hotels just on next street (on 28th). The two hotels are so "homogenised" I often book thinking it was this hotel but ended up staying in the other (Hilton Garden Inn) or vice versa. No way this is a criticism or a negative point. It doesn't bother me which one I ended up at just coz I know what to expect from the Hilton brands. The facilities and amenities in the room is decent. Comfy bed! Room looking a little tired but nothing major. Elevator is the biggest problem here. Only 2 for the many floors and during busy period you could end up waiting for ages. I would recommend this hotel it's practical, simple and no frills.

title: Buona la posizione
text: Molto buono come albergo, pulizia impeccabile, posizione veramente ottima!! A 5 min dalle maggiori attrazioni e soprattutto dalla vita notturna di Time Square.. ottimo rapporto qualità-prezzo. Abbiamo preso la camera con vista. Soldi spesi benissimo..Ci tornerei !

title: Perfecte ligging
text: Mooie kamer en fijne badkamer. Ligging is perfect. Kwartier lopen van Times square, je ligt om de hoek van het empire state building...aardige mensen. Ontbijt is er prima. Om de hoek krijg je lekkere koffie en verse broodjes.

title: Girls Get-a-way in NYC
text: DoubleTree in Chelsea was a wonderful experience for me and my friends during our Girl's Get-a-way to NYC. The staff was beyond accommodating and welcoming. Rooms were clean and comfortable and I would highly recommend this hotel.

title: A good base for exploring New York
text:
There are a wide range of hotels in New York City. If you need a hotel on a bright, glamourous street with a big ornate lobby....this isn't the place for you. It's in a relatively dark, gritty block mainly occupied by wholesale businesses that are not open to the public.And for a hotel as nice as this one,  the lobby is positively tiny. But if you can work around those things, this hotel can be a fine value for you. The hotel is well run and maintained. Everything in my room worked well, and the bed was exceptionally comfortable. The room was very tidy (though using the stairwells, Imoften had to step over bags of garbage during cleaning hours). Hallways are narrow; rooms are fairly small; there are relatively few room per floor, so most are quite near an elevator. I was on the 9th floor, so the view was unremarkable, but I could see the very top of the Empire State Building. Elevator service is a bit subpar but okay overall; there were some long waits. Wifi worked very well except for needing to log in each time. The staff responded well to my request for more decaf and creamer, though the front desk did forget to make a wake up call I requested directly from them. Staff was pleasant but mainly unremarkable--but the concierge was fantastic in helping me on my checkout day. He was friendly, helpful and made me feel it was his pleasure to help.  He was superb. 
The location on W. 29 th is not scenic--but it is in a great location for the subway, Madison Square Garden and things to do. There are plenty of restaurants nearby. Finally, I would say the price I paid was a good value. For what I was looking for--a good base to see the city while in town to see Wisconsin in the NCAA basketball tournament up the street at MSG--it fit the bill well. I'd definitely consider staying there again, especially if being near Penn Station and MSG were a priority.

title: Not the best Hilton
text: I stayed here for one night while in town for business. I wanted to day in a Hilton and thought a doubletree would be nice. The lobby was ok  and so was check in I guess but the room was yuck.  Room felt small, carpet was dirty, walls and bathroom needed a bit of repair.  There are better places to stay in NYC.    I do not recommend.

title: Great location for Madison Square Garden and train access
text: The Doubletree Hotel Chelsea is a great location for anyone taking in sports or concerts at Madison Square Garden or accessing transportation at Penn Station, just a short few blocks away.  Additionally, there is a convenient NYC subway station about one block from the hotel with direct uptown and downtown access, with stops at popular destinations such as Central Park and museums, Times Square, 9-11 Memorial, and Battery Park ferry terminals a short ride on the 1,2,3 line.  The staff at the lobby desk were helpful, efficient, and cheerful, offering suggestions for sightseeing and dining.  The bellman assisted me without delay in storing my luggage (because I arrived very early in the morning) and getting a taxi when needed.  I did not use the hotel dining room, since there are literally dozens of cafes, delis, and pubs within a few minutes walk, particularly on 7th Avenue.  The 27 floor building is tucked in among other buildings of similar height.   My compact room was comfortable, quiet, and clean and had a view of the upper half of the Empire State Building, also only a short walk away.  There was a king bed, small desk with rolling chair and a wardrobe for storage.  As a person who uses the room mostly for sleeping, rather than work or sitting, it worked fine for me.  I thought the price of the room was favorable for New York City and the Hilton brand.  I booked the room online directly through the Hilton Honors web site, and had no difficulty with price, confirmation, or accuracy of the reservation.

title: One night stay
text: Can't say much since I stayed one night only. TV didn't work, bedroom really dirty behind furniture. Internet didn't work day of arrival. Good location. Reported the TV problem the day I left. No idea if it was fixed.

title: Perfect location for a trip to NYC
text:
We booked this hotel based on it being a Hilton Doubletree (reliable), but mostly on its location.
Perfect base to explore the various districts of NYC.
Rooms are an ok size, clean and comfortable. Crib was provided, but only with a standard bed sheet which we had to wrap around the mattress a few times!
Didn't eat or drink in the bar/restaurant as there are just too many places to explore (highly recommend NoMad district, in particular The Smith).
Staff are friendly enough, and of course provide the daily "doubletree cookies"...

title: Not what you would expect from a hotel with this price tag
text:
While looking for a hotel in New York we found this hotel which had good reviews. 
Normally we would have booked this hotel through a 3rd party website because of the lower advertised price. But since we had some questions about our stay we contacted an employee who informed us about the "Best Price Guarantee" policy of Hilton. 

Due to this policy we decided to book the room directly through Hilton and apply for the "Best Price Guarantee" policy. This process is quite easy and straightforward. Within 24 hours after submitting the form we received an email that Hilton is honoring our request. Because we had paid the room in advance, they told us they will send us a cheque with the amount to be received. Because cashing out a cheque is quite expensive in the country in which I live, I asked them if it was possible to receive the amount back on my credit card or bank transfer. This was not possible according to the support staff. Because of this it was cheaper for us to book the room through a 3rd party website then directly with Hilton. When I asked for a manager to discuss the matter, I received an email back that they only do cheques and that they close the case and will not respond to future emails about this. So we ended up with a high price then advertised available.

Since we were traveling with family and our 1 year old son we had a lot of luggage with us. When we arrived at the hotel by taxi and unloaded all our luggage the front door manager didn't apply to help us but stayed inside and watched how we struggled with all the luggage. When we arrived at the front desk we had to wait for at least another 15 minutes before we could check in because all the staff were busy with one group of people who had issues with there reservation. It would be more appropriate if one of them helped the group and the others helped other customers.

Although we had to wait for more then 15 minutes, the front desk staff were very friendly and helpful and made sure the requested crib was arranged quickly.

The room itself was clean and had a nice view at Liberty Tower but could use a make over as they are very outdated. The beds were very short which caused my feet be outside of the bed all night resulting in cold feet. The blankets were made of a thin fleece blanket with sheets around them. The heating / cooling unit turn on every now and then during the night and makes a lot of noise which woke us up.

Because we were on a holiday with family we booked a room for 4 persons but only received 3 towels. Although we requested for an additional towel, we only received it ones. All other days we did only receive 3 towels and needed to request again for an additional one.

Internet connection in the rooms are good but you have to login again everyday. The hotel is located near Penn station and it is easy to travel to all the sightseeing locations in New York.

title: Group Stay/Party Event
text: The staff were great! They helped my family, friends. and me celebrate my mother's birthday! The event was absolutely a phenomenal success. We had a wonderful time. The service was spot on. Everyone was really helpful! The only complaint my guests provided was with the food which was not well prepared. Unfortunately, the falafels were dry. The chef made french fries, which were not on our original menu.  I was not given the promised breakfast vouchers and the elevator was broken.

title: An OK hotel in New York
text: Had good check in - staff helpful;  Room was OK - small but that was sort of expected. Clean and cleaned regularly.  Didn't have a lounge, which we would have liked to be able to sit in and read (as the rooms were too small to do this).  Was lovely and central to the places we wanted to visit in New York.  Concierge helpful when we wanted to book a show.

title: Business
text: Check in service was great, place was clean, staff very helpful.  At check in they helped me add an extra stay for checking in early.  The room was clean.  Slept very well for a small period of time.  The staff at the bar were also friendly and let me sneak in last minute before closing.  The hotel also held our bags so didn't have to carry them around all day.  All and all it was good value for the stay.

title: Pretty much as expected & good.
text:
We were in New York for a five nights stay to celebrate a significant birthday. We were greeted in a very friendly & courteous manner & checked in speedily even though we were significantly ahead of stated check in time. Our room was already available.
The hot cookies are a nice touch.
The room was absolutely fine in all respects. Each day it was serviced beautifully.
The free wifi was good & worked well, which is not always the case with some hotel systems. The only small issue was it seemed to cut off about 4 hours before our checkout time, but as it wasn't an issue for us we didn't worry about it. I'd hope that if it was they'd have done something about it.
We were only on the fourth floor so the view was somewhat restricted - no doubt the view from the top few floors are great, but no doubt at a premium price.
All the staff we encountered were lovely.
In all the hotel is to be recommended.

title: Don't just listen to the concierge GET CONFIRMATION!
text: If they tell you something, don't rely on it.  Double check a few times.  We had two rooms and wanted to put each room on a different credit card.  The front desk lady said no problem, it will be split upon checkout.  Then she proceeded to charge both rooms to the same credit card.  ALWAYS verify what is happening in writing. GET RECEIPTS!

title: Hotel experience hot and cold
text: Each floor has few rooms, normal NYC small rooms. Staff is lukewarm, and not honest about the breakfast buffet. If it had not been for the nice dining room staff I would have made a bigger fuss. I have stayed at many Doubletree and have had complimentary breakfasts. But here do not be fooled

title: Top floor terrace
text: Stayed March 13 thru the 16th. This was my second time staying here. I love it for the penthouse room with huge terrace, however this time it got snow covered. But the view is magnificent! There are 27 floors and only two rooms on the top floor. Nice size room for the city. Only real complaint is it needs some additional seating in the room. Room service was quick. Restaurant meal was very good. Breakfast buffet was standard fare and same items everyday but adequate.

title: Double tree Chelsea
text: This hotel is a bust!  Thermostat not working, tv would not turn off(not remote problem) telephone to front desk not working properly. Rooms are very small.  The restaurant and bar are not available-only breakfast buffet.   Terrible time trying to resolve with Hilton Honors.  I would never recommend this to anyone who wants to enjoy their stay!

title: Not good, not bad
text: Just ordinary hotel. There was some trouble with my service. The staff is not polite. If you are an elite member of the loyalty program, you don't feel your advantages except for cookies. Great location: only 3 mins by walk from the subway

title: Ubicación inagualable
text: Si lo que quieres es ir a explorar Nueva York recomiendo mucho este hotel. Las habitaciones son del tamaño ideal, no tan grandes pero no diminutas como he leído aquí. Lo mejor es la ubicación, llegas a todos lados de Manhattan en no más de 30 minutos en metro. Tienes por lo menos 3 estaciones diferentes de metro a no más de 4 cuadras, sin contar lo cerca que está de Penn Station. Lo mejor para llegar al hotel desde el aeropuerto JFK es tomar el shuttle NYC Airporter hacia Penn Station y de ahí caminar. No se preocupen por andar en la calle con males, no van a ser los únicos.

title: Acceptable
text:
Doubletree by Hilton Chelsea is very far away from the Hilton or the Doubletree standars.
The rooms are really small, the carpets both on the rooms and corridors do not look very clean and the furniture is really cheap.
If you, like me, have the missfortune of staying in floor 2, you'll have an army of vacuum cleaners in the corridor and the ice machine won't work.
The pros are that you are really close to times square, that you have free wifi, you can send packages with no additional cost to the hotel and that you get a free cookie when you check in.
Maybe it's me but when I booked a Doubletree by Hilton hotel I was thinking in something different.
Notwithstanding the above when you come to New York you don't mind where you stay, the important is the city itself so I would return.
P.S. don't even think of drinking the water with fruits that they have at the lobby

title: perfect base for sightseeing in and around chelsea
text: Staff are very inviting. nothing was too much trouble. The bar just off reception was an ideal base for drinks at the end of walking around the city during the day. There were various small but thoughtful touches such as water infused with fresh fruit available daily int the reception area, warm cookies provided on checking into the hotel, and tea/coffee stock replenished daily in your room. The room was adequately sized for four adults sharing. i notice on other reviews that the lift could be quite slow when called. our group all agreed that this never posed an inconvenience to us, however this may be because our visit was not during peak times? i would definitely recommend this hotel. Amazing value for money.

title: Mother/Son trip to NYC for Knicks/Warriors game
text:
Perfect location! Madison Square Garden is just a 5 minute walk from this hotel. Our room was always clean. 1604, Empire State Building view. Housekeeping did a great job. The bell man was very friendly and helped us with storing our bags till our room was available. Travel tip: I would advise tipping the bell man. We did and while we were waiting I was noticing a lot of people did not. Although it's not required, it is a courtesy he is providing and it is in good etiquette to do so. After all, he IS storing and keeping an eye on YOUR luggage. It would be smart to take care of the people who are taking care of you. Don't be cheap. 
We always had a "have a great day" as we were leaving and a " welcome back" as we returned each evening. Small thing, but meant a lot to see smiling faces behind the counter no matter what time of day it was. 
I had a little trouble in the business center, the printer kept reading "off line". So I couldn't print our Knicks tickets. I went upstairs and they took care of me. Printed them for me, no problem at all!! Very helpful. We made it to the game!! 
The elevators ran smoothly. No issues with waiting a long time. Keep in mind the busy check in/ check out times, there will be a slight wait during those times. Don't panic.   At most 2-3 minutes. 
The one and only negative. They were completely out of any and all red wine all the days we were there. That really bummed me out. Buts that's ok, lots of other places to go for red wine. Wasn't really an issue, other than braving the cold wind. 
To recap, everyone was friendly. There are a lot of choices in regards to places to stay in New York City. I would recommend this hotel to anyone who is going to an event at MSG. You won't be disappointed. 
Thank you for the hospitality 
Angela

title: Awesome stay!
text: Good job folks :)   I liked the fact that when I wanted an alcoholic drink in the morning, I was promptly served. In San Francisco it is harder to get a drink that early in the day. People here are too into "nature", "hiking", "biking", "environment", etc. I get so irritated here that I sometimes wish I was in NYC.   The concierge (Harrington) was amazing. He went out of his way to help me.

title: Ehh at best
text: Do yourself a favor and spend a little bit more and stay somewhere else! My wife and I are from the suburbs of NY, and we decided to book a night in the city after a billy joel concert. All my wife wanted to do was go home! It didn't feel safe, the rooms are tiny, the bathroom was a little dirty, and the towels smelled like mildew. If you have to stay here make sure you get a room with two queens, we were "upgraded" to a king with a city view.. when we laid on the bed we were able to touch the walls on either side.

title: Great Location for MSG
text: Great location for MSG and other things to do. Easy to get taxi for other locations. Could have more restaurants close by, but that is the way it goes. The mattress and shower are fantastic and the flavoured water qvailable in the lobby is a nice addition

title: Cookie de graça
text: O hotel além de ter uma ótima localização e boa limpeza  ainda oferece cookies deliciosos de graça para os hóspedes, um mimo delicioso para descansar depois de um dia de compras. O hotel só peca pelo fato de o quarto ser pequeno.

title: Awesome staff
text: This is my second stay at this property. The only downer is that maybe some of the towels have seen better days, and maybe the mattress needs to be tossed. Saying this, these were minor issues and can be expected sometimes. What I will say is this. Of all the hotels I have stayed at, the staff is by far the best. Not just one or two people but everyone I had interacted with. From check in to check out and in between they were extremely helpful.

title: very disappointing in every way
text: In addition to the hotel somehow not having our reservation for a breakfast-included stay, the room itself was dingy and poorly lit, the room service food was inedible, and the elevators from anywhere but the lobby simply didn't work. Won't be staying here again!

title: Nothing special, but no complaints either
text: I stayed here three nights on a business trip.  The room was clean, dark, and quiet - which is primarily what I am looking for in a hotel.  I had less than a one mile walk to both of my work locations.  Central Park was only 1.6 miles away for early morning exercise.  I had heard complaints about elevator wait times, but never personally experienced anything excessive.

title: Great location
text: The room was clean and the staff was very helpful. The room was small but expected in NYC. Did not really like the fact you have to park in the parking garage down the street and then walk up the ramp to your room.

title: Great place to stay. Exceptional  staff and great location.
text: I go to NYC often.  We usually take the train back to Long Island but decided to spend a night with my sister and our kids. I certainly picked the perfect hotel starting with great location to transit, food and shopping.  The price was the reason it was booked.  Will be back soon- I guarantee it!

title: Good for what/where is is
text: A little pricey, paid the extra money for a view which was only visible from an angel. But close to MSG, easy and fast check in and out. Good for a quick one night stay, rooms are tiny as to be expected.

title: Awesome hotel - Great location
text: Very friendly staff, great location, Madison Square Garden is around the corner as well as Penn Station.  Room are nicely decorated, comfortable beds.  Restaurant has a good selection and the menu is priced well.

title: Great Location - Great View.
text: Stayed at the Doubletree by Hilton in Feb 20017.  I think the location of this hotel is great.  Close to pretty much everything.  Our room had a great view of the Empire State Building.  The rooms are on the small side, but this is New York & we were only in there to sleep.  The beds & pillows were comfortable.  The room was very clean.  We stayed on the 22nd floor & zero issues with the elevators (I had read other reviews that mentioned this as being a problem).  The best thing about the Doubletree is the staff.  They are amazing.  Friendly & helpful.  They helped us with directions & which trains to get on the subway etc.  The second best thing about this hotel was the cookies!   We ate at the restaurant one evening & the food was good.  I would recommend this hotel & I would definitely stay here again.

title: Double tree hotel  W29th st Nyc Nyc
text: Fantastic experience. Great front desk staff. Friendly at check in and departure and ONG the COOKIES!!!   Hot and ready when I checked in! Room was clean bright and tight (NYC room is tight and to be expected space wise). I was on an upper floor and it was pretty quite.  Flavored water in the lobby changes flavor daily. Overall a really really good experience.

title: Great Stay, friendly staff
text: Rooms were very comfortable and large for NY standards and very clean. Staff was tremendous, warm and friendly. Bar was fun and the food was very good. Front desk staff were extremely helpful. Recommend this hotel.

title: Location excellent - duvet thin!
text:
As far as hotel location goes, this one is excellent. Midtown is best for everything. 

Rooms are small, we paid extra for an Empire State View room and wasn't disappointed. However the bedding is thin and the room was cold at night. With the heating on, you couldn't sleep due to the noise. Could've done with a blanket!

Didn't eat here but the bar is reasonable for a casual drink.

title: Wi-fi höjer betyget!
text: Okej hotell, bra läge på Manhattan men beläget på en ganska ruffig gata. Trevlig personal i receptionen och bra städning. Vårt rum var litet, med ont om plats för väskorna, men sängarna var sköna. Väldigt bra wi-fi!

title: Location....location...location
text: This hotel, like many in NYC, has small rooms, an unpredictable elevator and is so clean you could eat from the floor. It's a basic, comfortable, no nonsense New York hotel. The area around it is not the best but it doesn't feel threatening. But THE best thing is that you can walk everywhere. Whether you want to go Uptown or Downtown or to the Highline which is about 4 blocks east you can do it all from this spot. In 5 days in NYC we used 1 cab because it was raining and the Subway once because we were late for a dinner reservation.  We stayed on the 18th floor with a street facing room and it was ideal. So don't expect luxury just enjoy it's location...oh and the Friedman's Deli on 32nd street for the best breakfast in town.

title: NYC TRIP with my girlfriends
text: We traveled 3.5 hours south to visit the city. Found a really great price for this hotel on Expedia.com. Everything looked clean in photos via TripAdvisor. I had to use the valet parking since we were running late to a special invite only event. Found out valet parking and I suppose parking garage was $57! Yikes. Other than that the rooms were spacious for NYC and clean. Elevators very tiny and one went out of order. The staff was SUPER FRIENDLY! And the breakfast buffet ($22.95) was very good. We had them retrieve the car while we ate breakfast. Very easy to get to and very helpful getting you a cab.

title: Very Nice Hotel Near Harold Square
text: Very clean hotel minutes from the NYC Flower Market and Harold Square.  Breakfast was also very good and had a good variety.  Rooms are average for NYC and backside rooms were quiet. Warm cookie upon arrival.

title: Great place to stay for Westminster
text: The hotel is nice and very well locate for the reason for my stay which was to go to the Westminster Dog Show.  It is a short walk to Madison Square Garden and there are reasonable restaurants in the area.

title: Very nice.
text: Stayed here for Valentine's Day weekend. The room was small but very nice and comfortable for just me and my boyfriend. Front desk was very friendly and helpful. Definitely would recommend staying here if you're looking for something small and not too expensive.

title: Staff is super helpful !!
text:
Hotel is very basic but clean, quiet and the beds are very comfortable! 
The staff, though was remarkably friendly and helpful. They can't do enough for you. I was very impressed. Also, I like the Chelsea location ... a short walk to Herald Square and far enough away from the Times Square crowds.
I will definitely go back to this hotel.

title: Great staff, really tiny expensive rooms.
text: The staff were wonderful, helpful and fun. The elevators always have at least one out of order - so you do have quite a wait, sometimes more than 10 minutes.  The rooms are very clean and pretty but too small for more than one person. If you sit in the char, no one can get by you as you will have the back of the chair touching the bed. The bathroom fans is SUPER LOUD and you have to turn it off when having a shower or you sound like you are in an airplane hanger. BUT the staff, again is great.  Both days I was there I was not given coffee or creamer in my room and both times I went downstairs and got. The room cost about $210 Canadian a night and I have stayed in much better much cheaper.

title: Restful place and wonderful staff
text: Went for 3 days but because of snow canceling our flight home, we had to stay 2 extra days. Entire staff from housekeeping to reservation desk staff, each was courteous and seemed genuinely willing to help you. I would recommend staying here while in NY.

title: Great people
text:
I enjoyed my stay at the Doubletree Chelsea although I am not used to the New York noise. The people were great, the room cleans but basic - all I needed for my stay although an extra 20 square feet would have been nice so you can sit in the chair and someone can sill get into the room past the end of the bed.
There was always elevator problems while I was there, but it was never a problem and the one time I would have had to carry my bags up a set of stairs- from the business center, a man washing the floors can and carried my bags up for me. GREAT PEOPLE.. I enjoyed my stay!

title: The staff is sooo helpful!
text: I was traveling to New York City by myself which is something that I never do. It was such a relief to have the staff be so kind and helpful with questions and finding me a cab to the airport.  I ate in the restaurants for supper and breakfast.  For supper, I had a cobb salad and it was very good.  For breakfast, I had fresh fruit with yogurt and granola and it was INCREDIBLE.  I believe the granola was homemade and I was given lots of fruit (strawberries, blueberries and blackberries).  It satisfied me for the entire morning.  I also love breakfast in a restaurant when you get your own pot of coffee at your table.

title: Overall nice hotel, weird parking garage
text:
I stayed at this hotel last week. I was traveling for business. The hotel is clean, front desk staff were friendly and helpful, and the room was a pretty decent size considering it's NYC. We ate dinner at Bricchino's down the street on the recommendation of the bellman, which was excellent. I was up on a higher floor and did hear some city noise, but it wasn't bad.

I did want to share a very bizarre experience I had trying to park my car at the garage across the street (the one the hotel works with). The workers there ignored me for about 10 minutes, then when I asked to park my car there, one of them gave me a lollipop and told me to "have a nice day". They eventually did park the car, but it took a bit of convincing. 

The crew the next morning was awesome though. They seemed to know what a car was and that they worked in a parking garage.

title: Good Bad Ugly
text:
I have stayed on 24th/6th, 28th/6th and now 29th/6th in Hilton properties, Hampton Inn, Hilton Garden and Double tree about 30 times. What a difference a couple of blocks make!
Nearer you get to Herald Sq worse it gets. Dirty street full of smoking rag trade workers vs flower market on 28th and office workers on 24th.
Rooms are renovated and sink leaves you absolutely nowhere to put your bath things, towels are thin.
But worst aspect, all these Mnahattan hotel suffer to some extent, is the elevators. Literally 10 mins wait at 8.10 in morning from 6th floor, why...maids. 
The maids have to use the elevators to carry service equipment so BOTH the elevatosr were held on high floors for this purpose as they went one floor at a time. Then coming back at 9am the elevator again was held in basement. Infuriating. There really ought to be a system suing just one and freeing up for guests.
This was only hotel of the 3 where I had to call front desk at 11.45pm as there was a party in the next door room.
At this price range I'll stick with Hampton Inn or Hilton Garden. Not coming back here for sure.

title: New York
text:
Ett bra beläget hotell på 29 e gatan i Staden som aldrig sover.
Rent och snyggt med god service.
I vårt pris ingick frukost, helt ok!
Negativt att lobbyn var väldigt liten och upplevdes som trång och opersonlig.
Utanför hotellet fanns en liten trädgård med sittmöbler, att alternativ till lobbyn.

title: Well situated
text:
We stayed here for 3 nights in the hilton honours room on the 24th floor. Basic room. We went room only so cannot comment on food. We did get a bit cookie on arrival though 
The hotel is well situated off 6th avenue. Nice little cafe at top of the street with a lovely breakfast buffet.
The room had a fab shower and the beds are so comfortable.
The front of house staff are so friendly and helpful
I would certainly stay here again

title: Perfect location
text:
Central location for  sites we wanted to visit. 
Very close to everything going on in the village and Chelsea, close to shopping and historical sites and great food. Rooms were nice and clean and we really didn't hear any  noise. Oh.. and the breakfast was very good

title: Good for a basic stay
text: Hotel location is walk-able to a number of things but the immediate area feels sparse in the evening. The rooms were clean and reasonably sized. The amenities felt average. I think the hotel's standout point was their staff. Every interaction I had was friendly and they went out of their way to make sure that we were happy. Their check in and checkout processes were very easy. Overall the hotel is great if you are not looking for luxury.

title: Quarto pequeno demais. Hotel precisa de reforma.
text: Não se espera quartos grandes em Manhattan. Porém, considerando o preço comparado a outros de mesma categoria, este hotel possui um quarto minúsculo. De todas as minhas hospedagens em NYC nos últimos 6 anos, este quarto foi o menor de todos. Os carpetes das partes comuns precisam ser trocados ou sofrer uma boa manutenção. Chelsea é uma boa região pra se ficar em NYC, perto do comércio e não tão perto do tumulto da região da Broadway. Mas acredito que pelo preço pode -se encontrar um hotel melhor na região.

title: Conveniently located
text: This hotel is conveniently located on 37th St, particularly because it is near the subway, so access to Downtown, Uptown etc is easy. The staff is friendly and efficient. Breakfast is excellent with lots of choices although fresher pastries would be appreciated. My granddaughter said the Fitness Center was satisfactory. Our room was clean. Highly recommended for a good value hotel in Manhattan. Stayed 4 nights.

title: Hotel cómodo!!
text:
El hotel está ubicado cerca del metro (2 cuadras) y cerca a pie de Macys. La zona no es muy pintoresca ya que está rodeado de negocios mayoristas en el Koreatown. Igual esta a dos cuadras de la 5ta Av. y si el tiempo lo permite a unos 15 minutos a pie de Time Square.
El hotel es correcto. Las habitaciones son normales. Cuenta con restaurante que te saca de un apuro si no quieres salir a cenar ya que tampoco abundan por la zona muchos lugares salvo comidas rápidas.
Un tema son los ascensores ya que en horas de la mañana los dos con los que cuenta no son suficientes y es mucho el tiempo que hay que esperar.
Si el precio es bueno en el momento de la reserva puede ser una opción.

title: Happy in NoMad
text: The hotel provides a delightful experience in a lively neighborhood. It is walking distance from many fine restaurants, bars and music clubs. An extra special is the location near the flower district on 28th St. On our stroll Sunday morning we purchased a phenomenal orchid plant.

title: Staff are fab!
text:
We unexpectedly found ourselves staying another night in New York so after ringing around and finding most places booked out ended up staying at the Doubletree Chelsea by default really. The room, which cost a total of  USD 384.72 on a Monday night, was small but had all the required amenities and though rather average it was completely fine. It was nice and close to quite a few bars but we found it hard to find a restaurant that wasn’t a grill or pub style place. Should’ve asked at reception/concierge I guess. 

The most outstanding feature of this hotel was the staff. Very friendly and enthusiastic but not overly so. They even allowed us to have breakfast after the closing time and late checkout was not a problem either. If you have a desire to stay in Chelsea you couldn’t go wrong here but I’d stay here because of the location not the hotel room. Room 3 stars so the extra star for the staff.

title: Good Value, Great Location
text: Very close to MSG, empire state building, and Macy's/shopping. Multiple subway stations within a few blocks. Easy accessibility to the Lincoln Tunnel and parking is reasonable by NYC standards, close to the hotel, and easy.  Good value for money in the area. Rooms were tidy, but had a couple small issues regarding getting linens. Management eventually resolved these concerns. No real view to speak of, but this hotel more than served our purpose for this trip.

title: Great place to stay!
text: Very convenient a few mins walk to the 6 train. The hotel is clean and functional. Rooms are a little small but the bed was king size so it was fine. Bathroom was clean and we had an abundance of towels. Front of house and staff in general was amazing. Would stay again!

title: Exceptional customer service, fantastic location close to Madison Square Gardens and Times Square.
text: The hotel staff was extremely polite and helpful. They went out of their way to meet our needs, and always did so with a smile. The room, though small, was very clean and comfortable. The location was amazing. Zero complaints!! Would definitely stay again!

title: Tiny rooms, with a lacking view
text: I reserved an Empire State Building view room. This description is quite misleading. In order to see the Empire State Building, you need to really try to see it. The room is a closet, enough room to walk around the bed. If you're staying here as a crash pad, then it may work for you but it was claustrophobic. The doubletree suites in time square is a much better option.

title: Location, Price, Cleanliness - Check!
text: We stayed in the room with 2 dbl beds and ESB view.  Room was very tight but doable (don't even think about that size room for more than two people).  Great location. Very generous shower power and volume, almost to the point of wasteful, but way better than the usual shower.  Nice staff.  Unlike previous reviewers, the elevators worked fine for us.  Would stay again, but would certainly upgrade to the room with one king bed or the suite/penthouse.

title: Far below brand standard.
text:
This hotel needs working on, the rooms are dated and beginning to fall apart. Simple things like the iron leaked all over my shirt, just as I was getting ready to go for a family meal.

The beds weren't great in our room. Didn't manage a good night's sleep once.

The brand will only suffer from not maintaining its hotels!.

How did I come to a 2 star review?

1/. The location is fantastic, not too far from Times Square, Macys and the Empire State Building. Depending on your walk pace, 10 - 20 mins to all mentioned locations.

2/. The staff were fantastic! They were extremely helpful, friendly and would happily go out of their way to assist you. I don't need to name specific names, they are ALL fantastic. The team being as great as they are, are wasted at such a 'past it' hotel, definitely should all be somewhere else where they would be appreciated by many more guests.

I wouldn't return to this hotel. Great staff isn't enough to warrant a return unfortunately.

title: "Dump"
text: There are only 2 elevators that barely work. At one point it took over 10 minutes to get an elevator down to the lobby. The rooms have poor sound insulation. I kept hearing beeps and street noises throughtout the night despite being on the 12th floor. The bed sheet was threadbare with a hole. The lampshade had a hole.

title: Conforme à nos attentes: bien contents
text:
Un séjour d'une semaine dans un chambre pour quatre avec des filles de 12 ans: nous sommes très satisfaits des prestations !
Belle vue sur l'Empire state building, chambre propre, linge propre, super accueil et des attentions agréables ( plein de cookies ! )…
L'hôtel est bien placé à Manhattan et le personnel fait le boulot avec le sourire.
En fait, aucune raison de se plaindre !
À noter: c'était la saison creuse.

title: In the heart of Chelsea
text: Really great small Doubletree in the heart of Chelsea.  If you are a retailer, this property puts you in the center of accessory wholesale Mecca!  New really good resturants have popped up and several Starbucks too. A hidden gem in Luna Cafe across the street from the hotel.  GREAT coffee and to go breakfast stuff.  Chilled boiled eggs with arugula or gluten free blueberry orange bread. Not the usual to go fare.  Owners are lovely.  No lines.

title: Nice Place
text:
Had a impromptu reunion with a few high school friends, convenient location. Parking is expensive but what do you expect it's New York! 
They have a good breakfast spread a bit pricy though. Otherwise had a good time, friendly staff, clean room and bath.

title: ヒルトンはこんなものか
text: スタッフの愛想は悪いし、接客態度も最悪。WiFiはケアラインに電話しても、問題を抱えたまま泣き寝入り。もう泊まらない。

title: Simple, clean, quiet.
text: We booked this hotel as our plans changed at the last moment, and there was no room in the Garden Inn which would have been our first choice. The rooms were nice and clean, although the beds were really below standard.  The service was generally very good and very friendly - we had a small malfunction in our shower and it was fixed right away.

title: Birthday Trip
text: The staff at this Doubletree really went out of their way to make my wife and I feel welcome. They even took the time to deliver a handwritten birthday card with two free breakfast passes and two complimentary drink passes.

title: Buena Estadía de Fin de año 2016
text:
El hotel está ubicado literalmente en el medio de todo (Calle 29 entre la 6ta y la 7ma avenida) aproximadamente a 10 cuadras del Time Square, a un par de cuadras del Madison Square Garden y del Empire State. A pocas cuadras de dos estaciones de subte.
Al llegar te reciben con una galleta de chips de chocolate calentita. 
Tiene 27 pisos (recomiendo que soliciten habitaciones en los pisos superiores por la hermosa vista que tienen. A mí me tocó un piso 12 y sólo veía un costadito del Empire State y las ventanas de otros hoteles). Solo cuenta con 2 ascensores por lo que tomar el ascensor en horas pico (por ej. hora del desayuno, cena) puede demorar bastante tiempo. Además estos mismos ascensores son utilizados por el personal del hotel para transportar maletas, elementos de limpieza, etc. Esto también favorece a la lentitud en el uso de los mismos.
La habitación es chica como en todo NYC y no tienen mucho espacio de guardado en los armarios. TV digital y WIFI excelentes!!! Inclusive tienen On Demand para huéspedes. 
Las habitaciones no tienen frigobar pero tienen cafetera y te reponen los consumibles. Además en muchos pisos del hotel hay máquinas expendedores que venden botellas de agua y gaseosas.
El desayuno es muy muy bueno! Hay buena variedad de cosas y muy sabroso.
Las camas dobles son muy buenas y cómodas lo mismo que las almohadas, aliados indispensables luego del día de caminata por la ciudad.

Buen funcionamiento de la caja fuerte de la habitación. 
Buen servicio de limpieza (todos los días cambiaban las toallas y dejaban jabones) pero un poco lento el servicio de limpieza de la habitación por ej. Un día llegue al hotel a las 16.30 y todavía no habían limpiado la habitación.
La gente de recepción es amable y servicial en su mayoría.
Lo recomendaría.

title: Poor Service!
text:
I visited here in December with 3 other friends. The purpose of our trip was to celebrate our 30ths. We had done a lot of research & booked the hotel 12 months before. 
Rooms:
Very small. There was 2 beds in (3/4 size beds) for 4 adults in spite of the website stating double beds.
The room was booked for 4 people but there were 4 hangers in the wardrobe and nowhere to put our cases.
The view of the Empire State was good!
The room was not cleaned whilst we were there, the bed was made & fresh towels provided, most days both bins were emptied but not always. 
TV was covered in dust.
Staff:
I went to speak to reception to request a room a bit bigger & to get more hangers (4 girls for 5 nights with 4 hangers wasn't quite enough).
I was told that someone would be up with the hangers, 5 days later when we checked out, guess what- no hangers!
I was told the hotel was full & that it was tough about the beds.
The lady who laughed when I said the beds weren't even double offered us complimentary breakfast the following day, a male colleague (I assume manager) said to give us 2 days free. 
Breakfast:
Offered eggs, sausages & pastries. 
Whilst it was fine for us as it was quick we would never have paid £22 each for it, there's a cafe around the corner called Speedys which was much nicer and the 4 of us are for $20 total.
Location:
Perfect!! 
Could pretty much walk anywhere within 10-15 minutes!
I would return here for the location, but the hotel itself & the staff definitely need some work.

title: Fijne locatie
text:
Uitstekende plek om Manhattan te verkennen. Op loopafstand van het Empire State Building, Penn Station, Macy's en meerdere subway-lijnen.
Vriendelijk personeel en, in tegenstelling met andere beoordelaars, geen enkel probleem met lange wachttijden bij de lift.
Nadeel: kleine bedden in kleine kamers; maar ja de meeste betaalbare hotels in New York hebben kleine kamers.

title: Awesome stay with great view
text: The place is located at a key spot with all facilities and an empire state building view . All facilities nearby and the bar has HappyHours as well . Courteous staff and great service. No complaints worth the money.

title: An arrogant Guard treat Diamond HH Members like Trash
text:
We stayed in this hotel for 3 days the 4th day the hotel was over booked by  negative 5 as we speak with the front desk, so we left our luggage there for that day and had a reservation following that day (day 5) supposedly until new year. We came back to get something and we were at the business center and a few minutes after we were just browsing the Internet, this security guard in the name of Francis asked us if we are guest. We said yes. And we showed our room key to him. This was like 230am, though. We even said we are Diamond HH members. He left us then he came back and told us that we are not guest. Then we explained about the booking etc, etc. I even showed him my tag. We just bowed out heads and left. We just cancelled further reservations and booked to another hotel. 
In addition to that we had an incident that is not so nice. Our room's toilet is clogged. They even have to call the staff to get a plunger to fix it. They will not transfer us to another room even the first night we asked for upgrade(since we are diamond) they said all rooms are sold so no upgrade. I mean, where is the appreciation here of reaching this level? Never had ever been offered any service recovery bonus or points. Hampton did have us a free night. So far twice. This has none to offer to fulfill the guest satisfaction promised the the business they are in. I am spending a lot of money in hotel and we chose our hotel, not expensively but the practical type. We deserve some courtesy as being part of this membership especially when the purpose is to honor Hilton guest, courtesy is part of it. I guest, hotel guess are suppose to be treated at par excellent especially in customer service. 
Number 1 - the treatment is so rude. The treatment is not suppose to be this way since we are guest still and still going to be guest in the following days. Well we guess not anymore. We felt humiliated and embarrassed that we felt like we are criminals that just gate crashed into the hotel or inside the business center. We felt like we are to steal something in the hotel. I would understand also if we are doing something alarming like we making noise damaging the property or the like but we were just siting in there surfing the web. Yes, he might be following what his responsibility which is to safeguard the hotel. Not to throw us out. 
I want a reprimand to the management of hotel to training arrogantly a staff that does not deserve to be in the customer service oriented business whose primary goal is customer satisfaction. I don't believe he is even qualified and if this is the fruit  of the training of this hotel. I recommend readers of my review to think twice. 
If in case management will appreciate our review for letting the readers known of it. I want us to be appreciated to any HH  hotels and resorts for free nights and points. The shamefulness we felt as we left the hotel. We just said to ourself we will come back to get the luggages in a few hours after cancelling our reservation to them and booking in another HH Hotel group in Times Square. Which we actually did.

title: Un hotel completamente básico
text:
El hotel está ubicado aproximadamente a 10 cuadras del time squeare, al llegar te reciben con una galleta de chips de chocolate calor Rita y deliciosa. 
Son 27 pisos y solo con 2 ascensores. Tomar el ascensor es muy demorado, los tapetes de los pisos son muy sucios y desagradables al igual que el tapete dentro de la habitación. Recomiendo andar con clanclas o zapatos. 
Las camas son muy buenas lo mismo que las almohadas. 
Las habitaciones son con 2 camas dobles ( demasiado pequeñas las habitaciones) si llevas varias maletas puedes estar en problemas. Hasta caminar en la habitación es complicado.

title: Spend the extra $ for a better place
text:
I always rate the hotel by asking myself if I would stay here again...in this case no. 

Pros
- Internet speed good but disconnects you often
- water pressure very good
- cookies are great
- location good if you don't mind walking-I would next time stay closer to time square
- set back further from the street so we didn't hear outside noise (but we were on Level 20ish)

Cons
- elevator wait time is at least 10mins our longest wait 20mins no exaggeration.
- smaller than usual rooms and there was no room for our luggage
- They should look into an environmental towel system and not replace everyday

title: Good
text: Rooms very small but clean. The good thing was that it was walking distance from empirestate building and flat iron building on one side and time square and Rockefeller on other side. Bryant park and central park are also close by. Metrostation just around the corner. Overall it was nice to sleep in.

title: Great stay!M
text: We stayed in this hotel for a family trip. Even though the room was extremely small, my husband and 3 kids didn't seem to mind it. After all we didn't really stay in room very much. The location is great. Right in the middle of EVERYTHING!! Will definitely visit again.

title: Fine for the price
text:
This is definitely not the typical DoubleTree experience I expect. While the employees were friendly, the rooms are in dire need of an update and were just barely clean enough to be acceptable. I found dirt and/or trash around the room in places that weren't obvious (under the bed for instance, trash cans not cleaned, etc). The towels I used were clean as far as I can tell, but were full of holes and loose threads. Soundproofing did not exist, and the room was very tiny. Worst of all was the wait for the elevators - for some reason I suspect that they pick up in order of the request, rather than stopping for other passengers along the way. We waited for about 10 minutes or more each time we needed to go between our room and the lobby.

All that being said, I paid very little for this hotel compared to the astronomical rates you can usually expect in NYC, especially considering the convenient Chelsea location near MSG/Penn Station/Herald Square among many other classic sites. If you're looking for a cheap place to sleep (and a warm cookie!), this is your place. Personally, I'll probably skip it next time and pay the extra bucks to stay somewhere a little nicer.

title: Good location but small room
text: Very Good location, walking distance to major sight-seeings and shopping, Empire State building, Time square, Macy's, etc. We walked a lot and uses the subway to distance like Statue of Liberty or central park. Penn Station and subway stations are less than 5-10 minutes away. The only problem was the room was so small, the hallway is tiny as well. I told my kids that we were at Manhattan downtown, space was the most valuable thing here.

title: Rooms not fit for purpose
text: Very disappointed - we booked a "double double" room which showed up as suitable for 4 adults and as having 2 "full size" double beds. Firstly, the beds were far from  full sized doubles, at most they were 3/4 and that's being generous. They didn't even have 2 normal sized pillows on them as they were too small for them. By the time 4 people and 4 cases were in the room, there was no space to move and no floor space at all. This led to very uncomfortable night's sleep and room not being cleaned properly, probably as the cleaner wouldn't have fitted in the room. There was 1 set of hotel sized toiletries provided for 4 adults and these were not replaced during our 5 night stay. Hotel couldn't care less when we complained about the bed size not as advertised and room being unfit for 4 people, receptionist shrugged and said "that's the size of the room". When we persisted we got a free breakfast where we could eat as many stale muffins and pastries as we wanted. The only good thing about this hotel was the location. Complained via Expedia and 3 weeks later they are still waiting on a response from the hotel. Just not good enough at all.

title: The hotel was acceptable
text: The hotel and room were clean. The service was excellent. The bed was so comfortable I wanted to take it back to the U.K. The only issue was the lifts which there are only 2. I had to wait 5-10 minutes for the lift.

title: Disappointing hotel experience
text: Very disappointed in the poor service, old, tired looking suite& the poor elevator situation- only 2elevators for 26 floors (& no service elevator!) Hotel is in good location but I would not stay there again. Better options for the price.

title: Great front desk staff
text: This is a small no frills city hotel. It is older so adjust your expectations. What I really appreciated was the staff. We were unloading put front when I accidentally dropped my daughters cookies in a puddle.  This was heartbreaking. We go to Doubletrees because the girls love the cookies. My daughter went to the front desk staff who not only replaced the cookies but our water bottles too. Little things matter!

title: Typical for NYC
text: Given the high cost of space in Manhattan, this is a typical NYC hotel. Well maintained but cramped lobby, and small-ish rooms that were clean enough. Front desk staff were very professional and courteous and the location is very good.

title: One night stay
text: Rooms are really small when traveling with kids. The Conrad was 4 times the size for the same money and was luxurious. Elevators are really crowded and it takes forever to get up to your room. Not sure if is stay again.

title: Cookie cookie cookie!
text: This is my second visit to NYC. This hotel did not disappoint. Easy to locate, the hotel itself in a very good location, a short walk to 5th, Macy's etc and an even shorter walk to MSG. We traveled in a group of 7 and booked 2 rooms with 2 double beds in as it was cheaper than splitting into couples. All the staff were friendly at all times, the gym served it's purpose. The bar was nice and ambient with the offering of a happy hour. Rooms were not huge but were ok to just cram 4 people's luggage in, beds comfy, nice big TV to watch. The wifi was good quality when it worked and free, they also offer a free printing service which is good for purchasing tickets for shows etc. Bathrooms a little small and old. The best thing about sleeping here is there was hardly any traffic noise, had some really good night's sleeps. The only downside, for a Hilton, you do expect more decor wise and space wise but otherwise this was an ideal base for our NYC visit. And what's not to like about 24/7 free cookies?!

title: Great location
text: Clean, comfortable room and smaller size to be expected in NYC. The friendly staff provided a warm welcome.  Perfect location and an easy walk to Times Square, Macy's and Chelsea restaurants.  Very reasonable parking rate for NYC.

title: Penthouse suite
text:
Ehh ok not the biggest fan. Room
Was huge but no seating other than the bed. Balcony was also
Large but loud and dirty. Management was fantastic trying to settle our complaints. Overall a 3 out of 5. But not a homerun

title: Perfect!
text: Room is standard size for NYC. Stayed in room 406, bathroom is tiny and coffeepot is archaic but it was a perfect location and bed was very comfortable! Could have used another blanket but kept forgetting to ask! Checked in Christmas Day and staff were cheerful and happy and pleasant the entire stay!!!

title: Holiday
text: A great hotel base for our trip to New York. Ten minutes walk to empire state building about 20 to time square.  Rooms well equipped and very comfortable, cleaned everyday even over the Christmas period. Meals available if not alrready booked

title: Clean and friendly
text: Great location for me. Place was clean staff was friendly. Bed was comfortable used the mobile check in and keyless entry so I bypassed the front desk.  Never had to come in contact with anyone however a staff member treated me on my way in.

title: Great value and location
text: Stayed here with family just prior to the holidays.  Rooms were quiet and well suited for our stay.  Check in was flawless and the staff were very helpful. Opted for one room with a view and the other around the corner.

title: great location and price !
text: off season rates...great hotel. even with one elevator down for awhile, still a great value. Dinner is the restaurant was good, not a great selection, but good. Front desk staff was very helpful also. Will stay here again.

title: Manhattan
text:
Hotellet har bra medelklass standard. Rummen är ganska små men med väldigt stora och sköna sängar.
Kan bli lite körigt vid utcheckningen då det bara finns två hissar. Frukosten har en del övrigt att önska. Väldigt begränsat utbud men man kan åtminstone få ett par rostade mackor. Hotellets läge är bra mellan 6:e och 7:e avenyn. Nära till tunnelbanan.

title: A less than doubletree experience
text:
First, I am aware that this is NYC, so this review should be taken with a grain of salt. And overall, this hotel was average but compared to my other doubletree and/or hilton experiences, I was a little disappointed. 

The location is great in terms of access to everything NYC, however the hallways were basically cut in half and the rooms had no where to move. I literally could not place my suitcase anywhere except by the door. If you have two people and are staying in a regular room, good luck. This just honestly struck me as not an ideal location for a hotel. 

The staff was fine, room was clean, so again I say, the overall experience was average. I just think doubletree fell short of its usual stellar hotel experience. It is NYC, and the rules are different, but I suggest finding another doubletree property first before going to this one.

title: Budget friendly for NYC
text: Clean, well situated to where I wanted to be, budget friendly. They had rooms available at last minute. Not your normal large Doubletree; felt more like a boutique hotel which was fine with me. Would visit again.

title: Hotel with location values
text: Fine hotel located within walking distance of Penn Station and several different subway lines.  Convenient for sightseeing, restaurants, theater and museums in Chelsea area. Lobby staff (receptionist and bellboy) some of the most efficient we've ever experienced.  Rooms are small but adequate.  Bedding very comfortable.  Would stay here again.

title: Concert Trip to MSG
text: We wouldn't think of staying anywhere else on another trip to NYC. Cleaniliness, staff assistance and location of hotel was first class! Concierge recommended several awesome restaurants close to the hotel.

title: Reasonable
text: location is excellent, just off 34th st Macy's and close to Penn station. The hotel is everything you would expect from the chain, clean rooms, decent wifi (free). On the good side - staff is friendly, helpful and professional, and rooms are a bit bigger than what you would expect from an NYC hotel. On the bad side - the hotel has only 2 elevators ( 25 floors) so waiting for an elevator can be annoying - try to get a room at a low floor so you can use the stairs.

title: Another Great Stay at the Doubletree Chelsea - NYC
text: Whenever I'm in NYC for business, this is my 'go to' property.  In my opinion, the outstanding staff is what make s the difference between this and other properties in the vicinity.  I strongly recommend visitors coming to NYC consider this property.

title: Comfortable Stay for Business Traveler
text: I stay at this location in Chelsea often because it is close to Penn Station and business locations. There are a lot of dining options and it is close to NYC landmarks. Rooms that face away from the street are very quiet.

title: Location good, staff nice
text: But that is about all.. the hotel rooms are very small even for NY standards.  The front desk agents were very lovely and welcoming.  Its such an easy walk to Times Square or Flat Iron .  The walls are paper thin we could hear everything.  The bathroom has zero counter space.  The TV situation was a welcome surprise there is on demand so you can watch shows on demand as well as fast foward, pause etc.  This is a NICE feature that I wish all HIlton rooms had.   I would stay here again but it wouldnt get my first choice unless I got a really good rate.

title: Great staff
text: Rooms could use a little updating but were fine for us the little time we spent there. It was nice to have a separate sitting room/bedroom. This is not common in NY hotels for the reasonable price of the suite.

title: Penthouse
text: Stayed in the penthouse. Very cheap for a penthouse. Great views. Bit cold in the winter. Good fun place. Only downside was only two lifts for the entire hotel. Good service. Free wifi. Good location.

title: Good for NY
text:
The hotel itself is situated in a good part of NYC, next to subway station and in between times square and lower Manhattan. Chelsea is a good spot for food spots and right near Madison square. 

The room itself is small and can only fit 1 suitcase on ground but wouldn't expect too much in NYC. The main thing I worried about is the bed is real comfy and the shower is good with good pressure. 

Lifts are real slow and we spent many a morning waiting for the lift. 

Good for NYC and would happily stay here again.

title: A bar fridge would be handy
text: It's been a long time since we have stayed in ANY hotel anywhere in the world that didn't have a small bar fridge to store a few supplies. The rooms are small but ok, the staff were friendly, but the lifts are dreadful - only two and we got stuck in one for a while. Not a nice experience. The hotel is in a pretty good location but is in dire need of a refurbishment as it's quite dated.

title: Buena opción en midtown
text: Fui con mi familia, habitación doble de dos camas dobles para cuatro (2 adultos; 2 niños). Habitación con vistas, impresionante!. Al ser miembro de HHonors, al llegar ya tenía hecho el registro por la app móvil, y no tuve nada que hacer. Habitación con smartkey, se abría desde la app movil, muy cómodo. Desayuno fabuloso, con personal muy atento que hablaba español. La habitación es pequeña, necesita remodelación, y tiene poco espacio de armarios, especialmente para 4 personas. Camas muy cómodas. Metro a 1 calle (en la 28). Times Square y Macy's, a unos 10 minutos.Sin duda, buena opción para alojarse en midtown

title: Fantástico
text: Estuvimos alojados en el hotel durante el mes de diciembre de 2016., habitación doble de dos camas, para mi mujer y dos  hijos. Habitación un poco pequeña, pero con dos camas dobles muy cómodas. El desayuno fantástico, con un personal que en todo momento intentó ayudarnos, haciendo la estancia muy agradable. La habitación tenía vistas al Empire State, merece la pena conseguir esas habitaciones. Los niños quedaron fascinados con la vista. Metro muy cerca (una calle mas abajo), y Times Square a unos 10 minutos andando. Definitivamente, una buena opción par alojarse en la zona de midtown

title: Great time in NYC!
text: Another great experience! This hotel was close to shopping and only a few blocks from 5th avenue and Times Square.  The beds are amazing.  I also love the flavored water when you come in each day!  Oh and those famous cookies!!!!

title: Quiet and nice staff
text: We had a room in the back (902) which was the quietest room we've ever had in NYC.  No traffic or early trash hauler sounds.  The room is average size for the City but well appointed and the bed was comfortable.

title: Hidden Gem for Reasonable Rates
text: NYC can be quite expensive.  If you're traveling to enjoy the city, how much time do you actually spend in one's hotel room itself?  I had to stay overnight.  Not unusual circumstances for me, but wanted a place that was clean, safe, secure, reasonable, and had a restaurant or at least some sort of eatery.  Got this all and more.  In addition to above, got a friendly welcoming attentive staff and bountiful breakfast.

title: Ok hotel, doesn't meet the Hilton standard
text:
Overpriced like most hotels in Chelsea, but reasonably convenient.  
Clean, good location, good bed.
The worst thing in that hotel is the staff. Very unpleasant and rude reception desk. Answer to most requests is no.

title: Great Location
text: We are currently staying here. Family of four. Great service very helpful staff. Clean rooms. Make sure you try the complimentary cookies. Great location walking distance to Empire State Building and Madison Square Gardens. Would stay here again.

title: Needs a refresh -
text: Hilton staff is always accommodating and pleasant, however, room was subpar. Bathroom needed updated, heat/AC wasn't great. It was either freezing or 85 degrees. Unless you get a smoking deal on a Standard King Bed room, I'd find another option.   I know everything in NY is used, but for $400 a night, it could be better.

title: Room Space
text: Rooms were very small. No place to put your luggage unless you are staying alone in the room. Not good for 2 people to share a room. Closet very small and only 2 drawers to put clothes in, again, Ok for one person, not anymore than that. Was not happy with the room.

title: Friendly staff but hotel in need of major refurbish
text:
We stayed in small king room, right need elevator and vending machines, although we were told we wouldn't have a view we were able to see the Empire State Building.

What was fab? 
* View of Empire State Building (Limited number of rooms would have this)
* Friendly staff

What was drab? 
* Everything is looking very tired and worn
* Lots of noise from hallway 
* they use the man entrance as a temporary laundry area 
* Totally overpriced, I found the same room I prepaid a few days later on the same Hilton site I booked for $150 USD cheaper 

What can't be easily changed? 
* All things in drab could be easi changed with a refurbishment 

Would I stay here again?
* Not unless it was overhauled or the price matched the value

title: Bien ubicado, buena atención, buen precio.
text: De casualidad fui a este hotel ya que fui al Pensilvania que está a la vuelta y no nos gustó. La habitación es chica como todos en NYC, tv digital y wifi excelente. No tiene frigobar eso es incomodo ya que no teníamos el desayuno incluido y no podía guardar nada. Habitación   con vista a la calle en piso 14 pero con vista a los edificios del frente. Limpio, bien ubicado a la vuelta del Madison Scuare Garden, en el medio de todo digamos, a u$15 en taxi tanto de Central Park como de China Town. Regresaría.

title: I used 70,000 points for this?!
text:
My stay here had me questioning my loyalty to the Hilton brand. Hotel needs an update, bathroom especially was in very bad shape (I think the contractor was drunk when doing the shower/tile and the ceiling is flaking down). I ended up taking the stairs because of a ridiculously long wait for the elevator.

The only positive I can say is that the bed is VERY comfortable.

I thought the value on this was very disappointing. For a similar price, try the Hotel Indigo Chelsea which is close by and WORLDS nicer. Won't be staying at this one again.

title: Great staff - average hotel
text:
Let's start with the property's strengths.  LOCATION: Walking distance to most subway lines, Herald Sq, Chelsea, MSG. STAFF: Everyone I interacted with - front desk, maintenance, restaurant, doorman, baggage ALL friendly, helpful and genuinely caring. The breakfast buffet was quite good -- free as a HHonors Diamond (and I believe Gold) member; not sure it would be worth the $30 it was charging others. 

There are many areas that need improvement. The biggest two are only two elevators for 27 floors and they are for BOTH staff and guests. Waits of ten minutes happen too often. Night security is a joke. I came back three nights after midnight - walked straight into the lobby to the elevator. No one stopped to see if I belonged. 

Other areas that should be noted, and addressed where doable: Rooms are tiny, even by NYC standards. Stains on bedroom ceiling. No hotel room guide (being a frequent traveler, I knew to ask to have sheets changed more than ever few days, or for a room refrigerator. But even I still missed TV directory.) My Diamond upgrade room was a room with from the window, if you peer closely from the corner of the room you can see a smidgen of the Empire State Building. I had to ask! To me an upgrade would be a larger room, a bathrobe, refrigerator, etc. No premium wifi for Diamond guests. Vending/Ice only on 6 of 27 floors -- especially troublesome given the elevator situation. 

Again because of staff and location, you might want to consider. But if the hotel could take steps to correct some of the issues, rating would increase.

title: muy buen hotel
text: fui en familia con una habitacion con 2 camas dobles para 3 personas, muy confortable pequeña pero bien para 6 maletas, aseo diario, toallas y amenities repuestos todos los dias, amabilidad del personal, a la llegada nos dieron unas galletas exquisitas ademas la opcion de sacar limonada del lobby cuando quisiera, buena ubicación muy cerca de 2 lineas de metros que nos llevaron a todos lados, volveria feliz a este hotel, muy conforme lo recomiendo

title: Don't do it
text: Rate dropped $50 per day about 24-hours after we booked on Hilton.com, they would not honor cheaper rate, checkin took too long when the room should have been ready at midnight, dirty bathroom, loud room

title: Room small, Staff WONDERFUL
text: Stayed here for 16th birthday celebration. Very important trip for our family. Room was uncomfortably small for our family of 4, but this was eclipsed by amazing experience with all staff members we interacted with. Front desk were cheerful, highly efficient, and genuine in wanting us to have a great time. Restaurant staff were conscientious and attentive. Set the bar very high for customer experience in NYC!

title: AWESOME NYC DOUBLE TREE HOTEL
text: Extremely comfortable stay at the Double Tree Chelsea NYC. Will stay at this location again.  It was perfect!  From the staff to the rooms to the free breakfast!  Excellent!!!!! Check in was pretty awesome online and the digital key was pretty cool too however, when I activated the key on my phone it cancelled the key card.

title: Pequeño pero bueno
text:
Llegamos en pleno "Thanksgiving day" a las 7:00 de la mañana y una habitación de las dos de nuestra reserva ya estaba lista. Nos permitieron subir y dejar el equipaje completo allí hasta que estuviera lista la otra habitación. Muy amables. Nos regalaron cookies tibias al momento del checkin. El personal de conserjería habla inglés y español sin problemas.
El hotel es pequeño pero muy alto. Tiene 27 pisos. Recomiendo que soliciten con antelación habitaciones en los pisos superiores por la hermosa vista que tienen. A mí me tocó un piso 7 y sólo venía ventanas de otros hoteles.
El baño es realmente muy pequeño !!!
La cama es muy buena, y ha cafetera con café y té a disposición. No tiene frigobar, pero en muchos pisos del hotel hay máquinas que venden botellas de aguar y gaseosas, y expededoras de agua y hielo gratis!!!
Recomiendo llegar al hotel por la 6ta. Avenida, ya que el ambiente allí es mucho mejor que si llegan caminando por la 7ma.
Está MUY cerca de Macy's (34th) y de Best Buy (26th)

title: Location Makes You Feel Like a New Yorker
text: I stayed one night at the hotel, but got in early and had to leave the hotel late. The staff was very accommodating with my schedule, which I appreciated. The room itself was fine, if a little dated. Still, comfy bed and quiet room. My only issue is that the concierge told me to take a car service to my dinner date, rather than wait for a cab. He told me it would be about the same cost. Well, the car service was $37 and the cab back was $14 so clearly that was not the case. It made me wonder if he gets some kind of kickback from the car service. Otherwise everyone was very nice and the location was in a real nieghborhood, not a touristy area.

title: Good Hotel, Great Little Restaurant
text: Room was clean except perhaps carpet. Room and bathroom small but adequate, comfortable and clean. Good TV, linens, amenities. Elevator broke while we were there. Went to the restaurant to check out room service and menu and the manager (?) was so nice and sat me down and I ordered a burger he said would be sent up to the room. It was. It was a REALLY unexpectedly good burger and fries. Room a bit noisy in terms of hallway. But all the way around a good room.

title: Great price great location
text: Hotel was great and clean. It was small but comparable to most nyc hotels. Bed was comfortable. Location was convenient for me. Luggage storage was easy. Only negative is that all rooms are close to elevator and you can sometimes hear hallway chit chat but it didn't keep me awake. Overall very satisfied.

title: Lovely staff good location
text:
We stayed for 4 nights. Room was big enough for the 2 of us. We hardly spent any time in it we were so busy shopping and sight seeing. Maid was in daily to change towels etc. We had tea coffee in room and also an iron and ironing board. There was also a safe deposit box available free of charge. The bathroom was quite small but adequate 
There was also an alarm clock in the room. Reception staff very nice and helpful. We were only 10 min walk to Macy's. We would return

title: Old hotel on a rough street
text:
Hotel itself is decent, the lifts are extremely slow, sometimes had a 20+ minute wait in the mornings. The rooms are a little dated but they are clean and well presented. Bathroom was okay, and the toiletries provided were a nice little touch. 

The hotel is in a good location in regards to attractions, however it is on one of the roughest streets going. On our two day stay, I saw a woman and man "canoodling" against a wall, a man at 9pm urinating in the middle of the pavement and many drug deals. Did not make us feel safe at all. 

They also charged my card twice for this stay, and trying to get in contact with them via email is impossible! I am down a lot of money and will not be staying again!

title: Great location but needs updating..
text: Just got home from a long weekend in this great city. We were a little disappointed with the Hotel as it looked like a vacuum cleaner wouldn't have gone a miss and our room had a distinct damp smell to it. The size of the room was okay and pretty much normal for New York. There were lots of areas of repair that needed to be carried out which were simple. The furnishings were old and a bit battered. On a positive bed linen and towels were clean and our room was attended to every day. Considering the amount of time spent in the room we were generally satisfied and it was a place to lay our heads. Staff were polite and helped out if asked.  The location was perfect and within walking distance of everything. Don't expect 4 star as described, we would have given it a 3.

title: 21st Nov-26th Nov
text:
We arrived slightly earlier than check in time but this was no issue. We were told they had oversold on rooms so didn't have the queen room we booked, so instead placed us in a double king. For us this was no problem and the reception staff were very friendly. The next day we changed into a queen room - again no fuss as the hotel staff moved our belongings for us, so when we arrived back after a long day out we just needed to pick up our new room key. 

Both rooms were warm, clean and comfortable and had all the basics that you would need plus some added extras such as toiletries and a safe. 

We were on the 24th floor. There are a lot of reviews here about the wait for lifts but I have to say this was never an issue for us, maybe we got lucky. View not particularly great - we did not pay extra for the Empire State Building views as to be honest we weren't in the room all that much. 

Did not use the restaurant or bar so cannot comment on this. 

Location wise we thought it was fine. Quiet enough but also only a short walk to major attractions. 

All in all a positive experience. Would stay again.

title: Disappointing service
text:
We arrived here after a long flight from the UK with no bags as BA hadn't managed to get them onto our connection. We were told on arrival that the hotel was overbooked and 2/3 rooms would have to transfer to the hotel around the block. It took such a long time to arrange the transfer and we had to walk a block at 1am in the freezing cold and dark, with little guidance. They also didn't have anything to give us to sleep in - no robe or adapters to charge our phone. The alternative hotel should have been arranged and a taxi called to take us. Yes, it's around the corner but at 1am in the freezing cold with dodgy looking people knocking about the streets, they could have put us in danger. The man on the desk didn't seem to care that this mistake had been made. The hotel really needs to take some learning from this experience and provide a much smoother, easier experience when they make such significant blunders. 

After this experience I'd say the hotel itself was good. Clean and comfortable, it was located a short walk from Macy's, Penn Station, Madison Square Gardens, Times Square and the Empire State. Such a shame that the experience at the beginning let the hotel down.

title: Location and service excellent
text:
