This was my second time here and both times were great experiences! Positives: every and I mean every hotel worker was friendly and helpful. No questions re: request for more cookies, and the breakfast staff worked so hard but all were there to help out and ask if I needed more juice, etc. Thanksgiving morning was able to just walk out of the hotel and down the street to see the parade!!! It was so awesome!! Near Macy's and Koreatown plus all the other 34th Ave shops. The room was clean and quiet! Better to have no view IMO and a quieter sleep. Also worked out and all the machines are new. I loved the green paint it felt bright and airy. Cleaning ladies I ran into downstairs were also so nice. 
Negatives: did not like the air freshener/Febreeze like smell immediately upon room entry. Did not happen last time I stayed. Left note for cleaning lady not to use next day and she did not. Wasn't sure if from hotel or previous guest. Bathroom and room are pretty small.  The heater has a pretty loud vent, though does not smell and after the first night was better regulated. Still could sleep well!

title: Value for Money
text: The hotel was clean and tidy, staff were friendly and helpful at all times. It was within walking distance to Maddison square gardens, 5th avenue and with a subway 2 blocks down so was perfect for accessing everything easily. The street doesn't look the cleanest but it serves a purpose and we had no trouble at all. Rooms was a good size, view was poor but we were hardly in our room! The room was either Cold or boiling as the heater is a little out dated and it could be noisy at times over night within the hotel. Overall it served as a good bases for a break in NYC and was value for money.

title: Great Location
text:
Although perhaps not in the nicest part of Manhattan, the location of this hotel is excellent and within easy walking distance of the Empire State Building, Macy's, Times Square and Central Park. All the staff we encountered were friendly and helpful and the free cookies at check-in were a nice touch, particularly after a long flight. 

The room was basic but clean and functional with a large screen TV, safe, hairdryer and iron & ironing board. The bed was comfortable and the bathroom well stocked with towels and plentiful hot water. Although we didn't eat at the hotel, we used the bar for pre-dinner drinks and it was very reasonably priced for NYC. Free WiFi was also particularly welcome. 

On the downside, only having two elevators for 25+ floors can result in a long wait and we often found it quicker to walk down the stairs.  Our room was on the sixth floor at the front of the building and didn't seem particularly well soundproofed, with vehicle noise and sirens from the surrounding streets being heard throughout the night. The room was also quite compact which meant limited space to store our suitcase.

However, these are minor problems and this is definitely a good base for the budget conscious traveller.

title: Good location
text: Small room, bathroom and hallways could do with renovating, staff were nice, and is in an excellent location just a few blocks away from Maddison square garden, Empire State Building and Times Square.

title: Close to lots to do
text: I enjoyed my visit. Although it was a work trip, I had time to walk around the area and see Times Square, Trump Tower... It was a great location! The hotel was clean; the staff was friendly and helpful; the restaurant served good food.

title: Great Location, Friendly Staff
text: Great Staff always, very good location! Rooms are pretty big for the location. Breakfast bar is kinda bland wish they had a waffle maker. Staff are incredibly personable and rooms are spotless! The location is superb and very close to good places to eat.

title: I was "walked"
text: Arrived at midnight to find that the hotel had decided not to honor my reservation and have a room for me. They "walked" me to another hotel from which I had to move back to the doubletree the next morning before my meetings. HORRIBLE service and experience.

title: Good hotel for the price in a not so busy location, was nice and quiet
text: Couldn't even hear any city noise at night! Quiet. I love my cookies and bottle of water they give you at check-in. Front desk staff was helpful when it came to answering questions. Had caked a few days before to find a location of a parking garage and there is one right across the street!

title: Great location
text: Comfortable beds, quiet rooms considering you are close to Empire State Building .. amazing location close to subway 5 min , corrected situation that happened quickly... staff great and yummy cookies and free bottles of water

title: Skip this overpriced dog
text: The hotel is old; rooms are so small that you can't fit your clothes and luggage in the small closet. No counter space in bathroom, and your hear noisy elevators all night. For the money they charge per night, it's laughable. It's no wonder why Air B&B is killing the hotel business in Manhattan.

title: Pleasant overnight - good breakfast
text: We selected this DoubleTree because we wanted a place within walking distance of Grand Central Station and we have had good experiences with DoubleTree hotels including their breakfast.  We had a good overnight stay and enjoyed the breakfast.  Like many hotels in downtown NYC the halls and rooms are smaller than you will find outside of large cities but perfectly adequate.  Unfortunately I can not locate the room number we had so the attached picture of the view will not be helpful for room selection.  That said, I would not select this hotel due to any expectations of a great view.  The staff was professional and provided good service.  What city noises could be heard in the room were within reason especially given that you are in NYC.  We would stay at this hotel again.

title: good location, friendly and accommodating staff
text: Front desk staff was very nice.  Rooms are comfortable and very clear.  Good location.  Convenient if you are interested in midtown, Chelsea, Soho and attractions south of 42nd street. A perfect place when coming from Penn Station.  two block walk.

title: Disappointing Stay for Anniverary
text: Picked this location because I have had good experiences in the past with the DoubleTree brand hotels and wanted to be in Chelsea.  Hotel is in a good location city wise. Nothing worthwhile on the block itself. Hotel needs upgrading. Long waits for elevator as there are only two for a 27 story building. Rooms are very small. Maybe good for business trip but not leisure.

title: Wonderful Expirience for 1st ever trip to New York
text:
First Family trip to New York. Really wonderful city but our stay was so pleasant it helped us to just enjoy the city in full.
Staff at the Double Tree hotel in Chelsea were Top Top Top Class.
I wish we took their names for a high praise on here. But the Lady that gave us those beautiful cookies, was so so so helpful.
Hotel was clean, perfect location too. Empire State - Penn Station - Macey's - Times Square, all within 10 min walk.When I go NY again this will be my return location... Thank You !!!

title: Perfect stay
text:
Stayed at Doubletree for four nights and couldn't be happier. Good food, very clean rooms and excellent staff. Small walk from the empire State building and 5th avenue, Would highly recommend.
 Thank you  😊

title: Affordable accommodation in Chelsea area
text: For visiting family in the Chelsea area, this was an affordable option that met our needs. Bed comfortable (wished I had asked for extra blankets as no comforter on bed). Clean. Did not try the restaurant but nice to have one on premises. We were able to walk to many nice destinations and restaurants.

title: Very good Stay
text: I have stayed in many hotels in NYC.  This one had better customer service than the Conrad NYC which is supposed to be the best of the best as far as Hiltons are concerned. The customer service at the Conrad NYC is horrible, and the beautiful rooms aren't enough to entice me back.  Back to DoubleTree Chelsea--  I was greeted by a very nice woman at the front desk which was a great start.  The rooms and hallways match what a doubletree would be- basic without the bells and whistles of a higher grade hotel.  It is a basic hotel, simplistic, but clean.  I had problems with my wifi, and I called the front desk and was able to have this resolved within minutes.  Overall, great experience for a short stay in NYC, where I wanted to drop off my bags for a weekend and enjoy my weekend.  I would stay here again.

title: Hilton.. Or budget motel?
text:
Rip off. Why even call this hotel a Hilton if it's going to be a budget hotel? I was expecİting the Hilton experience and when I booked over the phone was told this hotel was just as nice as the surrounding hilton's, but that was clearly not the case. 

Towels in the shower? Toilet that runs all night. Heat that doesn't work. No comforter, assumingly so guests don't turn up the heat. 4 crappy treadmills in the workout "center". A 25$ breakfast that was.. Probably the biggest insult of all. Boxed eggs, cheap yoghurt, and stale bagels.

This sort of experience makes me not only never want to stay at this hilton, but not want to stay at any hilton's. Very dissatisfied.

On the plus- the staff was nice.

title: Bad experience
text:
Bad experience 
The service was so bad we checked out 2 days early we have never done that before.  This hotel should not be in the Hilton offering. We had to ask for bed linens 3 times and never got an apology for our bad experience. Very disappointing. The rooms we dated and small

title: Drab choice
text: This hotel was disappointing. It has low ceilings, narrow hallways, and florescent lighting through (including in room). The bed was the ultra bouncy variety. It was clean and the staff was friendly but in terms of physical space, you should be able to do better than this in the neighborhood.

title: Great long weekend stay
text: I can't say enough good things about my stay.  Took my mom to NY for her 60th birthday. The hotel staff took it to the next level and made our stay special for my moms birthday. Thank You!  Location is very convenient. Scomodations were perfect for a weeken in the city. I'll be back here for work and play.

title: à éviter si possible
text: Hotel dont les chambres sont faites à peu pres, beaucoup de poussiere, chambre pas tres propre, la tv ne fonctionne pas toujours, telecommande .... le personnel n'est vraiment pas chaleureux et comprehensif. le wi fi est n'est pas des plus simples.  Bruyant le matin  en raison des portes lourdement lâchées. Hotel bien situé mais si possible en choisir un autre

title: Double tree-Chelsea-Newyork
text: Hotel location is good. Walkable distance to Time Square, Empire State Building. Hotel facilities are ok.  No refrigerator and Micro Oven in room. Rooms are small compared to other Hilton Hotels. Hotel Staff is helpful.  No break fast and extra water bottles.

title: Week in the City with views
text: At first was disappointed with the size of the room on 25th floor for $320+tax but soon adjusted as the view was great and this is NYC I guess?! The gym must have been redone recently - great kit in there. Breakfasts pretty good - fantastic location to walk anywhere and everywhere. All in all worked out well.

title: New York Stay
text: The room was very good but the overall look and feel of the hotel was poor. The decor was drab and the hotel looked like it needed a complete refit. There was no "wow" factor and initially made me wonder how bad the room was going to be as I made my way along the corridor. I expected better from the Hilton group. Additionally the extras added to my bill soon made my stay much more expensive than anticipated, poor value for money.

title: Halloween weekend at the Doubletree
text: Very pleasant stay in a great and central location. The staff was friendly and accommodating. Also, the hotel room itself was clean and comfortable. I would stay here again. What I got for the rate of the room was perfect for my stay!

title: Great location to explore the city.
text: Recently stayed here 2 nights with family. Area is good to Times Square, Chelsea and downtown as well as midtown. Can get anywhere easily. Stay was split into single nights over the a 3 day weekend. Both rooms were double queens,1st room faced the street on a lower floor, 2nd faced the back of the hotel on a high Honors floor. Both were spotlessly clean, enough room to move around (but not too much room!), and quiet. Beds were comfortable, if just a little too soft, and provided a good nights sleep. Smaller bathroom, shower had strong pressure with all the hot water needed. Check in and out both times was easy. Felt welcomed be everyone we encountered. Bell very helpful with directions, even walked down the street in heavy rain to secure a taxi. Not the prettiest of streets, but all in all a good stay. Included wifi was good. Only 2 elevators, and 1 was down for a bit which resulted in a bit of a back up.

title: Flower district
text: Close to Madison square garden, rail links , and walk to markets shops, food. Good clean hotel without exorbitant price. Great cookies at reception. The hotel is nicely placed and staff were helpful. There is a fridge in room at request! The staff are also happy to heat food for you in the microwave.

title: excelente trato, ubicacion y limpeza
text:
desde el primer dia que ingrese nos trataron genial, excelente limpieza, cookies buenisimas, un hotel para ir solo o en familia, en pleno manhatta.
a un paso de todas las atracciones y a una cuadra de la 5° avenida

title: In need of major renovation
text: Helpful staff. Good location. The rooms look old and feel dirty, at least the one I had. As a diamond member I'd assume they gave me one of their better rooms, so I can't imagine what other rooms are like. There was no rack to put luggage on. The carpet looked old and dirty. I did try out the breakfast buffet as part of my diamond amenity. It was okay - basic breakfast options with scrambled eggs and all. Overall staying in that room was so uncomfortable that I had to cut short my stay there and move to the Hilton Fashion District. Definitely not value for the money since I was able to get a similar rate at the Hilton for a much upgrade experience. The only good thing about the hotel was their great staff.

title: Awesome Stay for Birthday Getaway!
text: This was my third trip to NYC and I have stayed near Timesquare twice already.  Timesquare is very hectic and overwhelming, but if its your first time visiting, then you should a least experience it.  I loved experiencing NY in Chelsea.  What's not to love?  Food and shopping is a cool part of NY.  The staff is AWESOME!  Thanks for the perks for my friends birthday!  You are the best!  The hotel is near Madison Square Garden and the floral district.  Everything is just a subway ride away.  The rooms are quaint, this is NY, but very comfy.  We enjoyed  the restaurant and bar...good food and drinks..."Forget about it!" That's my best impression of NY but probably NJ is better. Whoever said New Yorkers are not friendly, have not stayed here.  I was traveling with three other ladies from SC that had never been to NYC and the staff  was sooooo gracious in directing us. I have to mention that we saw an off Broadway show "Stuffed" and Doubletree Hotel is  mentioned in the show for their fresh baked cookies.  AWESOME COOKIES!  AWESOME STAFF!  We Love NY!

title: 親切かつ便利！
text: 一人旅だったので治安と利便性の両方を満たしたホテルをと思い予約しましたが大正解でした。ペン駅から近く、また夜遅くまで人がたくさんいる通りから少し曲がったところにあるので、４泊しましたが怖いと思うことはありませんでした。チェックインクッキーも評判通り美味しく、部屋についているコーヒーメーカーで入れるコーヒーも美味しかったです。

title: Meh...
text: One room stunk like cat pee, the other had drapes falling down and a service panel above the tub that leaked on me while I was showering. Gross. Bathroom ceiling had been shoddily patched over to repair a stubborn leak.

title: Top notch staff, great location.
text: The staff at this hotel has to be one of the best I have ever had the pleasure of dealing with. They are warm, welcoming, and on top of everything. A few other reviewers have commented that the room decor isn't the most modern. OK, there are currently no USB charging ports in the rooms, and the television is a modest 32" or so flat screen (when did that become small, anyway?). But as someone who spends many night a year in hotels for work none of that really matters. What matters is a good bed (which this hotel has) and staff that makes you feel like you have a temporary home. From the desk clerks to the bell boys to the bartenders this staff has service down pat. I would stay here any time I'm in the city.

title: Good location - quiet area
text: Small hotel and the room was not very clean. A lot of dust in the room. For a family room the beds were too small. The staff was very nice and helpfull. The wi-fi was not good nor stabil. The location is very good - close to 7th ave. And only 15 minuts walk to Times Square.

title: Convenient location, nice staff
text: Stayed her for 3 nights as I was on a business trip that need me near penn station. Not normally a Hilton person but rate was great for location so gave it a chance. Rooms were average but normal for this area. Staff was friendly.

title: Long Weekend Stay
text: Hotel staff are quite friendly. Each offer smiles & greetings. The lobby is open & comfortable; as was the outdoor, bistro seating area. The room was clean yet smaller than I expected. Halls on the floors are narrow & felt very claustrophobic. Hallway carpet needs a good cleaning; or complete change. Overall the stay was pleasant even though the visual presentation of the hotel was a bit underwhelming. Pricing was comprable to others in the area

title: Great location, nice staff, small dated rooms.
text:
The staff was absolutely wonderful at this property.  Check-in was great even though they were extremely busy.  Super helpful on information for places to eat, see, etc.

The only drawback was the size of the room and the age of the appointments.  I even called down to see if there were larger rooms and there were not.  Can be typical of NY hotels.  Room was not very clean (I found a grape under my air conditioner).

Price was reasonable.  Small lobby.

title: Perfect location
text: Great Hotel with an amazing staff. As a Hilton Awards member we got a 21st floor room with an amazing view of the Empire State Building. Only a few blocks from Penn Station and Madison Square Garden, also super close to Times Square

title: Great Location, almost charming.
text:
This hotel is in a great location if you are seeing shows.  We walked to everything; lots of shopping and great places to grab a coffee, meal or snack.  We were walking distance to many of the subway lines so travel else were was easy.  The hotel staff was very helpful; they provided up with directions to our destinations.
The rooms are small but very comfortable, we stayed on a higher floor so travel on the elevator was a little slow.  
Would stay here again when in town.

title: Bra läge, kass städning
text:
Bra läge på Manhattan och nära till allt :) Metro (Subway) i nära anslutning till hotellet.
Frukost helt ok. 

Städningen är under all kritik. Smutsigt när vi kom och resten av veckan... heltäckningsmatta som luktade unket.

title: Very small, not convenient
text: I had to put my suitcase in front of the door in order to open it. The room was that small. It was clean, and the staff was very welcoming.  It would be ok if you only were staying a night or two or only had a small case.

title: Bastante básico para Hilton
text: -Medio que busca hotel Hilton con una pequeña recepción y el diseño de edad. El desayuno es bastante bueno (selección típica americana). Las habitaciones son normales. Lo recomendaría para una escapada corta a sí mismo.

title: NYC visit to Manhattan
text: This hotel has basic amenities. Coffee and rea in the room, no fridge. The rooms are clean, the beds were comfortable. One receives a large cookie upon arrival and they even gave us another and water at a later date. The staff was the friendliest I have ever encountered at a hotel. Every person at the front desk, the concierge and the wait staff in the restaurant went out of their way to be helpful and accomodating! I would stay here again.

title: Great place for a couple nights
text: We started here for two nights as we came over to watch the football. Brilliant location 2 minute walk to Penn Station. 15/20minute walk to Times Square. Room was small but had everything we needed. Good air con, not to hot and stuffy which is a bonus! Staff were very helpful. If we'd been staying for longer I would have started to get annoyed with the small room , but overall for a couple of nights it's perfect !

title: Beautiful, good location, confortable
text: I really liked this hotel. It's not super fancy but it's comfortable, beautiful and well located.  What else do you want?  Room was spacious, bathroom clean and nice, cant' complain.  Just didn't like the reception/ hall area, but that's fine.

title: So welcoming.
text:
We stayed here for here for four nights. The rooms were modern, fairly spacious and very clean, as were the bathrooms. The staff couldn't be more helpful, nothing was too much trouble. The complementary warm cookies every day as well as the free bottled water was a great touch.

We were four ladies celebrating a friends 50th.....once the staff found out each of our rooms received a bottle of champagne with huge strawberries dipped in chocolate which was delightful to receive, but also a birthday card with four complementary ticket for full breakfast for one of our mornings. So kind and thoughtful, made my friends trip.....

It's central to all the attraction......the Conciege was extremely knowledgeable and again nothing was to much trouble.

title: Trip to see son in a performance
text: I arrived and was sad that they said I couldn't check until 4. I got there at noon..... my anger comes from the world thinking its ok to charge for a stay for the night when they make you check in when its too late to wash your buns for that meeting or function you had to stay for and shove you out too early to enjoy a sleep in.... i came in for a function i had to be at by 4 and was told I couldn't check in til 4 which meant it really defeated the purpose of staying at all if i had to get washed up and changed in the bathroom at the mcdonalds up the road . I did state to the desk how important it was i get in shortly the said there were no guarantees and i asked them to call me as soon as they knew i could come back. We went to get something to eat worrying the whole time if i could relax and wash up for my function....noone should feel like that after traveling hundreds of miles and paying all that money

title: Good and bad
text: Pros: Good bed, great view from room, quiet room, good ventilation with no odors  Cons: No comfortable chair in room, poor ergonomics and setup of bathroom, connection and log in to Wi-fi difficult. I would not expect these issues for the price paid.

title: Good location, but needs a refresh
text: Stayed here with a group of friends. Best of it is the location in Midtown. The place however needs a facelift. Bit outdated decor, small rooms (which I guess is just NYC) and all in all just a bit crammed. Not particularly good value for money

title: Good location, good price, but just average hotel
text: Rooms are really small, even for Manhattan standards, interesting settings like the replacement toilet paper is under the TV, not in the bathroom. Not very clean room, for example the lids for the coffee cups are dusty, so maybe haven't been changed before our arrival, ice bucked also doesn't get cleaned daily. If you want stirers for your coffee, that's almost impossible. Hotel has no security, just all open even at 2am in the morning,  trash and laundy piling up outside the hotel, also tables and chairs outside very dirty. Hotel has 26 or 27 floors and just two very slow elevators, which not always were running, so be patient when you want to get home or go out. Hotel wasn't bookable through HHonors, so didn't get any points for the stay.

title: Good hotel, great location
text: Right in the centre of Manhattan island it doesn't take long to get to the key attractions on the Island. Rooms are small and not particularly special (at least the cheapest rooms are) but to be expected in the location.

title: decent hotel
text: Room wasn't ready until 430pm.  Book 2 rooms at same time but we were on different floors.  Good location for Penn Station and coffee shops. Staff was friendly just wish my group could have been closer.  Elevator is slow so be patient and give yourself time

title: Friendly Staff, 3.5 stars
text: Stayed 9/29-10/3, our room was a king facing 29th st. Wished we had a higher floor to avoid some of the street noises. It was a little loud due to the construction (which is everywhere in NYC). The hotel's elevators (only 2) were kinda slow. I mainly took the stairs because I didn't want to wait. Hailing down a cab is very difficult. Cleaning staff did a great job cleaning the room and baggage porters we're super friendly. Even though the price was right, I don't think I would stay here again.

title: Friendly staff
text: As is typical of New York City hotels, the room was very small and the price was high. That said, the staff was extremely friendly and helpful. The location was convenient and I would recommend this hotel if you need to stay in the central Manhattan area.

title: Chelsea Jem
text: Combined a business trip and couple weekend in this Great New York City hotel in Chelsea. Clean rooms, good service and amenities. The gym had good working equipment; however was older and starting to rust in the joints. Equipment still worked well, but we aware. Room was small but nice with king bed, great cable selection, awesome wifi, but no pay per view.

title: Girls weekend
text: This hotel was in a great location to everything we planned .  We were close to the subway for our downtown tours and dinner. The next day we had our Broadway play and we walked to the thearter. The rooms were small, clean and the staff was excellent.

title: Great stay
text: My husband and I spent 4 nights at this property and found it to be a great choice. Not the best area of Chelsea but safe, convenient to transit and restaurants and a complimentary upgrade to a beautiful EPS bldng view. We had a king room on the 16th floor, just off the elevators and except for some street noise one night (ear plugs mitigated that) it was very quiet. We arrived around 9 am and staff gladly stored our bags until our room was ready. Same for a late afternoon departure flight when they again stored our bags after checkout. The room was good size by NY standards and very clean and well maintained. Linens were above average quality and always plentiful, although some towels were somewhat worn. The bed was quite comfortable. I had read some complaints of extremely slow elevators, but found this very minimal inconvenience only during checkout time. For the price, excellent choice.

title: Not up to par.
text:
We spent 2 nights at the Doubletree Chelsea at the end of August.  When in NY, we usually stay at another large chain hotel a block away, but decided to check out the Doubletree this time.  Not again.  Although the staff was terrific, this is an old property, and there are things that can’t be changed.  Our rating is based on the following:
Service—The staff was friendly and very professional.  We left our bags with the bell captain the morning we checked out, and it was quick and easy on both ends.   
WiFi—Although they told us there was a secure site to use, and gave us the password, we were never able to access it, and the front desk couldn’t make it work either.  
Room—The room was really small.  We are in NY several times a year, and know that most hotel rooms are small.  But here we had to unpack completely, because there was no space for a small suitcase to remain accessible.  There was a temp control on the wall, but it didn’t actually effect the A/C.  Our experience was that the temp was turned down overnight, which was fine, but at 8am it blasted icy air, which we couldn’t turn down.   The bed was good and it was quiet.  Bathroom was small, but very clean and functional.  There was a small wardrobe, with a safe and plenty of hangers.
Elevators—There are only 2 elevators to service the entire building.  It has 25-26 floors, with 8 rooms per floor.  That means a lot of people and a lot of staff using the same 2 elevators, which take some time to make a trip up and down.  There were times when the doors opened and we saw that the elevator was already full of huge bags of fresh laundry, or a service cart, and we had to wait for the next one.  
We were on the 18th floor, and paid extra for a view of the Empire State Building.  Views will certainly vary, depending on the room, but check out the photo from our room, and see if you think it was worth it.  
There is a small outdoor courtyard out front, which is nice.

title: Great Location
text:
Situated on the northern end of Chelsea this hotel is in the perfect location for a weekend away.  We were close to shopping (Macy's), many restaurants and bars, the subway and Madison Square Garden (we were in town for the Adele show).  

Our room was tiny but fit our needs.  It was clean and quiet.  The staff at the hotel was VERY friendly and every single one of them greeted us with a smile.  They were very accommodating and helped with anything we asked.

The room was a bit pricey, but it's Midtown Manhattan and there was a lot going on in the city that weekend.  Plus, we didn't book as early as we should have.  Best advice is to book early and keep your eyes on the prices.  

Great hotel, the best staff and yummy cookies.  What else can you ask for?!

title: Clean, safe and convenient
text: Great place to stay.  Clean, close to MOST everything - Times Square, broadway, Empire State bldg, subway, port authority etc.  Quiet, friendly staff, conceierge on duty, just what we needed.  Close to quaint great value restaurants

title: Excellent service
text: I used my honours point to book and didn't experience any hitch before and during my stay. The hotel staff were helpful, professional and friendly. The hotel is a just a few steps to Penn station and in the middle of everything. I will stay here again and again.

title: Great Location
text: Ideally suited for up and down town.Sat between 7th and 6th avenue. Penn station 3 blocks away. Comfortable rooms and great coffee also. Staff are really helpfully. Beer in bar is competitive priced. Would reccommend, booked through BA,Vacations.

title: Good location
text:
The good part: it was super convenient to Penn Station. And, the room was reasonably clean. There was also a view of the Empire State Building from our room. 

Unfortunately, it was a TINY room - mostly just a bed with about 18" of space around all sides. We had to stack our suitcases on top of each other and shimmy past them to get to the other side of the bed. Also, one of the world's slowest, smallest, elevators. In the morning, it took a long time for the elevator to arrive, and it was packed full by the time we got from the top down the the 15th floor.  Finally, breakfast. Oh. My. Goodness. Skip it. Don't get your day off to a terrible start - there are several great spots nearby. Go there - anywhere else. 

Circling back, so as not to end on a bad note, staff members were consistently helpful and kind. For the price, we'd probably stay elsewhere; but, it wasn't the worst place we've been.

title: Doubletree New York - Chelsea
text: Good clean and friendly place to stay.  Great location on W29th for visiting New York with easy access for both Uptown and Downtown Manhattan. Staff do everything they can to help you make your stay enjoyable.  One downside is some of the rooms are a little small especially if you have luggage. Great breakfast!!!

title: Great location, great staff
text: I picked this hotel because the price was almost affordable and it was super close to MSG for the Adele concert.    The staff was great!  Very friendly and helpful.  The room size was typical for New York, even a little bit roomier than I expected.  The king sized bed seemed slightly smaller than a normal king sized bed.  My friend is 5'11" and her feet hung off the end.

title: マンハッタン内で安く済ませられる
text:
国連会議があったためかマンハッタン内ヒルトン系列は
どれも1泊500ドル以上と非常に高額な日程でした。
ヒルトンのポイント特典で宿泊を利用しようにも
ミッドタウン周辺は80000ポイントが多い中
このホテルは60000でよいため所持ポイントで
滞在分賄え助かりました。（2016年9月）

【客室】
マンハッタン内で仕方ないですがかなり狭いです
スーツケースを広げて利用は2個利用が限界
クローゼットはあるため衣類はすぐアンパッキングし
スーツケースは閉じてしまいましょう
コーヒーメーカーはありますが冷蔵庫がない

【バスルーム】
固定シャワータイプ
水圧はそこそこあります

【ロケーション】
ブロックの間にあるためどの駅にも徒歩５分程かかります
逆に言えば最適な路線が使え乗り換えが少なくて済みます
グーグルマップ等を利用すると便利です
ペンステーションへ徒歩で行けるのはニューアーク空港利用に便利です

ヒルトン直接予約なら部屋の指定ができるため
20F以上があればそこにすると景色が抜けると思います

【サービス】
荷物預けやチェックインは手早く適切です
ゴールド特典の朝食券や水もすぐ渡してくれます

【レストラン】
ゴールド特典でもフルバフェ可能です

title: Great location, great staff, ok amenities
text:
I was there last week and the location was perfect for us. A couple of blocks from Madison Square Garden, a few blocks from a direct subway to MoMA. The staff was really welcoming, especially the front desk and bell staff.

I must tell you that the room is small, like Holiday-Inn Express small. I think the hotel is not Doubletree caliber because of the size of the room and the limited amenities. Only with nicer-looking furniture it deserves to be a Doubletree.

Now the hiccups. I called the morning of arrival and was told my reservation is for the next day, even though I had the email confirmation with the correct date. After an hour talking to people on the phone and telling me they didn't have any room available, they straightened it out. No apologies from the hotel but by the end of the episode I was happy to get a room there.

I asked for late checkout and was given initially at 1pm. Apparently the information didn't trickle down to housekeeping, who knocked on the door at 10:30am.

Anyway, that week of the stay UN General Assembly was in town and every hotel in Manhattan charged north of $500 including this hotel. I don't think it's worth that much any other day, but demand really drives the price.

title: Great business hotel
text: Great place if you're in Manhattan for work...slightly pricey but within NYC hotel range!  Loved their service and location. Easy access to train stations as well as walkable from most shopping or tourist places.

title: New York chelsea
text: Ruidoso, la calle donde se encuentra esta sucia y con varios homeless, alfombras pueden estar mejor, personal excelente!!! Siempre dispuestos para ayudar, el desayuno pago no es barato pero es abundante, los ascensores a veces no son suficientes, la ubicación esta muy bien cerca de todo y el metro a una cuadra

title: Great location, enjoyed exploring Chelsea.
text: Glad we found this place, staff were friendly and helpful. Complimentary breakfast was great and pleasant surprise. Bed was comfortable. Seemed safe for walking around for supper and shopping. Rooms were very clean. I would recommend this hotel.

title: Ok experience
text: I was at the Chelsea location to take a tour of NYU, the location was farther than I anticipated.  Also, according to the website they had parking, but it is offsite, public Parking, which is very inconvenient. And no valet.

title: Bra hotell mitt på Manhattan
text:
Bra läge på Manhattan, nära till allt... Restauranger, shopping, nöjen. Riktigt bekväma sängar, bra rum med AC och fräscha badrum. 
Personalen är verkligen service minded och trevliga. Det går att köpa frukost på hotellet. Hit skulle jag gärna komma tillbaka!
